title: Enacts the "Marriage Equality and Religious Exemption Act."
Authorizes deployment of integrity oversight monitors in implementation of certain recovery and rebuilding projects.*
Imposes oversight upon Hurricane Sandy recovery funds.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law.
Prohibits loans as political contributions by certain persons; prohibits certain inducements for political contributions; reduces permitted amount of outstanding loans in certain cases.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to members of Legislature.
Establishes new standard and procedure for forfeiture of elective public office for accepting illegal contributions; removes illegal contribution threshold for such forfeiture.

Limits contributions to certain candidates and elected officials by certain public contractors; limits contributions by certain political party committees; repeals certain campaign contribution prohibitions.
Prohibits member of Legislature from performing certain no-bid contracts.
Requires issue advocacy organization using certain candidate information in advertisements to register with ELEC as political committee or continuing political committee.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective offices; provides for transition period between offices.
Bans campaign contributions and certain political communication by corporations and labor organizations.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Establishes a "Local Authorities Review Commission."
Clarifies penalties court may impose in sentencing certain adults and juveniles guilty of making false public alarms.

Requires electronic bulletin board on DCA website for local units to advertise shared services opportunities; requires development of computerized survey to match local units together to implement shared services.
Requires suspension of local elected and appointed officers and employees indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Eliminates PERS membership for current and future part-time elected and appointed officials.
Concerns criminal background checks for certain school employees.
Prohibits sex offenders from entering school property.
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Requires public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions to reimburse public entities for legal expenses.
Establishes certain minimum standards for State contracts paid on hourly basis.

Requires prequalification process for prospective bidders on school district transportation contracts; authorizes debarment of bidders convicted of certain crimes; authorizes disqualification of bidder or termination of transportation contract for certain crimes by an employee.
Prohibits certain political activity by governmental employees and by public employee unions.
Requires State Treasurer to post information about State contracts for legal services on special website.
Prohibits member of Legislature from representing any person or party other than the State in connection with any proceeding of municipal, county, or State government entity.
Regulates receipt of things of value by members and employees of Legislature and officers and employees of Executive Branch.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Concerns collective bargaining by executive county superintendents.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.
Creates "Comprehensive Anti-Nepotism Act."
Concerns eligibility for unemployment insurance for certain seasonal workers.
Concerns repayment of unemployment insurance benefits obtained fraudulently.
Amends definition of "racketeering activity" in RICO statute to include unemployment insurance fraud offenses.
Limits compensation provided to presidents of public institutions of higher education.
Establishes the "New Jersey Right to Work Act"; prohibits payroll deduction of union dues from wages or salaries of public employees.
Restricts business entities that make campaign contributions from performing certain local government contracts.
Requires builders of new homes to provide owners with building plans.
Clarifies DCA's authority to ensure planned real estate development builders comply with disclosure requirements.
Requires developer under "The Planned Real Estate Full Disclosure Act" to post bond with DCA and provides for more accountability to owners in common interest community.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Clarifies current law regarding noisy motor vehicle muffler; establishes penalty for commercial motor vehicle operators.

Clarifies and strengthens disclosure requirements for certain complimentary tickets received by candidates, officeholders, political party officials, political committees and continuing political committees.

Authorizes the Legislative Counsel in the Office of Legislative Services to accept proper and sufficient service of process on behalf of the State Legislature when either or both Houses are named defendants in any legal proceeding.
Changes date for election of fire district commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of general election.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Provides for the election of school board members at November general election.
Moves school, fire district and certain municipal elections to date of nonpartisan municipal elections.
Directs State public issuer of obligations to use competitive bidding process when investing proceeds from such obligations.

Prohibits contributions by administrator of Type II school district to candidates for member of district's school board; restricts employment by Type II school district of contributors to election campaign of member of district's school board.
Permits tax credit against gross income tax for certain adoption expenses.
Concerns debarment of contractors for conviction of certain computer-related crimes.
Requires foreign corporations providing electronic communication services or remote computing services to comply with New Jersey subpoenas, court orders and search warrants.
Revises child pornography law.
Excuses students with conflicts of conscience from certain class requirements of public institutions of higher education.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Requires certain conditions affecting application for development or zoning variance to be recorded with municipality and county.
Requires savings from recent changes in PERS and TPAF to ease unfunded liability of those systems.
Allows New Jersey S corporations to elect to transfer corporation business tax credits to shareholders to apply against the shareholders' gross income tax liability.
Requires municipal governing bodies and boards of education to provide sufficient time for all requested public comment at open public meetings.
Requires local unit to make adopted budget available for inspection by public in office, without written request, and to make copies available at reasonable fee.
Allows victims and relatives to witness parole hearings.
Requires hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Establishes net operating loss carryback deduction under corporation business tax.
Permits layoff plans as substitute for employment reconciliation plans for joint meetings or shared service agreements under certain circumstances.
Designates State Highway Route 31 as the "Tri-County Purple Heart Memorial Highway."
Gives Director subpoena powers in administration of Division of Pensions and Benefits.

Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for Supreme Court Justices, Superior Court Judges, Tax Court Judges, Administrative Law Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and County Prosecutors from 70 to 75.
Prohibits sale of certain products using advertisements alluding to controlled dangerous substances or analogs.
Directs Division of Consumer Affairs to develop informational brochure regarding dental amalgam, and requires dentists to distribute brochure to patients and offer composite alternatives.
Requires public schools to include instruction on caffeine-related health issues as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Allows municipalities to require mortgage lenders to maintain vacant residential properties during foreclosure.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Belleville Township.
Broadens criteria for certain municipalities to qualify as having UEZ-impacted business districts.
Directs DOT, in consultation with other State entities, to study and report on certain solar and wind energy installations.
Permits exemption from mandatory immunization for students in writing for any reason.
Prohibits delivery of more than one magazine issue before billing information is obtained.

Authorizes municipality to adopt ordinance permitting tenant to remain in illegal occupancy with no immediate health or safety risk; requires expiration of ordinance upon evidence of economic stabilization.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands racetrack, upon voter approval; dedicates 1/3 net proceeds to General Fund, 1/3 to State education aid, and 1/3 to horse racing industry.
Requires appointments for safety-related recalls on vehicles to be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis.
Requires State to pay all costs associated with maintaining and operating the office of the executive county superintendent of schools.
Establishes certain specifications for NJ Sports and Exposition Authority sale or lease of Meadowlands Racetrack.
Permits appointment of certain nonpermanent firefighters laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Permits appointment of certain EMTs laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Requires DHSS to establish carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide air quality standards and certification requirements for ice arenas. *
"Caylee's Law;" requires missing child be reported within 12 hours.
Prohibits participating providers under managed care plans from charging certain fees; establishes penalties therefor.
Imposes temporary rollback and freeze on property tax bills to 2009 amounts, beginning April, 2012, until State unemployment rate falls below seven percent.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses paying a salary differential to National Guard members or reservists on active duty.
Creates motor vehicle offense of smoking in motor vehicle with a child present and dedicates penalties to "Smoking Cessation Fund."
Requires BPU to increase credit provided when issuing Solar Renewable Energy Certificates for solar energy produced by equipment manufactured in NJ.
Revises the definition of "public works projects" related to project labor agreements to include bridges.
Requires Council on Affordable Housing to adjust municipal fair share to reflect job loss in a municipality.

Provides for the election of school board members at November general election and eliminates vote on school budgets except for separate proposals to spend above cap which will also occur at general election.
Provides exclusive jurisdiction to PERC for certain unfair labor practice claims.
Creates Review Commission on Workers' Compensation.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Requires certain cable television companies to offer free Internet access to public libraries.
Removes decal requirement from graduated driver's license law; establishes new system for law enforcement to identify novice drivers.
Requires requestor pick up government records within 10 business days of availability.
Provides grants to eligible businesses equal to 5% of annual base salary of new employees hired under employment grant component of Invest in New Jersey Business Grant Program.
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase and installation of certain environmentally responsible business equipment.
Allows corporation business tax credits as incentives for redevelopment of distressed shopping centers.
Eliminates DOT approval of municipal traffic calming measures in business districts.
Requires municipal agency under MLUL to notify prospective applicant of potential need for additional governmental approvals.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Permits local unit to contract with private entities to lease advertising space on local unit's official Internet website.
Terminates early release program for certain State inmates.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Establishes safety zone speed control device pilot program.
Establishes reward program in DOE for districts with high academic performance and low per pupil expenditures.

Permits instruction on backpack safety to be included in the curriculum of elementary, middle, and high school students as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Permits municipalities to use up to 15% of affordable housing trust fund monies to provide financial assistance grants to the owners of real property that sustained certain weather-related damage.
Supplemental appropriation of $400,000 to DOT for installation of a traffic signal on Route 130 at the Shoppes at Hamilton in Hamilton Township, Mercer County.
Requires State Building Authority to make certain payments in lieu of taxes for public safety facilities to municipalities; makes appropriation.
Requires Secretary of State create e-mail notification system alerting when US and State flags flown at half-staff.

Exempts disabled veterans and recipients of the Purple Heart from the payment of municipal parking meter fees when their vehicles bear a disabled veteran's or Purple Heart license plate issued by the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission.
Provides explicit authorization for the Schools Development Authority to use the design/build/operate/maintain procurement model for school facilities projects.
Waives parking meter fee for certain veterans.

Grants eligibility for solar renewable energy certificates to solar facilities connected to net metering customer's side of the meter, or directly connected to the electric grid at 69 kilovolts or less.
Prohibits municipality from imposing special assessment for curb repair in certain circumstances.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
Exempts Holocaust reparations payments from legal process, and from estate recovery under Medicaid program.
Requires DHSS to establish "New Jersey Autism Website."
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires practitioners to disclose business relationship with out-of-State facilities when making patient referrals to those facilities.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and harassment under certain circumstances.
Makes technical correction to definition of "creditable coverage" in individual, small employer and larger group insurance laws.
Provides for appointment to board of directors of New Jersey Automobile Insurance Risk Exchange by Commissioner of Banking and Insurance.
Increases and clarifies permissible categories of fees chargeable by residential mortgage lenders and brokers.
Prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts.
The "Health Care Provider Network Transparency Act"; establishes requirements for granting access to certain health care provider discounts.
Restructures ticket sales law.
"Life Settlements Act"; regulates life settlement contracts and prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts; repeals "Viatical Settlements Act."
Makes supplemental appropriation of $7,000,000 to DOE to reinstate nonpublic technology initiative aid.
Requires contribution for health care benefits provided for certain local elected and appointed officials.
Establishes that only non-violent offenders should have their cases reviewed by the parole board every three years.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.

Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for recipients of Medicaid and Supplemental Security Income who are veterans or spouses of veterans and provides for annual cost-of-living increase in allowance.
Establishes waiver, rebate or payment of insured's deductible, copayment, or coinsurance by health care practitioner as a form of insurance fraud subject to criminal and civil penalties.
Transfers Bureau of Securities to Department of Banking and Insurance.
"Healthcare Transparency and Disclosure Act."
Makes permanent certain temporary authorizations that expanded permitted investment by Director of Division of Investment of State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund and State pension funds.
Extends deadline for filing nominating petitions each year new legislative districts are established by Apportionment Commission.
Requires Commissioner of Education to change deadline for municipal review of defeated school budgets whenever he changes the annual school election date.
Requires State to provide recipients of State tax refunds, unemployment insurance benefits and State employee compensation certain payment options.
Requires child's religion not be changed due to foster care or adoption.
Requires that DMV suspension and revocation notices be given by certified mail.
Requires notification of municipalities by public utilities under certain circumstances.
Exempts government-owned property from adverse possession and eliminates statute of limitation period for recovery.
Allows publication of legal advertisements in "free" newspapers.
Limits scope of inmates whose cases must be reviewed for parole eligibility every three years.
Sets State's mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Creates bistate commission to coordinate management and flood prevention of waterways flowing between Bergen County, NJ and Rockland County, NY.
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal.

Repeals Kyleigh's Law decal requirement; requires MVC to provide parents of graduated driver license applicants detailed information about program's conditions and restrictions; imposes penalties on parents when licensees fail to comply.
Establishes $100 to $500 fine for owner of animal which attacks, injures, or otherwise interferes with law enforcement animals, search and rescue dogs, or service dogs; designated as "Dusty's Law."
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles.
Makes humane officers for NJSPCA and county societies eligible for body armor grants.
Allows certain sole proprietors to join a small employer health benefits purchasing alliance.
Requires, for roof mounted solar photovoltaic systems, identifying emblem on certain structures, and fire department notification for all structures. **
Requires DEP and owners of reservoirs to implement certain flood control measures, and authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoirs in response to severe weather events.
Provides sales and use tax rebates for certain purchases made by victims of Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee.
Permits in-person wagering at casinos on results of professional sports events, subject to voter approval and change in federal law.
Increases the types of matters eligible to be voted upon by a sending district representative on a receiving district board of education.
Makes elected officials with compensation less than $50,000 ineligible for health care benefits on the 61st day after enactment.
Makes certain State and local appointed public officials ineligible, retroactive to July 1, 2007, for PERS membership regardless of prior PERS membership.
Limits State appointment or employment of members of Legislature for two years after completion of legislative service.

Eliminates PERS credit and health care benefits for appointees to State or local agency, board, commission, authority or instrumentality with annual compensation less than $20,000 and weekly hours fewer than 35.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.

Provides that certain districts are not penalized in the calculation of State debt service aid for school facilities projects in which bonds were authorized but not issued prior to effective date of P.L.2008, c.39.
Increases penalty for certain type of manslaughter.
Extends Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program eligibility to areas located in municipality in which casino gaming is authorized.
Reduces number of members serving on Casino Control Commission from five to three.

Authorizes county colleges and county vocational school districts to establish aviation related job certification, training, and internship programs and provides a corporation business tax credit for funds donated to support such programs.
Expands area for designation of eligible neighborhoods under "Neighborhood Revitalization State Tax Credit Act."
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Creates "New Jersey Senior Labor Task Force."
Reduces compensation afforded members of Legislature by 20%.
Decreases the threshold percentages of student enrollment necessary for a sending school district to obtain representation on a receiving school district board of education.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for income earned in aviation related employment during or after qualified aviation related job training.
Expands "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit" program to municipalities with casino gaming.
Establishes innovation zone program and creates innovation zone around Aviation Research and Technology Park in Atlantic County.
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Eliminates salary for part-time members of certain boards, commissions, and independent authorities.
Eliminates imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus.
Adds public colleges and universities and county colleges to definition of a "qualifying economic redevelopment and growth grant incentive area."
Prohibits Pinelands Commission from requiring pinelands development credits for construction of development project that includes affordable housing.
Makes all members of Legislature ineligible to participate in SHBP.
Requires persons convicted of possessing child pornography to register as sex offenders.
Provides that members of Legislature employed in local government or public education must take approved leave of absence without pay from public employment for legislative duties.
Limits tuition rate charged by Atlantic City School District to per pupil amounts used to determine State school aid.
Requires SJTA to provide a cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Requires appointed or elected official receive annual salary of $50,000 or more for position to participate in PERS or DCRP.
Allows elected official who is enrolled in PERS by virtue of another public position to waive coverage in retirement system based on that other public position.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.
Provides temporary exemption from sales and use tax for rental of certain hotel rooms.
Permits municipality to sell certain vehicles in connection with motor vehicle offenses.
Reduces number of voters for whom person can serve as messenger; limits to three number of voted mail-in ballots transmittable by bearer; modifies conviction standard under vote by mail law.
Requires public bodies to allow public comment at every meeting.
Eliminates dual governmental pay to members of Legislature for legislative duties.
Allows former mayors to perform marriages.
Authorizes special plate for holders of "Combat Action Ribbon."
Requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Permits certain oaths, affirmations, and affidavits to be taken before township and village mayors.
Requires additional notices to governmental agencies upon termination of utility services to residential customers.
Exempts handicapped spots from meters or fees.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.
Excludes veterans' benefits from calculation of financial obligation for care at psychiatric facility.

Requires elected public officials and candidates for elective public office to disclose if they ever filed for bankruptcy; requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Permits contiguous municipalities in different vicinages to share court facilities.
Establishes security standards for judicial hearings at mental health facilities.
Requires municipal court judge to disclose to governing body of municipality information concerning certain decisions by the Advisory Committee on Judicial Conduct.
Alexandra's Law; prohibits operation of motor vehicle with detectable amount of CDS in blood.
Establishes study of technology for the tracking of domestic violence offenders; designated as "Lisa's Law."***
Prohibits the employment of unauthorized aliens and requires employers to use E-Verify program.
Permits special occasion events that promote agricultural tourism to be conducted on preserved farmland under certain circumstances. *
Authorizes notaries public to take oath of office before any official generally authorized to take oaths.
Authorizes account wagering licensee to accept wagers from residents of eligible United States jurisdictions through account wagering system via electronic means such as internet.
Prohibits payment of public employee bonuses not directly contingent upon achieving certain performance goals.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Establishes exemption for solar panel installation in certain wetland areas on farmland.

Provides State transportation aid incentive to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.

Allows permitholder that leases Meadowlands Racetrack from the New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct wagering on simulcast horse races at sports,retail and entertainment development at Meadowlands Complex, subject to agreement and approvals.*
Allows Standardbred private entity lessee or permit holder to exclude certain persons from racetrack and off-track wagering facility.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Permits taxing districts to credit amount of excess taxes paid to first two quarterly payments of local budget year next following date of final judgment, after successful appeal.
Revises law concerning scrap metal businesses.
Extends for three years expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Provides for three year retail alcoholic beverage licenses.

Authorizes municipalities to require alternative treatment centers to meet higher security standards than required by State law and to condition land use approval to operate upon compliance with local, State, and federal laws and regulations.
Requires certain psychiatric facilities to contact DYFS if minor is to be discharged and parent or guardian is unable or unwilling to remove minor from facility.
Requires court order to transfer person awaiting hearing for involuntary commitment from private hospital to State psychiatric hospital.
Codifies standard for rehospitalization after conditional discharge from psychiatric facitlity.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Requires the incorporation of solar panels in design and construction of new public school facilities.
Requires DEP to designate smoke-free sections of State beaches, parks, and forests.
Requires court to issue animal protective orders against persons found guilty of abusing animals.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Amends RICO to add certain crimes involving public servants.
Enacts the "Freedom of Religion and Equality in Civil Marriage Act."

Authorizes Commission on Higher Education to impose a fine against an institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.
"Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act."
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Requires all lamps and lighting devices on motor vehicles be kept in working order.
Permits automatic expungement of criminal records under certain circumstances.
Authorizes the appointment of an independent counsel to investigate allegations concerning the New Jersey Schools Construction Corporation.
Requires water purveyors to notify municipalities they service regarding water supply and water quality issues.*
Allows TPAF retiree to be employed as certificated superintendent or administrator for limited time frame due to critical need without TPAF reenrollment.
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.
Requires public body to publish notice of public meeting on official Internet website.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Creates new $100 assessment for convictions of certain sexual offenses to fund counseling for victims and their families; establishes Sexual Offender Victim Counseling Fund.
Provides New Jersey certification as a school administrator or principal to any applicant with similar certification in another State.
Allocates at least $100 million from Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund for coastal and inland Blue Acres land acquisition projects in flood-prone areas.
Denies custody and visitation rights to minor child by family members of individuals convicted of certain crimes.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program beginning in tax year 2002.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Allows adopted person access to his original birth certificate and other related information; appropriates $90,000.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.
Provides for the election of school board members at November general election.
Prohibits members of the Legislature from acting on certain bills in which they have personal interest; redefines personal interest.
Eliminates the public vote on a school district budget which is within cap.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Requires private vocational schools to provide adequate written notification when planning to close facilities.
Increases annual income limits for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Authorizes criminal history record background checks of employees and volunteers of nonprofit domestic violence victim serving organizations.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Provides that PFRS definitions of widow, widower and spouse will include domestic partners of all PFRS members.
Requires members of NJ Legislature to file statement of financial affairs.
Supplemental appropriation of $5 million to DHS to develop community residences for Division of Developmental Disabilities clients on the waiting list.
Provides NJ STARS II Program eligibility to certain students who attained an associate's degree through a joint program offered by a school district and a county college.
Increases penalties for violations committed by provisional driver's license holder.
Permits voter registration up to 29 days before an election; reduces polling place hours by one hour in the morning.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Changes political party affiliation deadline from 50th to 21st day before primary; changes date after which absentee ballots must be available from 40th to 21st day before any election.
Restricts gifts to certified homemaker-home health aides from patients.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of a boating accident.
Requires certain veterinarians to provide written notification to animal owner if boarded animal will not be subject to 24-hour supervision; "Betsy's Law."
Requires candidates for teacher certification to complete technology training program.

Provides temporary reduction of annual cap on corporation business tax benefit certificate transfer program for certain technology and biotechnology companies and temporarily suspends certain tax credits for certain film and digital media content production expenses.
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Prohibits the use of urea for melting, preventing the formation of, or removing ice.
Increases penalties for committing serious offenses while released on bail.
Requires police notification when driver license is suspended.
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Permits use of overseas absentee ballots for all elections.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
Requires notification of victims and certain additional persons through Victim Information and Notification Everyday (VINE) system.
Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Extends eligibility for certain veterans' benefits to members of reserve components of US Armed Forces and NJ organized militia who serve at least 180 continuous days.
Requires certain NJ Transit Corporation employees to undergo criminal history background checks and wear photo identification.
Terminates imposition of certain fees on transfers of real property.
Exempts senior citizens and blind or disabled persons from certain realty transfer fees.
Restores fiscal integrity and enhances funding to Transportation Trust Fund.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from working in ice cream trucks and amusement parks.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Prohibits sale of any dog by kennel, pet shop or other retail establishment without name, address and phone number of person providing dog thereto; establishes $500 fine for each violation.
Directs DHSS to adopt regulations prohibiting overcrowding of animals in kennels, pet shops and other retail establishments; establishes penalties.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
Authorizes court to require persons convicted of refusing breathalyzer for second or subsequent time to install ignition interlock.
Omits State Police detectives from Open Public Records Act.
Authorizes special parking insignias for passenger automobiles used to transport the developmentally disabled.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for marinas and boatyards that follow certain environmentally sound management practices.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Changes earliest date of construction or rehabilitation of housing granted credits without controls.
Provides that campaign contributions received from certain persons convicted of crimes will be forfeited and paid to ELEC for enforcement purposes.
Permits all municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring bond from seasonal rental landlords in certain circumstances and increases penalties for subsequent offenses.
Prohibits requiring school and county college employees to search for or handle explosive devices.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.
Requires notification of law enforcement for furlough of certain patients from State psychiatric hospitals.
Establishes New Jersey Borough Enterprise Zone Program to encourage business development in small, highly developed municipalities.
Prohibits certain alcoholic beverage advertisements within 300 feet of a school, church, or public park.
Gives judge discretion to revoke boating privileges for third or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Modifies penalty for operating an aircraft while impaired, establishes blood alcohol content offense level and requires report of violation to FAA.

Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits, employer unemployment tax rebates, sales tax exemption, property tax freeze and employee skill training program as incentives for business revitalization in distressed shopping centers.
Requires DHS to prepare annual reports on State psychiatric hospitals.
Makes various statutory changes to "Child Care Licensing Act."
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Bars sex offenders from jobs which primarily consist of contact with children.
Requires Attorney General to seize campaign funds of convicted candidates; prohibits convicted criminal offenders from making contributions to candidates and committees.
Regulates assignment and use of State vehicles.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Regulates assignment and use of vehicles owned or leased by State authorities.
Requires NJ Commission on Science and Technology to establish a science and technology business assistance service.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for the purchase price of monthly passes used for commuting to work by train, bus or ferry.
Clarifies criteria for issuing Amber Alert when child abducted by family member.
Adds certain cannabis-like chemical substances to list of controlled dangerous substances.
Bars sales of aerosol dusters to persons under the age of 18.

Permits certain applicants to submit personal statement of veteran status, in lieu of determination of veteran status, prior to issuance of civil service eligible list; requires submission of determination of status prior to employment.
Provides for satellite-based monitoring of homeless registered sex offenders.
Upgrades harassment under certain circumstances; restricts cyberbullying offenders' access to the Internet.
Prohibits sale of alcoholic energy drinks.
Makes harassment by electronic means a crime of the fourth degree.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under 21 years of age.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Regulates massage therapy advertising.
Permits advertising on exterior of school buses owned by a school bus contractor and requires sharing of the advertising revenue with school districts.
Prohibits cultivation or production of marijuana on preserved farmland and eligibility for farmland assessment of any land used for such purposes.
Provides that civil service make-up examinations not include the same questions as the original examination.
Expands number of disorders included in newborn screening program.
Establishes guidelines for dissemination of vital records.
Permits members of State Police to receive travel and subsistence reimbursement exceeding $500 limit from certain sources other than State for out of State travel for educational purposes.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons who are fingerprinted and permits law enforcement officers to collect certain biological samples.*
Expands eligible municipalities under the "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" to include Harrison Town in Hudson County.
Grants law enforcement agencies authority to order road closures; increases penalty for violations.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
"Pharmacy Quality Improvement and Error Prevention Act."
Chloe and Samantha's Law; requires notice to consumers of availability of products to prevent tip-over accidents involving certain furniture or televisions.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Increases the application fee and provides for an admission fee to pre-trial intervention; dedicates fee increase for victim services.
Eliminates downgrading of DWI offenses that occur more than 10 years after previous conviction.
Establishes conflict resolution procedures through Department of Agriculture for complaints against existing commercial fishing docks and fish processing facilities at established locations.
Fred Baker's Law; establishes July 30th of each year as "Corrections Officer Day."*
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Establishes new crimes concerning service dogs and upgrades crimes against certain other animals.
Designates portion of U.S. Route No. 40 in Buena Borough, Atlantic County as "Peter 'Pete' Dandrea Section of the Harding Highway."
Authorizes property tax levy cap banking by local units and boards of education.
Transfers administration of certain nutrition programs to Department of Agriculture.
Assigns financial responsibility of educating homeless student to district of attendance.
Increases penalties for certain motor vehicle right-of-way violations and requires attendance at Driver Improvement Program.

Requires forfeiture of public office upon conviction of fourth degree crime or higher; disqualifies person from future office upon conviction of fourth degree crime or higher or conviction of crime involving dishonesty.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
Requires reduction in number of positions in State service; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Increases minimum penalty for aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Creates crime of threatening the life of certain animals; designated as Dano and Valder's Law.**
Extends implied consent law to blood tests to determine if driver under influence of drugs.
Denies parole eligibility for certain inmates.
Reestablishes historic driving privileges afforded holders of agricultural driver's licenses in operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Revises qualifications and requirements for permits to carry handgun; establishes annual fee of $100.
Allows judge to admit evidence of prior sexual offenses in current sexual offense actions.
Provides additional penalties for certain crimes involving cemeteries and other property.
Increases penalty for assault that results in brain damage or permanent severe bodily injury.
Clarifies that conviction of refusal to submit to breathalyzer constitutes prior conviction for sentencing purposes under drunk driving law.
Creates striped bass license plates.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for fish and wildlife management and conservation.
Establishes licensing program in Department of Agriculture for farmed deer and other cervids.
Prohibits certain agencies from establishing checkpoints limited to specific vehicle types.
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Requires use of highest appraisal value as offer price for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs.
Prohibits DEP from imposing conditions on projects exempt from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Authorizes local law enforcement officers to inspect trucks.
Directs State public issuer of obligations to use competitive bidding process when investing proceeds from such obligations.

Requires State compensation of property owners for certain property devalued due to certain environmental laws; and requires State agencies to evaluate proposed administrative rules for potential to constitute taking of real property.
Repeals gross receipts and use taxes on retail sales of fur clothing.
Requires boards of education to provide more detailed information on compensation of school district employees not covered by collective bargaining agreements.
Authorizes certain non-emergency mutual agreements between municipalities for law enforcement purposes.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Establishes a limited education grant program for certain school districts sending pupils to a district that is experiencing overcrowding in its school facilities.
Allows students eligible for kindergarten enrollment in the subsequent school year to enroll in a choice district without prior enrollment in the sending district.
Designates "I'm From New Jersey" as the State song.
Requires DOT to provide for removal of deer carcasses from county and municipal roads; appropriates $730,000.
Clarifies that BB guns are not firearms under New Jersey law.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.

Adjusts thresholds under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) that trigger State intervention in school districts and requires appointment of State fiscal monitor in districts with a certain State aid support ratio.
Designates bison as agricultural livestock.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Repeals law permitting project labor agreements.
Allows commercial farmer to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees of defending against unreasonable complaints under "Right to Farm Act."
Prohibits public utilities from recovering certain charges from customers.
Requires accountability of NJSPCA and county societies for prevention of cruelty to animals to Attorney General and county prosecutors, respectively.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Provides tort claims immunity to certain State volunteer workers.
Requires third-party disbursement service organization that contracts with local government unit or board of education to post bond against failure to meet obligations.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Removes statutory requirements concerning salaries for certain county officers.
Concerns collective negotiations for school employees; repeals law prohibiting school boards from imposing terms and conditions of employment.

Authorizes an institution of higher education to initiate a new program without the approval of the Commission on Higher Education that might otherwise be required if the program is not supported by State funds.
Excludes gains on sales of certain real estate purchases from taxation under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Prohibits a public institution of higher education from using State funds to pay a commencement speaker.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
The "Retail Establishment Check Cashers Act"; establishes license for retail establishments to cash checks for fees.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having 3 or more units.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits or approvals for activities associated with offshore drilling for oil or natural gas.
Provides gross income tax deduction for three years of nursing pay for new enrollees in nursing education programs.
Requires boards of education to provide civics instruction in elementary and middle school grades and requires DOE to provide funding to enhance civics instruction.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Establishes "New Jersey Energy Efficient Weekend" sales tax holiday during third weekend of April.
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure.
Provides that 20% of fee charged for initial certified copy of birth certificate shall be used to support certain activities of NJ Cord Blood Bank.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Requires sellers collecting New Jersey sales tax for locations in New Jersey to record and report on their returns the amount of sales tax collected within each municipality in New Jersey.
Designates walking as New Jersey State Exercise.
Provides general election, primary, and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians in their first seven taxable years of practice in New Jersey.

Provides one-time reduction of pension contribution of local public employer of employee who retires with pension reduced for dishonorable service in amount equivalent to certain previous contributions by that employer.
Prohibits health insurance policy exclusion of coverage for loss sustained while intoxicated or under the influence of narcotics; repeals statute permitting such exclusion.
Establishes black bear special hunting permit and a per-day permit fee of $5 for State residents and $15 for out-of-State residents.

Requires multiple dwelling owner advised of structural safety issues discovered during private inspection to advise DCA; requires DCA to schedule emergency inspection of that multiple dwelling within 24 hours.
Concerns furloughing of direct care nurses employed by certain State institutions.
Requires use of direct deposit and Internet for State, local government, and school district employee compensation and certain retirement payments and information.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credits for purchase and installation of certain electric vehicle charging stations.
Prohibits drilling technique of hydraulic fracturing.
Authorizes public institution of higher education to establish in-municipality tuition rate for students who graduate from public high schools located in the same municipality as the institution.
Requires NJ FamilyCare to treat earned and unearned income in same manner when calculating gross family income for parents and caretakers.
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.
Modifies State's role in local unit consolidations.
Deems employee completion of required training in Public Employees Occupational Safety and Health program standard valid for other employers with same requirement.
Requires public parking facilities at NJ Transit stations to be open to public on weekends and other occasions; permits reasonable fee for use of parking facility.
Permits primary elections to be conducted by mail.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.*
Supplemental appropriation to DOT of $10,000,000 as State contribution towards resolution of flooding issues at Marsellus Street Bridge in Bergen County.
Establishes teacher residency as component of a higher education teacher preparation program; requires teachers who serve as mentors in residency program to meet certain qualifications.
"Good Samaritan Emergency Response Act"; eliminates criminal liability for persons who seek medical assistance in response to drug overdose. *
Makes employment matters not exempted by statute mandatory subjects of public employment collective bargaining.
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination"; repeals section 4 of P.L.1985, c.73.
Authorizes the court to credit a person in default of a court-imposed financial obligation under certain circumstances.*
Establishes a gross income tax credit for enrollment at a New Jersey college or university.
Modifies elements of the crime of stalking.
Requires readings at two separate meetings before final passage of a policy by a board of education.
Requires non-custodial parent to purchase health benefits coverage for child.
Requires social studies teachers to complete training in African-American studies.
Establishes "Matthew's Law Limiting the Use of Restraints."
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Establishes Distressed Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Fund.
Increases minimum wage.
Establishes Office of Minority Teacher Recruitment in Department of Education.
Authorizes educational service providers to provide in-district special education instructional programs.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Provides enhanced penalties for certain crimes when victim is 65 years of age or older, or disabled.
Requires ATM independent sales organizations to provide certain withdrawal options.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.

Expands parity between certain State-chartered financial institutions, and permits interstate banking by such institutions through de novo branching or expanded authority to acquire existing branches or institutions.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain minimum three foot safety distance when overtaking bicycles.
Revises approval process for rate changes applicable to medical malpractice liability insurance.
The "Debt-Management Services Act of New Jersey."

Authorizes court to waive certain fees, offer mediation as sentence; authorizes defendant information in presentence report; reduces certain expungement waiting periods; requires benefits be considered in juvenile plan.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Authorizes waiver of license revocation process for certain child support obligors.
Creates self-defense justification for victims of domestic violence.
Establishes crime of entering into certain restricted airport areas.
Requires training for constables.
Requires holder of rental security deposit account to provide second notice before account is deemed abandoned under the "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act."
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
Establishes municipal authority to supervise, discipline and terminate employment of construction code officials.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new NICS terminals.
Eliminates the New Jersey inheritance tax and repeals chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Provides immunity from civil liability for persons performing animal rescue and authorizes formation of emergency animal rescue response units.
Establishes "Seniors Helping Seniors Who are Blind or Visually Impaired Demonstration Program" in DHS; appropriates $360,000.
Allows gross income tax filers to designate contributions to VetGroup, Inc. for services for veterans.
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Requires State to reimburse counties and municipalities for salary and fringe benefit costs of employee on official leave of absence for military service in war on terror; makes an appropriation.
Extends veterans' property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Allows PERS ordinary disability retiree to earn up to $3,000 in PERS-covered employment annually before cancellation of disability benefit and reenrollment in PERS.
Extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Concerns custody and parenting time for military parents.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Establishes Hooked on Fishing-Not on Drugs Program in DEP and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires prosecutor to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires DEP to assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Repeals State and local hotel and motel occupancy taxes and voids existing municipal implementing ordinances.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires reduction in number of State employees to FY2000 level; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Extends penalties for driving under the influence to include any substance that impairs driving ability; deems driver's consent to non-invasive drug tests.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Ends the transitional energy facilities assessment, caps the State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures the balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Establishes, in the Division of Fish and Wildlife in DEP, a program to encourage school children to avoid drug use and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Requires DEP rejection of new solid waste facility registration if affected municipality disapproves proposed facility location.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $5,000 income tax deduction.
Requires certain offenders to register under Megan's Law; upgrades the crimes of invasion of privacy and peering into a window of a dwelling for a second or subsequent offense.
Prohibits seller of real estate to transfer realty transfer fee liability to buyer.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Provides for mandatory terms of imprisonment for certain sexual assaults upon a minor; amends murder statute.
Provides that trespassing in nuclear power plant is third degree crime.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Permits cancellation of municipal charges and fees under $10.
Permits local government units to increase service charge imposed for check payments returned for insufficient funds.
Requires certain documentation as proof of voter identity to vote; updates procedures for challenging voters regarding proof of identity.
Allows public contractors paying benefits under collective bargaining agreements to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Requires certain State public employees and officers and members of Legislature to file financial disclosure statement with State Ethics Commission or Joint Legislative Committee on Ethics.
Directs NJTA to dedicate toll increase revenue no longer required for payment of Access to the Region's Core Tunnel project to Transportation Trust Fund Account.

Imposes requirements concerning Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners budgets and capital plan; requires commissioners' meetings and public hearings be made available to public; requires commissioners make certain information available on website.
Makes changes to manner in which State-administered retirement systems operate and to public employee pension benefits.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations.

Increases PFRS employee contribution rate; requires new members to be age 50 for special retirement; creates cap on PFRS retiree COLA; restructures PFRS board of trustees and gives it control over fund investments.
Permits establishment of county-wide purchasing system by county employing qualified purchasing agent and requires participation by all municipalities and school districts within the county.
Limits when bidders can be required to submit a financial statement in order to bid on a local public contract or county college contract.
Develops evaluation procedure for classroom teachers and requires establishment of lead teacher endorsement.
Provides for modification of child support and certain alimony payments due to changed circumstances.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Requires DEP to establish artificial reef plan for commercial and recreational fishing.
Requires executive county superintendent of schools to establish a county-wide school calendar.
Prohibits conflict of interests by governing board members or management employees of homeowners' associations.
Exempts individuals with certain types of military service from certain professional and occupational fees and continuing education requirements.
Provides for indication of veteran status on driver's licenses and identification cards issued by MVC.*
Prohibits unilateral changing of terms and conditions of employment by public employers.
Establishes "Regional Network Health Benefits Plan Pilot Program."
Provides for continuation of health insurance coverage in group and SHBP health plans for unlimited period of time for certain former employees and their dependents.
Limits rent increases in certain low income rental projects financed by the New Jersey Housing and Mortgage Finance Agency.
Expands homestead property tax rebate program for certain non-senior and non-disabled tenants based on revised income qualifications.
Prohibits businesses that outsource jobs overseas from receiving State contracts or grants; prohibits investment of State funds in such businesses.
Establishes "New Jersey Colorectal Cancer Research Fund"; provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Exempts certain car-sharing programs from motor vehicle rental fees.
Allows firms, designated as qualified UEZ businesses, that experience economic hardship to lower employment levels without losing that designation.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Prohibits practice of requiring credit check as condition of employment.
Requires written residential leases to be provided in both English and Spanish in certain municipalities.
Allows for five years corporation business tax and gross income tax deductions for net interest amount received on loans to certain qualified UEZ businesses.
Requires health care providers to observe certain practices concerning collection of outstanding balances on patient accounts.
Designates New Jersey Commuter Pass Credit Act; provides for temporary gross income tax credit for certain commuting passes.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roofs.
Requires certain State departments, divisions, commissions, and authorities to consider use of green or blue roof in construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures.*
Requires adoption of certain rules and regulations by DCA and DEP concerning blue roofs and green roofs.**
Requires construction of new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.
Establishes program to provide financial assistance towards installation of blue roofs and green roofs; authorizes use of Global Warming Solutions Fund for certain such purposes.
Prohibits charging vehicle storage fees for days on which storage facility is closed.
Prohibits sale of merchandise designed to conceal license plates.
Prohibits attorney serving as elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Prohibits imposition of the corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations that only store personal property in this State incident to its importation.
Requires Department of Education to biannually distribute a letter to school districts reminding districts of requirement to enroll resident students regardless of immigration status.
Requires assisted living residences and comprehensive personal care homes to ensure connection of emergency cords in residential units to facility staff.

Requires direct deposit for all State employee compensation on and after July 1, 2014; allows county, county college, municipality,and local school district to opt for mandatory direct deposit for all employee compensation on or after July 1, 2014.***

Prohibits attorney spouse or domestic partner of elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Consumer Electronics Warranty Lemon Law.
The "Digital Impersonation Prevention Act."
Limits applicability of vacancy decontrol under local rent control ordinances under certain circumstances.

Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes to small and medium-sized businesses for certain export and export promotion activity; designated as the Export Promotion Tax Credit Act.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
Provides that a homestead owner who is 65 years of age or older or disabled shall not receive a homestead rebate of less than $1,440.
Requires public schools to include instruction on oral health as part of core curriculum content standards.
Permits removal of State board, commission or independent authority member for failure to attend three consecutive meetings thereof without good cause.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Prohibits insurers offering managed care plans from denying participation in network to health care providers willing to meet terms of contract.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice or represent oneself to others concerning certain licensed or certified health care related professions.**
Prohibits health care facilities from discharging prescription medications into sewer or septic systems in certain circumstances.***
Requires that all emergency departments have necessary pediatric equipment available.
Permits a child who moves out of a school district due to a family crisis to remain enrolled in that district until the end of the school year.
Prohibits certain breeding and sales practices; requires persons selling cats or dogs to provide certain information; and provides penalties.
Requires review and approval by New York and New Jersey legislatures of toll increases or new tolls proposed by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

Establishes a program to provide college scholarships to the spouses and children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Establishes pilot program in Department of Education to provide instruction in personal finance to elementary school students.
Establishes grant program in DCA to provide funding to youth mentoring programs.
Requires public schools which have automated external defibrillators to adopt policies concerning usage.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees.
Requires certain DOC, county, and municipal prison physicians to acquire certain training.
Requires correctional facilities to provide inmates with prescription medication that was prescribed for chronic conditions existing prior to incarceration.
Establishes a civil cause of action for gender-motivated violence.
Requires annual notice of assessment on property to contain bolded notice of filing deadline for appeal.
Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of the student borrower's death.
Includes nonpublic schools and incidents occurring off school grounds in school bullying law and provides greater protections for victims of bullying.
Establishes special parking for hybrid, electric, and alternative fuel vehicles.
Increases penalties for certain alteration of an automobile's computer and establishes penalty for resulting death or injury.

Requires school districts to ensure that certain student information stored on an electronic data processing system is backed up daily, and that teachers have access to the information for at least 150 days.
Modifies certain CATV company filing requirements with BPU and CATV company subsciber notice requirements concerning rates, charges, or services.*
Directs BPU to establish online process for submission of required documents by BPU regulated and licensed entities.
Revises notice requirements by CATV companies for changes to station channel positions to be consistent with federal law.*
Limits forum of consumer contract disputes to New Jersey.
Regulates individuals engaged in the facilitation of like-kind exchanges of property pursuant to Section 1031 of the United States Tax Code.
Creates New Jersey Business Action Center.
Requires independent State authority member to disclose contractual relationship between authority and authority member's relatives. *
Limits sale and manufacture of flame retardant chemical decabromodiphenyl ether.
Concerns exclusion of individuals with certain employment history in advertisements for job vacancies.
Creates a civil cause of action for stalking.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or fees and other statutory fees, subject to limitations, to fund e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; provides for review of such fees by Judiciary.*
Conforms Megan's law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Removes license suspension penalty for persons with only one outstanding parking fine; permits Motor Vehicle Commission to refuse registration to persons with outstanding parking fine.
Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.

Imposes mandatory minimum terms of imprisonment and forfeiture of pension and retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of crimes involving or touching their office or employment.
Clarifies that permitting sexual abusers to reside with a child constitutes endangering welfare of a child.
"Judy and Nikki's Law"; provides for life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of murder of a child 16 years of age or younger.
Provides immunity from civil liability to anyone who in good faith uses an automated external defibrillator in an emergency.
"Highway Accident Property Tax Relief Act;" requires State to reimburse municipalities for costs of providing certain emergency services.
Exempts senior citizens, disabled persons, and veterans from E-ZPass account monthly service charge.
