Exempts from sales tax certain sales by or to any senior citizens club organized for pleasure, recreation, or other nonprofitable purposes.
Expands eligibility under the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act by broadening certain municipal qualifier provisions.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
Provides that public employee pension benefits are calculated on base salary exclusive of various forms of extra compensation.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.

Concerns stalking and related restraining order protections for adoptive children and their adoptive parents victimized by persons whose parental rights to the adoptive children have been terminated.*
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Directs Attorney General to publicize information about human trafficking hotlines; mandates law enforcement training on responding to the needs of victims of the crime of human trafficking.
Increases and indexes maximum homestead property tax deduction under gross income tax.
Allocates nondedicated portion of State realty transfer fee collections to municipal property tax relief.
Permits eligible claimant who is proportionate owner paying entire property tax bill to collect entire homestead property tax reimbursement amount.
"One Strike, You're Ours;" adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
Bars direct solicitation letters from attorneys to accident victims and other persons.
Prohibits first responders from photographing persons being assisted or disclosing photographs of such persons without their consent.
Requires breath or blood test in motor vehicle accidents involving pedestrians.
Requires hospitals to maintain passive audio or visual mechanism for alerting emergency department staff to presence of non-ambulance vehicles containing patients.
Directs hospitals to establish protocols for dispatch and patient transport by specialty care transportation units used for inter-facility transfers.
Grants discretion to Parole Board in determining whether inmate should be released on parole.
Appropriates $5 million to Cranford Township for flood control projects.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for costs of electric power infrastructure for use by heavy duty vehicles to reduce idling times.
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, monument and historical markers. *
Prohibits service repair contractors from charging hourly rates for travel time.
Revises penalties for animal cruelty, increasing degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Reduces period of time that member of Legislature may be absent, without excuse, before member's seat is deemed vacant.
Permits advanced practice nurses to certify person as handicapped for purposes of handicapped parking.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.*
Requires reporting of public high school, district and Statewide drop-out and graduation rates.
"Statewide Drought Management Act."
Concerns unwanted delivery of newspapers.
Outlines procedures for conducting drug tests involving State law enforcement officers.
Establishes timeframes for certain stages in interest arbitration procedures.
Makes chief of police contractual municipal employee and requires peer review and performance evaluation for contract renewal.

"New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act"; requires each four-year public institution of higher education to provide on its website certain information regarding its costs, faculty, and graduation rates.
Prohibits public safety directors from exercising police powers.
Creates e-mail registration requirement for convicted stalkers.
Increases sheriffs' fees for executing arrest warrants in Special Civil Part.
Permits the issuance of restraining orders against persons charged with certain prostitution related offenses.

Establishes lawn watering restrictions; authorizes DEP to adopt water conservation regulations and to reduce water supply application backlog; and requires installation of automatic rain sensor devices under certain circumstances.
Permits municipalities to use auxiliary police in non-emergency situations.
Allows child support payor to petition court for accounting of recipient's disposition of child support funds under certain circumstances.
Repeals cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.
Excludes cosmetic dentistry from cosmetic medical procedures gross receipts tax.
Clarifies that motor vehicle rental companies may recover, through a "vehicle registration recovery fee" separately stated in rental agreement, certain costs of doing business.

Establishes uniform lower contribution limits and requires greater disclosure of all campaign contributions received by candidates; repeals laws regulating campaign contributions by entities performing certain public contracts.
Requires four-year institutions of higher education to achieve a minimum 50% five-year graduation rate for full time students within five years.
Requires owners of certain newly developed shopping centers to provide electric vehicle charging stations.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Replaces plenary winery and farm winery licenses with small winery and wine manufacturing licenses.
Requires certain municipal, school and fire district elections occur on date of nonpartisan municipal elections.
Requires municipalities to file copies of tax abatement and exemption agreements with county chief financial officer and county counsel within 30 days of execution.
Requires incarcerated individual be counted for redistricting purposes at previous address if State resident and not counted if incarcerated and not State resident.
Requires Chief Administrator of Motor Vehicle Commission to establish standards for average customer wait times at facilities.
Concerns UEZ funding to qualifying municipalities.
Prohibits distribution of campaign materials at any facility owned, maintained, operated or leased by unit of local government.
Prohibits soliciting of campaign contributions on any public property by elective public office candidates; prohibits persons from making contributions to such candidates on any public property.
Prohibits certain political activity by members and employees of local boards of education.
Provides immunity from civil liability to certain individuals who acquire or use an automated external defibrillator.
Provides that when addressing emergency Governor cannot take action that is inconsistent with statutes unless irreparable harm will result.
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Adds "significant bodily injury" to assault by auto or vessel statute; upgrades penalties for inflicting serious bodily injury.
Requires voter registration forms be made available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license.
Provides that public official may refuse to solemnize civil unions if solemnization conflicts with public official's conscience or sincerely held moral or religious beliefs.
Clarifies certain standards for regulation of recreational vehicles as housing.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Establishes reporting requirements and permissive inference for violations by motor vehicle operators approaching or passing certain horses, ponies and mules.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Clarifies that licensed dealers may provide firearms for display at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Sunsets "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" five years after date of enactment unless certain conditions are met.
"Ovarian Health Protection Act"; prohibits procurement or use of human eggs for research or experimentation.
Limits the salaries of school business administrators, superintendents of schools, and assistant superintendents of schools to the salary of the Commissioner of Education.
Prohibits placing primary election candidates into political party lines on primary ballot.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Eliminates $500 minimum tax on New Jersey S corporations with New Jersey gross receipts less than $100,000 under Corporation Business Tax.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Prohibits housing allowance in contract between State Board of Education and State district superintendent.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Prohibits release of illegal immigrants from correctional facilities.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Establishes separate license for dealers of non-motorized trailers.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Eliminates prohibition against purchasing more than one handgun in calendar month.
Repeals certain restrictions on future retail sales of handguns.
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Renders federal "Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act" null and void in NJ.
Requires certain public entities to issue requests for proposals for purchase of certain insurance products and services; requires disclosure of commissions paid.
Requires law enforcement agency to issue retired law enforcement officer identification card to certain qualified retirees.
Provides that farm, farmstand, or other agricultural operation selling firewood obtained from property other than seller's shall not be considered a lumber yard.

Authorizes municipalities that petition for or receive substantive certification pursuant to the "Fair Housing Act" to make certain affordable housing units available on a preferential basis to certain eligible persons.
Prohibits use of public funds for embryonic stem cell research.
Provides that no more than four of the seven public members appointed to the Highlands Water Protection and Planning Council may be of the same political party.
Allows certain self-employed business owners to deduct their own pension plan contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Allows for exclusion of certain properties from Highlands preservation area.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Requires "permanent injury" under limitation on lawsuit threshold to seriously impact life of injured person to pierce threshold.
Repeals sections of law pertaining to transfer of civil service and non-civil service employees of terminated local health agency to superseding agency.
Establishes "New Jersey Commission on Government Efficiency and Cost Control" to recommend measures for efficiency and cost reduction in State government.
Requires high-mounted rear stoplights on certain passenger vehicles.
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Concerns hazardous waste transporter fee.
Eliminates expansion of preschool education programs in "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Science Review Board and Environmental Policy Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with planning policies and science.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Exempts contaminated and industrially-zoned sites from affordable housing rules.
Prohibits the imposition of affordable housing need and related fees upon the local transfer or move of a business.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Provides that sales by UEZ retailers of items delivered to location outside of the UEZ shall not qualify for partial exemption from the sales tax.
Grants municipal courts discretion to assess court costs for certain dismissals and changes court costs for certain violations.

Prohibits elected officials and public employees from enrolling for health benefits with more than one public entity; provides civil action for treble expenses by public entity providing additional coverage.
The "New Jersey Self-Defense Law."
Increases membership of Fish and Game Council and clarifies it has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Eliminates seniority in Civil Service and other jurisdictions for reductions in force in certain circumstances.
Requires women incarcerated in county correctional facilities to cover full cost of abortion.
"The Abortion Mandate Opt-Out Act"; prohibits certain qualified health plans that provide abortion coverage from participating in health benefits Exchanges in the State.
Provides for drug testing of adult recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Revises current juror compensation.
Establishes a process for renewal of DOE issued authorization of certified educational facilities manager.
Establishes right to immediate interlocutory appeal from determinations as to class certification in class action lawsuits.

Makes various changes to civil service; permits institution of temporary layoffs; permits government entities to opt-out of civil service; requires civil service examinations be offered on continual basis.
Provides for automatic waiver of juvenile case to adult court for repeat juvenile offenders.
Permits a tax deduction under the New Jersey gross income tax for taxpayers who operate or maintain for their employees a licensed child care center or who have paid the cost of outside child care.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for day care center support benefiting children of employees.
Revises State funding formula for public education.
Raises monetary threshold for at-fault automobile accidents to $1,000.
Revises New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act and other laws relating thereto.
Changes compensation trigger for reenrollment of PERS retiree from $15,000 in aggregate to $15,000 per public employer.
Establishes tuition aid grant pilot program for part-time county college students.
Exempts municipal clerk from penalties for Open Public Records Act violations under certain circumstances.
Prohibits use of certain underwriting guidelines by insurers pertaining to guide dogs, service dogs, or hearing assistance dogs harbored on the insured property.
Provides for forwarding of criminal history record background check information among State agencies under certain circumstances.
Excludes individual building single family home as his primary residence from provisions of "Fair Housing Act."
Allows for certain capital asset loss and capital asset loss carryforward deductions under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Permits appointment of municipal emergency management coordinator from contiguous or adjoining municipality.
Exempts sales of services by counties and municipalities from sales and use tax.
Exempts security deposits by residential tenants from provisions of "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act.
Provides that an "attorney-in-fact" is a fiduciary for purposes of theft statutes.
Requires certain public utilities to notify an appropriate law enforcement officer of service shutoffs to residential customers under certain circumstances.
Authorizes courts to include animals in domestic violence restraining orders.
Establishes Office of Asset and Revenue Recovery within Office of Attorney General in DLPS.
Requires county board of taxation to transmit written memorandum of judgment to assessor and taxpayer within 15 days of judgment.
Prohibits application of foreign laws when application violates constitutional rights.
Exempts child under age six from hepatitis B vaccine requirement if child's mother tested negative for hepatitis B during her pregnancy.
Requires Legislative review and approval of toll increases or new tolls proposed by toll road authorities.
Requires certain notifications upon sale of property where private well is treated by point of entry system.
Upgrades possession of child pornography to a crime of the third degree; provides for parole supervision for life for production and transmission of child pornography.
Provides procedure for municipality acquiring school property from non-operating school district following merger to extinguish restrictive deed covenant.
Requires school buses transporting certain disabled persons to use flashing lights and establishes penalties for drivers who fail to yield.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.
Requires correspondence or notice by public entity contain citations of any appropriate statutes, ordinances, or resolutions.
Revises penalty for destruction of, or damage to, trees, saplings, shrubs or other plants; repeals current law thereon.

Clarifies law concerning labeling of farm products; increases penalties for violations and false labeling and identification of "Jersey Fresh" and Department of Agriculture designated brands; repeals R.S.4:10-15.
Requires health care professionals to notify patients of end of health benefits coverage during course of treatment in certain circumstances.
Allows fees to be suspended or vacated for certain persons sentenced to labor assistance programs as alternative to incarceration.
Concerns permits, letters of exemption, and enforcement with regard to agricultural activities under "Freshwater Wetlands Protection Act".
Establishes farm brewery and winery-brewery beverage license and permits farm wineries to produce hard cider.
Creates cooperative farm winery licenses.
Requires carriers to clarify whether medically necessary procedures are covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Requires certain notifications, and provides for guaranteed NJ Spill Compensation Fund coverage, upon sale of property where private well is treated by point of entry water treatment system.
Requires DHSS to dispose of newborn screening specimens within 60 days after testing.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Expands number of salesrooms winery may operate from six to seven and permits sampling of wine at salesrooms.
Permits wineries to sell wine at certain farm markets.
Permits supermarkets to sell New Jersey wine by the bottle from vending machines.
Permits New Jersey wineries to sell their products by the bottle in vending machines.
Permits breweries to offer samples and to sell directly to consumers at brewery premises.
Establishes and enhances certain insurance fraud prevention measures.
Allows person with diabetes to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Permits a farm income averaging credit under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Provides municipalities with discretion to restrict hours for sale of package goods.
Requires certificate of need for hospital-based basic obstetric and pediatric services.
Creates "Inmate Community Service Program" in DOC.
Concerns radiologic technology licensure.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable year 2010.
Expands wrongful death act to allow recovery for mental anguish, emotional pain and suffering, loss of society and loss of companionship.
Authorizes institutions of higher education to grant college credit to high school students who complete the Jersey Boys State or Jersey Girls State program.
Establishes School Asthma Protocol Task Force.
Establishes the Workforce Shortage Loan Redemption Program.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for employers who hire former prisoners.
Establishes the "Private Investment in Public Education Fund."
Restores benefit under State earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal credit beginning in Tax Year 2011.
Provides for priority consideration, by State, of permit applications by counties and municipalities with 10 or more shared services.
Requires interpretive statements of State general obligation bond act public questions to include certain fiscal information.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.

Prohibits legislative aide who works, or worked, directly for legislator in district office from making political contribution greater than $30 per election to that legislator; prohibits receipt of such contribution.
"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Allows residents of certain Highlands municipalities to designate on gross income tax returns that a portion of gross income tax paid be returned to municipality of residence.
Clarifies right of employers to require employees to speak English while engaged in work.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Excludes overtime pay of certain employees from gross income tax.
"Prenatally and Postnatally Diagnosed Conditions Awareness Act in New Jersey."
Prohibits wrongful life/birth suits.
Establishes procedure for notification to, and review by, municipalities of certain grant and loan applications for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Re-establishes 6.37 percent as top marginal gross income tax rate.
Places restrictions on unsolicited school budget communications sent by a board of education to school district residents 90 days prior to annual school election.
Authorizes the establishment of probationary periods for nontenured faculty members at State colleges.
"Medical Philanthropy Act"; provides physicians who provide uncompensated care with $250,000 cap on noneconomic damages in actions alleging medical malpractice.
"Education Investment Act"; establishes an equity financing for education program at certain public institutions of higher education.
Amends State college law to allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system.
Allows Governor to remove an executive county superintendent of schools at will.
Provides civil immunity to licensed health care professionals who provide care at health care facilities for no compensation.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers and additional modifications of the charter school program.

"School Children First Act"; modifies evaluation of teachers and principals; revises tenure acquisition process and certain tenure charge procedures; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires mutual consent for teacher placement; and eliminates certain seniority rights.
Eliminates public school district budget reduction appeals to the Commissioner of Education.

"Home-Based Jobs Creation Act"; classifies certain home businesses as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing, or retailing activities.
The "Smart Container Act."
Extends the statute of limitations for certain sexual abuse cases.
Authorizes special "We Support the Arts" license plates with proceeds to the New Jersey State Council on the Arts.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Requires health insurers to cover oral anticancer medications on no less favorable basis than intravenous anticancer medications.
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
Permits Legislature to void closing of State psychiatric hospital or developmental center.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Prohibits display of political campaign signs on any public property or highway.
Authorizes county to establish county hospital authority; amends title of "Municipal Hospital Authority Law."
Provides for oversight of DHS contracts with providers serving persons with developmental disabilities.
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public services privatization contracts.
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DHSS.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to register with ELEC and disclose contribution and independent expenditure information.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Allows credit against corporation business tax equal to 50 percent of fair market value of new computer equipment donated to public or nonpublic school.
Temporarily renames NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic Brain Injury as NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic and Acquired Brain Injury; establishes Acquired Brain Injury Fund.
Allows business tax credit to employers giving paid leave to employees for service with volunteer emergency services organizations under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Provides that charter schools will be subject to monitoring under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum.
Provides for collection on child support arrearages and certain public assistance overpayments through withholding of casino and racetrack winnings.
Requires hearing and approval of premium changes for individual and small employer health benefits plans; expands jurisdiction of Division of Rate Counsel.

Provides gross income tax credit for payment of certain tolls and fares related to certain transportation projects and improvements maintained and operated by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
"PANYNJTransparency and Accountability Act." *
Imposes time constraints on submission and analysis of rape kits.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Requires DHSS to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by December 31, 2010.
Increases penalties for drunk driving with a minor as a passenger.
Prohibits smoking in automobiles when children are present.
Requires certain motor vehicle reinspections be conducted at licensed private inspection facilities.
Provides for termination of child support obligation upon certain conditions.
Extends period for requested medical exam for disability benefits under PFRS to every two years until 55 years of age.
Establishes "Study Commission on E-Licensing."
Prohibits public and private employers from discriminating against ex-convicts.
Establishes linked deposit program allowing State Treasurer to deposit State funds at below market interest rates with certain banks.
Concerns prompt payment of construction contracts.
Excludes from income for gross income tax and PAAD eligibility purposes victims' remuneration for involuntary internment received under judgments or settlement agreements.

Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison, Keansburg, and two joint urban enterprise zones, one in Cliffside Park and Fairview, and one in Buena Vista Township and Buena Borough.
Prohibits authorized bearer from mailing or transporting voted ballots to county board on behalf of more than 10 qualified voters in an election.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Prohibits public and independent institutions of higher education from admitting any student who is not a United States citizen or who does not hold lawful immigration status.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Restores the death penalty for persons who commit certain murders.
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations.
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Makes various changes to civil service law concerning seasonal appointments, temporary layoffs, and rescinding adoption of civil service.
Limits right of appeal of disciplinary action taken by employer against certain public employees.
Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes.
Exempts contracting units who use cooperative purchasing agreements or cooperative pricing systems from price adjustments in local public contracts for asphalt cement and fuel.
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met.
Requires medical oxygen providers to notify fire department whenever they stop delivering oxygen to a local residence.
Permits municipalities to provide information on property tax bills concerning amount of local tax dollars saved through shared services.
Requires State agencies, when developing and proposing rules, to utilize approaches that will accomplish objectives of statutory law while minimizing adverse economic impact on municipalities.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights Program Act."
Provides tax credits to companies contributing to loan and loan redemption program for residents who attend institutions of higher education in the State and work at such a company upon graduation.
Increases threshold amount at which MLUL escrow deposits must be deposited in interest bearing accounts.
Prohibits local governments from acquiring by condemnation any airport that has had its development rights purchased.
Creates alternate voting members on county agriculture development boards.
Requires genetic testing to determine paternity in non-dissolution cases.
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Requires Attorney General to defend certain local law enforcement officers.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Establishes New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center and authorizes establishment of Foundation for the New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Requires State Office of Emergency Management to study and recommend evacuation routes in Trenton for inclement weather conditions or other emergency situations.
Requires electric utility bills to separately list the amount of State sales tax, societal benefits charge and transitional energy facility unit rate assessment surcharge.
Provides that certain permits and approvals for critical infrastructure projects must be acted upon within 45 days.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor under certain circumstances constitutes aggravated sexual assault or sexual assault.
Reduces unemployment benefits and employer unemployment taxes.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Authorizes development of public-private transportation demonstration projects.
Authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoir levels prior to certain severe weather events.
Adds child molestation and endangerment to crimes that subject public school employee offender to pension and retirement benefit forfeiture.

Provides school district tax levy cap adjustment for certain special education costs; limits sending district per pupil tuition increase to 2%; and provides increased representation on receiving board of education for certain sending districts.
Prohibits telecommunications, utility or cable television companies from charging certain customers prior to actual billing due date.
Directs State Lottery Commission to permit purchase of lottery tickets by electronic means.
"Kulesh and Kubert's, and Bolis Law;" establishes violation of hands-free cell phone law as reckless under vehicular homicide and assault by auto statutes.*
Requires public agencies to set printers and computers to default to most cost effective fonts for printing to conserve ink and paper.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.
Requires State toll road authorities to give preference in awarding service station contracts to bidders offering to dispense certain alternative fuels on State's toll roads.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.

Amends FY2011 annual appropriations act to authorize use of $2,000,000 of federal funds available from Temporary Assistance to Needy Families Emergency Contingency Fund for establishment of Statewide Youth Employment Initiative.
Increases fine and imposes license suspension for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in port district of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.

Requires the Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to develop and distribute a document containing student loan repayment information for school districts and nonpublic high schools to disseminate to students.
"New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit Act;" provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for investing in New Jersey emerging technology businesses.
Exempts certain files of clinical programs at law schools in State from Open Public Records Act.
Clarifies trustee's discretionary authority concerning income tax liability.
Establishes mandatory, uniform attorney identification card.
Requires that contracts by non-utility load serving entities to purchase solar renewable energy certificates shall extend for a term of 15 years or longer.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Creates the option to make a voluntary contribution for the support of local libraries on gross income tax returns.
Allows person with penicillin allergy to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
"Workforce Investment for New Teachers Act"; provides $5,000 refundable gross income tax credit to new teachers in low-performing school districts.
Establishes a loan redemption program for teachers employed in chronically failing schools.
Concerns wage protection and certain penalties for violating laws regarding wages, compensation or benefits.
Increases benefit amounts and income eligibility limits for the Work First New Jersey program.
Increases child support amount that may be received in addition to assistance grant under Work First New Jersey program.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certificate of patient if nurse is patient's primary care giver.*
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Modifies certain State and county-funded rental assistance programs.
Provides certain reemployment rights to teachers dismissed due to a reduction in force.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support the Girl Scouts councils in New Jersey.
Prohibits Governor from using State helicopter for personal and political events; requires quarterly reports to the Legislature.
Provides gross income tax credit for interest paid on certain student loans.
Requires prosecution of domestic violence-related cases in Superior Court; removes jurisdiction from municipal court.
Authorizes "Proud to Be an American" license plate with proceeds to veterans' and emergency management organizations.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.
Expands number of literacy advocacy programs eligible to receive voluntary taxpayer contributions through gross income tax returns.
Requires that certain relocation notices be bilingual in municipalities where at least one-third of the population are likely to speak a common non-English native language.
Affords emergency services peer counselors confidentiality privileges.
Prohibits sale of tobacco products in vending machines and establishes requirements for retail sales of tobacco.
Establishes procedure to insure inmates with military service receive all the veteran benefits to which they are entitled upon release.
Requires automobile insurers to maintain sales representation in urban rating territories.
The "Abandoned Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Act."
Requires NJMVC to implement procedures for issuing nondriver identification cards to persons rendered immobile by disabilities.
Establishes 180 day prohibition on purchase of handgun for certain individuals who fail to report loss or theft of firearm.
Establishes the Early Childhood Educator Development Scholarship Program.
Establishes School Success Task Force to study the issues of student truancy, suspensions, expulsions, dropouts, and school violence.
Requires training for certain staff working with persons with developmental disabilities.
Requires persons to report incidents of domestic violence to law enforcement and makes it a disorderly persons offense to fail to report.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Tuition Waiver Program."
Requires person in business of selling all-terrain vehicles to properly register vehicle prior to delivery to buyer; increases penalties for violating all-terrain vehicle restrictions.
Requires landlord to permit tenant to remain in foreclosed property in certain circumstances.
Allows denial of coverage to an insured who commits fraud but not to innocent spouse.
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age 17 for voting at next election occurring on or after 18th birthday.
Establishes "Small Business Revolving Loan and Credit Enhancement Fund" within EDA to provide loans and credit enhancement assistance to certain small businesses.
Requires Commissioner of Education to annually evaluate the effectiveness of teacher preparation programs at institutions of higher education in the State.
Provides for a municipal court community service fee.
Expands DNA database to include samples from certain arrestees; designated "Katie's Law."
"Internet Service Provider Customer Bill of Rights."
Provides tax credit against corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain small businesses receiving qualifying loans.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for business enterprises that are owned by or that employ veterans.
Establishes bill of rights for authorized family members of persons with developmental disabilities.*
Requires period of mandatory incarceration for second or subsequent conviction for prostitution.
Upgrades offense and increases penalty for certain acts of defiant trespass.
Concerns appeal of assessment of real property in certain municipalities.
Exempts individuals with certain types of military service from certain fees and continuing education or professional competency requirements.

Provides that NJBEST Program is available to persons with taxpayer identification number; establishes DREAM Commission to provide scholarships for children of immigrants; and requires teaching staff professional development include information on serving such children.
Increases domestic violence civil penalty and surcharge; imposes new civil penalties under certain circumstances; provides funds to Legal Services.
"Urban Hope Act"; provides a process to permit authorized entities to build, operate, and manage "renaissance school projects" as public schools in no more than three identified failing districts.
Requires Civil Service Commission to generate compensation guidelines to help counties and municipalities determine appropriate pay for various positions.
Prohibits local government agency from employing person on paid leave from local government agency of another county or municipality.
Requires building materials dealer to provide uniquely identified delivery ticket to consumer.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain small business employers that provide health care benefits to employees.
Provides a gross income tax credit for textbook purchases made for undergraduate education.
Requires suicide prevention continuing education courses for physicians and podiatrists.
Requires counties, municipalities, fire districts, and boards of education to cooperatively develop and implement five-year financial plans.
Directs certain recoveries of federal funds for services to persons with developmental disabilities be used for grants to support community infrastructure purposes.
Authorizes State and local governments to enter into group purchasing agreement for advanced technology vehicles and alternative fueled vehicles. *
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for construction of buildings in accordance with certain energy and environmental performance standards.
Requires Commission on Higher Education to develop accountability and transparency standards for public research institutions and State colleges.
Requires BPU to establish Energy Efficiency Leadership awards program.
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
Creates Office of Energy Savings to implement program to improve energy efficiency and conservation for all State agencies.

Establishes loan redemption program for certain teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public schools.
Encourages purchase of NJ solar panels and wind turbines for State projects and State-funded projects.
Establishes standardized energy audit and training program.
Requires school districts to annually disseminate information to students and parents or guardians on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means.

Prohibits retail stores from selling cellular telephone equipment or cellular telephone equipment service contracts unless stores provide information brochures about "sexting" to customers who purchase such equipment or contracts.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to address school climate issues related to harassment, intimidation, and bullying in public schools.
Requires New Jersey Transit to offer discount passes to all New Jersey higher education students.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement for claimants affected by eminent domain.
Revises the period of time required for a State college faculty member to receive tenure.*
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside; restricts locations of certain child care centers and school bus stops.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Permits institutions of higher education to make supplemental contributions to ABP.
Provides tax credits to certain businesses for certain capital investment in qualified business facilities and qualified residential projects located in vicinity of designated transit villages.
Encourages local unit sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave; limits employment for certain public employees.
Extends for three years application submission deadline to EDA for review and approval of certain construction projects involving public institutions of higher education.
Specifies that doctoral students seeking eligibility for licensure as practicing psychologists shall not be required to physically attend classes.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
Revises the NJ STARS and NJ STARS II Programs.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote the establishment of higher education and business partnerships.*
Extends certain business tax credit programs to the gross income tax.

Limits payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers or employees represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation. *
Concerns basic skills training provided by the New Jersey Community College Consortium for Workforce and Economic Development.
Concerns contents of zoning ordinances.
Prohibits sale on school property of certain foods during school breakfast and lunch periods.
Requires each municipality to establish a Reverse 9-1-1 system.
Provides immunity from liability for persons who install or inspect child restraint systems.

Requires the "Commission to Review Criminal Sentencing" to examine activities which victimize persons, particularly women and children, and are not codified in the Code of Criminal Justice and recommend appropriate legislation for establishing such crimes.
Concerns magazine subscriptions.
Requires installation of fire suppression systems in school buses and special paratransit vehicles.
Clarifies functioning high-mounted rear stop lamp is required under State law.
Establishes pilot program in DEP for chemical cleanouts in schools.
Concerns transfer of PANYNJ contracts related to marine terminals.
Criminalizes the manufacture, distribution and possession of Salvia divinorum.
Requires labeling of food containing any product from a cloned animal or its progeny.
Requires retail store operators to establish in-store recycling programs that provide opportunities for customers to return clean plastic carryout bags.
Requires retailers to provide consumers with information on origin of raw produce.
Requires NJ Transit to do study of platform safety issues at rail stations.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Requires NJ Transit to provide refunds for unused tickets for certain transit services.
Exempts from sales tax all hybrid and certain highly fuel efficient vehicles.
Requires DEP to conduct study concerning single-use paper bags and plastic bags.
Requires SHBP and School Employees' Health Benefits Program audit programs to review employee, retiree and dependent eligibility at least every five years.

Requires biannual assessment of the condition of trees within 25 feet of any public highway maintained by DOT and on the State's three toll roads and repair or removal of trees presenting a traffic hazard.
Permits certain fair share affordable housing obligations to be met with family and veteran's housing.
Requires projects with State or Local financing to be built to high performance green building standards and provides for performance review and annual report.
Requires the supervisor of a school bus driver to inspect the school bus for pupils remaining at the end of the transportation route.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message.
Clarifies ability of certain contracting units to specify use of inherently safer technologies for contracts involving extraordinarily hazardous substances.
Provides for equitable adjustment to certain contracts with DOT for construction and maintenance of highways, streets or roads.
Subjects county and municipal sewerage authority service rate increases to approval by Board of Public Utilities.
Increases health benefits continuation coverage to 36 months for certain persons covered under certain employer health benefits plans.
Revises penalties for a school bus driver who leaves a pupil on a school bus at the end of his route.

Permits collective bargaining on matters covered by civil service; requires civil service examinations to be offered on continual basis; creates title reduction task force; requires posting of layoff plans.
Clarifies that any use of another person's personal identifying information is a crime.
Revises definition of class I renewable energy to include energy produced by certain geothermal heat pumps.
Establishes pilot program to utilize value-based benefit design in SHBP to increase health benefits coverage for certain employees concerning chronic health conditions.
Provides updated procedures for disposition of State surplus computers and certain other electronic devices designated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.
Upgrades penalty for unlawful possession of certain firearms on grounds of an educational institution.*
Enhances penalties for failing to move over when approaching stationary emergency vehicle displaying emergency lights.
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages.
Establishes annual sales tax holiday for certain sales of personal computers and certain sales of school supplies and equipment during first full weekend of August.
Makes certain changes to public access of government records.
Establishes Office of Airline Consumer Advocate and consumer bill of rights for airline passengers; requires provision of certain services to passengers on flights delayed more than two hours.
Directs Attorney General to develop guidelines for positive identification of suspects before release.
Requires the adoption of nepotism policies by school districts and charter schools.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from certain drivers involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury.
Requires school districts to provide for the safe operation of electrically operated partitions in classrooms or other school facilities.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Prohibits the sale of certain children's products containing lead, mercury, or cadmium.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Requires printers to display average cost per 1,000 printed pages and ink cartridges to display yield.
Provides that regular work week of all newly-hired full-time State or local government employees will be 40 hours.
Concerns compensation and benefits of officers, employees, and members of State and local authorities.
Permits counties and municipalities to withdraw from civil service system by ordinance.
Authorizes hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Requires that public employees who are married, partners in civil union couples, or with domestic partners receive health care benefits from only one public employer.
Repeals restriction on weights and measures officers' and employees' duties.
Establishes pilot project to permit overseas and military voters to vote in certain elections using Internet; makes an appropriation.
Requires destruction of records stored on digital copy machines under certain circumstances.
Exempts stored value cards usable solely for telephone services from State's escheatment processes.
Authorizes county and municipal consumer affairs directors to conduct administrative hearings, assess civil and other penalties, and issue cease and desist orders.
Increases penalties for violations committed by precious metals buyers and requires weights and measures officers to seize scales under certain circumstances.
Requires DOH to establish uniform standards for retail food establishment health and sanitary evaluation placards.*

"Government Reality Check Act"; prohibits public employers from providing certain benefits to public employees; restricts gifts to public employees; restricts travel by public employees; imposes post-employment restriction on public contracting employees.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Port Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River and Bay Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Port Authority of New York and New Jersey commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.

Requires Civil Service Commission to establish and enforce clothing allowance policy for State employees; prohibits clothing allowance unless employment necessitates wearing of uniform or special clothing.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from selling from ice cream trucks.
Authorizes municipal governing body to create and maintain list of municipal residents in need of special assistance in case of emergency for public safety purposes.
Provides that gift certificates and cards shall not expire or contain dormancy fees.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 20 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 20 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of nonprofit community agencies from using title of psychologist.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Increases membership of State Police Retirement System Board of Trustees; requires membership to include two active and two retired members.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Increases additional penalty assessment for drunk driving; dedicates revenue to VCCB.
Regulates teen nights by requiring security provided by police officers, prohibiting persons under age 15 from attending, and disqualifying registered sex offenders from employment.
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Concerns contributions to special funds made through the gross income tax return.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Requires State Treasurer to disseminate information about organ and tissue donation; designates April each year as "Donate Life Month."
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million for grants to certain nursing schools to address shortage of nursing faculty.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State four years.*
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
Requires a review of corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit programs for payments to interns.*
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Requires SHBP and joint insurance funds to provide certain information to participating public employers.*
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Authorizes municipality to provide for imposition and collection of special assessment to secure developer's recovery of cost of certain improvements in connection with redevelopment project.
Revises privileges of limited and restricted breweries.*
Requires health insurers and SHBP to provide certain mental health benefits for eating disorders under same terms and conditions as for other illnesses and diseases.
Directs NJTA to study and report on potential revenue generating services of NJTA rest areas and service plazas.
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.

Clarifies that executive county superintendent's authorities regarding special education services do not allow him to require a child study team to make a specific determination on the special education placement for a student.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.
Requires insurers to cover treatment for sickle cell anemia; requires DHSS to provide information to public about sickle cell anemia.
Requires insurers to provide coverage for medications and dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Requires Commissioner of Education to accept charter school applications throughout the calendar year and expedites approval of charter school applications.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers.
Provides for notification to law enforcement authorities of discharge of certain persons brought to screening services for evaluation and assessment for mental health services.

Requires plans, specifications, and bid proposal documents for certain local public contracts to address soil contamination, and requires contracting unit to approve change order under certain circumstances related thereto.*
Clarifies enforcement responsibility of State Housing Code concerning multiple dwellings from municipalities to the State under the "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
Clarifies informed consent provisions of "Access to Medical Research Act" for persons with developmental disabilities.
Permits release of certain student information.

Requires schools that participate in Statewide interscholastic sports programs to annually inform student-athletes about National Collegiate Athletic Association eligibility standards for participation in collegiate athletics.
Establishes "VETeach Pilot Program" in DOE to facilitate the teacher certification of veterans.
Revises the dates for submission and approval of school district applications for designation as a choice district.
Prohibits the construction of school facilities on a contaminated or remediated site.
Establishes Public School Revenue Study Commission.
Prohibits sale of emergency warning lights to unauthorized motorists.
Increases penalties for unauthorized display or use of emergency warning lights.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for full time enrollment at four year institutions of higher education, county colleges and accredited post-secondary schools in New Jersey.
Increases annual income limitation to receive senior and disabled citizens' property tax deduction to $15,000.
Prohibits toll-free passage for SJTA employees, officers, and members except while commuting or carrying out official duties.

Authorizes county surrogates to establish or expand programs to provide information to law enforcement officers, firefighters and first aid squad members concerning the preparation of wills, living wills and powers of attorney.
Exempts reimbursements from Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare and allows deduction for charity care in calculation of gross receipts for purposes of assessment on ambulatory care facilities.
Authorizes the issuance of $2,705,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance the construction and renovation of higher education facilities; appropriates $5,000.
Revises the structure, functions and authority of the State Investment Council and the Director of the State Division of Investment.
Adds budget language specifying Medicaid reimbursement for various ambulance services provided to certain recipients.
Requires the State Police to establish a recently relocated offenders section within the Megan's Law sex offender Internet registry.
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.
Requires certain service extensions undertaken in municipally-designated areas in need of redevelopment or rehabilitation to receive same benefits as if located in smart growth area.
Requires DEP to submit annual financial report on status of certain fund balances.
Revises civil service status of certain county welfare agency management positions and requires county welfare agencies to adjust office hours.
Requires Mandated Health Benefits Advisory Commission to study financial impact of all enacted mandated health benefits.
Authorizes expenditures from open space trust funds to develop or maintain recreation and conservation land although the land was not acquired by the municipality.
Requires Treasurer and Divisions of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by May 15 and November 15 each year.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.
Concerns calculation of certain HMO loss ratios; makes various changes to individual and small employer health benefits programs, charity care and NJ FamilyCare programs.
Establishes a New Jersey Homebuyer Tax Credit Program under the New Jersey gross income tax for home purchases during a qualified period.

Decreases sales and use tax rate from seven percent to six percent and reduces sales and use tax base by eliminating tax on digital property and certain services and by restoring certain exclusions and exemptions.
Repeals application of gross income tax to certain New Jersey Lottery prize winnings.
Reduces the alcoholic beverage excise tax rate on liquor, wine, vermouth, sparkling wine, and hard cider and eliminates the dedication of that tax to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Removes plenary retail distribution license limit for certain stores.
Establishes limited retail religious distribution license.
Provides credit against ambulatory care facility assessment liability for value of unreimbursed care provided to hospital charity care patients.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds.
Clarifies responsibility of Unsatisfied Claim and Judgment Fund for pedestrian personal injury protection claims.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.*
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.
Establishes procedures for districts to opt to move the annual school election to November and eliminates vote on school budgets for such districts, except for separate proposals to spend above cap.
Changes marriage and civil union licensing requirements and increases license fees.**
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all elections under certain conditions.*

Establishes procedures for districts, municipalities, or voters to opt to move the annual school election to November and eliminates vote on school budgets for such districts, except for separate proposals to spend above cap.
Extends expiration date of certain permits pursuant to the "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Prohibits use of campaign funds by candidate or legislative leader convicted of crime; requires that such funds be paid to ELEC for enforcement purposes.
Eliminates statute of limitations in civil cases involving certain sexual offenses.
Requires AG to defend challenges to certain municipal ordinances that establish residency requirements for convicted sex offenders.
Prohibits the use of certain fishing gear on artificial reefs.
Establishes penalties for manufacture, purchase or possession of certain keys.
Upgrades lewdness to fourth degree crime if committed in public rest room.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Establishes training wage.

Revises laws governing provision of affordable housing; reestablishes regional contribution agreement as method of meeting affordable housing obligation; repeals Statewide non-residential development fee.
Requires Division of Property Management and Construction to conduct analysis of State buildings to determine energy and cost savings through use of renewable energy equipment or technology.
Provides partial tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for cost of renewable energy property.
Removes licensing requirement for recreational bingo games.
Requires criminal history record background checks on certain volunteer sports personnel.
Clarifies powers of public safety directors.
Exempts certain volunteer emergency service organizations from charitable contribution filing fees.
Provides that person who impersonates law enforcement officer and commits crime is guilty of third degree crime.
Requires all new State buildings to have solar or geothermal energy systems, where feasible.
Directs prison administrators and halfway house operators to notify local news media of inmate escapes.
Prohibits public school fund-raising activities which include unsupervised door-to-door sales by students.
Requires disclosure of all campaign contributions received and expenditures made by school board candidates.
Allows planning and zoning board members to satisfy training requirements on Internet.
Requires training and registration for in-house security officers.
Permits municipalities to charge a fee to cover ancillary costs of traffic control; limits fee.
Prohibits siting of industrial wind turbines within 2,000 feet of any residence or residentially zoned property.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route No. 34 in Wall Township as the "Duncan Thecker Memorial Highway."
Establishes task force to study various issues related to improving special education programs and services for public school students.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Criminalizes participation in criminal street gang.
Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a third degree crime.
Requires applicants for liquor licenses and license transfers to notify residents within 200 feet of licensed premises.
Prohibits certain sales of alcoholic beverages within 1,000 feet of schools or religious institutions.
Requires mandatory registration of family day care providers.
Establishes a 500 foot drug free zone around child care centers.
Broadens municipal arson investigators' powers.
Requires parents who intend to home-school their children to inform the school district of that decision; requires school district to maintain record of each home-schooled child in the district.
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Requires electric power suppliers to pay retail power prices for purchase of certain renewable energy production.
Provides for submission to voters in each county a binding referendum on the establishment of a county administrative school district to govern and operate all public schools in the county.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.
Provides immunity to institutions of higher education for food donations.
Provides corporation business tax incentives for life sciences research.

Requires electric, gas, and water public utilities to provide bill credits to volunteer fire companies, first aid, rescue, and emergency squads, and nonprofit homeless and domestic violence assistance organizations.
Expands State's energy efficiency and renewable energy requirements. **
Establishes alternative distributed energy generating requirement; provides financial incentives for certain alternative distributed energy generating facilities.**

Creates new taxable category of alcoholic beverages called flavored malt beverages, imposes separate rate of taxation on new category pursuant to alcoholic beverages tax and allocates associated revenue.
Authorizes school district to require a certificate of occupancy to demonstrate student eligibility for enrollment in the district.
Permits municipalities to establish weapons free zones around schools and public facilities.
Authorizes payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt institution of higher education property if 25 percent of property of municipality is tax exempt and 12.5 percent is institution's property.
Provides for uniform basic structure of taxicab fares in certain municipalities.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old; increases fine on parent of truant student; and requires truant student to complete community service requirement.
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Allows private passenger automobile usage information as rating factor in insurance underwriting.
Requires corporations qualifying for State development subsidy grants to repay entire grant amount if corporation fails to uphold grant terms.
Establishes pilot program suspending operations of superintendent and deputy superintendent of elections in certain second class counties.
Requires each charter school to annually employ teachers who hold special education endorsements.

Authorizes local governments to license the use of, or sell in fee simple or as an easement interest, public roads within a municipality to connect a non-contiguous solar, wind, combined heat and power, or biomass generation facility with an end-use customer; requires public utility to provide for the connection.
Establishes New Jersey Food Access Initiative; funds initiative with certain sales tax revenue from urban enterprise zones for five years.

Provides for homestead property tax relief for senior homestead owners with certain gross income based on higher of homestead credit or local school property taxes on first $60,000 of homestead value.
Authorizes payment of funeral expenses for certain public safety employees killed in line of duty.
Concerns adding names of certain veterans to certain civil service eligibility lists.
The "Common Sense Shared Services Act"; concerns shared service agreements for certain local personnel under "Uniform Shared Services and Consolidation Act."*
Requires payment to municipality for use of municipal services by for-profit lessee of property owned by county or county improvement authority.
Reduces sales tax rate on certain sales and admission charges at places of amusement in urban enterprise zone areas and provides that sales tax revenue be for municipal purposes.
Provides financial assistance for higher education expenses of former Work First New Jersey recipients after leaving program.
Provides for receipt for voter at primary or general election; allows receipt to be proof of eligibility to vote in subsequent election; provides State reimbursement.
Provides official State recognition of Powhatan Renape Nation, Nanticoke Lenni-Lenape Indians of New Jersey, Inc., and Ramapough Mountain Indians as American Indian Tribes for certain purposes.
Establishes Prevention Services Programs for Children and Families Network.
Establishes Trenton Capital City Aid program.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Restricts large trucks to certain highway networks.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Requires businesses to notify customers concerning use of radio frequency identification systems that collect information about customers.
Establishes minimum energy efficiency standards for certain products.
Establishes New Jersey Chronic Kidney Disease Task Force.
Establishes school chemical management program; appropriates $90,000.
Permits labor peace agreements in projects in which public entities have proprietary interests.
Decreases the penalty for certain parole violations.
Requires county sheriff to establish procedure to assist pre-release inmates applying for certain assistance.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses employing qualified ex-offenders.
Concerns access to wage records in connection with projects subject to prevailing wage requirements.
Authorizes eight hours of leave for parents and guardians from work for school-related events of children.
Requires that motor fuel pumps operated by retail dealers be equipped to measure in temperature-adjusted gallons.
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies.
Qua-Daishia's Law: bars disclosure of personal identifying information contained in grand jury materials; creates fourth degree offense for unauthorized disclosure.
Provides for continuing education for real estate brokers, broker-salespersons and salespersons, and creates a new licensing category of referral agents.
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
Requires notice by insurers when private passenger automobile insurance applicant not placed in most favorable tier based upon certain criteria.
Authorizes special Alpha Kappa Alpha license plate.
Establishes "Smart Housing Incentives Act."
Specifies term for chairmen of county boards of election; authorizes non-consecutive terms.
Mandates professional engineers to complete continuing professional competency requirements during each biennial licensure period.
Extends service prevailing wage requirements to food service contracts and to local units and State authorities.
Addresses various concerns affecting post-release employment.
Creates Foreclosure Prevention and Neighborhood Stabilization Revolving Trust Fund; places temporary surcharge on mortgage foreclosure complaints.
Requires lowest possible price for inmate telephone calls.
Requires incarcerated persons be counted as residents of their previous address, not prison, for redistricting purposes.
Eliminates certain prohibitions to expungements of criminal records.
Establishes a magnet school pilot program in DOE.
Expands category of lists from which a single juror source list is compiled to include recipients of cash assistance or food stamps.
Requires procedures for plea bargaining by mail for certain motor vehicle violations.
Authorizes assessment of development impact fees by municipalities.
Permits certain sheriffs to enforce truck weight limits.
Eliminates award of attorneys' fees, filing fees and costs of suit for technical violation of the consumer fraud act.
Provides public servant is guilty of official misconduct if he knowingly obtains, arranges or provides "no-show" job for himself or another.
Establishes procedures for admitting into evidence blood sample certificates and related lab reports in drunk driving cases.
The " Responsible Pesticide Use Reduction Recognition Act." *
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Consolidates all "doughnut municipalities" and "doughnut-hole municipalities" within 10 years.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter Public School Teachers, and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act."; appropriates $5 million.*
Requires sharing of revenues derived from major developments situated near municipal borders under certain circumstances.
Authorizes adoption of timed-growth ordinances by municipalities.
Establishes up to four-month extension for expiring carrier contracts with acute care hospitals while parties engage in contract renegotiation.
Clarifies authority of municipal court to suspend driver's licenses.
The "Seaside Lodging and Rental District Act"; imposes tax on certain lodging properties for tourism promotion therein.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2010.
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."
