Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Establishes conditional intervention program in municipal court for certain first-time offenders.
Requires legislators to certify in writing, upon introduction of legislation, that no monetary benefit will be derived from it; requires certification be filed with the Legislative Ethics Commission.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Creates Craft Distillery License to permit the manufacture of smaller amounts of distilled alcoholic beverages.
Decriminalizes possession of 15 grams or less of marijuana, imposes civil penalties, and establishes fund for drug education.*
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Allows pension calculation to be based on compensation increase in excess of actuarially assumed experience only if employer pays unfunded liability.
Clarifies that retention of unearned wages by a public servant is theft under certain circumstances.
Provides increased representation on receiving district boards of education for certain sending districts.

Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each housing unit occupied by a veteran; permits municipalities to satisfy fair share affordable housing obligation through 35 percent set aside for veterans.
Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each unit of transitional housing occupied by a veteran.
Makes members of county boards of taxation ineligible for membership in State-administered retirement system or for health care benefits coverage under plan for public employees.
Prohibits for ten years after compliance with penalty or sentence imposed by court elected or appointed officials convicted of certain crimes from serving as governmental affairs agents.
Repeals law requiring prevailing wage be paid to workers employed in construction undertaken with Board of Public Utilities financial assistance.
Establishes a 2.0 percent cap on annual appropriations increases for certain State government spending.
Amends law concerning conversion of age-restricted communities to define substantial detriment and makes other clarifications.
Requires local authorities and commissions to establish an Internet website and post information related to each entity's mission, finances, meetings, and employees.
Requires that police obtain warrant to seize cell phone data.
Requires that police obtain warrant to attach GPS device to suspect's motor vehicle.
Replaces TPAF, PERS, PFRS and SPRS accidental disability benefits with reduced work-related disability benefit; modifies JRS disability benefit.
Establishes "Victim-Witness Scholarship Fund;" establishes "Witness Protection Fund;" and concerns State forfeiture funds.
Creates advisory council to oversee revision of core curriculum content standards.
Establishes a Gun Court Pilot Program in Passaic County.
Dedesignates portions of Route 24.
"Women's Right to Know Act."
Requires State Building Authority to make certain payments in lieu of taxes for public safety facilities to municipalities; makes appropriation.
Prohibits Medicaid funding for abortifacients.
Prohibits public and certain private affirmative action programs based upon race, ethnicity, sex, color or national origin.
Prohibits the use of public sector union dues for political activities and requires specific written authorization for such use in the private sector.
Regulates use of human embryos fertilized in vitro.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Prohibits certain political activity by governmental employees and by public employee unions.
Limits compensation and contracts of State and local government officers and employees.
Limits ability of non-residents to bring tort suits in NJ courts.
Requires aggrieved person to request refund prior to commencing suit under consumer fraud law under certain circumstances.
Permits possession of certain types of ammunition.
"Post-Viability Protection Act."
Repeals "Global Warming Response Act" and related sections of Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative implementing law.
Clarifies that statutes shall be construed to apply prospectively, unless language provides for retroactive application.
Requires candidate to dispose of campaign funds within six months of electoral defeat or leaving office.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Expands immunity from civil liability in connection with provisions of 9-1-1 service.
Repeals interest arbitration of labor disputes for police and firefighters.
Repeals all prevailing wage laws.
"Parent Empowerment and Choice Act"; enables parents to initiate reform in low performing schools through a petition process.
Prohibits certain local officers from authorizing certain transfers, appointments, changes in compensation, and funding for capital projects in local units.
Repeals State inheritance taxes.
Requires and permits preference in awarding certain contracts.
Regulates advertising of manufacturer
Permits historic motor vehicles to be used for pleasure driving one day per week.
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Makes various technical and procedural amendments to the "Municipal Land Use Law."
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Regulates mailed manufacturer's rebates.
Provides useful life of three years for certain permitted maintenance projects with Transportation Trust Fund monies.
Permits tenant to be removed from leased housing due to criminal activity under certain circumstances.
Provides for licensure of elevator, escalator, and moving walkway mechanics by State board.**
Requires lobbyists that are nonprofit organizations to report annually to Election Law Enforcement Commission estimated number of members, contributors, and supporters.

Modifies process for contested case hearings by OAL with regard to telephone and video conferences, delegation of final decision authority, oral decisions, checklist decisions, electronic filings, and settlements.
Requires BPU, under certain circumstances, to issue a decision within 180 days after receipt of petition by public utilities to sell certain real property.*

Removes requirement that certain telecommunications companies file tariffs with BPU; requires them to provide certain information to public via their website; allows them assess late payment charge on unpaid bills.*
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning conflicts between rules of different State agencies.
Permits service of beer and wine by certain restaurants.
Permits certain municipalities to purchase retail alcoholic beverage licenses regardless of population restrictions.
Concerns Watershed Property Review Board in DEP.
Modifies certain service outage compensation and notice requirements for CATV companies.
Establishes "Property Tax Levy Cap Task Force" to monitor impact of changes to levy cap law.
Permits licensed dealers to display and auction firearms at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Allows casino to pay up to 6% or 9% of parimutuel pool to out-of-State racetrack for simulcast races; provides casino retains 55% of certain remaining takeout rate amounts.
Requires assessment of administrative penalty amount by administrative law judge for environmental violations.
The "Licensed Wildlife Rehabilitator Act"; establishes licensure requirements for wildlife rehabilitators.**
Requires DEP to conduct analysis of "Pollution Prevention Act."
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Requires at least 50% of highest Casino Simulcasting Special Fund amount awarded to racetrack be paid to Atlantic City Race Course; prescribes uses thereof.
Requires certain non-profit organizations be subject to open public records act.
Authorizes deer hunting with firearm on Sundays on private property.
Eliminates licensure of rehabilitation counselors.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
Prohibits requiring domed roofs on storage tanks if alternative emissions reduction method for volatile organic compound emissions can be established.
Prohibits State investment in petroleum product commodities, derivatives, and exchange-traded funds.
"Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act."
Establishes certain apprentice hunting licenses.
Revises law concerning certain professional and occupational licenses.
Revises exemption from license requirement for raffles for door prizes of donated or purchased merchandise; increases total retail value from $50 to $200 or higher if permitted.
Permits transcript or videotape of testimony before local issuing authority to be admissible in ABC appeal.
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.

Requires school districts to take all steps to ensure adequate security for students when school is open as a polling place and provides that school district costs shall be deducted from the itemized list of expenses submitted by the county board of elections.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Concerns time frames for establishing or enforcing property rights related to adverse possession.**
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Exempts experienced firefighters from certification requirement.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.
Requires State firewarden to consult with local fire department commander upon arrival at scene of wildfire.
Amends expiration date of P.L.2005, c.234, which concerns a systematic maintenance check program for intermodal chasis.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Limits liability for insurers conducting boiler insurance inspections.
Allows homestead property tax reimbursement program participants who lose income eligibility due to an IRA withdraw for certain purposes to maintain base year upon requalification.
Permits municipality, fire district or authority to approve transfer of certain firefighters from PERS to PFRS.
Establishes certain procedures for awarding design-build projects.*
Requires health insurers to disclose broker commissions to purchasers.
Concerns fair business practices at intermodal marine terminals.
Revises allocation of fees for certain NJPDES permits.
Revises requirement that library tax be assessed against equalized value of property.
Requires each school district to offer a summer payment plan for school district employees.
Permits retail dealer of motor fuel to sell motor fuel at price below retail dealer's net cost to meet competition.
Allows State agency to pay subcontractor directly for work performed in certain situations.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in certain portfield sites.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Expands education requirements for special learner's and examination permits.
Establishes standards for commercial insurers and Medicaid program implementing electronic prescribing systems.
Requires information concerning certain public employees be made public.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities and pay costs thereof when necessary for infrastructure projects.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Requires health insurance coverage by health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP for expenses incurred in connection with prophylactic mastectomies and other mastectomy-related procedures.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Appropriates $3,279,459 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to NJ Historic Trust for grant to Proprietary House Association for historic preservation purposes.
Requires owner of autocab to provide proof of financial responsibility.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of certain electric or plug-in hybrid electric vehicles.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Prohibits automatic renewal of service contracts.
Provides tax credit against gross income tax for costs of certain property that conserves energy or promotes energy efficiency and for other energy efficiency measures.
Creates the "Mold Safe Housing Act."

Requires DCA to establish procedures for inspection and abatement of mold hazards in residential buildings and school facilities, certification programs for mold inspectors and mold hazard abatement workers.**
Provides for nursing home reimbursement adjustment for cost of energy improvements.
Provides totally disabled persons with discount on hunting license fees.
Establishes real property assessment demonstration program.
Requires DCA to provide information regarding "Lead Hazard Control Assistance Act" to certain dwelling units approved for Weatherization Assistance Program.

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Authorizes issuance of special emergency notes to finance special emergency appropriations for payment of current year property assessment appeal refunds over three years.
Creates "New Jersey Life Science Internship Challenge" program.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid in State Fiscal Year 2012.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Permits board of education to accept donations for purpose of providing property tax relief.
Requires public schools to weight courses in visual and performing arts equally with other courses worth same number of credits in calculating grade point average.
Provides that limitation on lawsuit option does not apply in accident caused by drunk driver.
Permits municipal police officers to make arrests for any disorderly persons or petty disorderly persons offense outside the territorial limits of their municipality.
Establishes crime of participation in criminal street gang initiation ritual.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Allows person calling certain State or local government entities to have option of speaking or leaving a recorded message with a human telephone operator during normal business hours.
Requires employers to provide time off from work for members of certain volunteer organizations to respond to fires under certain conditions.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
"Janet's Law"; requires public and nonpublic schools to have automated external defibrillators and to establish emergency action plans for responding to sudden cardiac events.*
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Requires ballot question on approval of State bond issue to disclose total amount of debt of State or other entity, debt service on which is funded through annual State appropriation.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Creates the "Local Unit Audit Teams" program in the Department of the Treasury.
Establishes Educational Security Task Force.
Authorizes members of the New Jersey State Legislature to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Requires graduated driver licensees who plead guilty to non-point violations to complete driver safety course.
Provides for public comment period at certain sessions of each house of the Legislature.
Establishes conditional intervention program in municipal court for certain first-time offenders.
Permits publication of legal notices by governments and individuals on official government website instead of newspaper.
Increases penalty for commercial drivers who use a hand-held telephone or electronic communication device while driving.
Designated "New Jersey Economic Development Promotion Act"; streamlines and reorganizes State economic development statutes in order to promote administrative efficiency.
Allows physicians to jointly negotiate with carriers over contractual terms and conditions.
Eliminates minimum corporation business tax on New Jersey S corporations.
Allows jurors to designate donation of their jury duty fees to various charitable funds.
Permits certain holders of permits to carry a handgun to carry another licensee's handgun.
Extends alternate route police training certification from three to five years.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
Establishes a municipal court conditional dismissal program for certain first-time offenders.
Upgrades penalties for illegal use of a hand-held cell phone while driving.
Prohibits opening a motor vehicle door into oncoming traffic.
Establishes NJ FamilyCare coverage buy-in program for certain small employers.
Requires public notice of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey board meetings.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Increases motor fuels tax eight cents per year for three years with later CPI adjustment and requires all motor fuels taxes to be credited to Transportation Trust Fund.
Establishes five-year tax credit program to support expansion of preschool in school districts.
Clarifies duties and responsibilities of police directors and chiefs of police.
Establishes Statewide database of beds in shelters for the homeless.
Establishes DCA oversight of Passaic Valley Sewerage Comissioners.
Expands existing film and digital media production tax credit programs; designated as the Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act.
Authorizes Chief Administrator of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission to issue permits for certain overweight trucks and charge fee for such permits.
Increases compensation for persons wrongfully imprisoned.
Exempts from payment certain taxes and energy charges for manufacturing facilities.
Designated the Equitable Disclosure Act of 2010, modifies provisions of MLUL concerning objectors to applications for development.
Establishes a closing fund to provide financial resources for certain economic development projects.
Requires that each school district conducting an interscholastic athletic program must employ one or more school athletic trainers.
Allows for modifications to land use approvals because of changed economics.
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."
Makes certain veterans eligible for certificates of registration under Security Officer Registration Act.
Allows municipalities to designate redevelopment entities and certain non-profits to act as land banks.
Requires the State to provide State aid for public school adult high school programs.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Extends eligibility for total property tax exemption to 100% disabled Cold War veterans; requires State to reimburse municipality for local tax revenue loss.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Requires board of education to unseal and announce contents of bids for certain subcontracting only at regularly scheduled, public meetings of the board.
Requires the Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners maintain minutes of meetings; provides Governor veto over minutes.
Requires Local Finance Board approval for proposed loan agreements between local authorities and for-profit entities.
Requires SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for prostate cancer.
Requires mandatory sexual violence training for law enforcement, judicial and prosecutorial personnel.
Permits county board of taxation to extend municipality's filing deadline for assessment appeals for any year in which revaluation is implemented.
Allows certain undocumented aliens to qualify for in-state tuition rates at public institutions of higher education.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Authorizes probation officers to exercise police powers.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Establishes three-year Nurse Educator Pilot Program in Division of Consumer Affairs.
Establishes Task Force on Hospital Technology to recommend incentives to encourage hospitals to integrate technology to improve patient care and safety.

Requires SHBP and SEHBP to cover treatment for alcoholism, other substance-use disorders, and non biologically-based mental illnesses under same terms and conditions as for other diseases or illnesses. *
Allows property taxpayers an additional 90 days to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to VCCB.

Requires certain appointed public officials to work 35 hours or more per week to be eligible for PERS and SHBP; requires termination of PERS and SHBP participation of certain appointed officials whose term of appointment expires.
Permits alternative annual reorganization meeting date for county political committees if regular date coincides with period of religious observance.
Prohibits Internet posting of certain information on law enforcement officers.
Provides that labor union representatives cannot be compelled to disclose certain information.
Clarifies authority of private investigators to perform executive protection services.
Establishes "gun-free" and "weapon free" zones around certain school and public properties.
Adds certain crimes as crimes which have bail restrictions.
Prohibits false or secret compartments in motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Clarifies police powers of certain sheriff's officers to enforce motor vehicle and traffic laws.
Establishes offense of unlawfully accessing location of law enforcement vehicles through certain electronic means.*
Requires three forms of identification when requesting birth certificate.
Requires greater disclosure for campaign advertisements broadcast within certain time periods prior to an election.
Requires criminal history background check for certain persons working at schools.
Establishes a permanent Gang Land Security Task Force.
Establishes the "Office of the Gang Member Relocation Coordinator."
Criminalizes purchase or possession of firearms ammunition by persons convicted of certain crimes.
Increases juror compensation.
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Provides for expungement of certain records of victims of identity theft.
Permits immediate expungement of court records where the person is acquitted or discharged or where the charges have been dismissed.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from permitting direct solicitation of students for credit card accounts.
Establishes a Special Medical Malpractice Part in the Superior Court.
Creates 12 additional Superior Court judgeships; establishes a Special Business Part in the Superior Court; provides for appropriations.
Establishes a Business Part in the Superior Court.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under the New Jersey gross income tax.

Conforms voter identification procedures to requirements of Statewide voter registration system; permits use of provisional ballots for voters who move to different counties; revises certain penalty provisions.
Creates a Business Court.
Establishes grant program for school districts to develop in-district and collaborative special education programs and services to reduce need to place classified students out-of-district.
Provides Student Population Density Aid to certain public school districts.

Applies certain conflicts of interest restrictions on legislators to county, municipal and local authority condemnation proceedings and project contracts funded directly or indirectly by State monies.
Requires Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards to maintain information on Internet; requires certain assistance to be provided to individuals filing complaints with the committee.
Exempts local governmental units from supplemental titling fees on passenger automobiles they purchase or lease.
Clarifies authority of municipalities to utilize zoning authority to regulate billboards or outdoor advertising bearing commercial advertisements.
Prohibits campaign contributions between county party committees; makes such contributions a third degree crime; increases to third degree crimes certain other campaign finance offenses.
Prohibits contributions by certain entities doing business with State; limits amount of contributions by principals and officers of such entities.
Limits contributions by certain public contractors; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.

Limits political contributions by certain government contractors; revises disclosure standards applicable to State officials; expands disclosure for lobbyists; prohibits certain types of dual office holding.
Authorizes counties and municipalities to adopt regulations limiting political contributions by contractors.

Limits contributions to certain candidates and elected officials by certain public contractors; limits contributions by certain political party committees; repeals certain campaign contribution prohibitions.

Provides local governments may limit political contributions by business entities performing or seeking to perform public contracts; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Prohibits public entities from engaging certain governmental affairs agents.
Establishes certain ethical standards and financial control requirements for State authorities.
Establishes criminal penalties for operating or participating in pyramid promotional schemes.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits eviction for good cause of tenants who are creating nuisance; requires court to notify landlord when restraining order has been issued barring tenant from residential rental property.
Restricts bail options for second and subsequent offenses occurring while released.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance to curb gang related loitering and criminal activity.
Permits master deed of condominium to reflect proportional common and limited common elements interests of each owner as fractions.
Establishes professional standards for county sheriffs and their employees.
Clarifies that using an animal to cause bodily injury to another constitutes assault with a deadly weapon.*
Authorizes designation of joint urban enterprise zone by Urban Enterprize Zone Authority.
Requires health care facilities to report certain information about their health care staff to their respective professional boards or DHSS.
Modifies intent, purpose and standard of construction of "Municipal Land Use Law."
Prohibits BPU from exercising authority over utility service extensions in manner which creates cost differentials that distinguish among persons or localities based on location of such extensions.
Requires appointed board of education members and candidates for an elected board to reveal criminal convictions prior to assuming or running for office.
Decreases membership of county boards of taxation to 2004 level.
Amends the "Fair Housing Act" to change details of regional contribution agreements.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Concerns urban enterprise zones.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas until April 7, 2011.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; abolishes Council on Affordable Housing.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors.
Concerns membership and management of homeowners associations.
Establishes Nursing Student Support Program.
Requires certain advertising disclosures by certain funeral establishments.
Revises "lemon law" refund formula for consumers of certain new motor vehicles.
Requires health benefits coverage for orthotic and prosthetic appliances and provides reimbursement therefor.
Extends responsibilities of tow truck operators responding to calls for assistance from motorists.
Revises various provisions of the "New Jersey Cemetery Act, 2003."
Requires youth baseball league coaches to comply with pitch count standards to minimize injury to youth baseball pitchers.
Creates Construction Trades Licensing Board for licensing and regulation of several construction professions; creates new division for homeowner protection in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Imposes a four percent gross revenues tax on providers of direct-to-home satellite services.
Regulates certain service contracts to perform maintenance, repair, replacement, or service of property used for personal, family, or household purposes.
Requires registration of certain additional securities investment advisers.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Permits affordable housing occupancy preferences for veterans through municipal agreements with developer.*
Permits landscape irrigation contractors to install backflow prevention devices under certain circumstances.
Mandates education program for "at risk" mortgage borrowers as condition for residential purchase or refinance.
The "Residential Distressed Property Leaseback Act."
The "Residential Property Lease-Purchase Act."
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Town of Harrison, Hudson County.
Revises law concerning alarm business licensees.*
"Geologist Licensing Act."
"Tax Preparers Licensing Act."
Exempts certain Office of Emergency Management members from federal commercial driver's licensing requirements.*
Modifies certain procedures for the assignment of franchise interests regarding the retail sale of motor fuel.
Requires completion of no more than 18 credits of continuing education for renewal of burglar alarm licenses.
"Appraisal Management Company Registration Act."
Revises scope of practice of genetic counselors.
Revises responsibility for meadowlands adjustment payments.
Revises statutes concerning dental hygienists and dentists.
Prohibits use of jobs relocated within State in calculation of net positive benefit under "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act."
Permits sale of home-baked goods under certain circumstances.
Revises statutes concerning crematories and the cremation of human remains.
Requires person eligible for health care benefits from more than one public entity to choose coverage from only one.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Penalizes employment of unauthorized aliens; requires verification of citizenship for employment.
Establishes penalties for drivers who have never obtained driver's license.
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Restricts certain former DEP employees from employment with a permit applicant for one year after termination of DEP employments.
Prohibits implementation of formula-based rates for sewerage authorities and electric, gas and water public utilities.
Revises procedure for removal of municipal administrator by municipal council; provides for payment of balance of salary to municipal administrator upon removal.
Prohibits release on bail of persons in the country illegally who are charged with crimes of the first or second degree or with two prior criminal convictions.
Prohibits certain expenditures in school districts and establishes State aid penalty for violations.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain business telecommuting program development and implementation costs.
Invalidates any nominating petition filed after deadline therefor; voids any attempt by candidate to petition court to accept validity of petition filed after deadline.

Prohibits filling of vacancy among candidates if vacancy occurs after 48th and before 14th day before general election, with certain exceptions; prohibits filling subsequent vacancies before general election.
Establishes special license plates supporting autism awareness.
Increases penalties for luring a child and kidnapping.
Establishes crime for adult to misrepresent age in order to join youth serving organization.
Provides for use of alternative dispute resolution to settle disagreements between State agencies concerning public works projects.
Provides 10% reduction in compensation for members of Legislature.
Increases the penalty for certain gang related crimes.
Provides that minimum local tax levy requirement will only be applicable to certain school districts.
Establishes penalties for employer who allows unauthorized aliens to operate employer owned motor vehicle.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Expands authorization for use of dealer and temporary license plates and establishes fines for their misuse.
Repeals law providing benefits for family temporary disability leave and deposits moneys from the "Family Temporary Disability Leave Account" into the unemployment compensation fund.
Permits preference in awarding certain public contracts.
Requires a private seller of a used motor vehicle to request identification information from purchaser.
Creates permissive county-based housing assistance program.
Exempts sheltered workshops from disclosure and fingerprinting requirements for certain solid waste operations.
Renames quail management area within Greenwood Forest Wildlife Management Area as "Dr. A. Hunter Wilcox Field Trial Grounds."
Establishes crime of using blue lights or other insignia on vehicle to impersonate law enforcement authority.
Requires use of pervious concrete by State agencies under certain circumstances.
"Melanie A. Cantwell Law;" requires MVC to issue modified license to person convicted of driving under the influence.
Requires withholding of the State operating aid of any public or independent institution of higher education that enrolls students who are not lawfully present in the U.S.

Prohibits use of emergency warning lights or other insignia to impersonate law enforcement officer; prohibits sale of these lights to unauthorized persons and increases penalties for unauthorized use.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 2% over the prior academic year.
Concerns access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Requires applicants for public assistance undergo retinal scan to detect multiple case fraud.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act."
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program."

Prohibits permanent change of child custody during period of active military service; provides that absence due to active military duty, by itself, is insufficient justification to modify a child custody or visitation order.
Concerns liability, standards of care, and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Provides for expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Enters New Jersey in Nurse Multistate Licensure Compact.
Revises standards for expert witnesses in medical malpractice actions.
"New Jersey Public Water Supply Fluoridation Act."
"New Jersey Broadband and Electronic Health Information Network Authority Act."
Relieves municipalities along certain light rail lines of civil liability in Quiet Zones under certain circumstances.
Creates 14 additional judgeships; raises court fees.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Prohibits school districts from accessing a school-issued electronic communication device to monitor student conduct outside of school property.
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for 5 years.
Requires certain health benefits plans to include coverage for treatment at ambulatory surgical centers and surgical practices and prohibits riders to the contrary.
Requires Commissioner of Human Services to implement retinal scanning for Medicaid applicants.
Enhances pay-to-play provisions applicable to county bridge commission contractors.
Establishes death by auto as first degree crime in certain circumstances; designated as Dirk's law.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Requires use of biometric technology to verify coverage under Medicaid program.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Requires DOE to develop educational fact sheet for distribution to parents concerning sports-related eye injuries.
Directs school district to adjust date of group health insurance contract renewal to ensure coordination of any increased costs with adoption of school budget.
Requires monitoring of prescriptions for human growth hormones.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to assess how to increase number of teaching hospitals and medical residency programs throughout State.
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
Requires insurance coverage in the individual and small employer markets and SHBP and SEHBP for "off-label" uses of certain drugs.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
Establishes health insurance claims database in DOBI.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients and decision making process for patients without surrogates; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Requires hearing and approval of premium changes for individual and small employer health benefits plans; requires certain information be posted on DOBI's website.
Establishes standards of practice for providers of clinical nursing services for medically fragile students.*
Requires insurance coverage for magnetic resonance imaging for women at high risk for breast cancer.
Increases from $15,000 to $25,000 annual compensation PERS retiree may earn in PERS-covered employment without reenrollment.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.
"Group Home Fire Safety Act."
Makes discretionary driver's license suspension for first offense of driving without motor vehicle liability insurance.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warnings."
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for certain infant formulas.
Imposes limits on fees charged for discovery in municipal court matters.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Requires that school districts use a model contract developed by the Commissioner of Education when employing a superintendent of schools.
Pertains to certain review and approval responsibilities of land surveyors. *
Requires each county to establish and maintain veterans' service office.
Requires State Treasurer to follow usual procurement process prior to entering into cooperative purchasing agreements.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Provides for compensation of teachers on appropriate salary guide and schedule after withholding of an increment.
Requires binding arbitration for certain matters relating to dismissals or reductions in salary of tenured persons employed in a teaching capacity at a county college.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey shall serve as member of Government Records Council.
Prohibits the manufacture, distribution, and sale of certain jewelry.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for restricted use license.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Requires DOE to develop and distribute information regarding hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and expands role and membership of New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.
Incorporates federal standards governing sale and transfer of firearms to aliens and non-residents.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation for public adjusters.
The "Residential Mortgage Satisfaction Act."
Permits municipality to pay tax refund in equal installments over period of three years.
Abigail's Law; requires that newly-manufactured school buses be equipped with sensors.
Requires taxpayer to provide certificate of merit setting forth estimated true value of certain property which is subject to county tax appeal.
Authorizes mechanism for independent determination of legal sufficiency of initiated ordinances and referendum petitions.
Reverses certain changes to laws governing State treatment of unclaimed property.
Establishes certain consumer protections related to arbitration organizations.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.

Provides that settlement agents are not responsible for transmitting estimated gross income tax payment and forms for certain nonresident real estate transactions unless so responsible pursuant to contract.
Reduces maximum rate of interest to be charged for delinquent taxes from 18% to 12%.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to designation as charter school district of residence or expansion of a charter school.
Requires binding arbitration to determine contested cases involving dismissal or reduction in compensation of tenured public school employees.
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.
Requires State to offer surplus State police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Suspends certain tolls during evacuation of coastal areas.
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Requires the State Police to implement reverse lane strategy on certain roads.
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
Creates "Task Force on the Extension of Route 55."
Prohibits imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus.
Allows license suspension or revocation of certain health care professionals and medical waste facilities, generators, and transporters for willful illegal or improper medical waste disposal.*
Increases civil penalties for medical waste violations and intentional ocean pollution.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.
Allows public employers to offer retirees with other health care coverage incentive to waive SHBP coverage.
Creates State Beach Task Force.
Requires State Treasurer, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices for awarding independent State authority contracts.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.

Extends burial of indigent veterans to those who did not serve in time of war; clarifies role of DMVA in identifying deceased veterans; provides additional funding, subject to availability, for burial of indigent veterans.*

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.

Requires inmates serving "No Early Release Act" sentences be placed in State correctional institutions and prohibits their participation in Residential Community Release programs until they are eligible for parole.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
"Tabitha's Law"; requires parent or guardian to notify school administrators if pupil will be absent; requires school to notify parent in event of unexcused pupil absence.
Provides sales tax exemption for certain off-road diesel equipment and certain retrofit devices.
Requires motion sensor light switches in State buildings.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement leak detection programs.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Authorizes the conferral of certain academic degrees by religious corporations.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from serving on political party committees.
Establishes Governor's authority over approval of minutes of certain regional commissions.
Authorizes Global Warming Solutions Fund monies to be used to support freshwater wetlands stewardship and restoration.
Requires State to use pervious concrete whenever appropriate.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State school district administrators.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State teachers.
Requires certain not-for-profit agencies comply with open public meetings act and open public records act.

Removes requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal; requires certain novice drivers submit motor vehicle information to chief administrator.
Expands authority of emergency management departments in requesting assistance outside normal territorial jurisdictions.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Requires counties to fix curbs and surrounding areas when damaged during county road projects.
Upgrades simple assault on a public works employee to aggravated assault.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Permits school districts to withdraw from civil service system by referendum or adoption of board of education resolution.
Establishes the "Corrupt Gains Restitution Act."
Reduces number of signatures required on petition to recall elected official.
Reduces number of paid holidays from 13 to 10 for all State and local government employees.
Establishes limits for certain damages in medical malpractice actions.
Imposes new criteria of $18,000 compensation and 30 hours weekly for TPAF and PERS membership as well as for TPAF and PERS credit after break in service.
Makes it a crime to sell or possess products or materials designed to alter firearms to look like toy guns.
Subjects certain shared service agreements to review of Attorney General; requires Division of Local Government Services to provide assistance with shared service agreements.
Requires investigating law enforcement officer to contact next of kin of unconscious motor vehicle accident victim who has been transported to hospital emergency room.
Prohibits public employers from reimbursing tuition or awarding promotions or compensation based on degrees or certifications obtained from unaccredited institutions.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Allows only one PERS-covered position for PERS membership, contributions and service credit; provides for PERS designation of maximum compensation position among multiple positions held.
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Concerns unemployment benefits and work stoppages.
Excludes certain contributions to deferred compensation plans and provides deduction for certain individual retirement savings under the gross income tax.

"Tara's Law"; establishes registry of offending community care residence providers and requires written monthly case manager reports of individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.

Requires certain political subdivisions to grant employees only those holidays granted to State employees and standardizes amount of paid vacation and sick leave granted to employees of certain political subdivisions.
Prohibits certain political subdivisions from awarding longevity-based benefits to their employees.
Prohibits annual bonuses for perfect attendance and the non-use of sick leave.
Prohibits terminal leave compensation for local government employees.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies with ties to terrorists.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Records Privacy.
Prohibits member of Legislature from seeking certain grants or loans through annual appropriations act or legislatively-controlled program.
Requires COAH to subtract affordable units from municipality's fair share affordable housing obligation to reflect job loss upon closure of federal military installation.
Requires posting on State and local government websites information concerning assignment and use of vehicles.
Repeals statutory requirement of annual or biennial dog census.

Limits unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; permits local unit to pay certain benefits over 10 years; limits sick leave use by public employee before retirement.
Limits certain unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; limits sick leave use by new public employees before retirement.
Imposes mandatory forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Creates pilot program to allow wagering on horse races by means of certain patron-operated terminals.

Requires suspension of payment for unused sick or vacation leave payable to person indicted for criminal offense; requires forfeiture of such payment upon service deemed dishonorable or conviction for crime.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Caps attorney fee awards in actions against public entities.
Allows Eatontown, Oceanport, and Tinton Falls mayors to designate council member to represent them as members of Fort Monmouth Economic Revitalization Authority.
Upgrades penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and disabled persons.
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave.
Allows gross income tax deduction for expenses associated with enrollment in nonpublic schools.
Provides for regulation of modeling and talent marketing companies.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the "NJBEST college savings program."
Extends expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs from 2009 to 2014.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Permits developer to qualify for low-interest loan from NJEDA when building a high performance green building.
Permits water supply service and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings to promote water conservation.
Permits surety companies to issue blanket bonds for certain local government officers and employees; applies rating criteria and underwriting standards to blanket bond coverage.*
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
"Plastic Container Recycling Enhancement Act."
"Water Supply Open Space, Farmland and Historic Preservation Trust Fund Act."

Requires installation of operational automatic rain sensor on lawn sprinklers as condition of sale and on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail or industrial property and in common interest communities within specified timeframes.
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Bars certain officials from elective office and political activity for certain time periods.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $2,700,000 to DCA for Neighborhood Preservation Program.
The "Renewable Energy District Financing Act."
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
"Ocean County Stormwater Management System Demonstration Act."
Provides $3,000 gross income tax deduction for certain taxpayers providing home care for an elderly relative.
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.
Modifies requirements for local unit to dissolve certain authorities.
Permits public records custodian to require deposit for OPRA record requests exceeding $15.
Exempts various local units of government from State permitting fees and permits the reimbursement of violation fines under certain circumstances.
Provides parity between school boards and municipalities with respect to the prevailing wage threshold.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Establishes the Renewable Energy Infrastructure and Advanced Technology Vehicle Task Force.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Requires, after assessment, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.

Increase gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable years 2011 and 2012 and expands gross income tax exclusion for pensions, annuities and other retirement income for certain taxpayers beginning in 2011.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to, or purchases of credits from, federally qualified tuition program.
Requires certain percentage of hours worked on State-funded public works projects be reserved for New Jersey residents.
Revises sales and use tax to specify certain persons deemed to be sellers and to clarify tax collection responsibilities of certain other persons and agents.
Prohibits certain contractors from public works projects.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for qualified investment in certain biotechnology businesses.
Permits municipality to hire private company to provide construction officials, subcode officials, and technical assistants.
Enhances the reporting and disclosure requirements concerning State tax expenditures and limits the duration of new State tax expenditure enactments.
Establishes refundable gross income tax credit for certain taxpayers allowed Hope Scholarship Credit and Lifetime Learning Credit under Federal income tax.
Establishes certain tax exclusions and credits for the use of lifelong learning accounts to pay qualified education expenses.
Provides gross income tax deduction for payment of certain residential mortgage interest.
"New Jersey Homeless Veterans Grant Program Act;" establishes New Jersey Homeless Veterans Grant Program and allows voluntary contributions on gross income tax returns to support homeless veterans.**
Establishes Helmets to Hardhats pilot program in New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional STEM programs.*
Phases out sales and use tax on landscaping services and certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring.
Phases out imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Requires public institutions of higher education to implement certain practices concerning academic credits and residency requirements for military servicemembers.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Eliminates 1% fee, and phases out 1% tax, on purchasers of Class 4A commercial property transferred for consideration in excess of $1 million.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.

Requires insurers to cover breast evaluations and other additional medically necessary testing under certain circumstances and requires certain mammogram reports to contain information on breast density.**
Prohibits slaughter of horses and sale of horse flesh for human consumption.
Permits certain military funeral buglers to receive New Jersey Honor Guard Ribbon.*
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits for certain seasonal employees.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act": imposes mandatory term of imprisonment; provides for negotiated reduction of mandatory term under certain circumstances.**
Protects employee rights to ownership and usage of employee inventions developed entirely on employee's own time and without using employer's resources.
Designates the "Honor and Remember Flag" as an official State flag.
Requires driver's licenses to indicate veteran status.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.
Provides procedures for crediting certain dwellings used by agricultural workers in determination of municipality's fair share housing obligation.
Expands range of local units eligible to join an insurance fund established by a municipality or county under certain circumstances.
Requires that the members of a housing authority must reside in the municipality in which the housing authority was created.

Requires private entity primarily engaged in business of providing transportation for passengers in wheelchairs to secure passengers in wheelchairs using four-point securement system and to secure unoccupied wheelchairs.
Establishes "New Jersey Yellow Dot" program in MVC.*
Creates "Earn Your Way Out of Prison Into Supervision, Treatment, and Recovery Program."

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals, increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Revises animal fighting laws; establishes minimum penalty for criminal animal cruelty offenses; establishes additional penalties for animal cruelty offenses.
Establishes Agricultural Tourism Directional Sign Program, administered by DOT and Department of Agriculture, to direct motorists to agricultural tourism establishments. *
Allows municipalities to provide veterans free or reduced cost access to beaches.
Decreases the premium receipts tax for surplus lines insurance coverage.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Broadens scope of information sharing and civil immunity therefor, related to insurance fraud.
Requires gradual replacement of incandescent light bulbs in public school buildings with compact fluorescent light bulbs whenever possible.
Limits job creation estimation under previous COAH regulations for warehousing activities.
Concerns apprenticeship programs and other standards for public works contractors.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Requires development of fact sheet about bedbugs to be posted on the Department of Education's website.
Provides exemption from tax on sales of certain energy saving products and services purchased from businesses located in UEZ.
Provides that probationary license holder may transport siblings in addition to dependents and one additional passenger.
Prohibits use of public funds by employers for certain employee influence activities.
Permits construction workers to file a lien against the owner of real property under "Construction Lien Law."
Provides certain employment protections for sheriff's investigators.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain for-sale housing projects.
Limits rescheduling, cancelation, and no-show fees providers of health care services may charge in certain instances.
Provides corporation business tax credit for certain New Jersey news, weather, and sports content production expenses.
Establishes offense of criminal mischief committed on historical sites.
Directs Board of Nursing to encourage nursing schools to give academic credit to students for training received in US military as corpsmen and medics.
Prohibits charges for busy or unanswered cellular telephone calls.
Provides consumer protections under certain telecommunications service provider contracts.
Establishes 30-day grace period for consumer to cancel contract for telephone or cable service.
Establishes "Solar Equipment Purchase and Installation Assistance Program" in NJ EDA.
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Provides that certain nonprofit organizations would not be assessed a civil administrative penalty under the "Water Supply Management Act" for exceeding permitted water allocations.
Requires DOT to create map showing refueling facilities where alternative fuel is dispensed.
Requires DOT to construct noise barriers on Interstate 78.

Requires State, counties, municipalities, and instrumentalities thereof to post public employee contracts on respective websites; requires posting on Civil Service Commission's website when local unit does not maintain own website.
Establishes cross-acceptance of local master plans; intermunicipal review of certain development applications.

Creates housing purchase matching grant program for reserve component of the U.S. Armed Forces and the New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations; appropriates $2,000,000.
Permits municipal board of library commissioners to reduce library tax rate when municipality acquires new ratables.
Provides exemption from 3-day cancellation provision of home improvement contract in case of bona fide emergency.
Mandates that gift cards and certificates be redeemable at full value in perpetuity; places requirements on establishments accepting store gift cards.
Prohibits DOT from entering into certain contracts concerning short-line freight rail services.
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Increases penalties for harboring or concealing certain sex offender.*
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Establishes right of way for funeral processions.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for members of United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Requires persons under age 17 to wear helmets when operating non-motorized scooters.
Establishes guidelines for operating authorized emergency vehicles in emergency situations.
Requires all prison commissary profits be turned over to Victims of Crime Compensation Office.
Requires recalls on motor vehicles to be repaired prior to sale.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of offender.
Requires BPU to consider certain revenue-raising limitations when determining whether to approve increases in public utility rates, fares or charges that may be assessed to municipalities.
Imposes residency requirements on newly appointed members of sewerage and utility authorities.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for certain higher education tuition and fee expenses.
Authorizes free State park and forest admission and free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for persons with certain types of military service.
Establishes "green teams" to develop and advance energy conservation and efficiency and environmental sustainability in State governmental offices.
Requires State to purchase energy efficient and hybrid vehicles; provides for phase-in of the requirement.
Directs MVC to implement certain State Auditor recommendations to enhance integrity of driver database.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.
Directs State Agriculture Development Committee to establish limited transfer of development rights program for permanent retirement of certain residential development rights on preserved farmland.
Permits use of deadly force against black bears in certain cases.
Establishes Lane Splitting Task Force.
Prohibits DOT from putting tolls on I-78 and I-80 and from transferring jurisdiction to independent authority or entity.
Establishes practice driving requirements for examination and special learner's permit holders.
Clarifies that criminal impersonation committed by any means, including electronic communications or Internet website, shall be subject to criminal penalties. **

Requires lighting and security cameras at sexually oriented businesses; imposes civil penalty for permitting access to minors; permits negative secondary effects study; permits tax on sexually oriented business.
Provides for review and consolidation of certain toll free telecommunications services maintained and operated by certain State and local entities.
Establishes certain restrictions on aerial advertising above sports and entertainment facilities.
Requires high school driver education course, certain new driver brochures, and driver's license written exam to include aggressive driving information.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to develop online historic tour identifying locations of war battles and places of significance to war efforts in NJ.
Changes restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Establishes 24-hour hotline for information concerning the crime of human trafficking; appropriates $75,000.
Increases certain time frames governing arbitration in police and fire contract disputes.
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.

Extends "Right to Farm" protections to cultivation or production of marijuana for medical use; permits such activity on preserved farmland; prohibits county or municipal interference with such activity.
Requires HMOs that contract with DHS to reimburse hospitals for emergency services based on cost of those services.
Establishes "Matthew's Law Limiting the Use of Restraints."
Allows SPRS members to purchase SPRS credit for prior military service.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support improvement of State parks and forests.

"Assistance to Firefighters' Families Act"; doubles State survivor pension amounts for beneficiaries of certain deceased volunteer emergency service providers; requires municipal life insurance and burial expenses for volunteer firefighters; permits fire code inspection surcharge.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Permits small, women or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
Increases membership of Drinking Water Quality Institute and responsibilities of DEP related to institute.*

Establishes as third degree crime new offense of serious bodily injury to an animal; revises other offenses and penalties for animal cruelty, increasing the degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Eliminates requirement for CATV companies to provide advance notification of price decreases or addition of channel offerings. *
Permits imposition of municipal host community petroleum bulk processing impact fees under certain circumstances.
Prohibits MVC from inspecting buses on casino-owned property and designated casino parking, pick-up, or drop-off locations, except under exigent circumstances.
Permits certain former mayors to solemnize marriage and civil union ceremonies.**
Prohibits BPU review and approval of property transactions of certain telecommunications companies.
Authorizes release of sex offender registration information to DHS and county welfare agencies.
Authorizes BPU to promulgate regulations requiring electricity providers to provide information so customers may compare prices and services.*
Extends protections of the new vehicle "lemon Law" to new motor vehicle farm equipment purchased or leased in New Jersey.
Permits certain self-employed individuals to purchase small employer health benefits plans.
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Requires all campaign contributions to be reported to ELEC.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Jessica Rogers' Law; upgrades assault by auto or vessel. *
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.
Concerns outreach and training for minorities and women in the construction industry.
Prohibits minors under 14 years of age from using spray tanning in tanning facilities and prohibits minors under 17 years of age from using tanning beds.**
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DHSS.
Limits fees charged in connection with certain prepaid debit accounts; requires access to certain account information.
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Prohibits State and local public contracts with persons or entities engaging in certain investment activities in energy or finance sectors of Iran.*

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Requires ignition interlock device to be installed on vehicle owned or leased by drunk driver only after period of driver's license suspension.
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes pilot program for municipalities and school districts to contract for video monitoring systems to assist in enforcing law against unlawfully passing a school bus.*
Precludes most distributions of increased value of pre-marital residence at time of divorce.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning socio-economic impact statements for proposed rule-making.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Provides certain retirees from public police departments the right to hawk, peddle and vend.
Revises definition of religious employer in statute concerning insurance coverage of prescription female contraceptives.
Establishes sex-selection and race-selection abortions as third degree crimes and permits civil actions.
Authorizes Governor to enter into interstate compact to clarify fourteenth Amendment.
Prohibits MVC from charging certain fees for renewal of boat or motor vehicle registrations.
Repeals law requiring chain restaurants to post calorie information for menu items.
Revises State designation of "Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month" from February to September.
Increases minimum wage to $8.50, then makes annual adjustments based on CPI increases.
Requires certain financial training for school board members.
Concerns child custody and parenting time arrangements related to certain military service absences.*
Clarifies the effective date of the "New Jersey False Claims Act."
Requires Legislative approval of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey minutes.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act"; provides expedited process for foreclosing abandoned residential properties.
Establishes moratorium on licensing of certain emergency medical service helicopter response units pending evaluation and report.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act."
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.*
Clarifies that insurance broker transparency requirement only applies to sale of health benefits plans.
Establishes NJ Health Care Reform Implementation Council.
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Permits person covered by certain managed care plans to receive covered services from network provider without obtaining written referral from primary care provider.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics and federally qualified health centers.
Requires all assisted living facilities set aside at least 10% of beds for Medicaid-eligible persons and accept at least 5% Medicaid direct admission.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
