"Nursing Student Incentive Loan and Loan Redemption Program Act"; appropriates $5 million.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Requires a public body to record public meetings and post proceedings on its Internet website.
Requires pharmacist to dispense epilepsy drug from same manufacturer as previously dispensed for certain patients, unless otherwise prescribed.
Establishes prescription drug donation repository program.*
Requires hospitals implement Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection prevention programs in all units except inpatient psychiatric units.
Requires health insurers to cover costs of tobacco use cessation services.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to certain elected officials.
Directs AG to enter into agreement with U.S. Attorney General to empower certain corrections officers to investigate immigration status of inmates.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Permits MVC to issue registration plates to certain mechanics who rehabilitate and sell used motor vehicles.
Increases fine for defacement of private property including property used for religious purposes.
Makes various changes to registration and community notification requirements under Megan's Law.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for compressed natural gas used to fuel certain bus operation.

"Kulesh, Kubert, and Bolis' Law;" establishes violation of hands-free cell phone law as reckless under vehicular homicide and assault by auto statutes; enhances penalties for illegal cell phone use while driving.
Imposes certain registration and reporting requirements to prevent illegal trade of tigers.
Authorizes certified celebrants to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Permits establishment of county-wide purchasing system by a county employing qualified purchasing agent and requires participation by all school districts within the county.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to disclose contributions and expenditure information.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Invalidates consumer contracts which require a waiver of right to file a consumer complaint.
Increases income eligibility limits for PAAD program and Senior Gold Prescription Discount Program.
Concerns reviews of State's economic development incentives.
Designates New Jersey Route No. 15 as "Ronald Reagan Memorial Highway."
Restores benefit under State earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal credit beginning in Tax Year 2012.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $100,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $50,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $150,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $75,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $250,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $125,000 or less of taxable income.

Lowers gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years for taxpayers that file jointly with $200,000 or less of taxable income and certain taxpayers that file individually with $100,000 or less of taxable income.
Requires dental benefits coverage for dental composite restorations.
Provides for sales tax exemption for advanced technology partial zero emission vehicles, imposes surcharge on certain automobiles, and deletes surcharge on certain automobiles.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Establishes civil penalty for certain unlawful conduct.
Establishes the "Municipal Court Prosecutors' Automated System."
Increases penalties for violations of certain pet shop laws and regulations.
Revises confiscation, impoundment, and forfeiture procedures for an animal abandoned by owner or seized from abusing owner.
Requires electronic recording of purchases of over-the-counter drugs used to manufacture methamphetamine.
Changes UI contribution rates for certain employers.
Requires State to enable applicants for State agency-issued permits to track online the progress and status of their permit application.
Requires contractors to provide Department of the Treasury with employment information about contracts with public bodies.
Provides for immediate driver's license suspension under certain circumstances.
Makes escapees responsible for apprehension costs.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Prohibits use of hands-free wireless telephones and electronic communication devices while providing instruction in the operation of a motor vehicle.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Requires State to purchase certain vehicle tires and motor oils to minimize fuel usage.
Directs DOT to study and report on implementation of truck stop electrification systems to reduce truck idling and fuel usage.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Concerns methods of paying wages.
Requires Medicaid program to increase reimbursement for ambulance services provided to Medicaid recipients who are also Medicare eligible to Medicare rate.
Requires health benefits coverage for mammograms for women under 40 who lack access to family medical history due to their or their parent's adoption.
Requires NJ Transit and certain commercial bus operators to disclose information about drivers when requested.
Requires costs of contract for construction be revealed to municipal construction office for construction permit.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Requires demonstration of compliance with municipal zoning requirements as a condition for the issuance of certain construction and occupancy permits.
Requires certain pools, spas and hot tubs comply with certain barrier requirements.
Provides certified municipal fire inspectors and fire officials having more than four consecutive years service with tenure in office.
Exempts certain State authorities and local government contracting units from bidding requirements when goods and services are procured below prices available under State contract.
Expresses legislative intent that "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act" notice provisions apply to housing cooperatives.
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
Requires ATM operators to disclose balance inquiry fees.
Establishes certain requirements for trapping of snapping turtles.
Clarifies that hospitals are not subject to PIP medical fee schedules.
Prohibits motor fuel wholesaler from increasing price more than once in 24-hour period.
Authorizes certain disbursements from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund for transportation of low-level radioactive waste to appropriate disposal facilities.
Establishes special license to serve alcoholic beverages in qualifying redevelopment areas.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Establishes "Pretrial Release Program" for certain defendants.
Designates State Highway Route 42 as the "Route 42 Purple Heart Memorial Highway."
Requires State Treasurer to organize and publish certain contract and grant data and information on State expenditure Internet website.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Requires each nonprofit corporation operating in the State that accepts State funds to hold quarterly board meetings that include time for public participation.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to designate lanes approaching toll booths on toll roads with appropriate pavement markings.
Supplemental appropriation of $38 million in State and federal funding to DHSS to fund nursing homes.
Authorizes donation of forfeited bicycles to charities.
Prohibits use of State funds to lease or purchase certain motor vehicles.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.

Requires State to pay full contribution to State-administered pension systems plus $300 million annually until systems are fully funded; provides members of systems with contractual right to financially sound funding of systems.

Limits tuition increase in school district sending-receiving relationships to percentage increase in State aid and tax levy of sending school district and prohibits severance of such relationships currently in effect.
Requires design of new public schools to incorporate green building practices.
Provides that a charter school may only be established in certain school districts and prohibits further payments to a charter school in the event of closure.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers to redeem loan amounts received under the New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public or nonpublic schools in New Jersey.
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
Extends for 18 months application submission deadline to EDA for review and approval of certain construction projects involving public institutions of higher education.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain veterans.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.
Converts four paid holidays to administrative leave days; provides State and local government offices remain open for business on those days.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Increases fine for failure to keep right or failure to observe traffic lanes; establishes fund to pay for certain signage.*
"Flood Control, Mitigation, and Prevention Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for up to $2 billion, and appropriates $5,000.

Requires Governor to make temporary appointment when vacancy occurs in U.S. Senate; requires appointee be member of same political party as person vacating office since beginning of that term; eliminates special election option.
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
Provides purchasing preference to local and environmentally responsible businesses in the awarding of State contracts.
Requires local law enforcement officer or firefighter prescribed anabolic steroids or human growth hormone to report to designated physician for evaluation of fitness for duty.
Requires State to pay expenses associated with nonpartisan municipal elections.
Provides energy and utility service sales tax relief benefit to certain manufacturers throughout the State.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain security-related goods and services.
Prohibits double-trailer truck combinations on certain portions of U.S. Route 206 in Mercer and Somerset counties.
Permits board of chosen freeholders to establish "Sharing Resources" grant and loan program to encourage shared services and municipal consolidation.
Requires Financial Policy Review Board to issue quarterly reports and create and maintain website.
Requires affidavits for civil actions concerning certain mental health professionals. *
Requires certain electric public utilities to file emergency response plan with Board of Public Utilities.
Requires medical oxygen providers to notify fire department whenever they stop delivering oxygen to a local residence.
Designates Pine Barrens treefrog as New Jersey State Amphibian.
"Janet's Law"; requires public and nonpublic schools to have automated external defibrillators and to establish emergency action plans for responding to sudden cardiac events.
Requires deposit of property tax refunds for certain industrial sites under federal or State orders for remediation with Commissioner of Environmental Protection to help ensure compliance.
Provides corporate tax credit to corporations making contribution to Child Development Fund in DOE.
Requires Commissioner of Education to contract with qualified independent entity to conduct evaluation of State's charter schools.
Establishes loan redemption program and bonus program for teachers employed in schools in need of improvement.
Requires State Board of Education members to undergo two-day training program upon initial appointment and qualification to the board.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Prohibits employers from requiring job applicants to disclose criminal record on employment application.
Permits liquor licensees to employ certain ex-offenders in certain positions without a special permit.
Amends special probation statute to give judges additional discretion to admit certain offenders to "drug court" program.
Prohibits public and private employers from automatically disqualifying ex-offenders from employment.
Establishes "Emergency Department Triage Referral Pilot Program" in DHSS.

Requires that adoption or revision of program, policy, or regulation by the State Board, Commissioner, or Department of Education be based on documented evidence that it leads to positive educational outcomes.
Establishes in statute the requirements which must be fulfilled in order for any person to receive certification as a superintendent of schools.
Authorizes public access to government records through government website.
Requires parole board under certain circumstances to release inmates not convicted of a violent crime under the No Early Release Act at the time of parole eligibility.
Permits certain special law enforcement officers to carry firearms at all times when in State.

Permits Type II district with board of school estimate to opt to move school election to November; eliminates board of school estimate's approval of budgets for such districts, except for proposals to spend above cap.
Establishes program in DOE to address State's shortage of mathematics and science teachers.
Establishes a Community School Pilot Program in DOE to advance the construction of community school facilities projects in three pilot districts.
Clarifies requests for proposals of public entities implementing energy savings improvement program contracts.*
Requires State to use energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.
Authorizes certain municipalities and rural electric cooperatives to establish a municipal shared services energy authority.
Establishes uniform real property taxation for commercial renewable energy systems and limits municipal construction permit fees for non-commercial renewable energy systems.
Designates shared use walkway on State Highway Route No. 52 Causeway as "John 'Marty' Coggins Memorial Path."
Creates "Real Property Revaluation Review Commission."
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Establishes flat digital striped bass motor vehicle license plates.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 2% over the prior academic year.

Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex, and Warren Counties, and requires existing bus stops to be used.
"Pharmacy Quality Improvement and Error Prevention Act."
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.

Requires municipalities to exempt 100% disabled veterans from construction permit surcharge fees for improvements to promote living unit accessibility; appropriates $20,000 for municipal reimbursements.
Concerns determination of value for conveyance of certain State-owned lands.*
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to establish performance-based funding plan for public institutions of higher education.
Amends penalty imposed for interfering with apprehension or prosecution of certain criminals.
Requires builders registering under "New Home Warranty and Builders' Registration Act" to provide Social Security and employer identification numbers.
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Permits municipalities and fire districts to appoint paid fire chiefs for paid and certain part-paid fire departments; clarifies duties and responsibilities.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain corrections officers.
Adds option of receipt of employee's contributions plus portion of employer contributions when vested PERS member leaves PERS-covered service.
Provides procedure for suspension of county board of elections member charged with certain crimes.
Changes the scope of public notification regarding contaminated site remediation.

Implements Fish and Game Council recommendation to prohibit unintentional feeding of black bears and require bear-resistant dumpsters or food boxes, or both, at certain campgrounds and closed communities in bear habitat.

Modifies current law regarding regulation and restrictions on business entities who are public contractors and make campaign contributions to certain office holders, candidates and political organizations.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Requires DOC employees who recruit, interview, and hire corrections officers to have gang awareness training.
Requires instruction in traumatic situations as part of police training courses and assessment of police training candidates.
Permits granting residency credit points to candidates taking certain municipal police and fire promotional examinations.

Makes total property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans retroactive to effective date of determination of total disability; requires State to reimburse municipalities for reimbursement of property taxes paid to veteran.
Empowers special agents and enforcement officers of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Fisheries Office of Law Enforcement to make arrests for certain violations of State law.
Establishes that board of fire commissioners provide emergency medical services to areas encompassing each fire district.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Requires DOC to institute shift overlap program in State correctional facilities.
Establishes online portal for acceptance of donations to certain funds to which contributions may be made on gross income tax returns.
Requires certain cemeteries to accept Work First New Jersey and SSI allowance for burial expenses.
Clarifies language concerning criminal causation in accordance with recommendation by New Jersey Law Revision Commission.
Revises requirements for private investigator identification cards.
Prohibits talking on cell phone or text messaging when operating a boat.
Waives certain motor vehicle fees for religious or charitable organizations that offer transportation for after school programs.
Requires members of State Police to undergo annual performance evaluations.
Enpowers U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Office of the Inspector General law enforcement officers to make arrests for certain State law violations.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain spouses of National Guard members.
Prohibits job discrimination on basis of credit history or financial status.
Requires individual to be at least 21 years of age to enter into contract for the use of a credit card under certain circumstances.
Requires cemetery companies to file annual financial report.
Increases and revises membership of New Jersey Cemetery Board.
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for vision rehabilitation services to covered person experiencing sudden onset of blindness.
Makes various revisions to laws regulating certain health benefits plans.
Transfers authority over Palisades Interstate Park Commission patrolmen to State Police.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Increases number of constables that may be appointed by municipal governing body from 50 to 75.
Requires boards of education to provide certain nutritional information for food and beverage items offered for sale in school cafeterias.
Requires development and distribution of curriculum guidelines on Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Exempts from realty transfer fees, sales of homes of certain New Jersey members of the military.
The "New Jersey Spam Deterrence Act."
Allows certain visa holders to qualify for in-State tuition rates at public institutions of higher education.

Permits a child whose parent or guardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in the school district where the child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.
Extends hiring preference for certain civilian federal firefighters.
Provides that PFRS board of trustees may request physical exam of PFRS accidental disability retiree until age 55.
Concerns access to government records by licensed private detectives under certain circumstances.

Designated Kevin Apuzzio's Law; allows municipalities to provide increased survivor pensions for certain volunteer emergency workers and requires municipalities to provide health and life insurance coverage to volunteer firefighters.
Establishes crimes of dog fighting and leader of a dog fighting network; amends RICO to add leader of a dog fighting network.
Alex DeCroce's Law; enhances crime victims' rights under the "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Provides civil service preference to veterans of Operation "Noble Eagle."
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Allows school districts to qualify for assistance under the New Jersey Shade Tree and Community Forestry Assistance Act.
Prohibits certain contractors from public works projects.
Excludes certain federal employee retirement fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Permits the use of electronic communication in child custody arrangements that include parenting time.*
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."
Prohibits discrimination against potential organ transplant recipient on basis of mental or physical disability.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Prohibits transfer of certain juveniles to adult correctional facilities.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund. *
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites.
Authorizes development and operation of computer system which would allow electronic access to outstanding arrest warrant information.
Permits health care providers to report certain patient health problems to MVC.
Requires all State firefighter training to be accredited.
Establishes "Prescription Drug Labeling Task Force."
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Provides bonus awards to certain businesses who hire employees who were previously unemployed for more than 13 weeks.
Directs the State Lottery Commission to establish video lottery at not more than three horse racetracks; provides for NJ Casino Control Commission and NJ Division of Gaming Enforcement oversight.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Extends statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of potentially liable defendants; and revives certain actions.*
Makes certain veterans eligible for certificates of registration under Security Officer Registration Act.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
The "Adopt a Stormwater Management Basin Act."
Amends law concerning application, sale, and use of fertilizer to exempt organic fertilizer from certain requirements.
Establishes New Jersey Council on Responsible Fatherhood and Responsible Fatherhood Fund.
Creates New Jersey Business Action Center.
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers and certain schools, playgrounds, and recreational fields.
"The Truth In Tolling Act"; requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to display toll amount paid when EZ-Pass user passes through toll collection point.*
Implements real property assessment reforms recommended by the State Comptroller in his investigative report entitled "Inequitable Tax Assessments in the Borough of Edgewater."
Establishes an industrial hemp license.
Encourages development of electric vehicle charging stations in transportation projects.
Provides that public schools will not be in session on Veterans' Day of each year.
Requires coin redemption machine operators to disclose fees.
Provides for certain psychologists to prescribe medications.
Includes screening for toxoplasmosis in newborn screening program.
Permits a student to participate in certain voluntary surveys if the district sends prior written notification to the student's parents; limits use of information obtained from survey.*
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Revises newspaper advertising rates.
Establishes gubernatorial veto power over Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor's meeting minutes; expands gubernatorial oversight powers over commission.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; formally names open public records act "Martin O'Shea Open Public Records Act."
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and to information about meetings.

Requires Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness to train inspectors on identifying terrorist activity; creates grant program for inspectors to obtain radiation detection devices; appropriates $300,000.
Revises scope of P.L.2004, c.89, expediting certain State permits in smart growth areas.
Changes title of animal cruelty investigator to "municipal humane law enforcement officer" and defines term in statute.

Authorizes DOT, NJ Turnpike Authority, and South Jersey Transportation Authority to permit BPU-certified persons to install and maintain solar photovoltaic panels on noise barriers erected on roads and highways.
Permits person with developmental disability and legal guardian to audio record sessions of interdisciplinary team in which person or guardian participates.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.
Permits commercial advertising and sponsorship signs on equipment and materials related to the collection of tolls consistent with State law on outdoor advertising.
Imposes post-employment restrictions on certain ABC employees.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $2 per day.
Provides free tuition at public institutions of higher education for surviving spouses and dependent children of military personnel killed in performance of duties.
Replaces references to Civil Service Commission with chairperson of commission to clarify duties and responsibilities of chairperson.
Bars certain employees of certain public agencies from participating in PERS; repeals law permitting PERS and TPAF members on leave who work for labor organization to purchase pension credit.
Prevents managed care plan from denying coverage for maintenance medications for chronic conditions for covered persons solely because of change in health benefits plan or pharmacy benefits manager.
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.
Concerns collective negotiations for public institutions of higher education.

Increases maximum total amount of tax credits allowable under "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" from $1,500,000,000 to $2,500,000,000, and under "Grow New Jersey Assistance Act" from $200,000,000 to $400,000,000.
Concerns unemployment insurance benefits and certain severance payments.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment insurance benefits for crossing guards.
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Expands scope of review of Pension and Health Benefits Review Commission.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DYFS to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
Increases reimbursement rate for providers of adult medical day care services.
Provides that certain absentee ballots will be counted if received within ten days of election.
Prohibits dual elective office holding and holding of elective office and public office or position.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee and one percent fee on transfers of certain commercial real estate and tax on sale of controlling interests in certain commercial real property.
Provides that subcontractors who furnish non-specialty trade work shall not be named in local public bid documents.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment benefits for certain seasonal workers.

Prohibits dual government employment and office holding; requires pension forfeiture by convicted elected officials; bans use of campaign funds for criminal defense costs; revises legislative conflict of interest standards.
Clarifies that publication of all county ordinances may be by title and summary.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Requires DHSS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Prohibits certain drunk driver claims against licensed alcoholic beverage servers.
Requires health insurers that cover speech therapy, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for certain services.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
Requires that public address, and phone number or email address, of local elected officials be available on local unit website.
Revises requirements for emergency medical services delivery.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
Permits licensed facilities currently providing inpatient psychiatric services to add inpatient psychiatric beds without obtaining certificate of need.
Concerns use of health information technology products.
Extends charity care payments to physicians providing hospital-based charity care.
Prevents managed care plan from denying coverage for certain health care services provided to covered person solely because covered person did not present referral to provider who performed services.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.
Permits mayors to appoint municipal emergency management coordinators from among residents of municipalities subject to a shared services agreement.
Ends transitional energy facilities assessment (TEFA), caps State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Expands NJ Cancer Education and Early Detection Program in DHSS to include treatment for colorectal and prostate cancers; appropriates $450,000.
Increases maximum Emergency Services Volunteer Length of Service Award Program contributions and prospectively changes certain vesting requirements.
Authorizes property tax deferment for deployed military personnel.
Prohibits persons under 19 from smoking in public and purchasing tobacco products.
Requires health insurers to cover medically necessary expenses for preventing infertility in women undergoing chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
'"Invest in New Jersey First' Act;" requires preference in awarding certain contracts for critical infrastructure projects.
Excludes from disclosure as public record e-mail addresses provided to government entities to receive emergency notices.
Requires use of goods made in the United States for State contracts; requires businesses that receive State contracts or economic development assistance to disclose job exportation information.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.
Provides certain limits on benefits coverage by health insurers, SHBP, and SEHBP for certain services related to infertility.
Permits hospital to obtain charity care reimbursement for patients who are county jail inmates.
Upgrades penalties for assaults committed against process servers and licensed private investigators and detectives.
Provides for voluntary waiver of compensation by members of Senate and General Assembly.
Defines and removes limits on municipal market to affordable programs.

Prohibits payment for unused sick leave earned after effective date by public officers and employees not represented by union; for all public employees, limits vacation leave carry-forward and requires suspension and forfeiture of certain supplemental compensation.
Requires COAH to promulgate rules and regulations providing for veterans' affordable housing assistance preference.

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Increases host community benefit for municipalities wherein solid waste transfer stations are located from fifty cents to one dollar per ton of solid waste processed at such facilities.
Requires the State and local contracting units to purchase biodiesel or biodiesel blended fuel manufactured in NJ.

Prohibits payment to public employees at retirement for certain unused sick leave, provides for forfeiture of payment for unused sick leave for certain criminal convictions, and requires documentation for use of sick leave.
Clarifies the definition of citizenship in the State of New Jersey.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
Requires Commissioner of Education to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on school districts.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Provides gross income tax deduction for health care plan costs.
Clarifies that certain local administrative agency decisions involving monetary penalties or awards shall be docketed judgments.
Provides tuition-free enrollment at New Jersey public colleges to certain members of the State Police.
Establishes "New Jersey Partnership for Secure Schools Pilot Program" in Department of Education; appropriates $3 million.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the Meadowlands Conservation Trust.
Appropriates $200,000 from "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for grant to Save Ellis Island, Inc. to develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Prohibits electric public utilities from imposing charges for costs associated with light poles bearing solar panels placed by utility.
Establishes Solar Thermal Expansion Loan and Grant program; appropriates $10 million.
Establishes conditions for exemptions from electrical contracting permit requirements for work done by certain employees of municipal and county utilities authorities on public property.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
Revises filing requirements for minor subdivisions.
Grants workers' compensation coverage to volunteer firefighters going to or returning from their stations when called to a fire.
Prohibits notaries public from falsely representing themselvesas attorneys in advertisments.*
Requires physician supervision of nurse anesthetists.

Requires that chiropractic physicians, podiatric physicians, allopathic physicians, and osteopathic physicians be reimbursed at same rate as other health care providers under various health and accident plans.
Provides for registration of mold inspectors and remediators.
Prohibits HMOs from denying provider participation to orthotists, prosthetists and pedorthists willing to meet terms of HMO contract.
Establishes limits on resident's hours in hospitals.
Establishes Office of Advocacy for Persons with Autism and provides for designation of Autism Advocate.
Permits veterans' organizations to use net proceeds from games of chance for organizations' support.
Establishes grant program to rehabilitate veterans' organizations posts; appropriates $300,000.
Prohibits disqualification and replacement of cast absentee ballots because of withdrawal of candidate prior to election day.
Prohibits employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
Prohibits certain TPAF and PERS members from receiving service credit while on leave with labor organization.
Requires on-site care for children in school bus accidents.
Prohibits disclosure of certain personal information by computer services providers.
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Establishes the Office of Dropout Prevention and Reengagement of Out-of-School Youth in DOE, and the Student Dropout Prevention Task Force.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.*
Requires State-administered retirement systems to make determination on accidental disability retirement applications within three months of receiving applicant's medical determination.
Establishes civilian review board to review complaints against Palisades Interstate Park Commission patrolmen.
Requires permanent driver's license suspension for third drunk driving offense.
Establishes illegal use of a hand-held cell phone as reckless driving; requires education component.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $3 per day.
Imposes liability insurance requirement on alcoholic beverage licensees and provides penalties for occupancy and fire code violations.
Concerns the issuance and forfeiture of bail bonds.

Redirects vehicle surcharge revenues for Autism Medical Research and Treatment Fund to support children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other developmental delays and disabilities enrolled in the Early Childhood Intervention Program.
Provides DYFS caseworkers with personnel and law enforcement assistance when conducting DYFS investigations.
Expands health benefits coverage for early intervention services provided through DHSS.
Requires State Treasurer to include designated space for e-mail address on application forms for notaries public.
Reduces tasks that may be performed by pharmacy technicians.
Increases annual income limitation for senior and disabled citizens' eligibility for $250 property tax deduction and bases future annual income limitations on annual CPI changes.
Establishes requirements governing the closing of any State prison.
Eliminates the office of the executive county superintendent of schools and transfers all the duties of that office to the Commissioner of Education.
Authorizes DEP to require soil blending or burial of historic pesticide residue at sites undergoing remediation.
Requires notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of automobile and homeowners insurance policies to be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested.
Designates four State songs.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.*
Directs New Jersey Turnpike Authority to designate Garden State Parkway as memorial highway to POW-MIA's.
Concerns licensure exemptions for boiler operators.
Requires certain civil actions against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Requires employers to pay their employees when serving on a jury.
Permits chief administrator of MVC to waive CDL skills test for certain applicants with military experience operating commercial motor vehicles.*
Requires police to provide crime victim with free police report.
Requires any individual seeking elective public office to disclose when filing petition of nomination whether he or she has been convicted of a criminal offense.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $4.141 million from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE for aid to school districts with significant enrollment growth.
Provides that a student is ineligible for State financial aid upon a conviction for hazing.
Permits county clerk or register of deeds and mortgages to create identification cards for certain veterans for certain purposes.
Permits Governor to notify local governments to fly United States and State flags at half-staff upon death of member of Armed Forces of United States or National Guard who was State resident.*
Permits consumers to use manufacturer coupons when purchasing alcoholic beverages.
Clarifies requests for proposals of public entities implementing energy savings improvement program contracts.
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Provides that children under care, custody or supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
"State Authorities Reform Act."
Provides that toll revenue generated from PANYNJ bridges shall not exceed cost of maintenance, operation, and debt service of those bridges.
Excludes from State gross income tax certain payments made to the families of victims of school violence.
Requires an application fee to be paid to the DOE when applying to establish a charter school.
Prohibits certain elected public office holders from simultaneously holding more than one elective office.

"Tara's Law"; provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences and for investigations of abuse of individuals with developmental disabilities.
Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students.

Makes various changes regarding regulation of casino gaming; limits use of certain Casino Reinvestment Development Authority assets and revenues; permits use of mobile devices at casinos and racetracks to place wagers on sports or athletic events*
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex.
Revises calculation of assessments concerning certain casino licensee fees and clarifies certain conditions of employment concerning Atlantic City Tourism District.*
Authorizes Internet gaming at Atlantic City casinos under certain circumstances.*

Provides 50% State matching funds to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient pupil transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.
Concerns regulation of solid waste, hazardous waste, and recycling industries.
Applies current laws banning political contributions by certain business entities holding public contracts to State colleges and universities.
Requires municipal approval prior to issuance of special concessionaire permit.
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Requires DEP to allow for correction of technical and administrative permit application violations; and subjects adoption of DEP technical manuals to Administrative Procedure Act." *
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization for any fee increase, or imposition of a new regulatory fee.
Equalizes standing of private and public colleges before land use agencies.

Allows qualifying counties and municipalities to become "agriculture development counties" and "agriculture development municipalities" and provides certain associated resulting benefits therefrom to encourage, protect, and preserve agriculture and related businesses.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.

Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs; establishes that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug.*
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to NJ Alliance for Children Youth and Families.
Requires condominium and homeowners' associations to provide information to federal home loan insurance providers at no cost to potential buyers.
Requires Director of Division of Fire Safety to review preparation of local fire mutual aid plans and determine necessity of designated fire command structure.*
Concerns the sale of portable electronics insurance and licensing of limited lines insurance producers for that purpose.
Provides that certain paratransit vehicles that weigh less than 30,000 pounds are not autobuses.
Removes requirement for one and two-family residences to be equipped with a portable fire extinguisher.
Requires DOT Commissioner to develop public awareness programs and use variable message signs to inform motorists about State's "move over" law. *
Codifies AG recommendations for issuing Amber Alert when family member abducts child.
Establishes a "Blue Alert System."
Reduces amount of fire duty required in order to receive exempt fireman certificate.
Prohibits genital mutilation of females under 18 years of age.
Requires "No Turn on Red" signs be affixed to certain traffic control signals.

Applies provisions of "New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act" to proprietary schools and limits eligibility for State student assistance programs to students enrolled in certain proprietary schools.
Increases filing threshold and the applicable exclusion amount for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.

Prohibits filling of vacancy among candidates nominated at primaries after 48th and before 14th day before general election, except due to death; prohibits filling subsequent vacancies before elections.
Establishes the New Jersey State Commission on Education Reform to develop academic outcome-based per pupil public school funding amounts.
"Property Assessment Appeal Transparency Act"; revises content of required annual notification of real property assessment.
Provides temporary deferral of certain sales and use tax collection responsibilities of certain persons making certain investments and creating certain jobs.*

Amends and supplements the "New Jersey Parentage Act" to provide relief from judgment and modification of child support orders under certain circumstances; requires paternity testing of all infants at birth.
Authorizes placement of horse racing wagers using mobile gaming devices at in-State racetracks subject to commission rules and regulations.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of natural gas, and charges for transportation or transmission of natural gas, to certain colleges and universities.
Provides sales and use tax exclusion for charges for student parking provided by certain colleges and universities.

Limits leave and supplemental compensation benefits for school district superintendents, assistant superintendents, and school business administrators; provides procedures and penalties for enforcement of TPAF provisions.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for New Jersey chapter of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.*

Requires public institution of higher education to notify the parents of certain dependent students, without prior consent of the student, when student receives mental health treatment at the institution.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Requires acquisition of defibrillators for use in public and nonpublic high schools and training of certain personnel in usage.
Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to accept for transfer certain academic credits.
Extends eligibility for N.J. World Trade Center Scholarship Program to dependents and spouses of persons totally and permanently disabled as a result of exposure to the attack sites.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Allows an institution of higher education to require the mental health records of a student committed to attend the institution.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Permits undersheriff to perform administrative duties on behalf of county sheriff.
Terminates transitional energy facility assessment (TEFA) unit rate surcharges effective January 1, 2013.
Provides that the State Board of Examiners may not charge a fee for the issuance of credentials required to serve as a substitute school nurse.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.*
Eliminates the 1% fee, and the 1% tax, on purchasers of Class 4A commercial property transferred for consideration in excess of $1 million.
Establishes the "New Jersey Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act."
Exempts, for five years, certain new business activities in pinelands area from compliance with Pinelands Commission development approval process.
Allows law enforcement officers in PERS to transfer to and enroll in PFRS; requires all law enforcement officers to be enrolled in PFRS.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Creates "State Infrastructure Financing Authority;" appropriates $20,000,000.
Eliminates legislative leadership committees.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses providing employment to certain National Guard or reservists.
Requires appropriations in the nature of grants-in-aid to include certain criteria in the act in which they are enacted.
Establishes motor vehicle registration for street rods and custom motor vehicles.
Permits issuance of motorcycle endorsement to certain out-of-State military personnel.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.
Directs Department of the Treasury to post on its website appropriation amounts for public institutions of higher education.

Concerns combined sewer overflows; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; requires certain permit holders address such overflows in capital improvement plans; and appropriates $5 million.
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
Prohibits final granting of charter to school in which application contained material misstatement.
Requires approval of voters or board of school estimate for granting charter if district's charter school payment would exceed 50% of tax levy growth limitation.
Reduces cigarette tax rate by 30 cents per pack and reduces revenue dedicated to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Establishes restrictions and requirements for use of fishing gear and conch, fishing, and lobster pots on artificial reefs.
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.
Requires employers post notice of worker rights under certain State and federal laws.
Concerns disclosure of certain employment information.
Requires public contractors to report certain employment information.
Provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected by decision or practice, including each time compensation is paid.
Requires employer notification when relocating call center services to foreign country.
Bans charging workers' compensation claimants for medical expenses, gives Division of Workers' Compensation sole jurisdiction over work-related medical claims.
Repeals State moratorium prohibiting taking of horseshoe crabs from State waters.
Disqualifies individuals for unemployment benefits due to receipt of certain severance payments.
Authorizes courts to assess costs of prosecution against certain drug defendants.
Exempts certain health information contained in 9-1-1 calls from definition of government record.
Appropriates $3.963 million from General Fund to DOE for nonpublic nursing services aid.
"Common Interest Community Manager Licensing Act."
Establishes "Task Force on the Closure of State Psychiatric Hospitals."
Establishes county-based centers for transition for young adults with developmental disabilities.
Requires Commissioner of Health and Senior Services to adopt uniform informed consent form for clinical demonstration projects approved by DHSS.
Prohibits hospitals from executing certain contracts for electronic health records systems.
Provides post-traumatic stress disorder from military service during combat may be mitigating factor during sentencing.
Allows veteran or personal representative to withdraw honorable discharge papers from county clerk.
Requires New Jersey DMVA to issue Cold War certificates to Cold War veterans.
Prohibits State officer or employee involved in awarding contract from holding employment with party awarded contract for two years after leaving State service.
Makes reforms to "Health Care Quality Act;" requires audits of provider networks.
Provides additional enforcement provisions under "Health Care Quality Act"; allows certain private causes of action for violations; expands administrative remedies; establishes enforcement fund.
Revises "Health Care Quality Act;" requires certain provisions in managed care plan contracts; clarifies certain responsibilities for ordering tests and procedures.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or National Guard.
Prohibits manufacture, sale, or possession of synthetic marijuana.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.
Reappropriates $3 million from "Dam, Lake, Stream, Flood Control, Water Resources, and Wastewater Treatment Project Bond Act of 2003" to fund State flood control projects.
Designates State Highway Route 7 bridge between Township of Belleville and Borough of North Arlington "Lance Corporal Osbrany Montes De Oca Memorial Bridge." *
Requires local authorities and independent State authorities to grant officers and employees only those holidays granted to State employees.
Permits certain former members and employees of NJ Racing Commission to work for licensee thereof if State Ethics Commission finds no conflict of interest.
Establishes DOT roadside memorial program for fallen police officers, EMS workers, and firefighters.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund, dedicates $400,000 annually from certain power vessel operator license fees to the fund, and appropriates $400,000 for FY2012.

"Child Protection Act of 2012": amends statute of limitations for civil actions concerning sexual abuse; implements training programs for certain persons who work with children; establishes requirement for certain criminal background checks.
Increases mandatory sentence for second or subsequent conviction for certain sex crimes; permits consideration of convictions from foreign countries.
Increases monetary penalties to be assessed upon conviction for Megan's law offenses and fixes amount of penalty.
Concerns organ and tissue donation.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for 50% of purchase cost of diesel engine conversion devices.
Establishes a computers for schools program in DOC.
Raises vehicle registration fees for heavy vehicles and dedicates portion to Transportation Trust Fund Account.
Establishes the "Homeowners Down Payment Insurance Pilot Program" in HMFA.
Consolidates various municipalities into the new municipalities of Seaside Township and Long Beach Island Township, or alternatively requires shared services agreements for all major services.
Permits public referendum on certain bond ordinances in municipalities operating under the Walsh Act.
Establishes designated driver motor vehicle license plates.
"Christopher's Law;" provides court with option of ordering juveniles adjudicated delinquent to receive interactive instruction in preventing gang involvement and gang and youth violence.
Requires municipal court to obtain and transmit to prosecutor an offender's driver's abstract prior to sentencing for certain offenses.
Revises definition of "necessary care" in the State's animal cruelty law to include more specific requirements. *
Mandates NICS check be the exclusive method law enforcement uses to determine whether an applicant is qualified to purchase and possess a firearm.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Requires pawnbrokers to retain purchased property for not less than 20 days and record and report certain information.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in certain counties.
Permits advertising on exterior of DOC motor vehicles; revenues to fund tourism grants.
Provides for promotion of tourism attractions within New Jersey at service areas along certain toll roads.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to develop and promote NJ Heritage Weekend.
Creates gallery space on State House grounds for display of certain art works.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support historic preservation.
Requires toll road authorities to award contracts for motor fuel services on toll roads to retail dealers who dispense motor fuel provided by suppliers with refineries located in this State.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act;" requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.
Increases minimum wage for tipped workers.
Provides that a school district may implement bullying prevention programs and anti-bullying training programs at no cost through various entities; and appropriates $1 million.
Expands exceptions to minimum age requirement for operating a boat to include nontidal waters.
Adds conviction of unlawfully possessing weapon to list of crimes that statutorily prohibits someone from buying or owning firearm.
Upgrades crime of manslaughter to aggravated manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Allows certain materials to be included in corporation's proxy solicitation materials.
Requires theaters to reserve certain seats for patrons with hearing loss.
Extends time period for municipalities to commit to expend collected development fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units.

Transportation for Hazardous Walking Routes Act; requires school districts to provide busing for students required to walk to school along hazardous routes and prohibits school bus stops within 250 feet of residence of sex offender.
Prohibits possession and sale of shark fins.
Establishes the Division of Fire Safety in, but not of, the Department of Law and Public Safety; grants Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness certain supervisory powers.
Exempts certain materials and labor used to convert traditional motor vehicles into plug-in hybrid electric motor vehicles from sales and use tax.
Limits rent increases for certain senior citizens.

Requires public and nonpublic schools, local recreation departments, youth serving organizations and camps to have defibrillators for youth athletic events, and public schools to train pupils in defibrillator use and cardio-pulmonary resuscitation.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
"State Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Establishes criminal penalties for killing, injuring or interfering with a guide dog; designated as "Dusty's Law."
Allows distributor, refiner, wholesaler, or supplier to discriminate in tank wagon price of branded motor fuel in certain circumstances.**
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,250,000.
Provides refundable gross income tax credit for amount of annual homestead property tax that exceeds 7 percent of homestead owner's New Jersey gross income.
Requires schools to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit administration of epinephrine to any student having anaphylactic reaction.
Requires the Board of Public Utilities in the Department of the Treasury to administer certain federal energy assistance programs.
Establishes an animal abuser registration system.
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.**
Increases State appropriations to Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund by $387 million to restore municipal aid reductions from Fiscal Years 2009, 2010, and 2011.
Directs State Board of Education to promulgate regulations requiring school districts to develop a plan to establish stability in special education programming.
Concerns grant funding for Community Health Law Project; appropriates $100,000.
Provides that subcontractors who furnish non-specialty trade work shall not be named in local public bid documents.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Provides a NJHOPE credit, increases the current gross income tax homestead property tax credit, and increases the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1,000,000.
Directs DOT, NJTA, and SJTA to advertise local events and historic sites on variable message signs.
The "Healthy Puppies and Kittens Assurance Act."

Establishes bribery in official and political matters applies to person soliciting, accepting, or agreeing to accept benefit as consideration to act even though not yet in office or otherwise qualified to act.
Permits municipalities and school districts to agree on payment dates and amounts for transfer of school purposes tax collections.
Establishes "Blue Ribbon Panel to Review New Jersey's Driver License Suspension Laws."
Designates portion of U.S. Route 206 bypass in Hillsborough Township as "Peter J. Biondi Bypass."
"Healthcare Disclosure and Transparency Act."
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under gross income tax, eliminates income cap on exclusion.
Requires certain energy tax receipts to be paid directly to municipalities.
Requires municipality to post sign on property subject of development application.
Prohibits certain public officers and employees from receiving dual health care benefit coverage.
Provides surviving spouses of certain fire and police personnel who die in line of duty with workers' compensation for entire period of survivorship.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.

Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities and counties to implement municipal consolidation, the sharing of services, and the creation of a joint meeting under certain circumstances.
Requires BPU to establish uniform Statewide reliability standards for electric and gas public utilities.*
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.
Transfers the Div. of Fish and Wildlife and related entities to the Dept. of Agriculture.
Affords DRPA police officers authority to inspect hazardous materials carriers and cargoes; clarifies authority of State Police to conduct inspections.*

Increases fine and imposes license suspension for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving and dedicates fines to public information program; designated as the Toni Donato-Bolis and Baby R.J. Act.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism and NJ Historical Commission to provide volunteer opportunities on Internet website.
Exempts from sales and use tax sale of pet medications; designated as "Fritz's Law."
Restricts use of pesticides at State, county, and municipal parks.
Requires telecommunications companies to provide prorated refunds for service outages of longer than 24 hours.
Enhances penalties for false incrimination.
Establishes the Higher Education Reorganization Oversight Board to facilitate coordination of any reorganization of Rutgers University, UMDNJ, and Rowan University.
Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to achieve certain graduation rates for full-time undergraduate students to receive full State aid entitlement.
Increases tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax rates to be on par with tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax; dedicates revenue for smoking and tobacco use cessation programs.
Requires DOE to adopt green cleaning policy for schools and child care centers with 50 or more students.
Creates nine-member New Jersey Legislative Elections Public Financing Study Commission.
Grants EDA broader discretion to approve applications for corporation business tax certificate transfer program and business employment incentive program.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local unit for shared services.
Provides that the replacement of technology required during the course of a school year is eligible for emergency State funds.
Prohibits use of smokeless tobacco in public schools.
Establishes procedures for nomination and election of members of New Jersey Hall of Fame; directs principal location of hall to be in or adjacent to New Jersey State Museum.
Authorizes educational services commissions to purchase goods or services through nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreement.
Creates new offenses and penalties regarding animal fighting.
Revises "Radiologic Technologist Act" to include additional specialty designation of radiology practitioner assistant.
Requires charter schools to annually submit to Commissioner of Education salary and benefit information for certain employees.
Regulates sale of olive oil.
Provides an adjustment to school district tax levy cap for increases in special education costs per pupil in excess of $40,000 that exceed such prior year costs by more than 2%.
Clarifies that the implementation of a municipal court security plan, shall be at the discretion of the municipal governing body.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Provides for voluntary contributions to the "Homelessness Prevention Program" through real estate sales.
Increases fees charged for marriage or civil union licenses and dedicates monies to Displaced Homemakers Trust Fund.
Expands scope of claims subject to "Health Claims Authorization, Processing and Payment Act," and modifies certain claims procedures.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Establishes financial incentives for certain energy providers to conduct energy audits.
Concerns DEP government records requests.
Makes various revisions to operations of local tax collector's and assessor's offices.

Expands eligibility for veteran's property tax deduction and totally disabled veteran's property tax exemption to certain veterans exposed to radioactivity from atmospheric nuclear bomb testing at the Pacific Proving Grounds.
Appropriates $250,000 to Department of Community Affairs for grants to rape care crisis centers.
Requires affordable housing be built to green building standards; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to issue standards.
Requires DCA to adopt energy inspection code, and requires licensed home inspector to report energy analysis for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.
Establishes special environmental prosecutor.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Requires financial institution to notify account holder when information relative to an electronic fund transfer is shared with third party.
Regulates Internet pharmacies and electronic prescriptions.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.
Requires BPU financial incentives for photovoltaic equipment for residences that are Energy Star compliant receive preferred treatment.
Allows for 75% of costs of energy audits undertaken for commercial buildings be paid for by societal benefits charge.

Permits electric public utilities, electric power suppliers and basic generation service providers to enter into certain agreements with building owners for use of solar energy systems for such buildings.
Establishes forest harvest demonstration program in pinelands area.
"New Jersey Uniform Athlete Agents Act."
Exempts carsharing rentals from State imposed $5 per day motor vehicle rental fee.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Requires court appearance for certain motor vehicle offenses that occur in school zone.
Eliminates adjustment of tuition rate for special education students enrolled in a private school for students with disabilities.
Creates Highlands Conservation Trust to preserve land in Highlands Region, and authorizes Highlands conservation license plate to raise revenue therefor.
Establishes $2 surcharge upon building permits for payments to Community Health Law Project.
"New Jersey Transit Villages Act."
Permits municipalities to purchase and issue certain surplus retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Clarifies procedures for closing active child protective services cases.
Provides for decrease and eventual ban on use of non-compostable plastic grocery bags.
The "Retrofitted Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Requires DCA to promulgate certain fire safety regulations concerning upholstered furniture and furnishings purchased for use in residential premises and public buildings.
Authorizes local option tax on seller of billboard advertising space.
Allows municipality to restrict amount of alcoholic beverages carried into certain private establishments.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Clarifies manner of delivery of certain notices pursuant to "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Permits automatic expungement for certain persons completing a sentence to drug court under the special probation statute.

"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to entities contributing to scholarships for low-income children; appropriates $1,500,000 to Treasury.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a fourth degree crime.
Revises penalties for drunk driving offenses and creates restricted use driver's license.
Exempts certain qualified applicants for commercial driver's licenses from fingerprinting and criminal history record background check.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions, earnings, and qualified distributions associated with special needs trusts.
Provides that Probation Division would file child support judgement as a lien only when amount of judgement equals or exceeds amount of child support due for a one-month period.*
Requires that automated external defibrillators be located on every floor of State House and State House Annex; requires training for State Police.
Establishes forest stewardship program for State-owned lands.*
"Stormwater Management and Combined Sewer Overflow Abatement Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for $50,000,000, and appropriates $5,000.
Creates Witnesses of Crime Protection Program Fund and assess $25 penalty on persons convicted of crimes.
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.
Designates corn as New Jersey State Grain.
Imposes moratorium on construction and land use approvals in 100-year floodplains.
Provides farmland assessment incentive for landowner to lease land for community garden.
Increases campus security by allowing institutions of higher education to offer partial tuition credit to police officers enrolled at the institution who agree to be on duty while attending classes.
Requires criminal history background check for owners and employees of home service enterprises.
Concerning the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Raises allowable speed for low-speed vehicles to 35 miles per hour.
Providing for AG representation of county prosecutors' offices and employees in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Upgrades penalties for eluding police officer if stolen vehicle involved.
Requires mandatory jail time for certain driving while intoxicated convictions with high blood alcohol concentration.
Eliminates certificated superintendent and administrator exceptions to TPAF retiree reenrollment requirement.
Establishes notification signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.*
Dedicates up to $150,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach State Park to special fund to be used to support certain park programs, and makes an appropriation from the fund.
Makes FY 2012 supplemental appropriation of $65,000 to Main Street Counseling Center in West Orange, New Jersey.
Exempts charges for residential storage space and dues for residential health and fitness facilities from sales and use tax.
Updates provisions governing Board of Education Employees' Pension Fund of Essex County to comply with Internal Revenue Code.
Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.
Permits establishment of municipal employee early retirement incentive programs.
Revises "New Jersey Money Transmitters Act"; provides consumer protections; increases reporting and record keeping requirements.
Requires assisted living residences to have standby emergency power generators.
Establishes registry of stroke cases in State.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Requires health insurers and State Health Benefits Commission to provide coverage for posttraumatic stress disorder under same conditions as other sickness.
Requires mandatory incarceration for motor vehicle theft offenses.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Provides for school and medical family leave.
Requires State, whenever possible, to purchase and utilize energy efficient light bulbs when replacing incandescent and non-functioning light bulbs in State-owned buildings.
Regulates semen banks and semen donation; limits sale of human semen.
Eliminates restriction on placement of special education students in sectarian schools.
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signature from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission database.*
Provides for confiscation and forfeiture of mislabeled Jersey Fresh and similarly branded goods.
