Repeals law that established commission, inactive since 1999, to conduct review of salaries of certain public officials.
Removes statutory reference to 9-1-1 Commission which was renamed Statewide Public Safety Communications Commission.
Requires yellow label on certain secondhand furniture.
Requires permit from DHSS to refurbish mattresses.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2013.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2013.
Prohibits requirement to disclose user name, password, or other means for accessing account or service through electronic communications device by employers.
Prohibits requirement to disclose user name, password, or other means for accessing account or service through electronic communications devices by institutions of higher education.
Prohibits home-schooling of children under DYFS care, custody, or supervision without DYFS approval.
Requires professional boards to provide credits toward requirements for licensure for veterans with substantially equivalent training.*
Provides for phased-in mandatory participation in "drug court" program for certain offenders.*
Increases membership of Drinking Water Quality Institute and revises responsibilities of DEP related thereto.
Requires prompt monthly reporting on condition of major State budget funds and disclosure of the State's accrued revenues compared with anticipated revenues.
Designates blueberry pie as the New Jersey Dessert.
Requires Energy Master Plan to include long-term capacity planning and infrastructure planning.
Creates Office of Clean Energy in BPU.*
Provides for temporary nurse licensure for qualified nonresident military spouses.
The "Rainwater Capture and Water Conservation Incentives Act."
Provides for EMT and Mobile Intensive Care Paramedic certification for certain veterans.
Allows certain military spouses with out-of-State teaching license to receive temporary instructional certificate in New Jersey.
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."
Strengthens public entities' immunity for damages against claims of injury occurring on public beaches and boardwalks.
Establishes grant program to provide rebate of sales and use tax paid for purchase of certain materials and supplies used for construction of certain off-track wagering facilities.*
Requires school districts and school bus contractors to ensure that school bus drivers are familiar with assigned route.
Requires certain services be prearranged before homeless person is relocated.
Provides public access to certain information received or possessed by legislators.
Directs the Division on Women to conduct an audit of the coordination of community responses to domestic violence.
Requires telephone companies regulated by BPU to mail certain service discontinuance notices via certified, return receipt requested.
Eliminates exception to public advertising and bidding requirements for certain public contracts involving insurance coverage and consulting services.
Changes signature requirement for recall petition.
Changes date when a recall election may be initiated from 50th to 90th day preceding completion of first year of term of office.
Requires school districts to provide instruction in health literacy to ensure students can effectively communicate health concerns and comprehend medical terms and medication instructions.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.*
Increases certain filing fees, penalties and enhances enforcement provisions and procedures for violations of cigarette tax and unfair cigarette sales laws by cigarette license holders.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students.
Authorizes Division of Travel and Tourism to accept gifts and grants to promote NJ tourism.

Consolidates all categories of gross income for cross-claiming of net losses and allows 20 year loss carry forward under the New Jersey gross income tax; repeals alternate business income calculation.
Requires NJ State Council on the Arts to establish "Artist Colony" designation and select certain municipalities or areas therefor.
Permits consolidation of all fire districts in a municipality; sets forth procedure for consolidation.
Establishes "Tourism Mentor and Matchmaker Program" in Department of State.
Increases from 3.2% to 5% percentage of certain dedicated purse moneys used for horsemen aid programs and the association from Standardbred racing at private racetracks.
Allows State residents who are outside of New Jersey to place wagers on horse races using account wagering system.
Provides sales and use tax rebate on supplies and materials purchased for the construction or reconstruction of certain horse racetrack grandstands.
Exempts homestead from attachment in medical malpractice judgment.
Prohibits insurers from raising medical malpractice liability insurance premiums under certain circumstances.
Modifies timeframe during which charter school applications are submitted to and approved by DOE.
Creates the "New Jersey Security and Financial Empowerment Act" to assist victims of domestic violence and sexual assault.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Youth and Collegiate Affairs.

Increases distributions to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore aid reductions; extends "poison pill" protection to total formula aid provided to each municipality.
Increases funding of "The Senior Citizen and Disabled Resident Transportation Assistance Program."
Creates regional economic developmnet council program; appropriates $10,000,000.
Requires release of bid list prior to bid date under "Local Public Contracts Law."
Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in the urban enterprise zone program.
Requires school social workers to be licensed by State Board of Social Work Examiners and establishes criteria for emergency certificate.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.
Requires Bureau of Marine Law Enforcement to patrol shellfish beds.
Provides primary and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
"Blue Acres Floodplain Protection and Home Elevation Bond Act of 2013," authorizes bonds for $100 million, and appropriates $5,000.*
Permits toll-free passage on State toll roads for certain buses traveling to casinos.
"The Anti-Big Brother Act."
Directs Department of Law and Public Safety to engage in Internet privacy and social media responsibility campaign.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain moving expenses for taxpayer moving to New Jersey to commence work in State.
Permits certain municipalities to issue additional plenary retail consumption licenses.
Criminalizes fourth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Prohibits emergency shelters for the homeless from refusing to provide services for minimum time frame unless shelters are at maximum capacity.
Requires emergency shelters for the homeless to admit persons with mental illness unless they pose danger.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Requires certain purchasers of precious metals and jewelry to maintain certain records; grandfathers certain municipal ordinances regarding sales of used and secondhand jewelry.**
Establishes Consumer Finance Advisory Board; abolishes certain advisory boards in DOBI.
Changes calculation of years of service from date of enrollment in pension system to date of appointment to determine certain retirees' payment obligations for health care coverage.
Authorizes executor or administrator to take control of online accounts of deceased person.
Establishes maximum payment to virtual charter schools and requires State to pay portion of costs for first five years.
Codifies in statute case law developedlegal standards for establishing grandparent and sibling visitation with a child when visitation objected to by child's parent, guardian, or legal custodian.*
Changes parameters of existing exemption for certain beach bars from noise control standards.*
Makes various revisions to laws concerning disabled person identification cards and placards related to parking privileges.*
Sets forth certain reporting requirements when out-of-State law enforcement entities conduct counter-terrorism investigations within New Jersey.*
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell surplus property, known as Plainfield Armory, located in City of Plainfield in Union County.
Extends time municipalities have to commit fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units to six years.
Authorizes certain incinerator authorities to perform sanitation, public works, and environmental services.*
Conforms Megan's Law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.
Provides disabled persons with discount on fishing license fees. *
Expands scope of serological testing of certain defendants to include blood-borne diseases.
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically modified material.
Changes law regulating size limits of lobsters.
Upgrades penalty for certain aggravated assaults when victim suffers serious bodily injury.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students and students who attend charter schools to participate in interscholastic sports programs on resident district's sports teams.
Requires complaint against juvenile taken into custody be filed within 24 hours.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.
Establishes penalty for unlawfully using handicapped parking placard.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.

Prohibits feeding of black bears and requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in bear habitat and under certain circumstances, including garbage collection.
Authorizes submission of certification of remediation at unregulated heating oil tank sites by certain persons; requires use of contractors by DEP to review site remediation submissions.
Subjects certain municipal and school property to property taxation.

Revises certain solar renewable energy programs and requirements; provides for aggregated net metering of electricity consumption related to properties owned by certain governmental bodies and school districts.**
Requires managed care plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell certain surplus real properties located in Township of Woodbridge, Middlesex County.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from using social networking websites and requires certain identifying information.
Establishes NJ Center for Oral Health at UMDNJ Dental School.
Concerns dissolution of free public libraries.
Establishes "Commission on College Tuition."
Requires certain companies providing local telephone service within 10-mile radius of nuclear electric generating facility to adhere to certain service quality standards.
Permits establishment of countywide purchasing system by a county and requires participation by all school districts within the county.
Requires certain user fees for the provision of traditional municipal services to be included within the 2% municipal and county property tax levy cap.
Permits licensed veterinarians to employ foreign veterinary school graduates under certain circumstances.
Establishes a loan redemption program for certified veterinarians employed as large animal veterinarians in the State.
Requires Department of Agriculture to publish on its website information concerning wineries and community supported agriculture entities in NJ.
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Applies driving while intoxicated law to operation of certain motor vehicles in certain circumstances.
Creates the "Meadowlands Responsible Development Program."
Directs State Treasurer to review effects of disclosure and nondisclosure of lottery winners on transparency and lottery sales.*
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance unpaid receivables resulting from federal income tax refund offset reversals.
Permits chair or booth rentals for the purpose of providing cosmetology and hairstyling services or ancillary services.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide after school programs to students in certain districts and allows tax credit for contributions to "After School Program Support Fund."
Places certain limitations on attorney solicitation letters.

Authorizes sale of certain property interests in public roads by local governments to connect certain electric generating facilities with customers; provides for net metering, virtual net metering and connections by public utility.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Authorizes special Distinguished Flying Cross license plates.
Requires mandatory drug addiction assessments and participation in "drug court" program under special probation statute for certain offenders.
Requires persons who form and administer political committees and continuing political committees to provide additional information about affiliations with other committees and individuals.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain ex-service members.
Provides for two-year post-employment restriction on certain employees of the Department of Banking and Insurance.
Requires veterinarians to provide written prescriptions and certain notifications.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program; prohibits future use of red light cameras in State.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Authorizes appointment of part-time county tax administrators.
Allows certain emergency squad volunteers holding municipal elective office to vote on emergency squad concerns.
Changes various provisions of "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act."
Requires prior written authorization for third-party charges to be placed on cellular telephone bills.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Lieutenant Scott Jenkins' Law; creates certain new criminal offenses aimed at theft from carriers; amends theft statutes.*
Decreases BPU membership from five to three members.
Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Grandfathers municipal ordinances that require merchants of used and secondhand jewelry to maintain possession longer than minimum period required by State law.
Removes provision permitting dismissal of de minimis violations for offenses involving corruption of public resources.
Increases civil penalty for first offense violation of campaign finance requirements; makes first offense punishable with forfeiture of candidacy or office.
Requires candidates keep detailed records of how campaign funds are spent for the ordinary and necessary expenses of holding public office.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid.
Establishes "Veterans Higher Education Commission."
Limits contributions to legal defense fund of candidate for or holder of elective public office; requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Exempts disabled veterans from certain fees at State parks and forests.
The "New Jersey Responsible Banking Act."
Allows application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Exempts employees and school board members of federal impact aid districts from certain out-of-state travel restrictions.

Specifies conditions under which State, county, municipality, independent authority, school district, or higher education institution can grant unpaid or paid leave of absence to public employee to perform work for labor organization.
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Authorizes public schools to serve to students certain produce grown in community garden.
Directs MVC to establish driver's license endorsement for autonomous vehicles.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support United Way of New Jersey.
Requires Internet service providers to retain data for law enforcement purposes.
Requires continuing education for licensed practicing psychologists.
Provides for distributions from ABP during transition to retirement programs for faculty at institutions of higher education.
Revises certain solar renewable energy programs and requirements; provides for aggregating net metering on certain properties owned or leased by local government units and school districts.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Authorizes the use of fraud prevention contractors by the Division of Taxation.
Establishes Clean Car Commission.**
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2012.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to create interactive Explore NJ mobile electronic communication device application.
Establishes Historic Sites Broadcast Pilot Program.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Provides that student truancy cases would be heard in municipal court and requires truants to attend an appropriate intervention program.
Permits electronic mail notification, and makes certain other revisions, regarding the "Self-Service Storage Facility Act."
Requires mandatory drug addiction assessments and participation in "drug court" program under special probation statute for certain offenders.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain donated vehicles.
Requires public water utilities to provide customers notice in utility bills of request for increase in rates.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Lupus Education and Awareness in DOH.**
Concerns hospital asset transformation program.

Requires insurers to provide information about organ donation and allows insurers to limit reimbursement for organ transplant if recipient has not made gift pursuant to Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Linden City.
Allows corporation business tax or gross income tax credits to developers for certain capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.*
Removes monk parakeet from list of potentially dangerous species.
Concerns the escheat of stored value cards.*
Requires health insurance coverage for certain student athlete physical examinations.
"Children's Sudden Cardiac Events Reporting Act."
"Scholastic Student-Athlete Safety Act;" establishes measures to ensure health of student-athletes.
Allows certain business combinations between resident domestic corporations and interested stockholders.
Allows corporate shareholder meeting participation by remote communication and clarifies remedies for dissenting shareholders.
Requires creditor to provide mortgage payoff balance on home loan within five business days after notification of request.
The "Residential Mortgage Satisfaction Act"; places certain requirements on issuance of mortgage pay-off letters; provides additional process for discharging mortgages of record.
Provides procedure to cancel mortgage of record by affidavit of entitled person under certain conditions.
Requires homeowners insurers to provide buyer's guide.
Requires insurance producers to perform bona fide services for public entities in order to share commissions; requires disclosure of commission sharing.
Restricts bail for persons charged with violent crimes; establishes bail alternatives for non-violent offenders.
Criminalizes second or subsequent drunk driving offenses in certain cases.
Requires Department of State to post on its website notice of days, weeks, and months designated by State law as special commemorations.
Requires Department of Transportation to update and maintain certain information on its website.*
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."*
Exempts certain persons from HVACR licensing requirement; clarifies definition of heating, ventilating, air conditioning, and refrigeration.*
Requires dental plans to make out-of-network payments based on assignment of benefits.
Establishes "port support zone" surrounding certain ports and marine terminals.
Requires certain entities to be equipped with generators and allows those entities to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of generators.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for certain purchases made by, or on behalf of, individuals and small businesses affected by Hurricane Sandy.
Increases compensation for wrongful imprisonment.
Concerns various authorities, boards, commissions, councils, divisions, and task forces.
Requires nursing homes to permit use of electronic monitoring devices at request of resident.
Revises eligibility requirements for an applicant seeking licensure as a locksmith based on criminal background.
Requires lobby security for certain senior citizen high-rise buildings in areas with high violent crime rates.
Allows graduates of foreign dental schools to take examination and become licensed as dental hygienists.
Creates cause of action for failure to maintain certain vacant properties; requires out-of-state creditors to designate in-State representative.
Expands gross income tax exclusion for pensions, annuities and other retirement income for certain taxpayers.

Changes certain eligibility criteria for TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS and SPRS disability benefits; requires Attorney General to establish fraud unit; creates temporary committee to recommend accidental disability standard for systems.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; appropriates $2,500,000.
Protects drug overdose victims and witnesses from certain criminal charges if medical assistance is sought.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.
Revises penalties imposed on businesses for failure to report security breach of computer system.
Establishes Cyber Security Bureau within the Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness.
Requires health benefits coverage for refills of prescription eye drops under certain conditions.
Establishes energy efficiency standards for battery chargers.
Limits motor vehicle rental companies vehicle license cost recovery fee to good-faith estimate of actual costs; requires company to annually adjust fee to reflect actual costs.*
The "Save the Hudson River Palisades Act."
Establishes the "Sexual Assault Victim's Bill of Rights."
Requires hospitals and birthing facilities to provide new parents information about crib safety.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct a motor vehicle operator's vision.
Requires new or replacement historical and roadside markers to have website; requires Division of Travel and Tourism to create and maintain quick reference code to be displayed on markers.

Provides municipality with affordable housing credit toward its municipal fair share housing obligation for funds transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund pursuant to P.L.2008, c.46.
Concerns prevailing wage payment in certain housing projects.
Revises certain provisions of farmland assessment law.*
Requires workers employed in certain public works to have completed a registered apprenticeship program.
Requires certain official State forms to contain the language oath or affirmation and swear to or affirm when the forms are reprinted.
Establishes permanent task force to review and guide implementation of process improvement programs for Executive Branch based on Lean Six Sigma management approach.
Concerns sharing of certain services by municipalities subject to provisions of "Municipal Rehabilitation and Economic Recovery Act."
The "Opioid Antidote and Overdose Prevention Act."
Establishes conditional dismissal program in municipal court; alters eligibility requirements and increases fees for existing conditional discharge and supervisory treatment programs.
Transfers New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority from DCA to Department of State.

Transfers records management functions of Division of Archives and Records Management from Department of State to Department of Treasury; transfers State Records Committee from Department of State to Department of Treasury.

Transfers various personnel management functions from Department of Treasury to Civil Service Commission; transfers Division of Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action from Department of Treasury to Civil Service Commission.
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials and school officials to the State Ethics Commission.
Reorganizes Department of Children and Families.
"New Jersey Medical and Health Sciences Education Restructuring Act."
Provides for priority consideration, by DCA, DEP, DOT, and municipalities, of permit applications for green building projects. *
Reorganizes and renames DHSS as Department of Health; establishes Division of Aging Services in DHS.
Establishes 12-month moratorium on establishment of new virtual charter schools and creates Virtual Charter School Task force.
Limits waiver of juvenile cases from family to adult court.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to create a Discover NJ Passport.
Repeals law establishing offshore wind renewable energy certificate program.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities when necessary for transportation infrastructure projects at direction of DOT.
Requires medical bills be standardized and accompanied by explanatory disclosure form.
Requires any candidate convicted of crimes or offenses to return campaign contributions to donors; freezes most campaign funds of candidates indicted for crimes or offenses.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Establishes maximum fees for licensing and administration of raffles by Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission and certain municipalities.
Criminalizes driving under the influence with person 17 years of age or younger in vehicle.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
Permits exterior-based property reassessments within eight years of last municipal-wide revaluation.
Requires wireless cell phone company to inform subscribers that cell phone GPS capability may be deactivated.
Limits rent increases for certain senior citizens.
Establishes permanent sterile syringe access program; appropriates $95,000.
Revises law concerning derivative proceedings and shareholder class actions.
Increases penalties for injuring school crossing guard or student pedestrian in crosswalk.
Creates permissive inference of credit card theft in certain cases and requires restitution in certain cases.
Authorizes public institutions of higher education to establish textbook rental programs.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.
Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge do not constitute hazardous substances under "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Establishes electronic lien and titling system for New Jersey motor vehicles.
Permits EMT, paramedic, or investigator for county medical examiner's office to make determination and pronouncement of death under certain circumstances.
Allows for the issuance of special licenses to sell alcoholic beverages in qualifying development projects.
Establishes bill of rights for continuing care retirement community residents.
Expands definition and licensure requirements for health care service firms.
Authorizes Commissioner of Education to approve waiver of salary cap for school district superintendent under certain circumstances.
Exempts commercial motor vehicle drivers from enforcement of snow and ice removal requirements until appropriate removal equipment is available.
Requires retired law enforcement officers to qualify in use of firearm once a year.
Revises various laws concerning medical malpractice.
Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act."

"Building Our Future Bond Act"; authorizes the issuance of $750,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance higher educational capital projects for increasing of academic capacity; appropriates $5,000.
Establishes bio-recovery specialist license and requires first responders to provide certain support to victims.

Establishes new public-private partnership agreement option for construction of State and county college facilities and changes reference from "Commission on Higher Education" to "Secretary of Higher Education" in higher education construction Educational Facilities Authority bond programs.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell surplus real property, known as Eagle Manor, located in Township of Fairfield in Cumberland County.
Designates portion of State Highway Route 37 as "Denis Miranda Memorial Highway."
Establishes offense of advertising commercial sexual abuse of minor.
Establishes NJ Business and the Arts Commission to promote art Statewide.
Provides 50 percent exemption of sales and use tax for sales of one-of-a-kind-art.
Requires Division of Travel and Tourism to create webpage listing wall murals in NJ.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Provides for SHBP New Jersey State Employee Wellness Program with financial incentives for participation in program.
Requires certain elected officials and appointed officers eligible for dual health benefits coverage to choose coverage by one public entity.
Makes all persons convicted of sexual assault subject to the No Early Release Act; specifies that any use of force elevates sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault.
Establishes per se standard for driving under influence of inhalant; designated as "Kimmie's Law."
Increases amount of tax credits authorized to be issued under Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program and extends application deadline.
Requires assessments prior to laboratory and diagnostic testing of persons undergoing mental health screening.
Regulates certain practices of pharmacy benefits management companies.
Requires that police obtain warrant to conduct aerial surveillance utilizing drones.
Requires in-network hospitals to notify patients of out-of-network health care professionals who provide services in hospital.
Restores Fiscal Year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.
Modifies tax levy apportionment methodology in certain school districts; restricts authority for certain municipalities to enter long-term tax exemption agreements.
The "Bio-based Heating Oil Act."
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and resident tuition rate.*
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report.
Requires State pay educational costs of students who reside in domestic violence shelter or transitional living facility outside district of residence for more than one year.
Excludes certain institutions of higher education from prevailing wage requirements.
Permits appointment and transfer of certain special law enforcement officers and county park police officers by certain sheriffs and counties.*
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Prohibits sale of certain laser pointers that exceed certain power output.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Requires shore municipalities to provide active members of the military and veterans free access to beaches.
Prohibits use of speed cameras in State.
Authorizes law enforcement agency to inform the president of a public or independent institution of higher education when a student is charged or convicted of certain crimes.
Eliminates New Jersey Law Revision Commission.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million to fund mandatory drug court.*
Clarifies local government unit obligations with regard to DEP loan awards for dam repairs.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastructure Bank and Energy Bank within New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust.*
Authorizes sale of site of former Riverfront State Prison in City of Camden as State surplus property to NJEDA for public auction to prequalified developer.
Authorizes placement of involved animal with animal welfare agency or similar entity pending adjudication of alleged animal cruelty violation when not adjudicated in seven days.
Requires suspension of pay of local elected officials during period between indictment and conviction for certain offenses involving moral turpitude.
Increases maximum penalty for attempted murder and conspiracy to commit murder in certain cases.
Specifies failure to restrain a cat, dog, or other domestic companion animal while the animal is riding in a motor vehicle is not cruel or inhumane transport.
Prohibits information from certain medical malpractice claims from being used by employers or medical malpractice insurers.
Reduces gross income tax rates by 10 percent over three years.
Concerns cigarette manufacturers and production of certain tobacco products using roll-your-own tobacco machines at retail establishments within this State.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act."
Provides that rental companies cannot rent, lease or sell unrepaired motor vehicles which are subject to safety recall.
Requires DCA to provide accounting of monies remitted to the "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund" by municipality and allows for municipal affordable housing credit for funds remitted.
Disengages stored value card escheat prospectively.
Concerns appeal of assessment of parcel of income-producing real property.
Authorizes special "Support the Arts" license plates; dedicates proceeds to New Jersey State Council on the Arts to support arts in NJ.
Requires labeling of all foods containing genetically modified material.
Requires DOT to develop common design for signs that indicate historic site or district.
Allows for suspension of commercial motor vehicle registration under certain circumstances.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit disadvantaged or minority men to teach in certain failing schools under alternate route program.*

Permits school districts to provide transportation to nonpublic school pupils and charge parents when the per pupil amount of the route exceeds the maximum nonpublic school transportation costs per pupil.
Concerns interest rate chargeable by licensed pawnbrokers on certain transactions.
Reduces number of rooms necessary for historic hotel to receive liquor license.
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings and wood utility poles.
Appropriates $31,741,467,000 in State funds and $12,368,238,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2012-2013.
Increases the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1 million contingent on enactment of certain homestead benefit enhancement legislation.

Makes FY 2013 supplemental appropriation of $789,000,000 to Homestead Benefit Program and amends budget language provisions to provide for significantly enhanced property tax relief payments to beleaguered homeowners and tenants.

Makes FY 2012 State and federal supplemental appropriations totaling $256,743,000, reduces FY 2012 appropriations by $86,000,000, and amends and supplements various language provisions affecting appropriations in FY 2012.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act."
Expands neighborhood revitalization State tax credit to include gross income taxpayers; increases annual total amount of tax credits allowable from $10,000,000 to $15,000,000.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Requires all bicyclists to wear helmets.
Modifies "inherently beneficial use" definition for purposes of zoning variance to discourage siting of wind and solar energy facilities on agricultural land and open space.
Permits certain witnesses under the age of 16 and victims of any age to testify by closed circuit television in prosecutions for crimes or offenses involving domestic violence.*
Requires NJ State Council on the Arts to create website listing art in public buildings in NJ.
Establishes requirements for pet restraints in passenger automobiles for dogs and cats; establishes failure to comply with requirements as a motor vehicle offense and an animal cruelty offense.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Establishes the "Neighborhood Scholar Revitalization Pilot Program."
"New Jersey Long-Term Care Oversight Act."
Establishes pilot program requiring certain first time drunk drivers to install ignition interlock device.
Eliminates one year residency requirement for certain civil action filings.
Establishes procedure for licensure of timeshare salespersons.
Provides for 30-day period for filing notice of appeal on matters adjudicated in municipal courts.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support the arts.
Requires NJ State Council on the Arts to provide an Internet listing of art galleries in NJ.
Requires NJ State Council on the Arts to establish living treasure designation to recognize distinguished NJ artists.
Requires protection of fine arts elements in public buildings that are to be renovated.
Directs Department of State to establish "New Jersey Crafted Program" to promote sale of goods crafted in NJ.
Allows exclusion of certain alternative energy and energy conservation patent income under gross income tax and corporation business tax.
Tax Relief for New Jersey Families Act; provides income tax credits for property tax relief, quadruples the homestead property tax credit and increases the earned income tax credit.
Clarifies that certain offenders who drive during periods of license suspension are eligible for certain alternatives to incarceration.
Requires county bridge commissions, New Jersey Turnpike Authority, and South Jersey Transportation Authority to offer cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Requires Deleware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission to offer cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Requires Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to offer cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Requires Delaware River Port Authority to offer cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Requires Delaware River and Bay Authority to offer cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from requiring or considering compliance by municipalities with State Development and Redevelopment Plan in certain circumstances.
Establishes "Art in Storefronts" initiative within the Main Street New Jersey program.
"Vader's Law"; revises law to enhance penalty for injuring or harming certain dogs.

Permits municipality to use proceeds of beach access fees for areas near beach facilities that are significantly affected by beach tourism; requires municipality to provide explanation of expenditures on website.
Requires notification to certain buyers of health club services of automatic renewal clauses in health club contracts.
Requires youth sports team organizations to implement written head injury policies.
Establishes summary action to foreclose mortgages on vacant and abandoned residential property.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Establishes animal cruelty offense of cruel confinement of a gestating pig.
Permits pharmacists to administer influenza vaccines to children seven years of age or older.****
Prohibits local officer or employee from lobbying or advocating before any body of the municipality where officer or employee serves.
Provides emergency vehicle exemption for vehicle spot lamps.*
Permits municipal court to order certain offenders to perform community service in lieu of payment of penalty.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Requires State Comptroller to report findings of audit compliance reviews.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires State department, agency, authority, or instrumentality thereof to provide link on its website for members of public to submit complaints.
Provides for excused absences for public school students involved in election activities on day of general election under certain circumstances.
Establishes grant program for constructing kitchen facilities in licensed child care centers; appropriates $1,000,000.
"Plastic and Paper Bag Reduction Act"; requires certain retailers to provide recyclable, compostable or reusable bags instead of plastic or paper carryout bags.
Amends "Flood Hazard Area Control Act" to require DEP to take certain actions concerning delineations of flood hazard areas and floodways.
Permits local units to enter into joint agreements to purchase fire equipment.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act; restricts consumer fraud act to New Jersey residents.
Requires private cord blood banks to pay a fee to support State-designated public cord blood bank.
Permits temporary casino gaming at Meadowlands Complex for 2014 Super Bowl.
Permits temporary casino gaming at Meadowlands Complex for 2014 Hambletonian Race.
Requires BPU to report annually on certain public utility bill assistance program expenditures.
Requires public and independent institutions of higher education to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.*
Requires Commissioners of Education and Labor and Workforce Development to study and report on departments' efforts in providing students with information on employment in high-demand industries.***
Establishes new crime of domestic violence committed in the presence of a child.
Provides for screening newborn infants for adrenoleukodystrophy.
Designated "Snookiville law," authorizes municipalities to license and regulate the filming of reality shows in public locations and in public places of accommodation within their jurisdiction.
Requires reporting of Clostridium difficile infections in hospitals and nursing homes.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act;" imposes mandatory term of 25 years to life for aggravated sexual assault against a child under 13 and increases penalties for harboring certain sex offenders.
Establishes process for county colleges to offer baccalaureate degree nursing programs.
Increases civil and criminal penalties involving unstamped and counterfeit cigarettes and cigarette smuggling and establishes crime involving transfers of counterfeit cigarettes.*
Permits use of excess municipal construction code fee collections for property tax relief.
Permits adoptees and certain others access to adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
Establishes State payment in lieu of taxes to municipalities for loss of revenues due to an overburden of tax-exempt cemetery property; appropriates $66 million.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Authorizes special Support Our Veterans license plate with proceeds supporting New Jersey homeless veteran's centers.
Revises certain motor vehicle fines imposed on motor vehicle drivers or operators for failing to have required documentation.

Lengthens amber light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by red light camera; implements half-second delay for red light camera violations.
Requires MVC to issue driving privilege cards to persons who cannot prove lawful presence in the country.
Increases penalties for illegal use of telephone or electronic communication device while driving.
Increases fine for student truancy and requires truant student to attend court-ordered truancy counseling program or other appropriate program.
"The New Jersey Social Innovation Act"; establishes social innovation loan pilot program and study commission within EDA.**
Requires certain buyers of precious metals and jewelry to pay by check and maintain certain records.

"Drug Dealer Accountability Act;" increases penalties for distribution of phencyclidine; establishes criminal liability for drug dealers under certain circumstances; imposes civil and criminal penalties for combinations of controlled dangerous substances.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on responsible use of social media for middle school students as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Technology.
Establishes system for early resolution of medical injury claims.
Adjusts the business employment incentive program to allow certain small medical practices to qualify for program participation.
Establishes certain exceptions for emergency personnel operating personal watercraft while providing rescue services.
"Property Tax Reduction Work Act"; permits local units to recruit residents to perform services in return for property tax vouchers.
Repeals grandparents visitation statute.
Concerns job order contracts for public work.
Requires a board of education to consult with appropriate nonpublic school representatives prior to any change in the provision of nursing services.
Prohibits person from contracting for public work if person is barred from receiving federal contract.
Clarifies that prostitution offenses include soliciting or procuring via electronic means.

Provides municipalities and fire districts with option to hire firefighters up to age 40 with eligibility for PFRS membership; allows firefighters legally hired after age 35 currently in PERS to transfer to PFRS.
Prohibits animal cruelty violators from owning domestic companion animals and from working at animal-related enterprises; designated as "Moose's Law."
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Concerns municipal rent control ordinances.
Allows credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for costs of installing certain alternative energy systems.
Establishes summary action to foreclose mortgages on vacant and abandoned residential property.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement fees, subject to limitations, to fund Legal Services of New Jersey and e-court information system; requires review and reporting on fees and expenditures of such fees.*
Concerns certain appeals of unemployment benefits determinations.
Concerns payment of independent contractors.
Directs Commissioner of Education to establish guidelines limiting amount of time students spend on school bus.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Requires school district superintendent to annually report to board of education on district contracts.
Requires restaurants to post notice about food allergy and anaphylaxis and provide food allergy information to customers.
Strengthens enforceability of premarital and pre-civil union agreements.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell as surplus certain land and improvements now part of East Jersey Prison to Woodbridge Township in Middlesex County for a restricted use.
Eliminates duplication and redundancy in registration of certain apartments.
Provides that certain personal identifying information may be redacted from certain public records in certain circumstances.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from charging a fee to an applicant solely to correct clerical errors on any application form.
Directs State agencies to take certain action to expedite permitting through use of general permits.
Amends "Administrative Procedure Act" to require State agencies to use various electronic technologies in rule-making procedures.
Requires certain local and State government entities to issue certain emergency warning light permits.
Requires each State agency to review permits issued by the agency and make neccessary changes to expedite and facilitate permitting. *
Requires State to review all licenses and certifications granted thereby, and recommend and make certain changes.
Authorizes certain cooperative purchasing agreements involving certain State and local government entities for certain purchases.

Permits certain former members and employees of NJ Racing Commission to work for, or hold interest in, licensee thereof if State Ethics Commission finds no conflict of interest following membership or employment.*
Increases amount of notice driver must receive for license suspension in certain cases and permits driver to provide proof of electronic payment for certain fines and penalties.
"New Jersey Death with Dignity Act"; permits qualified patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner, subject to voter approval.
Authorizes special Ancient Order of Hibernians license plate.
Requires developers constructing certain renewable energy generation systems to ensure that such systems would be functionally integrated to the electric grid prior to commencement of construction.
Prohibits the unauthorized photographing or videotaping of a child.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Requires administrative law judge to make final decision in certain contested cases.
Requires BPU to conduct study on how electric chiller equipment and natural gas cooling equipment would increase energy efficiency in commercial buildings.*

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
Permits NJ boat manufacturers to qualify for EDA loans for renewable energy technology, equipment, or systems.
Requires Superintendent of State Police to include additional questions on loading and passenger capacity in boat safety course examination.
Requires liability insurance for permit to possess certain dangerous animals.
Requires appropriate community notification when sex offender is placed in halfway house; prohibits certain county inmates in halfway house.
Implements various ELEC recommendations for changes in current campaign contributions and expenditures law.
Directs board of trustees of county college to post information on the compensation paid to college president on its website.
Directs Secretary of Higher Education to adopt guidelines for the employment contracts of county college presidents.
Requires businesses receiving State economic development subsidy to report campaign contributions greater than $10,000.
Requires disclosure of information about contributions and expenditures for candidates for elective public office, or for public questions, by publicly traded corporations doing business in State.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Criminalizes operation of school bus with suspended driver's license.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Allows disabled veteran's surviving spouse to claim property tax exemption when veteran's disability declaration is granted after death.
Excludes from gross income tax value of prizes or awards won in athletic competition in Olympic Games.
Prohibits the use of county and municipal vehicles by part-time elected local government officers.
The "Human Trafficking Prevention, Protection, and Treatment Act."
Requires hospitals to make publicly available information on charges for most commonly used services.
Requires DOT to issue guidance on certain aspects of red light camera pilot program.
Requires hepatitis B to be considered a priority under "Eliminating Health Disparities Initiative."
Requires retail pharmacies to stock and dispense emergency contraception.
Changes pejorative terminology referring to mental capacity of individuals.
Requires funds collected through societal benefits charge not allocated be credited to electric and gas public utility customers.
Concerns registration of contractors and sets criteria for responsible bidders in public work.
Creates Veterans Haven North Council; renames current Veterans Haven Council to Veterans Haven South Council.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Exempts certain properties acquired by municipalities from county, school, and fire district taxes immediately upon aquisition.*
Establishes threats of violence against prosecutors, law enforcement officers and their family members as a second degree crime, subject to the No Early Release Act sentencing.
Alters the amount school district may charge parents when it elects to offer empty seats on a school bus to students who live less than remote from school along established bus routes.
Establishes the "New Jersey Employer Identity Disclosure Act".*
Renames Mountainview Youth Correctional Facility as "William H. Fauver Youth Correctional Facility."

Requires owner or operator of industrial establishment applying for de minimis exemption from "Industrial Site Recovery Act" to certify as to no actual knowledge of contamination exceeding remediation standards.

Appropriates $45 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and $12 million from "2009 Blue Acres Fund" for State acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes, including Blue Acres projects.

Appropriates $55 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" for local government open space acquisition and park development projects, and approves $2,400,800 from 1995 bond act for coastal blue acres projects.
Appropriates $8,930,975 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Protects minors by prohibiting attempts to change sexual orientation.
Requires HMFA to expand participation in the NJ HomeKeeper Program.
Makes homeowners' association in which developer's control of executive board has not been surrendered a public body under "Senator Byron M. Baer Open Public Meetings Act."
Provides certain employees access to certain personnel records.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Transfers New Jersey State Forestry Services and related entities to Department of Agriculture.
Allows direct deposit of adoption subsidy payments.
Changes the definition of "child" to increase the age from 16 to 18 years for the crime of endangering the welfare of a child.
Provides for termination of parental rights under certain circumstances; expands definition of "abused child."
Requires persons convicted of human trafficking of a child or engaging in prostitution of a child to register as sex offenders.
Authorizes wiretap orders for the crimes of human trafficking and promoting prostitution.
Establishes new crimes concerning commercial exploitation of a child.
Permits human trafficking victims to testify by closed circuit television under certain circumstances.
Concerns human trafficking of a minor.
Eliminates statute of limitations for prosecution of human trafficking crimes.
"New Jersey Venture Investment and Employment Program Act;" establishes program under NJ EDA to provide for qualified investments of capital in qualified businesses.
Requires medical examiner training about sudden unexpected death in epilepsy and requesting decedent's medical information and brain donation for research.
Establishes standard of review for certain juvenile waiver motions.
Requires employers and health care providers to disseminate certain information regarding temporary disability leave benefits.
Requires newborn infant screening for tongue tie.
Prohibits school district from denying student school breakfast or school lunch because payment is in arrears without prior notice to parent.
The "Debt-Management Services Act of New Jersey."
Clarifies application of business personal property tax on local exchange telephone companies that were subject to tax as of April 1, 1997.
Authorizes professional and occupational boards to recognize continuing education approval entities.
Requires compounding pharmacies be accredited by Pharmacy Compounding Accreditation Board.
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.
Permits theaters with 250 seats or more to apply for liquor license. *
Allows nonpublic schools to participate in joint purchasing agreements entered into by two or more school districts.
Prohibits right on red turns at intersections with red light cameras; requires certain additional signage if red light camera is in safe corridor.
Subjects Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to New York's Freedom of Information Law and New Jersey's Open Public Records Act.
Changes the age for excuse from juror service to 70 years.

Extends statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of defendants who are potentially liable; codifies liability of public entities in these actions; and revives certain actions.
Creates Voluntary Registry for Individuals with a Mental Illness or Developmental Disability.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
Provides for temporary approval of WIC vendor applications if the applicant currently operates another approved program.

Provides for $5 million rebate program for purchase and installation of residential compressed natural gas vehicle fueling stations and electric vehicle charging stations using funds from societal benefits charge.
Provides that as of September 2013 only low-fat or fat-free milk may be sold, served, or given away on school property.
Creates "Expungement Waiting Period Reduction Study Commission."
Prohibits Medicaid managed care organizations from reducing certain provider reimbursement rates without approval from DHS.*
Requires school districts provide pupil directory information to county vocational schools upon request.

Authorizes civil action against developers who fail to reimburse municipalities for professional services expenses; bars developer challenges to municipal professional service charges not timely appealed.
Establishes two-year statute of limitations period for most civil actions.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Concerns regulation of grease recycling industry.
Requires BPU to conduct pilot program to allow free parking for alternative fuel vehicles and alternative technology vehicles.
Provides certain exemptions from sales and use tax for hybrid electric vehicles, compressed natural gas vehicles, and equipment used for refueling or recharging certain vehicles.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.
Permits compressed natural gas as fuel source to power school buses.

Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to provide natural gas refueling, propane refueling, and electric vehicle recharging stations at certain rest areas on New Jersey Turnpike, Garden State Parkway, and Atlantic City Expressway.*
Requires property tax bills to contain eligibility information on State tax relief programs.

Requires school districts to allow charter school students, county vocational school students, and students receiving equivalent instruction elsewhere than at school to participate in interscholastic sports programs on resident district's sports teams.
Prohibits certain energy suppliers from making false and misleading claims to potential customers; prohibits suppliers' calls to customers where no business relationship exists.*
Authorizes establishment through collective bargaining of alternative workers' compensation program and group self-insurance plans.

Changes deadline for filing nominating petitions for school board candidates to last Monday in July; revises procedure for filing school board candidate vacancy; and revises certain other election procedures. *
Provides for permanent debarment from government contracting of any person who is convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Requires sex offenders to note criminal status on social network accounts.
Provides for temporary professional or occupational licensure for qualified nonresident military spouses.
Requires correctional facilities to submit voting rights information packets to inmates.
Modifies powers of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.
Prohibits Medicaid managed care organizations from reducing certain provider reimbursement rates without approval from DHS.
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Requires development of a diabetes action plan by DOH.
Revises membership of Public Health Council and fully restores functions, powers, and duties of council.
Provides private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of insurance claims.
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.
The "New Jersey Consumer Catastrophe Preparedness and Protection Act"; creates "New Jersey Catastrophe Fund."
Prohibits the sale and possession of shark fins.
Establishes the crime of negligent vehicular homicide.
Repeals requirement for general hospitals and State psychiatric hospitals to hold annual public meetings.
Restricts use of electronic benefit cards by cash assistance recipients.
Extends and expands the scope of the "Local Unit Electronic Technology Pilot Program and Study Act."
Requires MVC to offer driver's license knowledge test in Italian.
Requires water utilities to cover costs related to flooding damage under certain circumstances.
Prohibits discrimination in employment in the providing of any health care benefits.
Permits pet owners to board public transportation with domesticated animals during emergency evacuation.
Creates offense of impairing communications, which would constitute domestic violence in certain circumstances.
Requires fee-for-service Medicaid prescription drug benefits for Medicaid recipients not eligible for Medicare.
Stipulates that applicants for pawnbroker license are not required to submit CPA-certified financial statement.
Exempts sales of county property from certain requirements under certain circumstances.

Requires eligibility checklist and audit for enrollment in PERS of certain public employees who provide professional services; imposes fine on certifying officer or supervisor for ineligible enrollments.
Appropriates $10 million to the DEP for Black Creek and Wreck Pond dredging.
Directs DEP and Monmouth County to form study commission to examine nonpoint source pollution and stormwater management issues in Wreck Pond Watershed.
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.
Requires that certain motor vehicle surcharge revenues be dedicated to the Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Provides grants to homeowners for certain flood damage relief sustained from Hurricane Irene; appropriates $5 million.
Prohibits imposition of parking fees in Meadowlands Sports Complex.
Requires reimbursement to State for costs related to provision of New Jersey State Police at certain Meadowlands Sports Complex events.
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Clarifies that a single State college may enter into a joint purchasing agreement with other contracting units. *
Establishes highway-related sponsorship programs in DOT, NJTA, and SJTA.*
Requires president of public institution of higher education to regularly report on-campus criminal and fire events to the institution's governing board.
Requires Local Finance Board in DCA to exercise oversight of certain local authority employment contracts and approve, when applicable, employee and board member travel expenses in excess of $250.
Requires bars, restaurants, and liquor stores to post penalties for DWI.
Limits actions against court-appointed psychologists, psychiatrists, social workers, or other licensed mental health professionals in certain Family Court matters.
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.

Permits certain businesses to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of alternative power generation devices; requires toll road authority contracts to provide for alternative power generation devices at service stations.
Amends Fiscal Year 2013 annual appropriations act to prohibit application of budget adjustment factor when determining Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain nursing facilities.
Requires certain contractors to verify work authorization of newly hired employees.
Criminalizes mental or emotional hazing.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Domestic Violence and Abuse.
Requires motor fuel dealer to maintain and use generator during power outage.

"Emergency Information Access Act"; requires utility service providers to report severe weather and emergency related service; directs utility service providers and State Office of Emergency Management to present reported information online and via telephone.

"Disaster Information Access Act"; requires utility service providers to report severe weather and emergency related service interruptions; directs utility service providers and State Office of Emergency Management to present reported information online and by telephone.
Provides for access to adoptee's original birth certificate under certain circumstances.
Revises the definition of "responsible charge" as it pertains to licensed professional engineers and land surveyors.
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise at least 33.3 percent of the population.
Requires retirement subdivision and retirement community to install electrical generator to provide electricity to common use area to be used as shelter in case of emergency.
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.
Establishes the authority of the court to order electronic monitoring of certain convicted domestic violence offenders.
Directs removal or enhancement of electric public utility infrastructure located in flood hazard area.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Underground Utility Lines.
Requires retail motor fuel dealer to use generator during power outage.
Requires mortgage holders to accept certain mortgage payments.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.

Allows monies statutorily dedicated to standardbred or thoroughbred horse racing purses to be used for benefit of horse racing industry, subject to agreement between permitholder and representative horsemen's organization.*
Requires State agencies to submit required reports by posting, on agency website, the information required to be reported.
Concerns voluntary contributions through gross income tax returns to support New Jersey athletes participating in 2014 Special Olympics USA Games.
Limits political contributions by hedge funds and private equity funds that invest in casinos or in which State funds are invested.
Reduces dollar amount of full outstanding debt issue that exempts casino institutional investor from requirement to maintain qualifications.
Caps at 35 percent share of State public employee pension and annuity funds portfolio that may be invested in combination of hedge funds, private equity, commodities, and real estate.
"New Jersey Residents' Power Protection Act"; requires use of emergency power generators by various facilities and businesses; provides related tax incentives.
Clarifies procedures for restoration of driver's license after suspension; authorizes the court to waive imprisonment under certain circumstances.

Revises residential property mortgage foreclosure process; requires documentation of right to foreclose and consultation on foreclosure alternatives; provides expedited process for foreclosing abandoned properties.

Requires county board of elections provide notice to voters by mail and on county's Internet site when change in polling place location for any election district occurs within 60 days of any election.
Concerns community-based correctional services for certain State and county inmates.
Requires DEP to update Shore Protection Master Plan.
Directs CATV companies to provide energy efficient CATV converter boxes to customers.
Requires DOC to conduct quarterly site visits at residential community release programs.
Establishes "Task Force To Review Residential Community Release Programs" to review this State's halfway houses and make recommendations concerning security and inmate services.
Prohibits pre-trial county inmates charged with first, second, or third degree crimes from being placed in halfway houses.
Requires the Division of Purchase and Property to award contracts to halfway houses; sets forth certain contract requirements.
Requires residential community release programs to file certain financial disclosure documents with DOC.

Provides that institutions of higher education require candidates for membership in or members of fraternities, sororities, sports teams, and other student organizations to sign anti-hazing agreement.
Increases interest rate paid on certain overdue refunds of tax overpayments.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education and State financial aid.
Requires proof of firearms safety training as a condition for issuance of firearms purchaser ID cards and permits to purchase handguns.
Designates "Sweet, Sweet New Jersey" as State song.
"Consumer Access to Health Care Act"; eliminates requirement of joint protocol with physician for advanced practice nurses to prescribe medication.
Designates May of each year "Military Appreciation Month" in New Jersey.
Requires assisted living residences and certain facilities under DCA, DCF, and DHS to be equipped with standby emergency power generators.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for certain purchases made by, or on behalf of, individuals and small businesses affected by natural disasters.
Requires Adjutant General of DMVA to issue State flag to resident enrolling in federal service academy.
Creates craft distillery license.
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters during certain emergencies.
Permits liens in favor of planned real estate development associations for unpaid assessments in planned real estate developments.
Requires electric and gas public utilities to file maps and information concerning utility infrastructure to municipal emergency management personnel.
Allows New Jersey gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions for Hurricane Sandy relief in New Jersey.
Eliminates certificated superintendent and administrator exceptions to TPAF retiree reenrollment requirement.
Upgrades penalties for certain crimes committed during a state of emergency.
Provides that participation by New Jersey residents in certain cooking or baking contests does not constitute unlawful gambling.
Prohibits multiple coverage for public employer health care benefits as employee, dependent, or retiree.

Authorizes municipalities, by resolution, to require tax collector to remove parcel of real property from accelerated tax sale list if fourth quarter property taxes not paid but property materially depreciated following severe weather event.
Requires designation of certain intersections for alternative emergency power generator in event of Statewide emergency.
Designates Paterson Plank Road bridge in the Town of Secaucus as "Joseph F. Tagliareni, Jr. Memorial Bridge."
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Requires disclosures by temporary help service firms.
Directs BPU to adopt best practices and standards for public utility disaster response.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.
Increases minimum wage to $8.00; provides for further increases.
Establishes "Energy Infrastructure Study Commission."
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Provides for termination of parental rights of certain persons convicted of sexual assault that resulted in the birth of a child.*
Provides for sick leave injury program of 30 days for State employees who are members of PFRS or SPRS.
Provides that certain personal identifying information may be redacted from certain public records in certain circumstances.
Requires board of education to provide an individual textbook for each student enrolled in a class.
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption for synthetic turf field construction by local government units.*
Permits flexible scheduling of private duty nursing services for eligible Medicaid recipients.
Requires adoption of procedures and standards for remediation of residential property used for illegal methamphetamine manufacture; requires notice to buyer of such use.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Temporarily eliminates sales and use tax imposed on sale of certain foods and beverages.
Eliminates requirement that full-time students at a county college in New Jersey maintain health insurance coverage.*
Clarifies that members of volunteer first aid squads that bill third parties do not lose right to use emergency warning lights.
Revises definition of volunteer first aid, rescue, and ambulance squad under "New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987."
Requires Division of Consumer Affairs to maintain database concerning retail motor fuel dealers.*

Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge expelled from a public sewer system or public sewage treatment plant are not hazardous substances for purposes of "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Requires use of constitutionally dedicated moneys to fund conversion of certain diesel vehicles to compressed natural gas, liquefied petroleum gas, or electric vehicles.
"New Jersey Disaster Victims' Bill of Rights"; authorizes $500 million emergency State bonds and appropriates money for municipal property tax relief program.
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.*
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Provides for one-time increase of PFRS retiree annual pensions under $32,000.
Directs Attorney General to develop plan to disseminate Amber and Silver Alert information through social media.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Provides for licensure of pediatric respite care facilities. *
Requires training program for school bus drivers and aides on interacting with students with special needs.
Extends gross income tax medical expense deduction to certain cord blood banking services.
Makes direct deposit the default distribution method for gross income tax refunds and allows gross income tax refunds via prepaid debit cards.*
Modernizes the form of disbursement for certain State and local government payments to individuals and business entities.*
