Requires retail motor fuel dealer to use generator during declared state of emergency resulting in power outage.
Requires electric public utilities to repair or install streetlights within certain time periods after municipal notification.
Permits certain public and private entities to qualify for BPU grants or low interest loans for cost of alternative power generation devices.
Provides for voluntary contributions through gross income tax returns to support victims of Hurricane Sandy.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Requires State pay postage for voted ballots returned by mail; makes an appropriation.*
Requires existing and new senior residential multiple dwellings to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
"Property Tax Lien Pilot Program," establishes pilot program to allow certain municipalities greater control over sale of tax liens.

Increases distribution to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore municipal aid reductions; requires additional aid to be subtracted from municipal property tax levy.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.
Establishes Developmental Disability Awareness license plates; dedicates fees to Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Permits extension of deadline for notification of depreciation of value of real property to tax assessor and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.

Lengthens yellow light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by camera; implements one second delay for red light camera violations.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.*
Permits wineries to operate salesrooms in certain municipalities with restrictions on the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Establishes de minimus levels for regulation of air contaminants and hazardous air pollutants, and directs DEP to establish de minimus levels for regulation of hazardous substances.
Revises laws concerning traffic control signals and traffic control signal monitoring systems.
Establishes workplace training program for unemployment compensation recipients; makes an appropriation.
Concerns enforcement, penalties, and procedures for law regarding failure to pay wages.
"Garden State Manufacturing Jobs Act."
Establishes School Security Task Force.*
Temporarily suspends penalties and interest for late payment of State taxes by businesses disrupted by Hurricane Sandy.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Removes statutory authority of DOH and Board of Medical Examiners over medical standards governing declarations of death upon the basis of neurological criteria.*
Permits cities of the first class to operate weigh stations and to inspect vehicles and railroad cars transporting hazardous materials within their jurisdiction.
Requires newly elected or appointed board of education member to complete training program before voting on any major resolution.
Requires new electric distribution lines to be located or relocated underground wherever practicable.
Authorizes transfer of officers of abolished county park police forces to county police force in certain cases.
Appropriates $24,290,379 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for farmland preservation purposes.
Appropriates $38.5 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for county planning incentive grants.
Appropriates $16,250,000 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" for planning incentive grants to municipalities for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $4,083,320 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit organizations for farmland preservation purposes.
Establishes Disparity in Treatment of Persons with Disabilities in Underrepresented Communities Commission in DCA.
Excludes certain conveyances of graves, crypts and niches from 15% fee charged by cemetery company.
Prohibits municipalities from charging interest on unpaid property taxes for 30 days after payment is due following hurricane or other catastrophic weather event.
Establishes conditional dismissal program in municipal court.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
"New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database Act"; establishes New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database and arbitration process for reimbursing out-of-network health care providers.
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.
Requires certain public school students to be screened for dyslexia and other reading disabilities.**

Requires DOE provide professional development opportunities related to reading disabilities; mandates certain school district personnel annually compete two hours of professional development related to reading disabilities.*
Requires DOE provide professional development opportunities related to reading disabilities to school district personnel.
Directs State Board of Education to incorporate the International Dyslexia Association's definition of dyslexia into special education regulations.
Requires that candidates for certain teaching certificates, in addition to existing requirements, also pass a written test on the foundations of teaching reading and diagnosing reading difficulties.
Requires disclosure of storm or flood damage in vehicle sales.
Authorizes marriage by same-sex couples, and provides for issuance of marriage license to same-sex couples, including those previously joined in civil union, subject to voter approval.
Permits municipalities to dedicate revenues from storage of motor vehicles for maintenance, surveillance, construction expenses, and salaries related to municipal impound lots.
Repeals and replaces Chapters 1 and 7 of the Uniform Commercial Code and revises various additional provisions of the code.
Requires that contract for private operation of State Lottery be subject to approval by Legislature.
Codifies protections set forth in certain case law and limits use of eminent domain under the "Local Redevelopment and Housing Law."
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Establishes budgetary oversight authority over State government expenditures of private monetary donations and expenditures for advising and consulting services.
Requires certain disclosures in advertisements by health care professionals.

Requires cable television, telecommunications, and utility service providers request alternate mode of communication from customers; requires that providers contact customers in event of service interruptions and emergencies.*
Requires disposition of remains of active duty service member of Armed Forces of United States pursuant to Department of Defense form completed by service member.*
Establishes requirements for newly installed and replacement electric utility poles and transmission towers.
Directs BPU to study feasibility of adopting certain requirements for installation of new and replacement electric distribution utility poles and transmission towers.
Requires halfway house employees to complete police training course.
Provides that participation by New Jersey residents in contests of skill does not constitute unlawful gambling. *
Requires emergency operations plans in certain senior occupied buildings.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for capital gains from sale of certain employer securities.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.
Adds one member to New Jersey Epilepsy Task Force and extends for one year.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits to businesses for purchase of certain alternative-power trucks.*

Appropriates $20,000,000 from General Fund to the Department of State for travel and tourism advertising and promotion to communicate that New Jersey's tourism destinations are operational despite damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.
Requires disclosure of water damage prior to vehicle sales.
Permits reassessment of real property when municipal assessor has not received notice of material depreciation from property owner and allows Division of Taxation to extend certain statutory dates.
Provides State, county, municipal, and school district contracts for professional services will be awarded pursuant to competitive contracting process.

Allows municipality to petition county for removal of abandoned vessel; provides that vessel shall not be deemed abandoned for period of not more than six months following declared state of emergency.
Makes various revisions to scrap metal law.
Provides for $250,000 grant program encouraging compressed natural gas and electric vehicle conversion training programs.
Provides for $5 million grant program encouraging compressed natural gas fueling stations and electric charging stations.
Removes certain requirements for professional engineers to take examination to operate water supply and wastewater treatment systems.
Requires carbon monoxide detectors in school buildings.
Requires boards of education to adopt policies to make schools asthma-friendly.
Requires homeowners insurance consumer information brochure to contain one page summary of policy.
Provides three years of partial funding to urban enterprise zone assistance fund for Hurricane Sandy relief.
Establishes moratorium on hydraulic fracturing for purpose of natural gas exploration or production until certain conditions are met.
Establishes a regulatory and reporting program for ammunition sales and transfers.*
Establishes a regulatory system to govern the sale and transfer of ammunition.
Makes looting during a state of emergency an aggravating circumstance in sentencing.
Affords immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.
Provides homestead owners gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Dedicates sales and use tax collections from sales of medical marijuana to the "Medical Marijuana for a Cure Fund" for medical research grants on certain debilitating medical conditions.
School bond validating act.
"The Hurricane Sandy Relief and Recovery Bond Act," authorizes bonds for $1 billion to support State's ongoing relief and recovery efforts and makes an appropriation to cover issuing costs.
Criminalizes purchasing or owning weapon if person has previous conviction of unlawful possession of weapon.
"Vegetation Management Response Act"; concerns vegetation management related to electric public utility infrastructure.*
Provides employers with various tax incentives for hiring persons with disabilities under insurance premiums tax, corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Eliminates requirement that notice of elections list polling place locations; requires notice include Division of Elections Internet site providing polling place locations.
"Nikhil's Law"; requires MVC to inform and test drivers on dangers of failing to comply with traffic safety laws and "STOP for Nikhil Safety Pledge."
Allows for waiver of school bus requirements for mobility assistance vehicle technicians who transport students with medical needs to and from school.
Revises definition of destructive device to include weapons of 50 caliber or greater.
Designates DMVA headquarters building as "General H. Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr. Building."
Requires EDA to issue report concerning conveyance of real property.
Prohibits appointment of an executive of company regulated by Board of Public Utilities to governing board of public institution of higher education.
The "Green Acres, Water Supply and Floodplain Protection, and Farmland and Historic Preservation Bond Act of 2013," authorizes bonds for $400 million; appropriates $5,000.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Prohibits insurers from increasing premiums or making other adverse underwriting decisions with respect to medical malpractice liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Prohibits mail order, Internet, telephone, and any other anonymous method of ammunition sale or transfer in New Jersey.
Requires mental health screening by licensed professional to purchase a firearm.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing assault firearms for civilian use.**
Amends "Main Street New Jersey" program to provide assistance to arts and tourism organizations.
Amends the Historic Preservation license plate law establishing a new design periodically.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.
Requires halfway houses to permit attorneys and certain representatives of attorneys to visit incarcerated clients.
Requires electric public utilities to provide priority power restoration to hospitals, assisted living facilities, and nursing homes.
Upgrades burglary of a residence to a crime of the second degree; requires mandatory period of parole ineligibility if residence was occupied at time of offense.
Eliminates 10% surcharge on employer UI taxes during fiscal year 2014.
Requires psychological evaluation and in-home inspection as prerequisite to purchase firearm.
Designates ephedrine and pseudoephedrine as Schedule III controlled dangerous substances.
Requires certain financial information of certain corporations to be available to public.
Revises the definition of "public works projects" to permit project labor agreements for more projects.
"The New Jersey Economic Opportunity Act of 2013."**
Requires DOC to report certain information concerning halfway houses.
Requires DOC oversight of placement of pre-trial county inmates in halfway houses.
Sets forth procedures for transporting inmates housed in residential community release programs.
Requires residential community release programs to install cameras in certain facilities and provide telephone access to ombudsperson; requires ombudsperson to investigate reports.
Requires PANYNJ to impose cargo facility charge on certain cargo.
Permits two or more candidates for school board member to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot for same term.
Disqualifies person named on federal Terrorist Watchlist from obtaining firearms identification card or permit to purchase handgun.
Requires mental health evaluation and list of household members with mental illness to purchase firearm.
Requires security guards who carry weapons to wear certain uniform, including identification card.
Declares violence a public health crisis and establishes "Study Commission on Violence."*
Requires school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Expands notification when an offender is released from custody or transferred within the criminal justice system. *
Grants immunity from liability for certain professional services rendered during emergencies under certain circumstances.
Allows host municipalities to offer property tax abatements on former Fort Monmouth property under terms and conditions established by those municipalities.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.
Increases penalties for illegal cigarette trafficking.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Requires managed care plans to disclose allowed amounts for out-of-network health care services under certain circumstances.
Establishes that police cruisers have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Establishes public awareness campaign advising pregnant women, new parents, and women who are breast feeding about dangers of casual milk sharing.
Provides for licensure of human milk banks.
Requires handgun ammunition to be encoded with serial number.
Provides certain small businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain reinvestment in Shore municipalities.

Prohibits enforcement, for a period of 12 months, of homeowners' association bylaws prohibiting domesticated animals if owner is FEMA designated displaced individual following emergency declaration by President or Governor.
Establishes a ballistics identifier program for certain firearms.
Establishes pilot program requiring Attorney General to perform internal affairs functions of certain law enforcement agencies.
Deletes CAFRA permit exemption for reconstruction activities in coastal area.
"Consumer Protection Act of 2012."
Prohibits service and sale in schools of food and beverage items labeled as not intended or recommended for children.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Authorizes seizure and impoundment of a dog believed to have attacked, severely injured, or killed another domestic animal.
Appropriates up to $1,000,000 to bridge federal funding for Violence Against Women Act grantees.
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
Requires submission of certain mental health records to National Instant Criminal Background Check System.
Permits real estate licensees to prepare broker price opinions and comparative market analyses.
Includes payday lending as a violation of the consumer fraud act.
Provides grants for cleanup of flood damaged residential property; establishes New Jersey Flood Cleanup Fund; appropriates $5 million.
Prohibits notaries public from falsely representing themselves as attorneys in advertisements.
Appropriates $3.5 million to Phillip Alampi Beneficial Insect Rearing Laboratory improvements project.
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Removes registration requirement for providers of tinting materials on motor vehicle windshields and windows for medical reasons.
Permits certain county boards of chosen freeholders to publish notices of proposed or amended ordinances by title and summary.
Repeals anachronistic, superceded, or invalidated sections of statutory law.
Imposes additional five percent tax on sale of firearms and ammunition to fund safety infrastructure improvements in public buildings.
Requires owner of building advised of structural safety concern during private inspection to notify municipal code official and DCA; provides for emergency inspection.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Extends certain time limitations in police and fire contract arbitration proceedings.
"Certificates of Insurance Act."
Requires suspension of member of Legislature indicted for certain crimes or offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Creates grant program for municipalities to establish Light of the Missing; appropriates $100,000.
Revises statutes and enhances penalties for offenses involving child pornography; makes crime of causing a child to engage in a prohibited sexual act subject to "No Early Release Act." *

Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act."
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations and partnerships.
Establishes criminal penalties for killing, injuring or interfering with a service animal or guide dog; designated as "Dusty's Law." *
Requires reauthorization of payroll deduction for contributions to political committees.
Requires employers provide itemized statement of certain payroll deductions for political contributions.
Concerns certain reductions of UI benefits due to receipt of SS payments.
Concerns certain severance payments and unemployment insurance benefits.
Requires explanatory statement of employee contributions to political committees.
Establishes farmland preservation inheritance tax deduction program within Department of Agriculture.
Eliminates 10% surcharge on employer UI taxes during fiscal year 2014.
Appropriates $1,393,084 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to provide historic site management grants for certain historic preservation projects.
Makes consent to register with Selective Service part of driver's license application process for males under age 26.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special horse racing permit for steeplechase races; allows wagering on such races.
Establishes time limit for issuance of warrant for certain motor vehicle violations.
Clarifies that crime victim has a right to make a victim impact statement directly to the defendant at sentencing.
Provides unemployment benefits to certain college and university adjunct faculty members.
Requires reporting of the graduation and transfer rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.*
Establishes pilot program to provide zero-interest loans to certain emergency shelters and food banks for purchase and installation of generator.
Encourages school districts and nonpublic schools to increase student participation in school breakfast programs.
Requires municipal tax assessors to use disaster relief special tax codes to reduce assessments for parcels of real property destroyed or damaged due to disaster event.
"Unfair Wage Recovery Act"; provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected.
Concerns earned sick leave.
"Art Therapist Licensing Act."
Provides for Medicaid coverage and reimbursement for mental health services provided through telepsychiatry.
Prohibits public boardwalk construction using uncertified rainforest wood.
Establishes task force to study issues related to use of technology in education.
Establishes a limited license for threading within the practice of cosmetology and hairstyling.
Establishes electronic reporting system for purchasers of precious metals or jewelry.
Permits persons at racetracks, off-track wagering facilities, and casino simulcasting facilities to place instant racing wagers.

Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to automatically transmit information of potentially eligible voters to Secretary of State for voter registration purposes; requires public agencies and voter registration agencies to file change of residence notices.
Revises exemption from "unemployment compensation law" for operators of certain motor vehicles.
Raises minimum age for purchase and sale of tobacco products and electronic smoking devices from 19 to 21.
Directs DOH to develop plan to phase out use of latex gloves in health care facilities and food establishments.
Allows "Coastal Protection Trust Fund" monies to be used to separate combined sewer systems.
Prohibits awarding alimony to domestic violence offenders; permits termination of alimony based on conviction for crime or offense involving domestic violence.
Exempts certain veterinary students from compliance with veterinary practice licensure laws.
Requires BPU to conduct biennial rate cases for public utilities; increases penalties for public utilities failing to comply with BPU orders.
Creates exemption from certain MVC fees for prisoners of war.
Prohibits sex offenders from holding any job, position, or type of employment that primarily consists of contact with children.
Requires municipality to revoke autocab consent for certain motor vehicle violations.
Establishes certain requirements, including allowable fees, for provision of medical records to patients, legally authorized representatives, and authorized third parties.*
Upgrades theft to a crime of the first degree if amount involved is $500,000 or more.
Prohibits use of wearable computer with head mounted display while driving.

Requires certain public contract bid advertisements to contain certified cost estimate ranges, specifies grounds for rejection of all bids, and requires 50% guaranty on bids; designated as the Fairness in Bidding Act.
Requires Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to include information on life insurance plans in its student loan repayment information document.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special permit for horse racing on beach; allows wagering on such races.**
Establishes time limit for execution of arrest warrant for non-moving motor vehicle violations.
Allows certain drug dealing offenses to be graded by "units," rather than weight, of controlled dangerous substances.
Upgrades certain unlawful possession of firearms to first degree crime; revises certain penalties under the "Graves Act."
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Designates four State songs.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
Reduces fire service requirement for exempt fireman certificate.
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Requires BPU to regulate rates and terms and conditions of service of alternate operator telephone service providers to protect users of those services.
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for diagnosis, evaluation and treatment of lymphedema.
Establishes "Collaborative Mental Health Care Pilot Program" in DOH; appropriates $750,000.
Protects home addresses of law enforcement officers from being released by governmental entities.
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Eliminates requirement that every full-time student at an institution of higher education in New Jersey maintain health insurance coverage.*
Authorizes school district hiring preference for veterans.
Increases statute of limitations for prosecution of theft of firearm.
Permits conversion of life insurance policies to pay for Medicaid long-term care.
Requires mortgage lenders to maintain vacant, age-restricted dwelling units during foreclosure.
Prohibits PANYNJ from imposing cargo facility charge in certain instances.
Provides Medicaid coverage for family planning services to individuals with incomes up to 200 percent of the federal poverty level.
Makes FY 2013 supplemental appropriation to DOH for $7,453,000 for family planning services.
Prohibits soliciting or phishing for personal identifying information.
Revises ignition interlock device requirements for first drunk driving offenses.
Requires school districts to pay advanced placement examination fees for certain students and the State to reimburse school districts for the cost.
Prohibits tax return preparers from charging separately itemized fees for electronically filing State individual income tax returns.

Establishes a charter school review board in DOE to review charter school applications and modifies aspects of the charter school program including approval, monitoring, and evaluation of charter schools.
Requires presumption that any bail paid by defendant charged with certain weapons offenses will be in the form of full cash.
Upgrades penalty for unlawfully transferring a firearm to an underage person; permits transfer for instruction and training.*
Authorizes impoundment of motor vehicles for certain crimes and offenses.
Clarifies that information concerning the total number of firearms purchaser identification cards and permits to purchase a handgun issued in a municipality are public records.
Revises statutes concerning firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits; makes handgun purchase permit valid for four years.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2014.
Authorizes NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2014.
Makes certain changes to NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.
Concerns assessment of penalties for certain fraudulently obtained unemployment benefits and requires recovered penalties deposited into unemployment compensation fund.
Prohibits relieving certain charges of employer unemployment insurance accounts.
Concerns requirements to report newly hired employees.
Modifies short-time unemployment benefit law.
Designates State Highway Route No. 71 bridge between Borough of Belmar and Borough of Avon-by-the-Sea as "Robert A. Briant, Sr. Memorial Bridge." *
Exempts certain persons from all-terrain vehicle use restrictions.
Regulates sale and purchase of rifle and shotgun ammunition; imposes certain requirements on purchases of ammunition from out-of-State.
Requires certain police vehicles to be equipped with cameras.
Makes various changes to the "Urban Hope Act" including the financing and siting of renaissance school projects.
Prohibits sale and possession of undetectable firearms manufactured using three dimensional printing technology.
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles; requires that Attorney General issue guidelines or directives.
Prohibits the administration of State assessments via the Internet prior to 2016-2017 school year.
Appropriates $32,976,962,000 in State funds and $13,427,159,762 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2013-2014.
Makes FY 2013 State supplemental appropriations totaling $224,837,000, reduces FY 2013 appropriations by $398,006,000, and supplements various language provisions affecting appropriations in FY 2013.
Appropriates $715,706,303 from the "Building Our Future Bond Act" to the Office of the Secretary of Higher Education for public and private institutions of higher education.
Increases penalties for improper prescribing of drugs.

Permits contractor in certain construction contracts with State college to choose between a retainage deduction from monthly progress payments or depositing a bond; allows 2% retainage deduction of amount due on each partial payment.
Replaces NJ Wine Industry Advisory Council with NJ Wine Board and establishes new duties and authorizes revenue-producing activities.

Eliminates requirement that at least one of two licenses issued under small-scale and staged casino facility pilot program must be staged casino facility license; permits these facilities to be located in renovated buildings.
Concerns access to information maintained by Prescription Monitoring Program.
Permits minors to engage in certain construction work for nonprofit organizations.
Allows practitioner with financial interest in health care service providing lithotripsy to refer patients to that health care service if certain conditions are met.
Establishes special license plates to bring awareness to breast cancer.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education and State financial aid.*
Requires 10% of any increase in revenue realized by Rutgers University due to participation in Big Ten Conference to be appropriated to Rutgers University - Newark and Rutgers University - Camden.
Requires patient to receive notification of abnormality in chest x-ray; designated as Claudia's Law.
Authorizes release or reduction of original performance guarantee after deposit of adequate replacement performance guarantee by successor developer.
Designates salt water taffy as New Jersey State Candy.
Authorizes disclosure by DCF of information regarding child abuse to religious institutions.
Establishes "Environmental Justice Advisory Council."
Creates pilot program to allow certain county utilities authorities to fund certain local infrastructure.*
Expands Medicaid eligibility pursuant to federal "Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act."
Provides a gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Allows a gross income tax credit to certain taxpayers for capital improvements made to principal residence.
Gives priority status for connection of solar photovoltaic systems for customer-generators who are public entities.
Changes date of 2013 general election from November 5th to October 16th.
Concerns closure of, and other activities at, certain landfills.
Authorizes disclosure by DCF of child abuse and neglect information to religious institutions.
Permits court to order involuntary outpatient treatment in any county; concerns patient compliance with taking medication.

Provides for similar requirements for minor and adult patients in medical marijuana program; prohibits limitations on number of strains of medical marijuana cultivated and expands available means of packaging and ditribution thereof.*
Requires MVC to provide Gold Star Family decals to certain family members of armed services members who died while on active duty.
Limits easement, acquired by the State or local government unit, for use of beachfront property to dune construction or beach replenishment except under certain circumstances.
Authorizes court to include in domestic violence restraining orders a provision making the order applicable to a pregnant victim's child upon birth of the child.
Requires boards of education to calculate body mass index for students in first, fourth, seventh, and tenth grades.
Establishes trunk fighting as animal cruelty offense and crime of the third degree.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to provide assistive technology to elementary and middle school students with dyslexia.
Provides for shops offering a combination of skin care specialty services and manicuring services.
Requires opportunity to vote early in person using paper ballots on October 16, 2013 for both general election and U.S. Senate vacancy candidates.*
Provides for issuance of a uniform identification card for all law enforcement officers.
Extends moratorium on the imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until 2018; establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Establishes alternatives to monetary bail for certain criminal offenders.
Permits adoptees and certain others to obtain adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act.
Permits Sunday motor vehicle sales in certain counties.
Requires certain accuracy standards for child support wage garnishments.
Requires transfer of certain incarceration records to DOLWD.
Specifies bringing minor to animal fight as crime of third degree; establishes civil penalty therefor.
Provides law enforcement officers option to obtain handgun permit or firearms identification card from municipality where they are employed.
Authorizes issuance of duplicate firearms purchaser identification cards for change of address with certain proof.
Extends Right to Farm Act protections to commercial beekeepers, with some restrictions.*
Establishes exclusive State regulatory authority over apiary activities and allows for delegation of monitoring and enforcement authority to municipalities.*
Establishes penalty for destruction of man-made native bee hive.
Requires disclosure of original purchase price for land to be sold to a county, county agriculture development board, or municipality for farmland preservation purposes.
Prohibits workers' compensation reimbursement to certain entities for treatment paid on behalf of injured worker.
Directs public utilities and pipeline operators to reimburse municipalities for certain emergency services.
Clarifies that electronic funds transfers are included within the scope of the civil statute concerning issuing bad checks.
Exempts all transfers made to lineal relatives from the Transfer Inheritance Tax.
Expands applicability of "The Truth-in-Renting Act."
Extends moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees, for three years, through June 30, 2016.
Concerns employment of certain minors as runway or print models.
Requires municipality which has authorized installation and use of red light cameras to designate one person in prosecutor's office to respond to certain summons issued in error.
Directs all fines imposed by municipalities for violations of red light cameras to Highway Safety Fund.
Clarifies procedures for resignation, removal, and succession of fiduciaries.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Clarifies that compensation may be paid for expenses related to service animals required due to injuries resulting from crime against victim.*
Makes supplemental appropriation of $1,000,000 to fund the New Jersey Agricultural Experiment Station at Rutgers University.
Clarifies definition of reasonably necessary deviation when legally transporting firearm or weapon in motor vehicle.
Provides supplemental enrollment growth aid to districts that experienced significant enrollment growth; appropriates $21,881,000 to DOE.
"Autumn Joy Stillbirth Research and Dignity Act"; requires DOH to establish protocols for stillbirths, establishes stillbirth research database.
Authorizes New Jersey Racing Commission to grant special horse racing permit for steeplechase races; allows wagering on such races.
Requires sharing of incarceration information between government agencies; prohibits certain benefits program payments to incarcerated individuals.
Permits new cigar bar or cigar lounge to be opened under certain circumstances.
Expands implied consent statute to include blood and urine testing.
Requires electric public utilities to conduct vegetation management adjacent to service lines on certain real properties.*
Increases State hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues required to be annually appropriated to fund certain arts and cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.*
Imposes supplemental State hotel and motel occupancy fee for certain occupancies occurring on or after January 26, 2014 but before February 3, 2014; dedicates revenues to support arts and tourism.
Expands NJ Meadowlands Commission responsibilities to include flood control activities.
Requires school districts to adopt policies concerning electronic communications between employees and students.
Increases penalty for operating motor vehicle equipped with television located or positioned so screen is visible to the driver.
Requires municipalities which license canvassers, peddlers, and solicitors to accept background check results from other municipalities.

Provides corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization, and expansion, or hiring and training of new employees for manufacturing purposes.
Requires State to reimburse municipalities for portion of foregone property tax revenue resulting from veterans' property tax exemption.
Directs BPU to undertake public awareness campaign concerning telecommunications carriers and disclosure of customer information.

Requires resource family parent, relative, preadoptive parent, or caretaker to be party to reviews or hearings involving a child under the Division of Child Protection and Permanency in the Department of Children and Families' care.
Requires telephone number to report reckless or aggressive driving be displayed on school buses.
Imposes certain restrictions on sale of products containing dextromethorphan.
Requires certain community residential facilities have standby emergency power generators.
Permits alternate members of county planning boards to vote in place of any absent public member.
Extends the timeline for performing certain budget-related tasks in school districts that have moved the annual school election to November.
Designates Stone Harbor Boulevard Interchange of Garden State Parkway as "Christopher Meyer Memorial Interchange."
Requires clinical laboratory that provides services for accountable care organization to establish clinical laboratory testing advisory board.
Provides that a public school used as a polling place may not be open for classes and the day must be used for staff professional development.
Revises statutes regarding practice of physical therapy.
Prohibits improper release of photographs or videos captured by public entities.
Prohibits governmental collection of biometric identifiers without consent.
Imposes criminal penalties for illegally obtaining or disclosing personally identifiable health information.
Increases penalties for the unlawful disclosure or use of taxpayer information by State tax officials.
Requires judge approval prior to installation of video camera by public entity.
Requires administrative agency to include privacy impact statement when adopting, amending, or repealing rule.
Requires State personal income tax materials to include notice of certain property tax relief programs.
"Michael Massey's Law"; requires sanitation vehicles display flashing lights in certain circumstances and imposes conditions on drivers approaching sanitation vehicles displaying flashing lights.
Establishes Office of River Maintenance in DEP; repeals P.L.1993, c.376 concerning stream cleaning activities.
Expands scope of law prohibiting certain kinds of fraudulent political activity; increases penalty for violations.
Eliminates the board of trustees of Rutgers University and provides that its powers will be exercised by the board of governors of the university.
Establishes Meadowlands Flood Advisory Task Force.
Requires certain bidders for prevailing wage public work to provide proof that the prevailing wage will be paid.
Prohibits smoking on property acquired or developed for recreation and conservation purposes by local government units of nonprofit organizations using State funds.
Prohibits smoking at State parks, forests, beaches, and wildlife management areas.
Enhances penalties for drivers without motor vehicle insurance involved in accident with pedestrian; requires public awareness campaign concerning importance of this insurance.
Authorizes use of emergency reserve fund or proceeds from bonds issued by EDA to finance school security improvements.
Allows use of master meter system in residential dwellings under certain conditions.
Allows New Jersey Board of Massage and Bodywork Therapy to accept alternative proof of education for licensure of current practitioners.
Requires that certain health care facilities be generator ready; allows health care facilities to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of generators.

Excludes certain out-of-State businesses and employees from certain taxes, fees, and business registration requirements when temporarily performing in-State work or services during declared disaster or emergency.
Provides that child study team members may be employees of the school district or of a DOE approved agency or clinic.
Concerns procedures for public comment about matters before municipal planning and zoning boards.
Restricts access to recorded data imbedded in motor vehicle computer systems.
Creates first degree crime of home invasion, makes crime subject to No Early Release Act, and upgrades burglary of a residence to a second degree crime under certain circumstances.
Establishes specialty street rod and historic motor vehicle license plates and dedicates net proceeds to General Fund.
Applies prevailing wage to work on Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital grounds and facilities.
Permits boards of education to establish donated leave programs for their employees as an alternative to the sick leave banks which are currently permitted by law.
Requires any State entity administering State or federal public benefit programs to verify recipient's personal information against death records to prevent payment to deceased individual.
Requires State Board of Education regulations regarding school nurse certification to include certain minimum eligibility requirements.

Requires issue advocacy organization disclosure; increases disclosure of campaign finance information; raises amount of money contributable to committees; modifies restrictions on contributions by certain business entities performing public contracts.
Enacts "Motor Vehicle Owners' Right to Repair Act."
Exempts veterans' organizations from motor vehicle registration fee.
Requires patient to receive notification of abnormality in chest x-ray; designated as Claudia's Law.
Establishes "Mom2Mom Peer Support Program" telephone helpline.

Abolishes Landscape Irrigation Contractors Examining Board in the Department of Environmental Protection and transfers regulation of landscape irrigation contractors to Department of Community Affairs.
Establishes "Rutgers, The State University Study Commission."
Concerns contracts for asphalt work under the "Local Public Contracts Law."
Allows for sale of municipally owned preserved open space under certain circumstances to homeowners displaced as a result of severe repetitive loss events.
Includes auxiliary police officers in Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program.
Requires annual physical examination of child 19 years of age or younger include certain questions related to cardiac health.
Makes construction work on public utilities subject to "The Public Works Contractor Registration Act."
Expands infertility coverage under certain health insurance plans.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school and summer programs; appropriates $60,000.
Prohibits use or sale of neonicotinoid pesticides.
Permits Internet gaming equipment to be located at certain secure facilities in Atlantic City.
Authorizes court to order law enforcement to submit DNA evidence to national database to determine whether the evidence matches a known individual or a DNA profile from an unsolved crime.
Requires court to deny defendant's right to copy or reproduce images of child pornography as part of discovery.
"Permit Transparency Act"; requires State entity to post on official website number of permits applied for and issued, revenue derived, number of employees involved, and salary of such employees.
Authorizes municipalities to contract with appropriately trained municipal firefighters to provide paramedic services.
Requires PANYNJ to conduct noise and land use compatibility survey.
Prohibits incarcerated individuals from receiving Medicaid, Work First New Jersey, or Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits.
Requires pharmacies and prescribers to notify patients about how to ensure proper and safe disposal of unused prescription drugs.
"Solar Installation and Wind Turbine Decommissioning Act."

Establishes one-year moratorium on replacement of copper-based landline telephone service with non-copper-based landline or wireless telephone service; requires BPU to report to Governor and Legislature.
Permits charter school to limit admission to students with a substance abuse or dependence disorder.
Establishes public awareness campaign concerning safety of certain pedestrians.
Establishes $800,000,000 program of tax credits for qualified residential projects; restricts $200,000,000 for 100 percent-dedicated affordable housing.
Provides that the New Jersey Supreme Court shall have the authority to administer juror challenges through its rulemaking process.
Prohibits use of certain technology for unauthorized electronic surveillance of cellular telephones and portable electronic devices.

Requires forms for homestead property tax reimbursement, veterans' property tax exemption, veterans' property tax deduction, and senior and disabled property tax deduction to be available in certain languages.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Directs the Division of Taxation to produce instructional materials on the appropriate gross income tax treatment of certain deferred compensation plans.
Concerns installation and maintenance of solar panels in common interest communities.
Revises current review and approval process for certain State information technology-related spending requests; designated as the "Spurring Technological Innovation Act."
"Transparency in Government Legal Billing Act;" requires that bill for legal services rendered for public entity contain certain information as condition of payment.
Requires certain energy drinks to be labeled with warning for young consumers.
Requires each school district to offer a summer payment plan for school district employees.
Makes it unlawful for a private citizen to record a communication unless all parties to the communication have previously consented.
Prohibits employees of revaluation firms from employment by companies that may appeal assessed value of real property following municipal-wide revaluation.
Concerns rights of Delaware River and Bay Authority employees.
Prohibits boards of education from charging students a fee to participate in extracurricular activities.
Prevents county park facility from having primary purpose of hosting private events.
Limits length of contracts for annual county and municipal audits to five years.
Exempts veterans and members of military from boat license and registration fees under certain circumstances.

Provides for disclosure of person's medical records related to AIDS or HIV infection for investigations or prosecutions of crime of diseased person committing act of sexual penetration; makes crime ineligible for expungment.
Establishes certain warrant requirements for law enforcement agencies that utilize drones.
Provides for private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of certain insurance claims.
Establishes process for consideration of offers from short sale buyers during residential mortgage foreclosures.
Requires DEP to establish regulations for approval to install and operate certain solar facilities.

Provides that a school business administrator appointed by a school district after a certain date will not be eligible for tenure and may be dismissed pursuant to the terms of the employment contract.
Revises licensing provisions for orthotists and prosthetists and assistants.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on awareness of eating disorders as part of Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Allocates $10 million to City of Trenton to hire 75 additional police officers.
Requires school bus transporting students using wheelchairs to be equipped with four-point securement system; requires school bus operator to secure students using wheelchairs.
Prohibits sale of prepaid and wireless telephone service and equipment unless certain buyer information is recorded.
Allows processing of wild striped bass caught out of State for sale out of State.
Allows sale of wild striped bass caught outside of NJ.
Establishes Statewide Opioid Law Enforcement Coordinating Task Force.
Provides standards for home elevation contractors.

Requires appropriation of revenues collected in excess of amount anticipated for fiscal year for State hotel and motel occupancy fee for additional allocation among certain cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.

Requires mail-in ballot applications be available at polling places on election day for voting in future elections; requires poll workers to discuss application instructions with applicant upon request.
Requires prevailing wage be paid to certain workers.
Requires judicial approval prior to installation or use of automated license plate reader by law enforcement agency.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with 25 or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.
Provides for electronic scanning of certain certificates for initiating court proceedings for involuntary commitment.
Requires disclosure of chemicals to be used in hydraulic fracturing process as part of hydraulic fracturing permit application.

Establishes Common Core State Standards Evaluation Task Force; delays use of assessments developed by Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers until task force submits final report.
Requires completion of a computer science class as part of the high school graduation requirements.
"New Jersey Open Data Initiative;" requires certain information be made available on Internet by State departments and agencies.
Permits, as approved by court, use of assistance dogs by certain victims or witnesses when giving testimony on certain offenses.
Establishes compensation program for State and juvenile corrections officers and parole officers injured while performing official duties.
Authorizes county prosecutor to issue rewards to persons who provide information leading to the arrest, prosecution and conviction of persons who have committed certain drug offenses.
Provides immunity from civil liability for person who sends text message to motor vehicle operator.
Prohibits use of facial recognition systems except in certain circumstances.
Extends Class Two special law enforcement training for time deployed.
Enhances penalties for committing improper behavior in place of public accommodation.
Requires slow moving vehicle emblems to be affixed to rear of farm vehicles.

"Sudden Cardiac Arrest Prevention Act"; provides student-athletes, parents, and coaches with information on sudden cardiac arrest and establishes protocol concerning removal-from-play for athletes exhibiting symptoms of sudden cardiac arrest.
Prohibits use of certain technology for unauthorized electronic surveillance of cellular telephones.
Prohibits certain public utilities from sending residential customers redundant written notice of enrollment in government energy aggregation programs.
Prohibits electric and gas public utilities from disqualifying certain residential customers if enrolled in government energy aggregation program.
Clarifies juvenile's right to attorney representation; requires twelve-month judicial review hearing when juvenile is placed out-of-home.
Prohibits distribution of images and information produced by red light cameras.
Requires public institutions of higher education to submit proposed tuition and fees for upcoming academic year to Secretary of Higher Education for review.
Requires institutions of higher education to post on their websites information concerning open enrollment period in qualified health plans.
Establishes Medicaid demonstration project to cover room and board services for certain terminally ill patients in the home or other non-institutional setting.
Concerns alternate methods of wage payment.
Requires access to law enforcement guidelines for processing firearms permit applications upon public records request.
Requires flying of US and State flags at half-staff under certain circumstances; adopts US Flag Code.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks; dedicates revenues derived therefrom as State aid for education.
Requires Department of Agriculture to post on its website certain information regarding State's farm to school program.

Requires each public employer to establish fund for contributions actuarially calculated to meet obligations to pay for retiree health care benefits and supplemental compensation for unused vacation and sick leave.
Requires cost disclosures by health care providers under certain circumstances; applies certain restrictions to charges for medical supplies.
Establishes that person who knowingly sends text message to motor vehicle operator is immune from civil liability.
Permits municipalities to authorize property tax reward programs; validates actions of municipalities that have created them.
Increases age for helmet requirement for roller skating and skateboarding to 17 and younger; extends helmet requirement to ice skaters.
Recognizes same-sex marriages entered into outside the State.
Clarifies that handgun ammunition may be sold to retired law enforcement officers with certain identification.
Clarifies the effect of abstention by a member of a public body.
Upgrades penalties for crimes committed with aid of firearms locator application.
Increases penalties for certain heroin offenses by revising threshold amounts for first, second, and third degree crimes of manufacturing, distributing, and dispensing heroin.
Authorizes DOT and historic entities to accept gifts and grants for purchase and erection of historic markers and signs.
Provides for licensing of abortion facilities and establishes criminal and civil penalties for violations, and designated as the "Women's Health Protection Act."
Requires preschool tuition rates equal actual cost per pupil.
Prohibits location of off-road vehicle training or recreation facility within five miles of residential zone.
Requires hospitals to post notice in emergency departments concerning prescription drug diversion.
Establishes "College Affordability Study Commission" to examine issues and develop recommendations to increase the affordability of higher education in New Jersey.*
Establishes "New Jersey Works Dual Enrollment Option Program."
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers shall not be responsible for certain fees associated with credit, debit and rewards cards.
Provides for background checks and other requirements for certain agencies providing temporary home for child or pregnant woman during crisis.
Establishes a cybersecurity investment incentive tax credit program.
Makes a $3 million supplemental appropriation for increased Per Capita Library Aid.
Allows gross income taxpayers to use their gross income tax returns to make voluntary contributions to ALS Association for services to New Jersey residents.
Establishes a loan redemption program for public school teachers who meet certain academic requirements and teach Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics subjects or special education.

Requires State Board of Education to adopt standards and benchmarks of performance for the improvement of teacher preparation programs and teacher certification candidates who complete the programs, and develop a program rating system.
Establishes Flexible Pathways Initiative in the Department of Education.
Revises procedures for the use of eminent domain and compensation for loss of business in municipal redevelopment programs.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Prohibits municipal officers and employees serving on redevelopment or housing agencies from voting to condemn property.
Reinstates moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.
Requires use of headlights on motor vehicles when motor vehicle is operated in an area of highway construction or repair.
Establishes the "Superstorm Sandy Victims' Bill of Rights."
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
Prohibits operator of motor vehicle from engaging in distracted driving.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $2,200,000 to Maritime Industry Fund in Office of Maritime Resources in DOT.
Revises "Contractors Registration Act" to include water remediation services.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle"s Law."
Expands protections in employment practices to include familial status.
Establishes fourth degree crime of possessing firearms locator application; enhances penalty if such application is used in the theft of firearm.
Prohibits use of anti-concurrent causation clauses in homeowners insurance policies.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Establishes pilot project to install global positioning system (GPS) devices on certain State vehicles.
Requires paint producers to implement or participate in a paint stewardship program.
Repeals laws concerning the incorporation of religious societies and congregations in New Jersey.
Establishes best practices for procurement and payment of legal services by local governments and school districts.
Allows refundable gross income tax credit for certain unreimbursed hearing aid expenses.
Eliminates duplicative requirements for notification to counties of admissions for Division of Developmental Disabilities residential services and for maintenance of those records.
Directs the collection by the Administrative Office of the Courts of data about crimes committed by persons released on bail.
Directs the collection of recidivism data for adults sentenced to a period of probation.
Clarifies manner of public disclosure of findings or information about child abuse or neglect cases resulting in child fatalities or near fatalities.

Establishes the Office of Dropout Prevention and Reengagement of Out-of-School Youth in DOE, and the Student Dropout Prevention Task Force.
Codifies responsible contractor requirements for contractors bidding for work through the Weatherization Assistance Program.
Establishes the "Private Investment in Public Education Fund."
Provides for certain psychologists to prescribe medications.
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.
Creates New Jersey Clinical Trials Registry in DHSS.
Allows business tax credit to employers giving paid leave to employees for service with volunteer emergency services organizations.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Requires certain health care facilities to adopt certain infection control strategies.
Requires State Treasurer to organize and publish certain contract and grant data and information on State expenditure Internet website.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Eliminates downgrading of DWI offenses that occur more than 10 years after previous conviction.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to register with ELEC and disclose contribution and independent expenditure information.
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.
Requires wireless cell phone company to inform subscribers that cell phone GPS capability may be deactivated.
Requires hospitals implement Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infection prevention programs in all units except inpatient psychiatric units.
Requires homeowners insurers to provide buyer's guide.
Requires hearing and approval of premium changes for individual and small employer health benefits plans; expands jurisdiction of Division of Rate Counsel.
Develops evaluation procedure for classroom teachers and requires establishment of lead teacher endorsement.
Establishes teacher residency as component of a higher education teacher preparation program; requires teachers who serve as mentors in residency program to meet certain qualifications.
Increases motor vehicle property damage reporting threshold to over $1,000.
Enhances penalties for provisional driver's license holders.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.
"Janet's Law"; requires public and nonpublic schools to have automated external defibrillators and to establish emergency action plans for responding to sudden cardiac events.*
Requires that victims of sex offense be informed of offender's risk of re-offense upon release.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Permits State aid to fund start-up costs for local shared services projects.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.
Provides loan redemption for certain physicians who work in State four years.*
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Prohibits the employment of unauthorized aliens and requires employers to use E-Verify program.
Creates non-State funded dispute resolution program for common interest community associations.
Requires physician practices that provide intravenous therapies in medical office to register with DHSS.
Provides criminal penalties for unauthorized use of images or likeness of minors and establishes civil action.
Expands the domestic violence statutes to encompass minors aged 16 and older.
Establishes the "Study Commission on the Cost-Effectiveness of Contracting with Nonprofit Organizations."
Requires cemeteries to implement woodchuck management strategies.
Requires certain health care facilities and operators of certain transient dwellings to maintain agreements for bedbug eradication services.
Requires persons who transport, store, or sell secondhand mattresses to encase mattresses with protective materials.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to convene a strategic planning summit to analyze the State's physician workforce supply.
Concerns the registration of persons convicted of arson related crimes.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of an offender.
Authorizes planned developments for hospitals and higher educational facilities.
Establishes Hooked on Fishing-Not on Drugs Program in DEP and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires prosecutors to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires reduction in number of State employees to FY2000 level; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Establishes, in the Division of Fish and Wildlife in DEP, a program to encourage school children to avoid drug use and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires DEP rejection of new solid waste facility registration if affected municipality disapproves proposed facility location.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Permits cancellation of municipal charges and fees under $10.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for those persons currently residing in nursing facilities, State hospitals or State developmental centers.
Imposes mandatory term of life imprisonment without eligibility for parole on persons who commit particularly brutal sexual assaults.
Prohibits first responders from photographing persons being assisted or disclosing photographs of such persons without their consent.*
Requires certain documentation as proof of voter identity to vote; updates procedures for challenging voters regarding proof of identity.
Exempts police from jury duty.
Increases penalties for committing serious offenses while released on bail.
Permits qualified retired law enforcement officers who were employed by law enforcement agencies outside the State to carry firearms.
Requires police notification when driver's license is suspended.*
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in the State.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
Revises distribution of monies from Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund to municipalities.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Borough of Seaside Heights.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Requires certain veterinarians to provide written notification to animal owner if boarded animal will not be subject to 24-hour supervision; "Betsy's Law."
Imposes criminal penalties for discharges of untreated sewage from containment devices installed on watercraft.
Requires officers of certain charitable organizations to be bonded.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
Clarifies that fishing license is not required to fish at a private community lake.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Prohibits the use of urea for melting, preventing the formation of, or removing ice.
Requires State park and forest restroom facilities to include an exclusive family restroom.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Prohibits use of public funds for embryonic stem cell research.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under New Jersey gross income tax.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning socio-economic impact statements for proposed rule-making.
"Zero-Based Budget Act;" requires State Treasurer to develop and integrate certain zero-based budgeting practices and procedures in preparation and submission of Governor's annual budget message.
Eliminates expansion of preschool education program in "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Requires Mandated Health Benefits Advisory Commission to study financial impact of all enacted mandated health benefits.
Repeals sections of law pertaining to transfer of civil service and non-civil service employees of terminated local health agency to superseding agency.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses providing employment to certain National Guard or reservists.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Eliminates seniority in Civil Service and other jurisdictions for reductions in force in certain circumstances.
Replaces references to Civil Service Commission with chairperson of commission to clarify duties and responsibilities of chairperson.
Establishes a 2.0 percent cap on annual appropriations increases for certain State government spending.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Provides exception to local cap law for purchases of fuel efficient vehicles and permits loans by New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust for those purchases.
Imposes two-year moratorium on certain new outpatient radiation oncology services and establishes Outpatient Radiation Oncology Services Task Force in DHSS.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Requires owner of building advised of structural safety concern during private inspection to notify municipal code official and DCA; provides for emergency inspection.
Requires carriers to classify medically necessary procedures as covered benefits and remit certain payments to hospitals for services rendered.
Prohibits drilling technique of hydraulic fracturing.
Establishes moratorium on hydraulic fracturing for purpose of natural gas exploration or production until certain conditions are met.
Establishes standards for commercial insurers and Medicaid program implementing electronic prescribing systems.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Increases penalties for repeated violations of Predatory Towing Prevention Act.
Provides purchasing preference to local and environmentally responsible businesses in the awarding of State contracts.

Prohibits treatment, discharge, disposal, or storage of wastewater, wastewater solids, sludge, drill cuttings or other byproducts from natural gas exploration or production using hydraulic fracturing.*
"Innovative Services for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Act."

Establishes loan redemption program for persons with Master's Degree in Business Administration or other business-related fields of study or Juris Doctorate and provide consulting or legal services to small business and legal services clients.
Provides sales and use tax rebates for certain purchases made by victims of Hurricane Irene and Tropical Storm Lee.
Supplemental appropriation to DOT of $10,000,000 as State contribution towards resolution of flooding issues at Marsellus Street Bridge in Bergen County.
"Emergency Transportation and Water Infrastructure Recovery Bond Act of 2011;" authorizes bonds for $100,000,000.
Establishes a Health Facility Reuse and Community Revitalization program.
Requires Financial Policy Review Board to issue quarterly reports and create and maintain website.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Authorizes business entities to designate representatives in court proceedings without the necessity for representation by an attorney.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $500 income tax deduction.
Grants county governing body final authority to determine expenditures for courtroom facilities.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Requires school districts to inform the parent or guardian of a student recommended to use certain medications of the possible side effects and potential negative consequences of those medications.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Establishes NJ Water Supply and Pharmaceutical Product Study Commission.
Provides for awarding of certain costs to defendants who prevail in DEP enforcement actions.
Permits DEP air quality regulation of certain outdoor wood burning units only in response to complaint.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Repeals "Global Warming Response Act" and related sections of Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative implementing law.
Specifies that certain images generated by body scans violate State statutes prohibiting invasion of privacy, pornography, and endangerment of child welfare under certain circumstances.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
Requires managed care plans to allow any clinical laboratory to participate in provider network.
Excludes from gross income the contributions that certain federal employees classified as criminal investigators make to the federal Thrift Savings Fund.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Provides for reduced sales tax imposition on certain sales in certain Highlands Region Preservation Area municipalities.
Directs NJ Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct feasibility study of Meadowlands convention center project.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor constitutes sexual assault against the minor under certain circumstances.
Requires DHSS to study relationship between autism and ultrasounds and issue protocol for use of ultrasounds.
