"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Authorizes use of retail coupons for purchase of milk by consumers.
Requires immediate resumed qualification as dependent covered person under certain health benefits plans after active military duty under certain circumstances.
Adds aneutronic fusion to types of Class I renewable energies as defined for purposes of "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits for surviving dependents of public safety workers who die in the line of duty.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct Medicaid payments when calculating gross receipts assessments.
Permits ambulatory care facility to deduct up to $125,000 in Medicare reimbursements when calculating gross receipts assessment.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.
Revises statutes concerning dental hygienists and dentists.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Clarifies right to access the judicial system in PIP benefit disputes.
Replaces TPAF, PERS, PFRS and SPRS accidental disability benefits with reduced work-related disability benefit; modifies JRS disability benefit.

"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website; requires certain public entities receiving State funds to establish similar website; makes an appropriation.
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet.
Requires MVC to notify Medicaid if driver's license of medical transportation services provider is suspended or revoked.
Requires simple majority for proposal to increase school tax levy above tax levy growth limit.
Expands area for designation of eligible neighborhoods under "Neighborhood Revitalization State Tax Credit Act."
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Requires issuance of general permit for beach food and drink concession stands under certain circumstances pursuant to CAFRA.
Requires school districts to provide for the safe operation of electrically operated partitions in classrooms or other school facilities.
Establishes conflict resolution procedures through Department of Agriculture for complaints against commercial fishing docks and fish processing facilities.
Establishes minimum reimbursement amounts for medical transportation services under Medicaid.
Repeals restriction on weights and measures officers' and employees' duties.
Requires certain liability coverage, and offering of coverage, under basic and special private passenger automobile insurance policies.
Provides grants and tax credits for school districts and private contractors for installing cameras on school buses.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Permits certain county boards of chosen freeholders to publish notices of proposed or amended ordinances by title and summary.
Requires DOE to develop and distribute information regarding hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and expands role and membership of New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.
Provides that subcontractors who furnish non-specialty trade work shall not be named in local public bid documents.
Requires a board of education to consult with appropriate nonpublic school representatives prior to any change in the provision of nursing services.
Provides that certain disabled veterans may purchase special automobile insurance policies.
Provides State indemnification for certain local law enforcement officers.
Permits veteran's property tax deduction for tax year when veteran was previously qualified to receive deduction and became owner of real property after October 1 of pretax year.
Permits county clerk or register of deeds and mortgages to create identification cards for certain veterans for certain purposes. *

Exempts disabled veterans and recipients of the Purple Heart from the payment of municipal parking meter fees when their vehicles bear a disabled veteran's or Purple Heart license plate issued by the New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission.
Requires Secretary of State create e-mail notification system alerting when US and State flags flown at half-staff.

"Emergency Information Access Act"; requires utility service providers to report severe weather and emergency related service; directs utility service providers and State Office of Emergency Management to present reported information online and via telephone.
Provides immunity to institutions of higher education for food donations.
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Provides grants to eligible businesses equal to 5% of annual base salary of new employees hired under employment grant component of Invest in New Jersey Business Grant Program.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Establishes the authority of the court to order electronic monitoring of certain convicted domestic violence offenders.
Authorizes a board of education to reject the lowest bid for a school transportation contract based on the school bus safety inspection record of the bidder.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination"; repeals section 4 of P.L.1985, c.73.
Requires Governor's annual budget message to include certain contract information.
Prohibits Internet posting of certain information on law enforcement officers.
Establishes minimum energy efficiency standards for certain products.
Revises scope of public employee collective negotiations.
Revises certain procedures for municipal redevelopment programs; prohibits certain campaign contributions by redevelopers.
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase of electric or plug-in hybrid electric vehicles.
Provides corporation business tax credit and allows gross income tax deduction for purchase and installation of electric vehicle charging stations.
Jessica Rogers' Law: upgrades assault by auto or vessel in situations of road rage.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Implements recommendations of State Comptroller's report analyzing the on-line transparency of local authorities and commissions.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Permits institutions of higher education to make supplemental contributions to ABP.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid in State Fiscal Year 2012.
Permits municipalities to use up to 15% of affordable housing trust fund monies to provide financial assistance grants to owners of property that sustained certain weather-related damage.
Requires that Board of Pharmacy compile and publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs and that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug.
Designates Pine Barrens treefrog as New Jersey State Amphibian.
Permits municipalities to enact ordinances regulating where sex offenders may reside.
Permits undersheriff to perform administrative duties on behalf of county sheriff.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and harassment under certain circumstances.
Requires persons subject to Megan's Law registration to provide law enforcement with any Internet identifiers.
Establishes permissive inferences related to conduct that serves as predicate to sex offenses against minors.
Makes it a crime to communicate or transmit sexually suggestive communications to a minor under certain circumstances.
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury.
Criminalizes driving under the influence with person 17 years of age or younger in vehicle.
Provides life imprisonment without eligibility for parole for all murders.
Provides for excused absences for public school students involved in election activities on day of general election under certain circumstances.
Provides primary and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Authorizes hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Establishes limited retail religious distribution license.
Concerns custody and parenting time issues for military parents.

Permits a child whose parent or guardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in the school district where the child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Requires appointments for safety-related recalls on vehicles to be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Authorizes State and local governments to enter into group purchasing agreement for alternative fueled vehicles.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Provides for collection on child support arrearages and certain public assistance overpayments through withholding of casino and racetrack winnings.
Exempts from sales tax cosmetic makeup services provided in conjunction with reconstructive breast surgery; designated as "Jen's Law." *
Establishes standards of practice for providers of clinical nursing services for medically fragile students.*
Requires State Treasurer to disseminate information about organ and tissue donation; designates April each year as "Donate Life Month."
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Prohibits municipal officers and employees serving on redevelopment or housing agencies from voting to condemn property.
Places temporary moratorium on use of eminent domain; creates Eminent Domain Study Commission to examine its use Statewide.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act;" imposes mandatory term of 25 years to life for aggravated sexual assault against a child under 13 and increases penalties for harboring certain sex offenders.**
Provides that a homestead owner who is 65 years of age or older or disabled shall not receive a homestead rebate of less than $1,440.
Provides for a mandatory minimum term for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
Creates "Green E-ZPass" discounts for certain fuel-efficient vehicles.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.
Requires candidates for teacher certification to complete technology training program.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Requires municipal court to hear certain violations of animal cruelty statutes within 14 days of the summons date.
Provides that records of convictions for carjacking, promoting prostitution of a child and certain child endangerment crimes shall not be expunged.
Clarifies that responsibility for investment of assets under management of Division of Investment vests in State Investment Council.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires payment of certain attorney's fees, expenses and costs in identity theft cases; adds debit card numbers to definition of "personal identifying information".
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Creates the crime of victimization of a senior citizen or a person with a disability.
Clarifies that "entering" a public place for a drug deal is conduct included in C.2C:33-2.1.
Concerns free access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Authorizes the AG or the Commissioner of DOLWD to obtain expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Exempts sales of methane gas fuel conversion machinery and equipment from sales and use taxes.
Requires BPU to conduct pilot program to allow free parking for alternative fuel vehicles and alternative technology vehicles.
Permits payments in subsidized adoption until child becomes 21 years of age under certain circumstances.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Provides for designation of new charter school authorizers.
Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements.
Expands jurisdiction of municipal arson investigators.
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."

Modifies various aspects of charter school program including student enrollment procedures, revocation of charter, monitoring of charter schools, and collaboration between school districts and charter schools.
Requires each public institution of higher education to post its budget on the institution's website.
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Creates "Task Force on the Extension of Route 55."
Requires DOT and DEP to conduct study on options to alleviate congestion on Route 47.
Reduces State hotel and motel occupancy fee from five to two percent starting FY2011; preserves dedication.
Expresses additional rationale for existing statutory prohibition of self-service dispensing of motor fuel at service stations.
Concerns recorded telephone messages.
Prohibits sale of certain laser pointers that exceed certain power output.*
Revises qualifications and requirements for permits to carry handgun; establishes annual fee of $100.
Permits Governor to notify local governments to fly United States and State flags at half-staff upon death of member of Armed Forces of United States or National Guard who was State resident.*
Requires carriers to process and render a decision on applications for individual health benefits plans within one week.

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
Extends for two years expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."

Requires inmates serving "No Early Release Act" sentences be placed in State correctional institutions and prohibits their participation in Residential Community Release programs until they are eligible for parole.
Tightens eligibility criteria and supervision protocols for early release program; directs Attorney General to evaluate program.
Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in the urban enterprise zone program.
Establishes bill of rights for parents of persons with developmental disabilities.
Concerns UEZ program funding to qualifying municipalities.
Requires NJT to purchase alternative fuel vehicles.
Requires two-way communications equipment on school buses.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons.*
Prohibits purchaser of used motor vehicle from waiving dealer's obligation regarding emissions control equipment.
Prohibits motor fuel wholesaler from increasing price more than once in 24-hour period.
Changes from two to four number of consecutive general elections where more than 750 votes or less than 250 votes may be cast before election district is redrawn.
Waives commercial driver's license requirements for certain Office of Emergency Management drivers.
Requires notice of development applications be given to residential tenants on that property.
Requires video cameras at certain ATMs.
Requires adult corrections officers in State facilities to complete in-service training program.
Provides for forfeiture of vehicle where weapon was unlawfully possessed.
Establishes grant program in DCA to provide funding to youth mentoring programs.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Permits counties to establish a central municipal drug court.
Allows security officer applicant to demonstrate rehabilitation if previously convicted of crime.
Requires property tax bills to contain eligibility information on State tax relief programs.
Requires public institutions of higher education to advertise for bids prior to awarding contracts for professional services.
Increases mandatory minimum prison term for certain crimes involving firearms and designated as Tamrah's Law.
Establishes three categories for investigative findings of allegations of child abuse or neglect, and requires DCF to track and report certain unfounded cases that subsequently are substantiated.
Permits a student to participate in certain voluntary surveys if the district sends prior written notification to the student's parents; limits use of information obtained from survey.*
Prohibits employers from obtaining, requiring, or discriminating on the basis of credit reports.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for a restricted use license.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to the establishment of a charter school.
Prohibits a student from participating in high school graduation ceremonies unless the student has completed all graduation requirements.
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances; eliminates presumption of nonimprisonment.
Requires boil water notices be provided to mayor and municipal clerk within one hour.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message.
Creates Craft Distillery License to permit the manufacture of smaller amounts of distilled alcoholic beverages.
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.
Authorizes public access to government records through government website.
Makes various changes in the charter school program in regard to student enrollment procedures, charter revocation, and monitoring of charter schools.
Requires certain electric public utilities to file emergency response plan with Board of Public Utilities.
Provides immunity from liability for certain recreational activities and from injuries caused by acts of God.
Requires the Director of the Division of Taxation to establish a gross income tax payment system by credit card or debit card.
Authorizes DMV to offer a red heart-shaped identifying symbol on personalized license plates.
Allows property taxpayers an additional year to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Includes auxiliary police officers in Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program.
Establishes that passenger vehicles other than police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Reduces statute of limitations for medical malpractice liability actions to four years.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Permits law enforcement personnel to examine account records of E-ZPass customers when the theft of a transponder has been reported.
Concerns medical malpractice procedures and liability.
Requires penalties to be levied against renters and homeowners who violate affordability controls on affordable housing units.
Establishes residency requirement for police officers and firefighters in certain municipalities.

Prohibits former elected official from receiving for five years compensation from charitable or non-profit organization when official's candidate committee donated campaign contributions to organization.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HIV vaccine.
Eliminates requirement that candidate campaign treasurer reports be filed with county clerk for legislative, local and school board candidates.
Implements measures to strengthen oversight of hospital charity care subsidies.
Prohibits solid waste collectors from billing for residential collection services more than 30 days in advance of the service.
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Clarifies calculation of at-risk weight in school funding formula.
Requires certain persons on boats less than 21 feet long to wear personal flotation device between November 1st and May 1st.
Clarifies breath test warnings provided to persons arrested for intoxicated driving and boating need only be in English and those warnings are not element of offense of refusing breath test.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Provides for attachment of real property relating to terrorism.
Provides for the inclusion of home-schooled students in the NJ STARS Program.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund, dedicates $400,000 annually from certain power vessel operator license fees to the fund, and appropriates $400,000 for FY2012.*
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for positron emission tomography to diagnose Alzheimer's disease.
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.
Requires insurers to provide minimum of 30 days inpatient treatment for substance abuse when physician determines treatment is medically necessary.
Requires municipalities that receive State aid to certify that all municipal buildings adhere to fire codes.
Establishes "William's Law," pertaining to pool safety.
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Requires medical oxygen providers to notify fire department whenever they stop delivering oxygen to a local residence.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights Program Act."
Requires public schools to include instruction on the events relating to September 11, 2001 and the death of Osama bin Laden, as part of core curriculum content standards.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain costs of home bedbug infestation remediation.
Requires, for roof mounted solar photovoltaic systems, identifying emblem on certain structures, and fire department notification for all structures. *
Provides for continuity of religious upbringing, to the maximum extent practicable, for children placed into resource family homes.
Expands membership of Police Training Commission to include representative from Chiefs of County Detectives/Investigators Association of NJ.
Establishes public-private partnership for certain transportation projects; requires 10% of public-private partnership projects to be set aside for small businesses.

"Assistance to Firefighters' Families Act"; doubles State survivor pension amounts for beneficiaries of certain deceased volunteer emergency service providers; requires municipal life insurance and burial expenses for volunteer firefighters; permits fire code inspection surcharge.
Authorizes payment of funeral expenses for certain public safety employees killed in line of duty.
Waives commercial driver's license fees for certain volunteer firefighters.
Requires the adoption of nepotism policies by school districts and charter schools.
Authorizes county vocational school district to reduce required local share when it deems appropriate.

"Government Reality Check Act"; prohibits public employers from providing certain benefits to public employees; restricts gifts to public employees; restricts travel by public employees; imposes post-employment restriction on public contracting employees.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Port Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River and Bay Authority commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Imposes restrictions concerning Port Authority of New York and New Jersey commissioners, officers, and employees regarding employment, gifts, and compensation.
Requires printers to display average cost per 1,000 printed pages and ink cartridges to display yield.
Permits appointment of certain EMTs laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Increases penalties for violations committed by precious metals buyers and requires weights and measures officers to seize scales under certain circumstances.
Provides for a municipal court community service fee.
Concerns Watershed Property Review Board in DEP.
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age 17 for voting at next election occurring on or after 18th birthday.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for business enterprises that are owned by or that employ veterans.
Provides one-year opportunity to purchase certain military time for service credit in State-administered retirement system by certain veterans.
Grants eligibility for solar renewable energy certificates to solar facilities connected to net metering customer's side of the meter, or directly to electric grid at 69 kilovolts or less.
Increases fine for failure to keep right or failure to observe traffic lanes; establishes fund to pay for certain signage.*
Establishes New Jersey Food Access Initiative; funds initiative with certain sales tax revenue from urban enterprise zones for five years.
Provides for uniform basic structure of taxicab fares in certain municipalities.

The "Common Sense Shared Services Pilot Program Act"; concerns shared service agreements and joint contracts, in certain municipalities, for certain tenured local employees under "Uniform Shared Services and Consolidation Act."**
Revises provisions of the "Open Public Meetings Act" to ensure greater compliance.
Strengthens public disclosure and monitoring requirements of "Open Public Meetings Act".
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 8, 2010; makes appropriation.
Bars public entities and public employees from entering into confidential settlements of claims against them; provides that such settlements constitute public records.
Allows gross income tax deduction for certain higher education tuition and fee expenses.
Requires insurers which provide prescription drug benefits to cover costs of medications for treating sickle cell anemia.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $100,000 for FY 2010 to Kean University to fund the Wynona M. Lipman Ethnic Studies Center.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers to redeem loan amounts received under the New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public or nonpublic schools in New Jersey.*
Requires health care provider participating in carrier network to give notice to covered person of provider's referral to out-of-network provider.
Establishes waiver, rebate or payment of insured's deductible, copayment, or coinsurance by health care practitioner as a form of insurance fraud subject to criminal and civil penalties.
Excludes from disclosure as public record e-mail addresses provided to government entities to receive emergency notices.
Extends certain benefits to veterans of Operation Allied Force in Kosovo.
Allows certain policy makers previously excluded from unemployment insurance coverage to be covered under "unemployment compensation law."
Allows certain business combinations between resident domestic corporations and interested stockholders.
Allows certain materials to be included in corporation's proxy solicitation materials.
"New Jersey Healthcare Exchange Act."
Provides for automatic expungement of records of certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent for engaging in prostitution.
Requires services be provided for sexually exploited juveniles charged with certain offenses; creates an affirmative defense regarding prostitution.
Regulates certain rental-purchase agreements.
Revises scope of practice of genetic counselors.
Revises statutes concerning crematories and the cremation of human remains.
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies.
Requires State to provide recipients of State tax refunds, unemployment insurance benefits and State employee compensation certain payment options.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Uphold Democracy."
Establishes Nursing Student Support Program.
Eliminates eligibility time limit on tuition benefits for spouses of certain public safety workers killed in performance of their duties.
Allows deduction against gross income for unreimbursed expenses incurred by organ donor.
Establishes "New Jersey Fire and EMS Crisis Intervention Services" telephone hotline.
Concerns radiologic technology licensure.
Increases penalties for certain motor vehicle right-of-way violations and requires attendance at Driver Improvement Program.
Encourages purchase of NJ solar panels and wind turbines for State projects and State-funded projects.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain veterans.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside; restricts locations of certain child care centers and school bus stops.
Permits tenant to be removed from leased housing due to criminal activity under certain circumstances.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires DEP to establish certification program for septic system inspectors.

Establishes annual sales tax holiday during first weekend of August for certain retail sales of computers, school computer supplies, school supplies, school art supplies, and school instructional materials.
Requires certain notifications, and provides for guaranteed NJ Spill Compensation Fund coverage, upon sale of property where private well is treated by point of entry water treatment system.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Designates State Highway Route 42 as the "Route 42 Purple Heart Memorial Highway."
Provides enhanced tax credits to certain businesses under the Business Retention and Relocation Assistance Grant Program.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
"New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit Act;" provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for investing in New Jersey emerging technology businesses.
Authorizes South Jersey Vietnam Veterans' Association license plates with proceeds to veterans' and emergency management operations.
Allows municipalities to designate redevelopment entities and certain non-profits to act as land banks.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Clarifies that retention of unearned wages by a public servant is theft under certain circumstances.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Revises certain provisions of farmland assessment law.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Establishes the "Corrupt Gains Restitution Act."
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act"; prohibits COAH from basing prospective need portion of fair share obligation on commercial development.

Provides a gross income tax credit of up to $7,500 for qualified home purchases made by certain first-time homebuyers in the remaining portion of taxable year 2009, taxable year 2010 and taxable year 2011.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.
Reduces corporation business tax rate and provides an additional rate reduction for three years for taxpayers that relocate corporate headquarters to New Jersey.
Prohibits county committee of a political party from contributing to or accepting contribution from another such county committee.
Prohibits local officer or employee from lobbying or advocating before any body of the municipality where officer or employee serves.

"Tara's Law"; provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences and for investigations of abuse of individuals with developmental disabilities.
Establishes task force to study various issues related to improving special education programs and services for public school students.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Upgrades penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and disabled persons.
Allows Eatontown, Oceanport, and Tinton Falls mayors to designate council member to represent them as members of Fort Monmouth Economic Revitalization Authority.
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Directs Division of Gaming Enforcement, in consultation with New Jersey Racing Commission, to establish and oversee slot machine gambling operations at horse racetracks.
Raises minimum wage to $8.50, then makes annual adjustments based on increases in the Statewide average weekly wage.
Permits licensed dealers to display and auction firearms at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.

Expands parity between certain State-chartered financial institutions, and permits interstate banking by such institutions through de novo branching or expanded authority to acquire existing branches or institutions.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district, jointure commission, or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Establishes county-based centers for transition for young adults with developmental disabilities.
Provides for licensure of elevator, escalator, and moving walkway mechanics by State board.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits.
Provides partial sales tax exemption for energy and utility service to certain manufacturers.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in port district of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Requires school buses transporting certain disabled persons to use flashing lights and establishes penalties for drivers who fail to yield.
Permits imposition of municipal host community petroleum bulk processing impact fees under certain circumstances.
Establishes "Task Force on the Closure of State Psychiatric Hospitals."
Establishes New Jersey General Accounting Office.
Increases penalty for harboring or concealing certain sex offenders. *
Establishes a Medical Malpractice Court.
Limits contributions by certain public contractors; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
"The 10-20-Life Law."
"Judy and Nikki's Law"; provides for life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of murder of a child 16 years of age or younger.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Establishes new limits for campaign contributions by individuals, certain groups and campaign committees.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Grants discretion to Parole Board in determining whether inmate should be released on parole.
Directs Attorney General to publicize information about human trafficking hotlines; mandates law enforcement training on responding to the needs of victims of the crime of human trafficking.
Designated "New Jersey Economic Development Promotion Act"; streamlines and reorganizes State economic development statutes in order to promote administrative efficiency.
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
Requires training and registration for in-house security officers.
Prohibits the sale of certain children's products containing lead, mercury, or cadmium.
Permits a waiver for high-performing school districts from the State system for monitoring school districts.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system and allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Concerns collective negotiations for public institutions of higher education.
Creates advisory council to oversee revision of core curriculum content standards.
Revises privileges of limited and restricted breweries. *

Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act": imposes mandatory term of 25 years to life for aggravated sexual assault against a child under the age of 13 and increases penalties for harboring certain sex offenders.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Authorizes the court to credit a person in default of a court-imposed financial obligation under certain circumstances.*
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund" and increases court fees.
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Prohibits local public employer continuation of pay programs.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around playgrounds and other public parks, buildings and housing facilities.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having 3 or more units.
Requires proof of firearms safety training as a condition for issuance of firearms purchaser ID cards and permits to purchase handguns.
Prohibits imposition of sewerage service connection fee by regional sewerage authorities and public utilities upon certain municipalities and boards of education.
Permits use of excess municipal construction code fee collections for property tax relief.
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
Subjects county and municipal sewerage authority service rate increases to approval by Board of Public Utilities.
Requires holder of rental security deposit account to provide second notice before account is deemed abandoned under the "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act."
Requires each general hospital that accepts public funds to hold quarterly board meetings that include time for public participation.
Limits fee charged by hospital to patient for copy of treatment record.
Requires owner of foreclosed property to provide relocation assistance to tenant displaced by termination of illegal occupancy.
Requires NJ Transit and certain commercial bus operators to disclose information about drivers when requested.
Prohibits possession of machetes in certain circumstances.
Requires certain State oversight of budgets of regional sewerage authorities.
Requires nursing homes to permit use of electronic monitoring devices at request of resident.
Allows graduates of foreign dental schools to take examination and become licensed as dental hygienists.
Concerns permissible number of, and salary for, aids to municipal council members in certain municipalities.
Requires lobby security for certain senior citizen high-rise buildings in areas with high violent crime rates.
Revises eligibility requirements for an applicant seeking licensure as a locksmith based on criminal background.
Expands education requirements for special learner's and examination permits.
"Plastic and Paper Bag Reduction Act"; requires certain retailers to provide recyclable, compostable or reusable bags instead of plastic or paper carryout bags.
Transfers Division of Parole in State Parole Board to Department of Corrections.
Allows two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employees' Pension Fund to be active county employee or retired county employee.
Prohibits release on bail of persons in the country illegally who are charged with crimes of the first or second degree or with two prior criminal convictions.
Requires person eligible for health care benefits from more than one public entity to choose coverage from only one.
Requires permanent driver's license suspension for third drunk driving offense.

Prohibits member of Legislature from holding local appointive office or position; removes provision allowing current members holding more than one elective position as of February 1, 2008 to continue to do so if service continuous.

Requires sewerage companies to provide metered service to certain single family, age-restricted community housing customers upon request; prohibits those companies from assessing charges for sewer service prior to providing such service.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping for certain retired military personnel.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service, and their immediate family members.
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for retired veterans living in NJ and their immediate family members.
Expands the list of crimes that may not be expunged.
Protects property owned by military personnel and first responders from condemnation.
Provides that minimum local tax levy requirement will only be applicable to certain school districts.
Increases the penalty for certain gang related crimes.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Requires Commissioner of Education to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on school districts.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
Requires payment from New Jersey Spill Compensation Fund for costs of installation and maintenance of point of entry water treatment systems.
Eliminates development review fees charged by Pinelands Commission.
Allows certain owners of preserved farmland to reacquire development rights for land underlying and next to farm buildings or structures.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Establishes penalties for employer who allows unauthorized aliens to operate employer owned motor vehicle.
Requires a private seller of a used motor vehicle to request identification information from purchaser.
Penalizes employment of unauthorized aliens; requires verification of citizenship for employment.
Establishes penalties for drivers who have never obtained driver's license.
Establishes special license plates supporting autism awareness.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
Exempts certain lake association membership fees and dues from imposition of sales and use tax.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Imposes mandatory terms of imprisonment on persons convicted of certain sex crimes against minors.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal.
Prohibits sale of caffeinated alcoholic beverages.
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Requires counties to fix curbs and surrounding areas when damaged during county road projects.
Prohibits the unauthorized photographing or videotaping of a child.
Requires certain commissions to maintain meeting minutes; establishes Governor's authority to approve or veto the minutes of those commissions.

Requires private entity primarily engaged in business of providing transportation for passengers in wheelchairs to secure passengers in wheelchairs using four-point securement system and to secure unoccupied wheelchairs.

Makes supplemental appropriations of $5.5 million from the General Fund to the Office of Information Technology for Network Infrastructure, IT Modernization and Information Security special purpose accounts.
Provides for indication of veteran status on driver's licenses and identification cards issued by MVC.*
Provides for automatic waiver of juvenile case to adult court for repeat juvenile offenders.
Requires health insurance coverage by health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP for expenses incurred in connection with prophylactic mastectomies and other mastectomy-related procedures.
Exempts local governmental units from supplemental titling fees on passenger automobiles they purchase or lease.
"Tabitha's Law"; requires parent or guardian to notify school administrators if pupil will be absent; requires school to notify parent in event of unexcused pupil absence.
Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison and Keansburg as well as a joint urban enterprise zone in Cliffside Park and Fairview.
Creates a Business Court.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain corrections officers.

Increases penalties for counterfeiting if the offense creates risk of bodily injury, serious bodily injury or death; creates new offense within Criminal Code of counterfeiting products related to health.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.
Revises law authorizing issuance of special license plates for street rods; extends authorization to replica custom vehicles.
Concerns school bus safety inspections.
Requires that each school district conducting an interscholastic athletic program must employ one or more school athletic trainers.
The "Fitness Professionals Certification Act."
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act"; imposes mandatory term of imprisonment; provides for negotiated reduction of mandatory term under certain circumstances.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.
Phases out cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.
Establishes "New Jersey Gaming Industry Study Commission" to evaluate impact of enacted gaming and technological reforms and explore future prospects for casino gaming and horse racing in this State.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.
Revises responsibility for meadowlands adjustment payments.
Delays implementation of P.L.2009, c.166 concerning role and qualification of local purchasing agents.
"Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act."
Extends expiration date of certain permits pursuant to the "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Replaces term "mentally defective" with "mentally incapable" in Criminal Code.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Includes administrative law judges and workers compensation judges among persons permitted to solemnize marriages.
Expands wrongful death act to allow recovery for mental anguish, emotional pain and suffering, loss of society and loss of companionship.
Terminates sick leave injury program for certain State employees injured after January 1, 2007 or expiration of current collective negotiation agreement.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Creates local police officer and paid firefighter emergency registry.
Revises filing requirements for minor subdivisions.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.
Establishes Rutgers Scarlet "R" license plate.

Requires Justices of the Supreme Court, Judges of the Superior Court, Tax Court Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and Administrative Law Judges to be admitted to the practice of law for at least 15 years prior to appointment to the bench.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Clarifies policyholder notice requirements as well as Rate Counsel jurisdiction regarding certain prior approval insurance rate filings seeking rate increase.
Revises "Notaries Public Act of 1979."
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to disclose contribution and expenditure information.
Recognizes litigation right, and requires arbitration of, uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage causes of action arising from private passenger automobile insurance.
Clarifies right to recover certain uncompensated medical expenses under private passenger automobile insurance.
Restricts access to motor vehicle accident reports under certain circumstances.*
Concerns attorney fees for workers' compensation awards.
Authorizes exception to the hearsay rule for certain out-of-court statements by witnesses in cases involving a crime.
Prohibits expenditure of State funds for certain cosmetic services in criminal trials.
Clarifies trustee's discretionary authority concerning income tax liability.
Provides private cause of action for bad faith in settlement of insurance claims.
Clarifies the effect of abstention by a member of a public body.

Authorizes annulments of marriages and civil unions, without cause, when demanded by party less than 30 days from date of ceremony; changes marriage and civil union licensing requirements and increases fees for such licenses.*
Provides updated procedures for disposition of State surplus computers and certain other electronic devices designated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.
Establishes Governor's authority over approval of minutes of certain regional commissions.
Revises procedures for municipal redevelopment programs; prohibits certain campaign contributions by redevelopers.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Alex DeCroce's Law, enhances crime victims' rights under the "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights." *
Increases and revises membership of New Jersey Cemetery Board.

Requires additional public participation and health impact study as conditions of conversion of health service corporation to domestic stock insurer; dissolves the Health Service Corporation Conversion Temporary Advisory Commission.
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.
Establishes registry of certain cemeteries that accept Work First New Jersey and SSI allowance for burial expenses.*
Prohibits display of signs on any public property or highway.
Requires Commissioner of Health to review State hospital financial reporting requirements, report recommendations to Governor.*

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Authorizes county to establish county hospital authority; amends title of "Municipal Hospital Authority Law."

Modifies current law regarding regulation and restrictions on business entities who are public contractors and make campaign contributions to certain office holders, candidates and political organizations.
Temporarily renames NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic Brain Injury as NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic and Acquired Brain Injury; establishes Acquired Brain Injury Fund.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Codifies in statute case law developed legal standards for establishing grandparent and sibling visitation with a child when visitation objected to by child's parent, guardian, or legal custodian.*
Supplements FY2012 annual appropriations act to require filing of application for expansion of Medicaid coverage for family planning services and appropriates $1 million.
Requires medical examination and submission of student work portfolios for home-schooled children; provides that children under supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.

Requires insurers to cover breast evaluations and other additional medically necessary testing under certain circumstances and requires certain mammogram reports to contain information on breast density.***
Prohibits display of signs on public property adjacent to highway or road.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to study impact of State business income taxes on business out-migration, business formation, and employment.
Establishes the New Jersey State Commission on Education Reform to develop academic outcome-based per pupil public school funding amounts.
Consolidates certain business-related categories of gross income and provides 20 year carryforward of certain net losses under gross income tax.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Eliminates minimum corporation business tax on New Jersey S corporations.

Abolishes legislative leadership committees; reduces contributions to State political party committees to $12,500 per year, to county committees to $10,000 per year and to municipal committees to $5,000 per year.
Authorizes hunting of game animals every day of the week during hunting season.
Establishes "Choose Life" license plate.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.
"Parent Empowerment and Choice Act"; enables parents to initiate reform in low performing schools through a petition process.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."

"School Children First Act"; modifies evaluation of teachers and principals; revises tenure acquisition process and certain tenure charge procedures; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires mutual consent for teacher placement; and eliminates certain seniority rights.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave.
Increases host community benefit for municipalities wherein solid waste transfer stations are located from fifty cents to one dollar per ton of solid waste processed at such facilities.
Clarifies that "airsoft" guns are firearms.
Establishes crime of removing federally required orange tip from toy gun; establishes crime of disguising a firearm by adding an orange muzzle tip.
"Carryout Bag Reduction and Recycling Act." *
Imposes water consumption and diversion user fees to fund open space and farmland preservation projects.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in EDA and transfers $2 million from societal benefits charge to initially fund program.*
Requires BPU to offer similar incentives to residents purchasing certain oil heating equipment as are offered to residents purchasing certain natural gas heating equipment.
Authorizes educational services commissions to purchase goods or services through nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreement.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Requires the State and local contracting units to purchase biodiesel or biodiesel blended fuel manufactured in NJ.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.
"Ocean County Stormwater Management System Demonstration Act."
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed.
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.
Revises the definitions of Class I renewable energy and renewable energy certificate under the Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act.
Concerns calculation of value for conveyance of certain State-owned lands.

Authorizes sale of certain property interests in public roads by local governments to connect certain electric generating facilities with customers; provides for net metering, virtual net metering and connections by public utility.
Revises definition of class I renewable energy to include energy produced by certain geothermal heat pumps.
Permits affordable housing occupancy preferences for veterans through municipal agreements with developer.*
"Telecommunications-Cable Television Deregulation Ensuring Consumer Protection Act"; revises State regulation of competitive services provided by telecommunications and cable television companies.
Establishes notification signage, and monitoring requirements related to combined sewer overflows.*
Permits adoptees and certain others access to adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 28 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 28 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Makes various changes to current system for approval, issuance, administration, and discontinuance of various types of special license plates.
Defines "mobile home park" as "multiple dwelling" for inspection purposes.
Requires policy on use of alternative dispute resolution for State agencies; expands duties of Dispute Settlement Office of Department of Public Advocate.
Concerns contributions to special funds made through the gross income tax return.
Revises the statutes concerning oaths and affidavits.
Establishes deadlines for filing financial disclosure statements with State Ethics Commission.
Requires State Board of Education to promulgate policy regarding outside employment of superintendents of schools.
Revises "Local Bond Law" provisions to exempt certain energy projects from appropriation requirement for five percent down payment.
Establishes gross income tax credit for cost of certain postage for sending goods to members of United States Armed Forces and National Guard who are serving their country away from home.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DHSS.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act"
"Healthcare Transparency and Disclosure Act."
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Conforms Megan's law to requirements of federal Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act.
"Good Samaritan Emergency Response Act"; eliminates criminal liability for persons who seek medical assistance in response to drug overdose.*
Provides immunity from civil liability to certain individuals who acquire or use an automated external defibrillator.
Increases minimum wage to $8.75, then makes annual adjustments based on CPI increases.
Regulates certain service contracts to perform maintenance, repair, replacement, or service of property used for personal, family, or household purposes.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell as surplus certain land and improvements now part of East Jersey Prison to Woodbridge Township in Middlesex County for a restricted use.
Reduces drug free school and public property zones to 200 feet.
Prohibits employment and licensing background checks to go back further than seven years under certain circumstances.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Exempts persons engaged in braiding hair from cosmetology-hairstyling licensing requirements.
Allows public contractors paying benefits to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Modifies laws concerning inmate income and complaints; requires certain correctional officer training; creates uniform identification cards for attorneys to enter State correctional facilities.
Establishes "Prisoners' Reentry Bill of Rights."
Addresses various concerns affecting post-release employment.
Clarifies juvenile's right to attorney representation; requires twelve month judicial review hearing when juvenile is placed out-of-home.
Requires DHSS to provide written notice to certain federal, State and local elected officials upon the filing of application for certificate of need to close hospital.
Provides for annual cost-of-living increase in amount of Lifeline Credit and Tenants' Lifeline Assistance payment.
The "Smart Container Act."

Authorizes courts to revoke fees at sentencing, include mediation as an alternative sentence, consider testimony from a defendant's family, reduce the waiting period for certain expungements, and impose an alternative to incarceration.
Prohibits transfer of certain juveniles to adult correctional facilities.
Establishes residency requirement for police officers and firefighters in certain municipalities.
Allows certain child support obligors in arrears to apply for certain licenses provided that applicant has made 12 consecutive timely child support payments.
Authorizes certain incinerator authorities to perform sanitation, public works, and environmental services.*
Concerns basic skills training provided by the New Jersey Community College Consortium for Workforce and Economic Development.
Revises the NJ STARS and NJ STARS II Programs.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Permits liquor licensees to employ certain ex-offenders in certain positions without a special permit.
The "Market Competition and Consumer Choice Act;" alters State regulation of competitive services provided by telecommunications and CATV Companies.
Prohibits public and private employers from automatically disqualifying ex-offenders from employment.
Eliminates requirement to mail general, primary and school election sample ballots to voters who register to vote by mail.
Eliminates prosecutorial objection to admission to drug court program; expands eligibility and provides for phased in mandatory drug court program.***
Broadens municipal arson investigators' powers.
Requires that sexual abuse against a child be reported to law enforcement officials.
Grants law enforcement agencies authority to order road closures; increases penalty for violations.
Expands civil rights protections to include pregnancy and breast-feeding; requires employers to provide daily break to breast-feeding mothers.
Increases penalty for illegal firearms' sale within 1,000 feet of school.
Allows Attorney General to prevent halfway house placement of murderers.
Affords emergency services peer counselors confidentiality privileges.
Requires Domestic Security Preparedness Planning Group to conduct mock exercise pertaining to agricultural bioterrorism; and appropriates $150,000 therefor from New Jersey Domestic Security Account.
Requires court to issue animal protection order against person found guilty of abusing an animal.
Concerns calculation of value for conveyance of certain State-owned lands.
Amends law concerning application, sale, and use of fertilizer to exempt organic fertilizer from certain requirements.
Increases additional penalty assessment for drunk driving; dedicates revenue to VCCB.
Clarifies that impersonation committed by any means, including electronic communications or Internet website, shall be subject to criminal penalties.**
Directs NJTA to study and report on potential revenue generating services of NJTA rest areas and service plazas.
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Revises standard of value for the purposes of real property assessment where property owner is responsible for environmental damage to real property.
Requires all State firefighter training to be accredited.
Allows disabled veteran's surviving spouse to claim property tax exemption when veteran's disability declaration is granted after death.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties within 20 mile radius.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.
Clarifies that conversions of housing cooperatives into condominiums are subject to notice provisions of "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act."

Revises sales and use tax to enumerate certain persons deemed to be sellers responsible for collection of sales and use tax and to clarify tax collection responsibilities of certain other persons and agents.

Limits payments to public employees for accumulated unused sick leave and vacation leave; limits carrying forward of unused vacation leave; requires documentation for use of sick leave in certain circumstances.
Requires parole board under certain circumstances to release inmates not convicted of a violent crime under the No Early Release Act at the time of parole eligibility.
"Flood Control, Mitigation, and Prevention Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for up to $2 billion, and appropriates $5,000.

Exempts transfer of ownership of real property between individual and business entity controlled by that individual from realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on transfer of ownership of certain real property.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
Revises exemption from license requirement for raffles for door prizes of donated or purchased merchandise; increases total retail value from $50 to $200 or higher if permitted.
Suspends "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" until certain conditions are met.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning conflicts between rules of different State agencies.
Applies building code of New York City to World Trade Center, requires fire safety inspections.
Regulates sales of certified copies of deeds or conveyances of real estate.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive one year suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Creates Meadowlands Economic Development Trust; provides for sharing of tax revenues generated by developments of regional economic significance to improve local quality of life.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that certain drivers display decal.
Requires State to offer surplus State police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals, increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Transfers the Div. of Fish and Wildlife and related entities to the Dept. of Agriculture.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Revises animal fighting laws; establishes minimum penalty for criminal animal cruelty offenses; establishes additional penalties for animal cruelty offenses.

Requires municipalities to exempt 100% disabled veterans from construction permit surcharge fees for improvements to promote living unit accessibility; appropriates $20,000 for municipal reimbursements.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local unit for shared services.
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
Establishes program for directing motorists to agricultural tourism establishments.
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow their customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages.
Directs DOT to allow wineries to erect tourist-oriented directional signs on roads and highways.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Permits certain self-employed individuals to purchase small employer health benefits plans.
Requires notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of automobile and homeowners insurance policies to be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested.
Invalidates consumer contracts which require a waiver of right to file a consumer complaint.
Prohibits financial institutions from charging any fee on sales and use tax portion of retail sales transaction.
Imposes certain registration and reporting requirements to prevent illegal trade of tigers.
Requires DEP assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Revises procedures for the use of eminent domain and compensation for loss of business in municipal redevelopment programs.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Utility Sub-metering.
Requires Division of Property Management and Construction to conduct analysis of State buildings to determine energy and cost savings through use of renewable energy equipment or technology.

"Family Home Occupation Act;" classifies certain home-occupations as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing or retailing activities.
Relieves municipalities and counties along light rail lines of civil liability in Quiet Zones under certain circumstances.

Requires municipalities accepting long-term tax exemption payment in lieu of taxes to distribute portion of payments to county and other taxing districts; limits payment in lieu of tax agreements to 15-20 years.
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
Upgrades offense of simple assault to aggravated assault when victim is employee of DHS and clearly engaged in duties conducting investigation.
Requires State toll road authorities to give preference in awarding service station contracts to bidders offering to dispense certain alternative fuels on State's toll roads.
Allows municipalities to provide veterans free or reduced cost access to beaches.
"New Jersey Public Water Supply Fluoridation Act."
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Requires municipality to post sign on property subject of development application.
Concerns environmental permits in low-income, minority communities.
Establishes NJ Native American Burial Ground Preservation Task Force.
Includes adult with onset physical disabilities as eligible criteria for assistance through Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Extends hiring preference for certain civilian federal firefighters.
Increases railroad franchise and property taxes to support improvements to railroad capital facilities.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public service privatization contracts.*
Concerns wage protection and certain penalties for violating laws regarding wages, compensation or benefits.
