Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.

Requires NJ Sports and Exposition Authority to notify and receive input from Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission and Hackensack Meadowlands District municipalities concerning certain Meadowlands complex projects.
Revises the definition of "public works projects" related to project labor agreements to include bridges.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain for-sale housing projects.
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.
Concerns apprenticeship programs and other standards for public works contractors.
Provides exclusive jurisdiction to PERC for certain unfair labor practice claims.
Establishes "Back to Work NJ Program"; makes an appropriation.
Amends "State Transfer of Development Rights Act," and provides for impact fees and other incentives for establishment of transfer of development rights programs.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Encourages development of electric vehicle charging stations in transportation projects.
Modifies certain service outage compensation and notice requirements for CATV companies.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Establishes criminal penalties for failure to pay the minimum wage.
Provides additional penalties for violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)" involving certain persons.
Modifies powers of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.
Requires retail store operators to establish in-store recycling programs that provide opportunities for customers to return clean plastic carryout bags.
Establishes special environmental prosecutor.
Prohibits sale of mercury batteries and consumer products that use mercury batteries; prohibits disposal of used mercury batteries as solid waste.
Requires contractors to provide Department of the Treasury with employment information about contracts with public bodies.
Requires Division of Rate Counsel to evaluate NJT fare increases and determine whether increases are necessary and fair to NJT customers.
Requires telephone companies regulated by BPU to mail certain service discontinuance notices via certified, return receipt requested.
Requires certain cable television companies to offer free Internet access to public libraries.
Creates a directory of registered telemarketers.
Exempts certain files of clinical programs at law schools in State from Open Public Records Act.
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.
Provides certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts are prohibited from making certain contributions.
Restricts campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Clarifies power of municipalities to zone for separation of incompatible land uses through specification of reasonable separation limitations.
Requires movie theaters to install captioning technology for use by hearing impaired patrons.
Allows corporation business tax credits as incentives for redevelopment of distressed shopping centers.
Requires children to wear athletic heart protectors while playing organized baseball or softball.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.

Establishes presumption of grandfathering of certain governing documents of homeowners' associations upon conflict with new statutory or regulatory provisions unless majority of members vote to amend.
Eliminates DOT approval of municipal traffic calming measures in business districts.
Prohibits municipality from imposing special assessment for curb repair in certain circumstances.
Creates annual inspection cycle for certain hotels and motels under "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
Establishes circumstances under which municipalities may base development approval, the timing thereof, or denial, on sufficiency of local transportation infrastructure.
Limits cancelation and rescheduling fees for cosmetology and hairstyling, barbering, beauty culture, manicuring, and skin care specialty services in certain instances.
Establishes 30-day grace period for consumer to cancel contract for telephone or cable service.
Prohibits the sale of jewelry containing phthalates.
Makes it unlawful practice to sell certain products via Internet auction.
Requires school bus safety instruction in all school districts which provide pupil transportation.
Codifies AG recommendations for issuing Amber Alert when family member abducts child.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Requires gradual replacement of incandescent light bulbs in public school buildings with compact fluorescent light bulbs whenever possible.
Requires municipal agency under MLUL to notify prospective applicant of potential need for additional governmental approvals.
Establishes the "New Jersey Foreclosure to Affordable Housing Transformation Act."
Concerns compensation and benefits of officers, employees, and members of State and local authorities.
Requires informational posters about safe placement alternatives for newborn infants be posted in public restrooms used by females.
Allows casino to pay up to 6% or 9% of parimutuel pool to out-of-State racetrack for simulcast races; provides casino retains 55% of certain remaining takeout rate amounts.
Establishes "VETeach Pilot Program" in DOE to facilitate the teacher certification of veterans.
Extends for 18 months application submission deadline to EDA for review and approval of certain construction projects involving public institutions of higher education.
Provides additional enforcement provisions under "Health Care Quality Act"; allows certain private causes of action for violations; expands administrative remedies; establishes enforcement fund.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Victim Protection Pilot Program."
Establishes the "Sexual Assault Victim's Bill of Rights."
Creates offense of impairing communications, which would constitute domestic violence in certain circumstances.
Upgrades offense of harassment under certain circumstances.
Requires DHSS to review standard of care at health care facilities in which 40% or more of direct patient care nursing staff are temporary hires.
Concerns special needs trusts for persons with developmental disabilities.*
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Permits local government units to increase service charge imposed for check payments returned for insufficient funds.
Eliminates certificate of need requirement for home health care services provided by a hospital.
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Imposes mandatory minimum terms of incarceration on juveniles who use guns to commit acts which, if committed by adults, would constitute serious crimes.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Creates new penalty for convictions or juvenile adjudications of arson; establishes Arson Investigation Fund.
Concerns child custody and parenting time arrangements related to certain military absences.*
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Provides for automatic expungement of criminal records under certain circumstances and reduces waiting period.
Prohibits employers from requiring applicants to disclose prior criminal convictions.
Requires incarcerated individual from State to be counted at residential address for legislative redistricting purposes.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Ends transitional energy facilities assessment (TEFA), caps State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Provides temporary period for making certain estate tax refund claims and directs notice be given to certain affected parties.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Repeals State and local hotel and motel occupancy taxes and voids existing municipal implementing ordinances.
Excludes the value of certain manufacturer rebates from the sales price of motor vehicles taxable under the sales and use tax.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
Requires additional fines for certain crimes against minors to fund Amber Alert system.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new National Crime Information Center terminals.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
"Invest in New Jersey First' Act;" requires preference in awarding certain contracts for critical infrastructure projects.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Extends veteran's property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Authorizes counties to reduce greenhead fly populations; appropriates $50,000.

Authorizes county colleges and county vocational school districts to establish aviation related job certification, training, and internship programs and provides a corporation business tax credit for funds donated to support such programs.

Extends burial of indigent veterans to those who did not serve in time of war; clarifies role of DMVA in identifying deceased veterans; provides additional funding, subject to availability, for burial of indigent veterans.*

Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex, and Warren Counties, and requires existing bus stops to be used.

Requires public and nonpublic schools, local recreation departments, youth serving organizations and camps to have defibrillators for youth athletic events, and public schools to train pupils in defibrillator use and cardio-pulmonary resuscitation.
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
"State Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."
"One Strike, You're Ours;" adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Establishes certain apprentice hunting licenses.
The "Adopt a Stormwater Management Basin Act." *
Establishes forest harvest program on State-owned land.
Provides corporation business tax incentives for life sciences research.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Requires person convicted of criminal sexual contact with person with intellectual disability to register under Megan's Law.
"Pharmacy Quality Improvement and Error Prevention Act."
Authorizes mayors to veto proposed actions of municipal authorities.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Provides tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain costs incurred in purchase and installation of certain environmentally responsible business equipment.
Prohibits imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for active duty members of United States Armed Forces, Reserve components thereof, and National Guard from New Jersey.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or national guard.
Requires registration of qualified journeyman electricians and restricts exemption for certain electrical work by public electric utilities.
Limits finance charge for personal lines insurance premium finance agreements to 14%.
Requires certain persons seeking license to operate facility to provide magnetic resonance imaging services to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Prohibits practice of requiring credit check as condition of employment.
Allows Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to open administrative supervision proceedings to guaranty associations under certain circumstances.
Increases New Jersey Property-Liability Insurance Guaranty Association payment cap to $500,000; immunizes policyholders protected by association from certain liability.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
Reinstates State board of Public Movers and Warehousemen.
Prohibits use of insurance scoring by property-casualty insurers in rate-making for personal lines insurance coverage.
Concerns contracts for credit card accounts with certain individuals under 21 years of age.
Requires certain financial institutions to disclose overdraft fees.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.
Requires use of direct deposit and Internet for State, local government, and school district employee compensation and certain retirement payments and information.
Provides tax relief for certain non-residential property owners and tenants in consolidated municipalities.
Increases New Jersey Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association payment cap to $250,000 for certain annuities.
Authorizes special emergency appropriations for the payment of certain expenses incurred by municipalities to implement a municipal consolidation.
"Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Transparency and Accountability Act."
Requires the establishment of a prequalification process for prospective bidders on public school district transportation contracts.
Requires scooter riders under 17 years old to wear helmets.

Requires prequalification process for prospective bidders on school district transportation contracts; authorizes debarment of bidders convicted of certain crimes; authorizes disqualification of bidder or termination of transportation contract for certain crimes by an employee.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Changes UI contribution rates for certain employers. *
Allows SPRS members to purchase SPRS credit for prior military service.
Provides sales and use tax rebate on supplies and materials purchased for the construction or reconstruction of certain horse racetrack grandstands.
Requires health insurers to cover medically necessary expenses for preventing infertility in women undergoing chemotherapy or radiation therapy.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Requires development of fact sheet about bedbugs to be posted on the Department of Education's website.
Permits a board of education to adopt a salary policy of up to five years.*
Establishes conditional intervention program in municipal court for certain first-time offenders.
Requires municipal clerk to publish holiday and emergency information on Internet site or in local newspaper.
Enhances penalties upon certain violators of housing codes.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter, Public School Teacher and Sanitation Worker Home-buyer Assistance Act."
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
Requires presumption that any bail paid by defendant charged with certain weapons offenses will be in the form of full cash.
Increases workers' compensation for loss of hand or foot; requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to study effectiveness of workers' compensation program.
Establishes the "Anti-Phishing Act."
Creates the Office on Women's Research and Policy and appropriates $150,000.
Concerns processing and payment of insurance claims for physical therapy services.
Revises child pornography law.
Creates special fallen firefighter plates with proceeds to children of fallen firefighters.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2012.*
Establishes gross income tax credit for full-time tuition cost at certain New Jersey institutions of post-secondary education.
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers and certain schools.*
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Bars the disclosure of personal identifying information of grand jury witnesses except for name; creates a fourth degree offense for attorney disclosure.
Authorizes the court to issue restraining orders to defendants charged with a crime as a condition of release on bail.
Increases the gross income tax rate on taxable income exceeding $1 million contingent on enactment of certain homestead benefit enhancement legislation.*
Requires public schools to include instruction on oral health as part of core curriculum content standards.
Permits person covered by certain managed care plans to receive covered services from network provider without obtaining written referral from primary care provider.
Establishes a civil cause of action for gender-motivated violence.
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.
Directs the Division on Women to conduct an audit of the coordination of community responses to domestic violence.
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Concerns furloughing of direct care nurses employed by certain State institutions.
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Authorizes certified celebrants to solemnize marriages.
Establishes civilian review board to review complaints against Palisades Interstate Park Commission patrolmen.

Re-establishes State Board of Education as the rule-making authority under several school district accountability statutes and reinstates its role in considering appeals from any Commissioner of Education determination.
Revises the period of time required for a State college faculty member to receive tenure. *
Requires boards of education to provide certain nutritional information for food and beverage items offered for sale in school cafeterias.
Revises membership of Public Health Council and fully restores functions, powers, and duties of council.
Requires health insurers and SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for screening for cervical cancer, including testing for HPV.
Allows tax credit to health care professionals for expenses to achieve accessibility for persons with mobility impairments.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics, and federally qualified health centers.

Requires health insurers SHBP, SEHBP, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for ancillary medical services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screening and surgical intervention services.
Requires retail pharmacies to stock and dispense emergency contraception.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.
Provides DYFS caseworkers with personnel and law enforcement assistance when conducting DYFS investigations.
Provides support for obstetric services by certain health care facilities.
Prohibits genital mutilation of females under 18 years of age.
Prohibits minors under 14 years of age from using spay tanning in tanning facilities and prohibits minors under 17 years of age from using tanning beds.**
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to Victims of Crime Compensation Office.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for New Jersey chapter of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.*
Establishes "New Jersey Colorectal Cancer Research Fund;" provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns.
Prohibits the use of certain fishing gear at artificial reef sites.*
Concerns temporary suspension of the application of corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for film and digital media content production expenses.
Prohibits talking on cell phone or text messaging when operating a boat.
Creates self-defense justification for victims of domestic violence.
Requires school districts and child care centers to distribute information on Megan's Law and instructions on how to access the Megan's Law sex offender registry website.
Exempts certain New Jersey teachers' purchase of qualified teaching materials from sales and use tax.
Makes supplemental appropriation of up to $6.3 million to DHSS for certain grants to counties for women's health services.
Exempts storage facility space furnished to active duty military personnel from the sales and use tax.
Exempts certain materials and labor used to convert traditional motor vehicles into plug-in hybrid electric motor vehicles from sales and use tax.
Establishes the Office of the Taxpayer Advocate.
Exempts certain medically appropriate tattooing services from the sales and use tax.
Excludes certain federal employee retirement fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Allows exclusion of certain alternative energy and energy conservation patent income under the gross income tax and corporation business tax.

Allows establishment of county-wide purchasing system for certain school district services; offers employment protections for certain food or custodial services employees; and regulates subcontracting by districts and public higher education institutions.*
Establishes a regional transportation coordinator unit in each office of the executive county superintendent to improve the coordination of pupil transportation services within the county.
Reorganizes the provisions in Title 18A regarding public and nonpublic school pupil transportation.
Requires Department of Education to encourage boards of education to offer instruction in media literacy.
Requires school facilities projects to maintain the character of historic school facilities.
Recognizes American Sign Language as a world language for meeting high school graduation requirements.
Provides for full State funding of the special education costs of students who reside in resource family homes.
Includes transportation costs in the calculation of extraordinary special education costs incurred by public school districts.
Permits a tax deduction under the New Jersey gross income tax for taxpayers who operate or maintain for their employees a licensed child care center or who have paid the cost of outside child care.
Allows refundable gross income tax credit for certain unreimbursed hearing aid expenses.
Requires health insurers to offer benefits for dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Prohibits delegation of investment discretion of Director of Division of Investment to outside managers.
Requires health care providers to obtain informed consent from patients for use of certain reprocessed medical devices.
Permits certain persons 70 and older to prove identity by affidavit for purpose of renewing driver's license.
Establishes Department of State Police.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Establishes pilot program in the Department of Law and Public Safety requiring the electronic recording of certain police interrogations.
Establishes the Equity in Education program in DOE to finance school district initiatives that target segregation.
Permits NJ boat manufacturers to qualify for EDA loans for renewable energy technology, equipment, or systems.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Establishes design-build delivery system for New Jersey Turnpike Authority projects.
Requires DOT Commissioner to erect signs informing motorists of State's "move over" law.
Establishes real property assessment demonstration program.
Regulates sale of certain bicycles with quick release wheels.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Requires mandatory jail time for certain driving while intoxicated convictions with high blood alcohol concentration.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Clarifies possession of machine guns and assault firearms by certain law enforcement officers.
Increases compensation for wrongful imprisonment.
Requires registered qualifying patient's authorized use of medical marijuana to be considered equivalent to use of any other prescribed medication.
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for 5 years.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Clarifies the effective date of the "New Jersey False Claims Act."
Requires notification of rape care advocate under certain circumstances by law enforcement, prosecutors and medical providers.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Regulates teen nights by requiring security provided by police officers, prohibiting persons under age 15 from attending, and disqualifying registered sex offenders from employment.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Allows any licensed healthcare provider trained in evaluation and management of concussions to provide written return to play clearance for student-athlete who has sustained a head injury.
Establishes the Workforce Shortage Loan Redemption Program.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
Prohibits municipal library trustees from transferring donated funds to municipality.
Requires certain owners of foreclosed property to file contact information with municipality and common interest community.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million for grants to certain nursing schools to address shortage of nursing faculty.
Requires DHSS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Prohibits substitution of prescribed epilepsy drugs by pharmacists without prior notification to and written consent of physician and patient.
Appropriates $1,000,000 for outreach and enrollment activities in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare programs.
Requires health benefits coverage for mammograms for women under 40 who lack access to family medical history due to their or their parent's adoption.
Clarifies that insurance broker transparency requirement only applies to sale of health benefits plans.
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Prohibits retail motor fuel dealer from charging a credit card customer in excess of four percent of purchase price for same fuel to customer paying by cash.
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Changes priorities for financial assistance from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund. *
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
Prohibits smoking at State-owned beaches.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of certain entities from using title of psychologist.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.

Requires SHBP and SHEBP to cover treatment for alcoholism, other substance-use disorders, and non biologically-based mental illnesses under same terms and conditions as for other diseases or illnesses.*

Creates new taxable category of alcoholic beverages called flavored malt beverages, imposes separate rate of taxation on new category pursuant to alcoholic beverages tax and allocates associated revenue.
"Group Home Fire Safety Act."
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure.
"Community Health Service Pilot Initiative Act."
Eliminates statute of limitations for kidnapping and increases statute of limitations for other serious crimes to 10 years.
Establishes moratorium on licensing of certain emergency medical service helicopter response units pending evaluation and report.
Establishes Medication Management, Outreach and Support Program in DHS; appropriates $8 million.
Allows corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for certain wages paid to qualified interns in tax years 2013 and 2014. *
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Makes technical corrections to individual health coverage and small employer health benefits programs and to NJ FamilyCare.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.
Requires NJ Business Action Center to assist boat manufacturers in converting or expanding business operations to manufacture components for wind energy equipment.
Prohibits smoking in certain outdoor public places.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Establishes uniform alternative assessment for commercial renewable energy systems and limits municipal construction permit fees for non-commercial renewable energy systems. *
Requires post-secondary educational institutions to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Requires the incorporation of solar panels in design and construction of new public school facilities.
Clarifies school district employees subject to statutory provisions concerning supplemental compensation for unused sick leave and vacation carry forward requirements.
Sets States mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Provides that preserved farmland may be sold by the State or a local government unit only to established farmers and restricts size of farmer residence which may be built thereon.
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program," in Mercer and Essex Counties.
Requires conditionally discharged drug dependent persons to undergo assessment and drug treatment.
Establishes "gun-free" and "weapon free" zones around certain school and public properties.
Upgrades penalty for unlawfully transferring a firearm to an underage person; permits transfer for instruction and training. *
Directs the BPU to determine whether the electric power generation service market in this State is competitive and to submit a report to the Governor and the Legislature.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2012.
Increases income threshold for qualifying for farmland assessment.
Authorizes certain disbursements from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund for transportation of low-level radioactive waste to appropriate disposal facilities.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Prohibits board of education or local governing body from providing health insurance to employees who work less than 35 hours a week
Requires school districts to provide information to high school students on cancers of the reproductive system as part of the health curriculum.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Authorizes awards to State and local government employees for suggestions to save taxpayers money through sharing and consolidation.
Shortens term of municipal court judges from three years to one year.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Prohibits electronic printing of certain debit card information on certain sales receipts.
Concerning development subsidies and certain employment practices.
Requires repayment of development subsidies in certain cases of failure to meet job creation or retention requirements.
Establishes employment goals and requirements for development subsidies.
Concerns eligibility requirements for licensed professional counselors and associate counselors.
Requires health service corporation to encrypt certain information.
Changes date for election of fire commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of primary election.
Concerns automobile insurance practices.
Requires candidates for school board member and local elective office to file financial disclosure statement on or before 10th day following deadline for filing nominating petitions for that office.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Revises penalties for animal cruelty, increasing degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Prohibits State and local public contracts with persons or entities engaging in certain investment activities in energy or finance sectors of Iran. *
Revises sales and use tax to specify certain persons deemed to be sellers and to clarify tax collection responsibilities of certain other persons and agents.
Establishes Solar Thermal Expansion Loan and Grant program; appropriates $10 million.
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Requires managed care plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities.
Provides for establishment of county offices for disability services; appropriates $90,000.
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires disclosure of campaign contributions received or expenditures made by individual seeking election as political party committee officer.

Requires governmental affairs agents to disclose on notice of representation form compensation amount received from State or local government entities; requires notice to be posted on Internet site of Election Law Enforcement Commission.
Permits removal of State board, commission or independent authority member for failure to attend three consecutive meetings thereof without good cause.

Requires suspension of payment for unused sick or vacation leave payable to person indicted for criminal offense; requires forfeiture of such payment upon service deemed dishonorable or conviction for crime.
Prohibits certain terminal leave compensation for local elected officials.
Prohibits department heads in Executive Branch from taking unpaid leave to assist any candidates for election to public office.
Consolidates nonpartisan municipal election procedures in Title 19 of Revised Statutes.
Prohibits State agencies from including advertisements in mailings to public.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act."
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Requires written notice of pending gubernatorial succession to both designated successor and Legislature whenever responsibilities of office of Governor will devolve upon temporary successor.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.

Makes various changes regarding regulation of casino gaming; limits use of certain Casino Reinvestment Development Authority assets and revenues; permits use of mobile devices at casinos and racetracks to place wagers on sports or athletic events*

Revises calculation of assessments concerning certain casino licensee fees; clarifies certain conditions of employment concerning Atlantic City Tourism District; makes non-gaming tourism district and certain CRDA project site properties eligible for tax credits.
Requires disclosure of all fees and charges associated with prepaid debit cards on the package of such cards.
Requires each public school to observe a period of silence on September 11 of each school year.

Requires schools that participate in Statewide interscholastic sports programs to annually inform student-athletes about National Collegiate Athletic Association eligibility standards for participation in collegiate athletics.

Permits Type II district with board of school estimate to opt to move school election to November; eliminates board of school estimate's approval of budgets for such districts, except for proposals to spend above cap.
Provides sales and use tax rebate on supplies and materials purchased for the construction or reconstruction of certain horse racetrack grandstands.

Penalizes permittees who acquire construction permits and certificates of occupancy by illegally influencing the permit procurement process; requires posting of bonds in certain situations; permits civil fines.
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex.
Requires forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Amends law concerning conversion of age-restricted communities to define substantial detriment and makes other clarifications.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.*
Provides for drug testing of licensees of community care residences and adult household members.
Requires State Treasurer, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices for awarding independent State authority contracts.
Provides for establishment, by NJT and its contract carriers, of customer feedback response programs.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
The "New Jersey Bleacher Safety Act."
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to establish the "Senior Citizen Home Repair and Modification Program;" appropriates $10 million.
Requires DCA to provide Internet resources for homeowner assistance programs and makes an appropriation.
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Requires State Comptroller to perform compliance audit to verify municipal implementation of corrective action plan following performance audit.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
Authorizes party to a final divorce judgment or judgment for the dissolution of a civil union to request name change without notifying opposing party.
Concerns certificates of occupancy for public housing projects.
Provides that taxes assessed on new property during period pending municipal-wide property revaluation shall not exceed 105 percent of taxes assessed on replaced property.
Revises certain procedures for real property tax appeals.
Concerns regulation of solid waste, hazardous waste, and recycling industries.

Extends "Right to Farm" protections to cultivation or production of marijuana for medical use; permits such activity on preserved farmland; prohibits county or municipal interference with such activity.
Concerns licensure exemptions for boiler operators.
Increases penalties for failing to yield when violation results in death to pedestrian.

Requires plans, specifications, and bid proposal documents for certain local public contracts to address soil contamination, and requires contracting unit to approve change order under certain circumstances related thereto.*
Exempts construction, expansion or renovation of public institutions of higher education, public schools, and police and fire academies from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens and mandates notaries public under certain circumstances to advertise information to public regarding limitations on their scope of authority.
Concerns dissolution of free public libraries.
Increases income eligibility limit for reduction or abatement of municipal or county utility authority fees.
Permits use of deadly force against black bears in certain cases.
Permits DCA to nominate a municipality as a qualified municipality for purposes of NJ Redevelopment Authority program participation.
Prohibits DOT from putting tolls on I-78 and I-80 and from transferring jurisdiction to independent authority or entity.
Allows for exclusion of certain properties from Highlands preservation area.
Revises exemption from license requirement for raffles for door prizes of donated or purchased merchandise; increases total retail value from $50 to $200 or higher if permitted.
Requires electric public utilities to prepare a study to better monitor street light outages.
Designates State Highway Route 31 as the "Tri-County Purple Heart Memorial Highway."
Requires labeling of foods containing genetically modified material.
Amends eligibility for expungement of criminal records.
Authorizes public institutions of higher education to establish textbook rental programs.
Requires the placement of defibrillators in public school buildings.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires that school districts use a model contract developed by the Commissioner of Education when employing a superintendent of schools.
Permits municipality to establish restricted parking spaces for certain volunteer firefighters.
Decreases the penalty for certain parole violations.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Clarifies that statute making "good behavior" credits at the Adult Diagnostic and Treatment Center contingent upon participation in treatment program applies to all inmates.
Expands gun court pilot program to include counties with municipalities participating in Operation CeaseFire.
Permits voter registration up to 14 days before election.
Requires an application fee to be paid to the DOE when applying to establish a charter school.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Increases annual property tax deduction for senior citizens and disabled persons from $250 to $500.
Creates Juvenile Transfer Task Force.
The "Toxic-free Beverage Containers Act."
Prohibits DCF from placing children in out-of-State residential child care facilities.
Establishes the New Jersey Task Force on Child Support Reform.
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Limits fees charged in connection with certain prepaid debit accounts; requires access to certain account information.
Provides for modification of child support and certain alimony payments due to changed circumstances.
Authorizes certain municipalities and rural electric cooperatives to establish a municipal shared services energy authority.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.

Prohibits retail stores from selling cellular telephone equipment or cellular telephone equipment service contracts unless stores provide information brochures about "sexting" to customers who purchase such equipment or contracts.

Authorizes State contracting agencies, local contracting units, boards of education, public institutions of higher education, and other public entities to enter into guaranteed energy savings contracts.
Requires insurers to provide coverage for medications and dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Provides additional oversight of municipalities receiving certain State aid.*
Exempts from payment certain taxes and energy charges for manufacturing facilities.
Requires school districts to notify DOE of sicknesses resulting from confirmed or suspected air pollution or other contamination.
Requires designated fire command structure in municipal emergency operations plans involving mutual aid responses to fires.
Prohibits participating providers under managed care plans from charging certain fees; establishes penalties therefor.
Clarifies permissible payment terms under residential leases and prohibits them from requiring prepayment of rent for entire lease term.
Requires local unit or authority to provide director of the Division of Local Government Services with report concerning law suits to which it is a party before budget is approved.

Provides for county welfare agency monitoring of welfare emergency assistance motel placements, annual inspection of hotels used for emergency assistance recipients and notice of mobile health van services.
Establishes Interagency Council on Preventing and Reducing Homelessness.

Requires interactive computer service to remove images, information, or data which depicts child engaged in prohibited sexual act from computer server or other storage device controlled or owned by the interactive computer service.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians and dentists in first seven taxable years of practice in NJ.
Renames the "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights" act the "Alex DeCroce Crime Victim's Bill of Rights" act.
Requires DEP and owners of reservoirs to implement certain flood control measures, and authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoirs in response to severe weather events.
Establishes 80 as maximum age for issuing special handgun carry permits to retired police officers.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.

Requires DOE to make certain determinations concerning the provision of educational services to a child residing in a domestic violence shelter and modifies calculation of tuition under certain circumstances.

Provides that expression of a political view or of a personal opinion on a school district budget by school board member does not constitute action that may form the basis of a school ethics complaint.
Revises method of determining reimbursement costs when a law enforcement entity hires a recently trained officer from another law enforcement entity.
Directs AG to enter into memorandum of understanding with U.S. Attorney General empowering certain corrections officers to investigate immigration status of inmates.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Requires, after study, DEP to adopt total maximum daily loads for Barnegat Bay ecosystem, and requires DEP to adopt nutrient standards for NJ marine waters.
Establishes Helmets to Hardhats pilot program in New Jersey Turnpike Authority.
Immunizes from civil liability first responders who forcibly enter property to provide emergency assistance.
Revises and expands New Jersey Trademark Anti-Counterfeiting Act.
Provides local board of education with approval authority of charter school application.
Clarifies blight criteria under "Local Redevelopment and Housing Law," and prevents use of condemnation to acquire code compliant residential property under that law.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Requires State to use energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Changes fire district election date from third Saturday in February to third Tuesday in April, the annual election day in type II school districts.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Prohibits use of certain accidents involving certain insureds during the course of employment with a government entity as rating factor in automobile insurance underwriting.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Permits certain municipalities to purchase retail alcoholic beverage licenses regardless of population restrictions.
Permits service of beer and wine by certain restaurants.
Permits municipalities to purchase and issue certain surplus retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Imposes post-employment restrictions on certain ABC employees.
Authorizes counties to charge inmates for costs of incarceration and to place a lien to ensure payment.
Establishes preservation requirements for certain biological evidence.
"The Truth In Tolling Act"; requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to display toll amount paid when EZ-Pass user passes through toll collection point.*

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.
Prohibits the manufacture, distribution, and sale of certain jewelry.
Permits a child who moves out of a school district due to a family crisis to remain enrolled in that district until the end of the school year.
Concerns the sale of portable electronics insurance and licensing of limited lines insurance producers for that purpose.
Requires public institutions of higher education to implement certain practices concerning academic credits and residency requirements for military servicemembers.
Requires cemetery companies to file annual financial report.
Increases health benefits continuation coverage to 36 months for certain persons covered under certain employer health benefits plans.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Codifies federal law notice, consent, and other requirements concerning certain employer-owned group life insurance contracts.
Establishes moratorium on conversion of health service corporation to domestic stock insurer.
Establishes online portal for acceptance of donations to certain funds to which contributions may be made on gross income tax returns.
Requires hearing and approval of premium changes for individual and small employer health benefits plans; requires certain information be posted on DOBI's website.
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings. *
Makes certain changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites.*
Enhances procedures for disposition of State surplus computers, computer equipment and software allocated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.
Changes signature requirement for recall petition and when recall may be initiated.
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."
Prohibits discrimination against potential organ transplant recipient on basis of mental or physical disability.
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.
Requires school districts to adopt policies concerning electronic communications between employees and students.
Permits establishment of county-wide purchasing system by a county employing qualified purchasing agent and requires participation by all school districts within the county.
Requires deposit of property tax refunds for certain industrial sites under federal or State orders for remediation with Commissioner of Environmental Protection to help ensure compliance.
Establishes and enhances certain insurance fraud prevention measures.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Requires certain health care facilities to offer, and health care workers to receive, annual influenza vaccination.
Extends exemption from charitable immunity for certain civil actions to persons of any age who are beneficiaries of the nonprofit corporation.
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson in the Division of Consumer Affairs.
Jessica Rogers' Law; upgrades assault by auto or vessel.
Provides surviving spouses of certain fire and police personnel who die in line of duty with workers' compensation for entire period of survivorship.
Expands domestic violence protection for adoptive parents.
Reduces period of time that member of Legislature may be absent, without excuse, before member's seat is deemed vacant.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission."
Requires suspension of local elected and appointed officers and employees indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Appropriates $5 million to Cranford Township for flood control projects.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Permits municipalities and school districts to contract for video monitoring systems to assist in enforcing law against unlawfully passing a school bus.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of a boating accident.
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.
Requires victims of the criminally insane to be notified upon release, escape, or transfer of offender from mental health facility.
Directs the BPU to establish certain energy-conservation programs.
Requires disclosure of certain adverse actions based on consumer credit reports.
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Establishes School Asthma Protocol Task Force.
Provides for mandatory life imprisonment for sexual assault upon a minor.
Appropriates $7.5 million of Powerball lottery game proceeds to extend Part-Time Tuition Aid Grant Program from county colleges to all colleges.

Establishes loan redemption program for certain teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public or nonpublic schools.*
Requires cost analysis in certain cases when State department contracts out work.
Requires NJ Energy Star Homes Program incentives be available Statewide.
Increases annual income limitation to receive senior and disabled citizens' property tax deduction to $15,000.
Concerns private entities that own, operate or manage correctional facilities or jails.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.
Clarifies that school bus for purpose of upgraded penalties in "school zone" criminal drug laws includes any bus owned and operated by board of education or by private contractor.
Concerns certain contracts to privatize State services.
Establishes certain customer protection requirements for cable television customers.
Requires State agencies to submit notice of request for proposals or other documents pertinent to privatization contracts to certain State employees.
Establishes cruel restraint of a dog as an animal cruelty offense.
Requires BPU to mandate electric power supply reliability and prevent market manipulation by electric power suppliers.
Establishes the School District Governance Study Commission.
Deletes requirement for certain cable television companies to fund "CATV Universal Access Fund."
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
Enhances penalties for illegally operating a snowmobile or all-terrain vehicle.
Increases penalties for drunk driving with minor as passenger.
Requires keg registration; makes the unlawful possession of an unregistered keg a petty disorderly persons offense.
Prohibits the use of simulated government documents in advertising.
Directs Attorney General to establish a criminal firearms recovery clearing house.
Establishes system of graduated parole violation sanctions.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warning."
Prohibits sale of tobacco products in vending machines with certain exceptions.
Requires aftercare treatment program as part of community supervision.
Upgrades sexual assault to aggravated sexual assault when committed in conjunction with a carjacking.
Authorizes State constitutional convention to reform system of property taxation; makes appropriation.
Provides State, county, municipal, and school district contracts for professional services will be awarded pursuant to competitive contracting process.*

Includes limitations on amount of retirement compensation which may be provided by a school board in the employment contracts of superintendents of schools, assistant superintendents of schools, and school business administrators.
Extends certain PERS benefits to veterans of "Operation Uphold Democracy".
Requires third-party disbursement service organization that contracts with local government unit or board of education to post bond against failure to meet obligations.
Expands calibers of rim-fire rifles permitted on State wildlife management target ranges.
Exempts agricultural driver's licensees from certain graduate driver law restrictions when operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Establishes a limited education grant program for certain school districts sending pupils to a district that is experiencing overcrowding in its school facilities.
Provides public employee salaries at all levels of government cannot exceed salary of Governor.
Extends property tax benefit to veterans who performed active service in U.S. Armed Forces during Cold War.

Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes and adjusts administration of setoffs against gross income tax refunds and homestead rebates or credits.
Eliminates the alternative minimum assessment under the corporation business tax.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Removes imposition of sales and use tax on sales of massage, bodywork and somatic services.
Prohibits use of body imaging scanners to screen passengers and airline crew members.
Allows certain State agencies to sell Internet advertisements on agencies' websites.
Supplemental appropriation of $11.7 million in State funds and $21.7 million in federal funds to DHS to restore eligibility to parents in NJ FamilyCare.
Permits health care providers to report certain patient health problems to MVC.
Equalizes standing of private and public colleges before land use agencies.
Concerns penalties for illegally passing school bus.
Permits mayors to appoint municipal emergency management coordinators from among residents of municipalities subject to a shared services agreement.
Clarifies that punitive damages may not be awarded against public entities or public employees acting within the scope of their employment in any action.
Adjusts fee schedule for county and municipal golf courses for certain veterans and service members.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct a motor vehicle operator's vision.
Directs each institution of higher education to develop and coordinate a comprehensive disaster preparedness plan.
Requires school districts to annually disseminate information to students and parents or guardians on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Requires public hearings on proposed off-track wagering facilities to be held in municipalities contiguous to site where proposed facilities will be located.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Concerns awarding of professional services contracts by public agencies and requires certain disclosures by State and local government officials and candidates for elective public office.
Allows lawsuits by home improvement contractors against homeowners to be brought in county in which residential or non-commercial property is located.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Requires account numbers to be truncated on certain sales receipts.
Limits sale and manufacture of flame retardant chemical decabromodiphenyl ether.

Concerns combined sewer overflows; exempts improvements thereto from 2% property tax cap; requires certain permit holders address such overflows in capital improvement plans; and appropriates $5 million.
Clarifies definition of "on-site generation facility" in "Electric Discount Energy Competition Act" with regard to geographic contiguity with end use customers.*
Authorizes creation of stormwater utilities for certain local government entities.
Upgrades offense and increases penalty for certain acts of defiant trespass.
Requires period of mandatory incarceration for second or subsequent conviction for prostitution.
"New Jersey Homeless Veterans Grant Program Act;" establishes New Jersey Homeless Veterans Grant Program and allows voluntary contributions on gross income tax returns to support homeless veterans.**
Exempts from sales and use tax the sale of materials and equipment used in the manufacture of wind energy components.
Increases amount of tax credits authorized to be issued under Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program and extends application deadline.*
Supplemental appropriation of $38 million in State and federal funding to DHSS to fund nursing homes.
Prohibits payment of supplemental compensation for unused sick earned by public officers and employees after effective date.
Authorizes Internet gaming at Atlantic City casinos under certain circumstances.*
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act"; provides expedited process for foreclosing abandoned residential properties.
Concerns alterations in child support obligations in response to changes to status of supported child.*
Reinstates automatic COLA for retirement benefits of members of the State-administered retirement systems.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
Establishes guidelines for creditworthiness determinations concerning affordable housing programs.

Mandates that certain personnel critical to certain State finance and revenue generating activities are essential employees during a declared State government shutdown due to failure to enact an annual appropriation act.
Provides for increase and annual adjustment in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires DHS to give priority to temporary rental assistance over use of hotels or motels in emergency assistance to Work First New Jersey recipients.
Restricts large trucks to certain highway networks.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
Enhances transparency in exercise of municipal redevelopment powers.
Creates cigar night smoking ban exemption at racetracks and off-track wagering facilities.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to suspend requirement that graduated driver licensees display decal until certain technology developed.

Provides a gross income tax credit of up to $7,500 for qualified home purchases made by certain first-time homebuyers in the remaining portion of taxable year 2012, taxable year 2013 and taxable year 2014.
Clarifies insurance coverage for certain home and health care agency employees under their own private passenger automobile insurance.
Establishes a State aid program for charter school facilities.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students; appropriates $2,500,000.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Exempts sale of recreational safety helmets from sales and use tax.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for employers who employ certain individuals who have received training from certain community rehabilitation programs.
Prohibits State agencies from posting emergency medical technicians' personal information on web sites.
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Strengthens various statutory provisions regarding civil union couples.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Specifies certain requirements for approval of a charter school application.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.
Requires binding arbitration to determine contested cases involving dismissal or reduction in compensation of tenured public school employees.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Establishes identification cards for persons without permanent residence.
Requires HIV tests for certain convicted sex offenders.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a third degree crime.
Expands eligibility under the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act by broadening certain municipal qualifier provisions.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certification of patient if nurse is patient's primary caregiver.*
Authorizes certain gestational carrier agreements.
Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.
Creates the "Local Unit Audit Teams" program in the Department of the Treasury.
Allows victims and relatives to witness parole hearings.
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Adds members representing fire fighting and fire safety interests to the Domestic Security Preparedness Planning Group.
Requires the reporting of criminal offenses occurring on school property to law enforcement authorities.
Provides for a presumption of joint physical custody in a child custody determination; addresses relocation.
Clarifies that crime victims' rights must be recognized by all courts in the State.
Increases certain arson offenses to a crime of the third degree.
Requires replacement of door and ignition locks on county and municipal vehicles prior to sale.
Waives fee to obtain State and national criminal history record background checks for volunteers and affiliates of certain organizations.
Exempts municipal clerk from penalties for Open Public Records Act violations under certain circumstances.
Permits county board of chosen freeholders to appoint interim member of county tax board under certain circumstances.
Permits certain military funeral buglers to receive New Jersey Honor Guard Ribbon.*
Clarifies position of NJT on avoiding destructive competition against private entities providing certain public transportation services.
"Kulesh, Kubert's, and Bolis' Law; " establishes violation of hands-free cell phone law as reckless under vehicular homicide and assault by auto statutes.*
Requires managed care plans to deem valid referral for a covered health care service as satisfying requirements for prior notification.
"Post-Viability Protection Act."
Provides that English shall be the official language of the State.
Restricts use of accumulated sick leave by public employees in year prior to retirement.
Establishes process by which a fiduciary is discharged.
Bars certain employees of certain public agencies from participating in PERS; repeals law permitting PERS and TPAF members on leave who work for labor organization to purchase pension credit.
Establishes pilot program to utilize value-based benefit design in SHBP to increase health benefits coverage for certain employees concerning chronic health conditions.
Requires certain public entities to issue requests for proposals for purchase of certain insurance products and services; requires disclosure of commissions paid.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."
Eliminates prohibition against purchasing more than one handgun in calendar month.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Provides that sales by UEZ retailers of items delivered to location outside of the UEZ shall not qualify for partial exemption from the sales tax.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.

Requires voter registration forms be available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license; requires display and collection of completed application if the applicant wishes to register at public agency.*
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Adds "significant bodily injury" to assault by auto or vessel statute; upgrades penalties for inflicting serious bodily injury.
David's Law; establishes crime of negligent vehicular homicide.
Makes certain body searches third degree crime of sexual assault under certain circumstances.
Establishes special license plates for veterans.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Codifies Lyme disease reporting requirements.
Mandates basic training for certain newly-appointed entry-level firefighters and supervisory training for full-time firefighters promoted to certain positions.
Exempts from sales and use tax sales of carbon monoxide detectors and any device or equipment sold for residential use to detect, warn of, abate, or extinguish fires.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires MVC to accept death certificate as proof of name change.
Clarifies that using motor vehicle to publicly display obscene material is fourth degree crime.
Creates procedure for destruction of all records pertaining to juveniles who are arrested but subsequently not charged with delinquency.

Permits certain former members and employees of NJ Racing Commission to work for, or hold interest in, licensee thereof if State Ethics Commission finds no conflict of interest following membership or employment.**
Restricts business entities who make campaign contributions from performing certain local government contracts.
Makes theft, misappropriation, or wrongful operation of certain motorbuses a second degree crime.
Establishes Office of the Advocate for Private Commuter Bus Services Consumers and bill of rights for customers of privately operated motorbus regular route services.
Authorizes criminal background checks for au pairs and nannies.
Revises requirements for emergency medical services delivery.
Removes statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands categories of defendants liable in such actions.
Prohibits certain unsolicited political calls by political organizations or candidates to persons in this State.
Requires State to enable applicants for State agency-issued permits to track online the progress and status of their permit application.
Provides for representation of certain regions of State on New Jersey Turnpike Authority.*
Permits small businesses to qualify for loans from NJEDA for costs of energy audit and making energy efficiency or conservation improvements.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.
Authorizes property tax deferment for deployed military personnel.
Eliminates statute of limitations for civil actions arising out of the sexual abuse of a child.
Eliminates statute of limitations for prosecutions for criminal sexual contact and aggravated criminal sexual contact.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.
Requires DEP to test certain DEP water wells and monitoring stations and report results thereof.
Requires reduction in number of positions in State service; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Reinstates State sick leave injury program for State employees who are members of PFRS or SPRS.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
Allows certain emergency squad volunteers holding municipal elective office to vote on emergency squad concerns.
Provides for time period during which complaints may be filed for certain motor vehicle violations.
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Revises and expands duties and responsibilities of State Auditor in performance of certain audits and reviews.
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
Removes investigation and security services from imposition of sales and use tax.
