Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Establishes criteria for State recognition of Native American tribe.
Provides procedure for suspension of county board of elections member charged with certain crimes.
Allows judge to admit evidence of prior sexual offenses in current sexual offense actions.
Requires the Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners maintain minutes of meetings; provides Governor veto over minutes.
Permits boards of education to convey certain school property to nonprofit senior citizen organizations for nominal consideration.
Provides for electronic monitoring of domestic violence offenders and notification to the victim; designated as "Lisa's Law."
Upgrades penalties for drag racing.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Permits chief administrator of MVC to waive CDL skills test for certain applicants with military experience operating commercial motor vehicles.*
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all elections under certain conditions.*
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Authorizes issuance of "municipal solid waste disposal only" license to certain applicants.
Prohibits law enforcement agency from conducting certain checkpoints and inspections limited only to motorcycles.*
Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority to hold regular meetings in various counties in the State.*
Establishes pilot project to permit overseas and military voters to vote in certain elections using Internet.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under legal drinking age.
Requires mandatory registration of family child care providers; requires family child care providers to undergo criminal history record background checks.

Requires tenant notification and documentation on landlord registration form whenever rental premises is adjudicated to have caused constructive eviction because of mold presence; requires Department of Community Affairs to maintain registry.
Makes changes to the School Ethics Act.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Authorizes law enforcement agency to inform the president of a public or independent institution of higher education when a student is charged or convicted of certain crimes.
Permits counties to share county tax administrators.
Implements Governor's "Tool Kit" proposals for public employer-public employee collective negotiation agreements.
Permits small, women owned, or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers or planning areas to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
Provides for review and consolidation of certain toll free telecommunications services maintained and operated by certain State and local entities.
Establishes DCA oversight of Passaic Valley Sewerage Comissioners.
Requires affirmative vote of majority of full membership of municipal council in mayor-council form of government to approve contracts.
Requires three-day attorney review period for residential leases.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to the total value of the monetary judgment or $50 million, whichever is less.
Establishes free smoke detector program in DCA.
Requires adoption agency, court, or DYFS to maintain child's religious upbringing when placing child in adoptive or resource family home.
Requires shore municipalities to provide active members of the military and veterans free access to beaches.
Permits municipalities to establish weapons free zones around schools and public facilities.
Permits certain special law enforcement officers to carry firearms at all times when in State.
Requires county prosecutor to determine and report to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement whether persons held for certain violent crimes are lawful residents of the United States.
Prohibits sale of certain products using advertisements alluding to controlled dangerous substances or analogs.
Establishes crime of entering into certain restricted airport areas.
Provides for information that may be requested for issuance of certain driver's licenses.
Provides that 20% of fee charged for initial certified copy of birth certificate shall be used to support certain activities of NJ Cord Blood Bank.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain ex-service members.
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Allows certain members of PFRS to serve until age 70 upon approval by municipal governing body.
Requires retail food establishments to donate surplus unused baked goods and surplus canned and packaged goods close to retail sale date to local nonprofits and charities.
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Eliminates exception to public advertising and bidding requirements for local public contracts involving marketing of recyclable materials.
Establishes program in DOE to address State's shortage of mathematics and science teachers.

Provides for awarding of certain incentives to persons making certain investments and creating certain jobs and revises sales and use tax to enumerate certain persons presumed to be sellers; makes an appropriation.
Exempts certain car-sharing programs from motor vehicle rental fees.
Modifies definition of at-risk pupils in school funding law.
Authorizes submission of certification of remediation at unregulated heating oil tank sites by certain persons; requires use of contractors by DEP to review site remediation submissions.
Requires school districts to notify DOE whenever law enforcement is called to respond to incident occurring at school.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Exempts certain motor vehicle repair dealers from consumer fraud law and regulation under certain circumstances.
Requires municipality to comply with State audit prior to receiving State aid.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain packaging equipment.
Requires minimum water usage charge to be applied per dwelling unit in multi-family dwelling.
Requires security guards at institutions of higher education which do not employ police officers to immediately report crimes committed on campus to the local police department.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under gross income tax, eliminates income cap on exclusion.
"New Jersey G.I. Bill"; provides higher education benefits to New Jersey veterans.
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from requiring certain consumer identification for return of merchandise.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed.
Provides two-year window for persons to transfer, render inoperable or surrender assault firearm.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in certain counties.
Authorizes municipalities to impose penalties on creditors that fail to timely remedy code violations of certain properties in forclosure.*
Enhances PFRS accidental death pension benefit for survivors of member serving in nonsupervisory rank.
Clarifies duties and responsibilities of police directors and chiefs of police.
Establishes program in Department of Law and Public Safety for Attorney General to audit, investigate and review superintendents of elections and county boards of elections.
Requires State institutions of higher education and associated hospitals or medical facilities to obtain legislative approval of any name change.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to ameliorate disparities among school districts with respect to educational technology.
Provides foreclosure forbearance for certain residential borrowers and exempts certain lenders that offer sustainable mortgage modifications.
Requires excuse for voting by mail-in ballot.
Establishes division in Department of Treasury to oversee and enforce equal employment opportunity requirements with regard to public works contracts.
Requires "No Turn on Red" signs be affixed to certain traffic control signals.
Revises penalties for drunk driving offenses and creates restricted use driver's license.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Expands eligible municipalities under the "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act" to include Harrison Town in Hudson County.
Clarifies requests for proposals of public entities implementing energy savings improvement program contracts.
Changes parameters of existing exemption for certain beach bars from noise control standards.*
Establishes the "New Jersey Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act."
Provides bonus awards to certain businesses who hire employees who were previously unemployed for more than 13 weeks.
Concerns grant funding for Community Health Law Project; appropriates $100,000.
Requires certain parents and caretakers to be enrolled in NJ Family Care if they meet income eligibility criteria.*
Clarifies statutory exemptions from mandatory immunizations for students.
"Higher Education Citizenship Equality Act;" defines domicile for dependent students for the purpose of eligibility for State student loans, grants, or scholarships and in State tuition rate.
"PANYNJ Transparency and Accountability Act."
Provides temporary deferral of certain sales and use tax collection responsibilities of certain persons making certain investments and creating certain jobs.
Requires that certain motor vehicle surcharge revenues be dedicated to the Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Prohibits possession and sale of shark fins.

Exempts certain transactions of residential property involving senior, blind, and disabled citizens from general purpose fee under realty transfer fee and one percent assessment on real property selling for more than $1,000,000.
Requires every State and local elected official using agent to represent or undertake scheduling of appearances therefore to disclose information about such service.
Prohibits certain individuals from membership on county boards of elections.
Establishes minimum and maximum sentences and penalties for election officers and employees convicted of fraud.
Eliminates award of attorneys' fees, filing fees and costs of suit for technical violation of the consumer fraud act.
Establishes "Blue Ribbon Panel to Review New Jersey's Driver License Suspension Laws."
Establishes the "General Durable Power of Attorney Act."
Permits municipality to enact ordinance to curb gang related loitering and criminal activity.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.*
Establishes procedures for governing bodies of municipalities or voters to opt to move annual fire district elections to November.
Makes various statutory changes to "Child Care Licensing Act."
Provides for two-year post-employment restriction on certain employees of the Department of Banking and Insurance.
Requires destruction of records stored on digital copy machines under certain circumstances.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to taxpayers contributing to scholarships for low-income children.
Prohibits persons under 19 from smoking in public and purchasing tobacco products.
Reappropriates $3 million from "Dam, Lake, Stream, Flood Control, Water Resources, and Wastewater Treatment Project Bond Act of 2003" to fund State flood control projects.
The "New Jersey Consumer Catastrophe Preparedness and Protection Act"; creates "New Jersey Catastrophe Fund."
Prohibits manufacture, sale, or possession of synthetic marijuana.
Provides that a school district may implement bullying prevention programs and anti-bullying training programs at no cost through various entities; and appropriates $1 million.
Exempts, for five years, certain new business activities in pinelands area from compliance with Pinelands Commission development approval process.
Requires mandatory audit of new voter registration records before an election and of absentee and provisional ballots after an election in randomly selected districts.
Establishes NJ Center for Oral Health at UMDNJ Dental School.
Requires certain CATV companies to make CATV service available throughout residential areas of municipality within specified number of years after CATV company first provides service to municipality.
Provides that a school district may implement bullying prevention programs and anti-bullying training programs at no cost through various entities; and appropriates $1 million.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.
Requires high school driver education course, certain new driver brochures, and driver's license written exam to include aggressive driving information.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $4.141 million from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE for aid to school districts with significant enrollment growth.
Provides that certain alimony payments may be deducted from gross income for purposes of the "Homestead Property Tax Credit Act."
Provides for mail notice of certain telephone rate and tariff changes.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program; appropriates $250,000.
Regulates smoking in multiple dwellings; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to promulgate construction standards for new multiple dwellings permitting smoking.
Upgrades crime of stalking when victim is less than 18 years old.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Requires superintendent to assume responsibilities of principal in certain school districts.
Authorizes injunctions against gangs.
Permits a joint meeting by the Senate and Assembly Budget Committees to review and veto utility rate increases approved by BPU.
Allows municipality to restrict amount of alcoholic beverages carried into certain private establishments.
Permits pet owners to board public transportation with domesticated animals during emergency evacuation.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.
Requires notification of victims and certain additional persons through Victim Information and Notification Everyday (VINE) system.
Requires civil service desk audit of provisional employees after layoff action by local employer.

Requires public and nonpublic schools, municipal and county recreation departments, youth serving organizations, and youth camps to utilize Preparticipation Physical Evaluation Form developed by certain medical professionals prior to child participation in athletics.
Provides a gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Allows application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law;" criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Affords DRPA police officers authority to inspect hazardous materials carriers and cargoes; clarifies authority of State Police to conduct inspections.*
Establishes a Community School Pilot Program in DOE to advance the construction of community school facilities projects in SDA pilot districts.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for supplies and materials purchased for construction of off-track wagering facilities.
Provides for distributions from ABP during transition to retirement programs for faculty at institutions of higher education.
Appropriates $3,279,459 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund to NJ Historic Trust for grant to Proprietary House Association for historic preservation purposes.
Requires toll road authorities to award contracts for motor fuel services on toll roads to retail dealers who dispense motor fuel provided by suppliers with refineries located in this State.

"Child Protection Act of 2012": amends statute of limitations for civil actions concerning sexual abuse; implements training programs for certain persons who work with children; establishes requirement for certain criminal background checks.
Designates State Highway Route 7 bridge between Township of Belleville and Borough of North Arlington "Lance Corporal Osbrany Montes De Oca Memorial Bridge." *
Increases mandatory sentence for second or subsequent conviction for certain sex crimes; permits consideration of convictions from foreign countries.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
"Property Tax Reduction Work Act"; permits local units to recruit residents to perform services in return for property tax vouchers.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Limits homeowners' association regulation of structures reasonably necessary or convenient for the accommodation or therapy of physically disabled persons.
Removes requirement for one and two-family residences to be equipped with a portable fire extinguisher.
Provides that videotaping of aggravated assault is a fourth degree crime.
Imposes liability insurance requirement on alcoholic beverage licensees and provides penalties for occupancy and fire code violations.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in all counties.
Requires DHSS to establish carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide air quality standards and certification requirements for ice arenas.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Prohibits investment of certain public funds in companies doing business in countries that sponsor terrorism.
Allows certain fuel dealers and distributors refunds of petroleum products gross receipts tax and credits against motor fuel tax for certain bad debts from sale of fuel.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Establishes the "Healthy Puppies and Kittens Assurance Act."
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Expands statute authorizing temporary restraining orders for certain alleged stalking victims to include victims of any age or mental capacity.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Permits sealing of certain criminal records.
Creates special education unit within the Office of Administrative Law.
Concerns replacement of natural gas pressure regulators in downtown commercial districts.
Establishes Rail Passenger Bill of Rights and authorizes Division of Consumer Affairs to enforce provisions.
Permits certain deer control activities; prohibits deer feeding; and establishes check-off donation on hunting license applications to support venison donation program.

Requires Division of Purchase and Property to provide additional notification of contracting opportunities to vendors or potential vendors providing or interested in providing home health care services to State agencies.

"Home-Based Jobs Creation Act"; classifies certain home businesses as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing, or retailing activities.

Increases fine and imposes license suspension for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving and dedicates fines to public information program; designated as the Toni Donato-Bolis and Baby R.J. Act.

Transportation for Hazardous Walking Routes Act; requires school districts to provide busing for students required to walk to school along hazardous routes and prohibits school bus stops within 250 feet of residence of sex offender.
Establishes electronic lien and titling system for New Jersey motor vehicles.*
Increases monetary penalties to be assessed upon conviction for Megan's law offenses and fixes amount of penalty.
Concerns voluntary contributions through gross income tax returns to support New Jersey athletes participating in 2014 Special Olympics USA Games.
Establishes pilot program suspending operations of superintendent and deputy superintendent of elections in certain second class counties.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Secretary of Higher Education to promote the establishment of higher education and business partnerships.*
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Provides for one-time increase of PFRS retiree annual pensions under $32,000.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
The "Wildlife Rehabilitation Act"; establishes Wildlife Rehabilitation Board and continuing education requirements and permit program for wildlife rehabilitators.
Designates four State songs.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Requires debt collectors, in certain circumstances, to cease debt collections against certain victims of identity theft.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to make payment to school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing upon adoption of resolution by municipal governing body.
Regulates deed procurement services.
Establishes "Commission on College Tuition."
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Increases and makes uniform mileage reimbursement rate for sheriffs, constables, and other court officers for various duties performed.

Clarifies that breath test warnings given to suspected drunk drivers are to be in English; requires applicants for driver's licenses to be able to read and understand English and directs MVC to offer examinations only in English.

Expands type of school bus driver required to undergo DOE criminal record check process and requires matching of data files to ensure school bus drivers remain qualified pursuant to records maintained by DOE and MVC.
Requires court to deny defendant's right to copy or reproduce images of child pornography as part of discovery.
Requires mandatory drug addiction assessments and participation in "drug court" program under special probation statute for certain offenders.
Enhances penalties for false incrimination and making fictitious reports.*
Concerns adding names of certain veterans to certain civil service eligibility lists.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; expands existing film and digital media production tax credit programs.
Establishes State payment in lieu of taxes to municipalities for loss of revenues due to an overburden of tax-exempt cemetery property; appropriates $66 million.
Requires DHSS to post on website information concerning hospital emergency department staffing and services for pediatric patients.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law.
Increases tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax rates to be on par with tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax; dedicates revenue for smoking and tobacco use cessation programs.
Requires emergency shelters for the homeless to admit persons with mental illness unless they pose danger.
Prohibits emergency shelters for the homeless from refusing to provide services for minimum time frame unless shelters are at maximum capacity.
Creates the "Mold Safe Housing Act."
Requires insurance producers to perform bona fide services for public entities in order to share commissions; requires disclosure of commission sharing.
Establishes DOT roadside memorial program for fallen police officers, EMS workers, and firefighters.

Permits municipal affordable housing trust funds and payments-in-lieu fees transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund to be returned to the originating county for affordable housing purposes.
Extends time period for municipalities to commit to expend collected development fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units.
Prohibits emergency service fees.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Prohibits residential development fees on reconstruction after natural disasters.
Prohibits requirement to provide information for access to account on social networking website by employer.
Designates portion of U.S. Route 206 bypass in Hillsborough Township as "Peter J. Biondi Bypass."

Increases distributions to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore aid reductions; extends "poison pill" protection to total formula aid provided to each municipality.
Requires police to provide certain reports free of charge to crime victims.
Provides for issuance of certificate of rehabilitation to certain offenders with substance abuse disorders.
Establishes process to bar certain health care providers from receiving reimbursement under PIP.
Allows for the issuance of special licenses to sell alcoholic beverages in qualifying development projects.
Provides for EMT and Mobile Intensive Care Paramedic certification for certain veterans.
Provides for temporary nurse licensure for qualified nonresident military spouses.
Establishes criminal penalties for killing, injuring or interfering with a service animal or guide dog; designated as "Dusty's Law." *
Requires a public body to record public meetings and post proceedings on its Internet website.
Establishes three regional superintendents of schools and eliminates the position of executive county superintendent of schools.
Requires health insurance coverage for certain student athlete physical examinations.
"Children's Sudden Cardiac Events Reporting Act."
"Scholastic Student-Athlete Safety Act;" establishes measures to ensure health of student-athletes.

Changes certain eligibility criteria for TPAF, JRS, PERS, PFRS and SPRS disability benefits; requires Attorney General to establish fraud unit; creates temporary committee to recommend accidental disability standard for systems.
Requires certain user fees for the provision of traditional municipal services to be included within the 2% municipal and county property tax levy cap.
Prohibits requirement to disclose user name, password, or other means for accessing account or service through electronic communications device by employers.
Prohibits requirement to disclose user name, password, or other means for accessing account or service through electronic communications devices by institutions of higher education.
Restricts certain campaign contributions by public employee labor organizations.
Permits local units to enter into joint agreements to purchase fire equipment.
"Blue Acres Floodplain Protection Bond Act of 2012," authorizes bonds for $100 million, and appropriates $5,000.
Requires employer notification when relocating call center services to foreign country.
Establishes animal cruelty offense of cruel confinement of a gestating pig.
Prohibits the sale and possession of shark fins.
Requires certain energy tax receipts to be paid directly to municipalities.
Increases State appropriations to Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund by $387 million to restore municipal aid reductions from Fiscal Years 2009, 2010, and 2011.

Revises certain solar renewable energy programs and requirements; provides for aggregated net metering of electricity consumption related to properties owned by certain governmental bodies and school districts.***
Bans charging workers' compensation claimants for medical expenses, gives Division of Workers' Compensation sole jurisdiction over work-related medical claims.
Allows certain military spouses with out-of-State teaching license to receive temporary instructional certificate in New Jersey.
Concerns the escheat of stored value cards.*
Eliminates restriction on placement of special education students in sectarian schools.
Requires employers post notice of worker rights under certain State and federal laws.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Requires public contractors to report certain employment information.
Provides that unlawful employment practice occurs each time individual is affected by decision or practice, including each time compensation is paid.
Directs portion of Unclaimed Child Support Trust Fund be used to balance unpaid receivables resulting from federal income tax refund offset reversals.
Concerns disclosure of certain employment information.
Increases renewable energy and energy efficiency requirements under "Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act."
Requires pawnbrokers to retain purchased property for not less than 20 days and record and report certain information.
Provides tax credit against gross income tax for costs of certain property that conserves energy or promotes energy efficiency and for other energy efficiency measures.

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Provides totally disabled persons with discount on hunting license fees.
Establishes refundable gross income tax credit for certain taxpayers allowed Hope Scholarship Credit and Lifetime Learning Credit under Federal income tax.
Enhances the reporting and disclosure requirements concerning State tax expenditures and limits the duration of new State tax expenditure enactments.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support autism programs.
Removes statutory reference to 9-1-1 Commission which was renamed Statewide Public Safety Communications Commission.
Regulates mailed manufacturer's rebates.
Authorizes release of sex offender registration information to DHS and county welfare agencies.
Allows installation of solar arrays by municipalities on preserved open space in certain circumstances.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for qualified investment in certain biotechnology businesses.
Directs State Board of Education to promulgate regulations requiring school districts to develop a plan to establish stability in special education programming.
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, monument and historical markers.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program; prohibits future use of red light cameras in State.
Limits health insurance requirement for college students to those residing in campus dormitories.
Requires each municipality to establish a Reverse 9-1-1 system.
Criminalizes fourth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Permits consolidation of all fire districts in a municipality; sets forth procedure for consolidation.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid via E-ZPass.
Authorizes issuance of special emergency notes to finance special emergency appropriations for payment of current year property assessment appeal refunds over three years.
Increases annual gross receipts limit for exemption from Unit Price Disclosure Act; concerns court appearances.
Designates Atlantic City and Pleasantville, Atlantic County, as areas eligible for redemption of pinelands development credits.
Establishes "Veterans Higher Education Commission."
Reverses certain changes to laws governing State treatment of unclaimed property.
Establishes pilot program for mandatory sentencing to "drug court" program under special probation statute for certain offenders.
Upgrades penalties for assaults committed against process servers and licensed private investigators and detectives.
Eliminates the office of the executive couny superintendent of schools and transfers all the duties of that office to the Commissioner of Education.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $7,000,000 to DOE to reinstate nonpublic technology initiative aid.
Provides for nursing home reimbursement adjustment for cost of energy improvements.
Permits certain sheriffs to enforce truck weight limits.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions, earnings, and qualified distributions associated with special needs trusts.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Enhances penalties upon corporate violators of housing codes.

Requires tenure charges be filed against any public school employee found to have bullied a student and requires the employment of any nontenured public school employee be terminated for such activity.
Directs hospitals to establish protocols for dispatch and patient transport by specialty care transportation units used for inter-facility transfers.
Requires charter schools to annually submit to Commissioner of Education salary and benefit information for certain employees.
Requires Division of Purchase and Property to establish Internet commerce site for purchase of fire equipment approved by State contract.
Prohibits slaughter of horses and sale of horse flesh for human consumption.
Decriminalizes possession of 50 grams or less of marijuana.
Provides for stacking of uninsured and underinsured motorist insurance coverage for insured covered under multiple vehicles or policies.
The "Debt-Management Services Act of New Jersey."
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2013.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2013.
Requires DCA to establish training and certification program and arbitration standards for new home warranty arbitrators and publish a "New Home Buyer's Bill of Rights."
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years based on cost analysis.
"Vader's Law"; revises law to enhance penalty for injuring or harming certain dogs.
Establishes telemarketing fraud investigation unit.
Requires certain companies providing local telephone service within 10-mile radius of nuclear electric generating facility to adhere to certain service quality standards.
Establishes maximum fees for licensing and administration of raffles by Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission and certain municipalities.
Requires telemarketers making sales calls to display their name and telephone number on any caller identification service.
Requires medical bills be standardized and accompanied by explanatory disclosure form.
Establishes restrictions and requirements for use of fishing gear and conch, fishing, and lobster pots on artificial reefs.
Directs Board of Nursing to encourage nursing schools to give academic credit to students for training received in US military as corpsmen and medics.
Permits chief financial officer to recommend reduced appropriation for reserve for uncollected taxes in certain circumstances.
Phases out sales and use tax imposed on charges for certain initiation fees, membership fees and dues.
Authorizes special Distinguished Flying Cross license plates.
Makes "Skinner's and Michelle's Law" violators subject to No Early Release Act sentencing guidelines.
Eliminates transfer inheritance tax and increases filing threshold and applicable exclusion amounts under New Jersey estate tax in accordance with provisions of federal tax law.
Supplemental appropriation of $400,000 to DOT for installation of a traffic signal on Route 130 at the Shoppes at Hamilton in Hamilton Township, Mercer County.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Permits complainant to withdraw complaint from county or municipal ethics board if decision not rendered within 180 days of receipt and submit to Local Finance Board.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell certain surplus real properties located in Township of Woodbridge, Middlesex County.
Establishes permanent sterile syringe access program; appropriates $95,000.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
Concerns hospital asset transformation program.
Establishes designated driver motor vehicle license plates.
Limits contributions to legal defense fund of candidate for or holder of elective public office; requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from using social networking websites and requires certain identifying information.
Designates the "Honor and Remember Flag" as an official State flag.

Provides municipality with affordable housing credit toward its municipal fair share housing obligation for funds transferred to the New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund pursuant to P.L.2008, c.46.
Establishes a grant program for school districts to establish substance abuse prevention programs for eighth grade students.
Provides for SHBP New Jersey State Employee Wellness Program with financial incentives for participation in program.
Extends time municipalities have to commit fees and payments-in-lieu of constructing affordable units to six years.

Makes FY 2012 State and federal supplemental appropriations totaling $256,743,000, reduces FY 2012 appropriations by $86,000,000, and amends and supplements various language provisions affecting appropriations in FY 2012.
Appropriates $31,741,467,000 in State funds and $12,368,238,000 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2012-2013.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain minimum three foot safety distance when overtaking bicycles.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell surplus property, known as Plainfield Armory, located in City of Plainfield in Union County.
The "Save the Hudson River Palisades Act."
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Linden City.
Authorizes award of attorney's fees and expenses in landlord-tenant actions under certain circumstances.*
Upgrades crime of kidnapping minor less than 16 years of age and increases applicable term of imprisonment.
Revises "New Jersey Transportation Trust Fund Authority Act."*
Establishes offense of advertising commercial sexual abuse of minor.
Bans charging workers' compensation claimants for medical expenses, gives Division of Workers' Compensation sole jurisdiction over work-related medical claims.
Removes licensing requirement for recreational bingo games.
Establishes licensing program in Department of Agriculture for farmed deer and other cervids.
Requires DEP to allow for correction of technical and administrative permit application violations; and subjects adoption of DEP technical manuals to "Administrative Procedure Act."
Requires DEP to conduct analysis of "Pollution Prevention Act."
"Melanie A. Cantwell Law;" requires MVC to issue modified license to person convicted of driving under the influence.
Criminalizes second or subsequent drunk driving offenses in certain cases.
Consolidates certain county police departments with certain county sheriff's offices.
Requires school districts to provide instruction on the dangers of texting while driving as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.

Specifies conditions under which State, county, municipality, independent authority, school district, or higher education institution can grant unpaid or paid leave of absence to public employee to perform work for labor organization.
Prohibits surrogacy agreements; establishes standards for determining custody of children resulting from such agreements.
Establishes NJ Council on Lupus Education and Awareness in DOH.*
Requires professional boards to provide waivers or exemptions from requirements for licensure for veterans with substantially equivalent training.
Establishes safety zone speed control device pilot program.
Permits liens in favor of planned real estate development associations for unpaid assessments in planned real estate developments.
Provides $3,000 gross income tax deduction for certain taxpayers providing home care for an elderly relative.
Requires DHSS to establish "New Jersey Autism Website."
Requires assisted living residences and comprehensive personal care homes to ensure connection of emergency cords in residential units to facility staff.
Revises State designation of "Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month" from February to September.
Increases certain filing fees, penalties and enhances enforcement provisions and procedures for violations of cigarette tax and unfair cigarette sales laws by cigarette license holders.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell surplus real property, known as Eagle Manor, located in Township of Fairfield in Cumberland County.
Subjects certain municipal and school property to property taxation.
Requires employers and health care providers to disseminate certain information regarding temporary disability leave benefits.
Requires hospital to notify patient admitted for observation of possible increased prescription charges and allow patient to use patient's own medication.
Eliminates requirement for CATV companies to provide advance notification of price decreases or addition of channel offerings.
Prohibits certain violations of terms of service for Internet ticket sales.

Requires insurers to provide information about organ donation and allows insurers to limit reimbursement for organ transplant if recipient has not made gift pursuant to Revised Uniform Anatomical Gift Act.
Authorizes certain cooperative purchasing agreements involving certain State and local government entities for certain purchases.
Permits toll-free passage on State toll roads for certain buses traveling to casinos.
Requires Department of Agriculture to publish on its website information concerning wineries and community supported agriculture entities in NJ.
Establishes bill of rights for continuing care retirement community residents.
Regulates placement of charges for products or services on telephone bills.
Permits up to 10 children to be cared for by a registered family day care provider.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
"The Anti-Big Brother Act."
Requires certain purchasers of precious metals and jewelry to maintain certain records; grandfathers certain municipal ordinances regarding sales of used and secondhand jewelry.*
Requires certain public contracts for insurance coverage and consulting services to be awarded through competitive contracting process.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Requires certain official State forms to contain the language oath or affirmation and swear to or affirm when the forms are reprinted.
Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement fees, subject to limitations, to fund e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; provides for review of such fees by Judiciary.
"New Jersey Medical and Health Sciences Education Restructuring Act."
Establishes per se standard for driving under influence of inhalant; designated as "Kimmie's Law."
Transfers New Jersey Sports and Exposition Authority from DCA to Department of State.

Transfers records management functions of Division of Archives and Records Management from Department of State to Department of Treasury; transfers State Records Committee from Department of State to Department of Treasury.

Transfers various personnel management functions from Department of Treasury to Civil Service Commission; transfers Division of Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action from Department of Treasury to Civil Service Commission.
Transfers responsibility for establishment and enforcement of ethical standards for local officials and school officials to the State Ethics Commission.
Prohibits certain drunk driver claims against licensed alcoholic beverage servers.
Reorganizes Department of Children and Families.
Establishes 12-month moratorium on establishment of new virtual charter schools and creates Virtual Charter School Task Force.
Reorganizes and renames DHSS as Department of Health; establishes Division of Aging Services in DHS.
Authorizes penalties for failure to file certain public employment contracts; clarifies requirement for electronic posting of public employment contracts and interest arbitration awards.
Permits special occasion events that promote agricultural tourism to be conducted on preserved farmland under certain circumstances.
Authorizes sale of site of former Riverfront State Prison in City of Camden as State surplus property to NJEDA for public auction to prequalified developer.
Concerns sharing of certain services by municipalities subject to provisions of "Municipal Rehabilitation and Economic Recovery Act."
Authorizes executor or administrator to take control of online accounts of deceased person.
Establishes grant program to provide rebate of sales and use tax paid for purchase of certain materials and supplies used for construction of certain off-track wagering facilities.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Establishes Hunterdon-Somerset Flood Advisory Task Force.

Requires DCA to establish procedures for inspection and abatement of mold hazards in residential buildings and school facilities, certification programs for mold inspectors and mold hazard abatement workers.*
The "Opioid Antidote and Overdose Prevention Act."
Increases number of trustees on SPRS board of trustees from five to seven; requires two trustees to be elected by SPRS active members and one trustee to be elected by SPRS retired members.
Requires housing authority to advertise when applications are being accepted for housing assistance waiting lists on its Internet website or webpage.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for compressed natural gas used to fuel certain bus operation.

Changes deadline for filing nominating petitions for school board candidates to last Monday in July; revises procedure for filling school board candidate vacancy; and revises certain other election procedures.*
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
"New Jersey Long-Term Care Oversight Act."

Requires direct deposit for all State employee compensation on and after July 1, 2014; allows county, county college, municipality,and local school district to opt for mandatory direct deposit for all employee compensation on or after July 1, 2014.*
Establishes license for timeshare salespersons.
Lieutenant Scott Jenkin's Law; creates certain new criminal offenses aimed at theft from cargo carriers; amends theft statute.*
Requires DOE to develop educational fact sheet for distribution to parents concerning sports-related eye injuries.
Clarifies that certain types of sewage and sewage sludge do not constitute hazardous substances under "Spill Compensation and Control Act."
Requires prompt monthly reporting on condition of major State budget funds and disclosure of the State's accrued revenues compared with anticipated revenues.

Makes FY 2013 supplemental appropriation of $789,000,000 to Homestead Benefit Program and amends budget language provisions to provide for significantly enhanced property tax relief payments to beleaguered homeowners and tenants.
Removes plenary retail distribution license limit for certain stores.
Expands definition and licensure requirements for health care service firms.
Exempts disabled veterans from certain fees at State parks and forests.
Modifies school funding law to incorporate recommendations of DOE's Education Funding Report.
Directs Department of Law and Public Safety to engage in Internet privacy and social media responsibility campaign.
Increases the State earned income tax credit from 20 percent to 25 percent of the federal earned income tax credit over two taxable years.
Reduces gross income tax rates by ten percent over three years.
Changes marriage and civil union licensing requirements and increases license fees.*
Creates permissive inference of credit card theft in certain cases and requires restitution in certain cases.
Requires Financial Policy Review Board to issue certain reports and create and maintain website.
Requires schools to maintain supply of epinephrine and permit administration of epinephrine to any student having anaphylactic reaction.
Requires Director of Division of Taxation to include sales of properties in age-restricted developments by third parties in table of equalized valuations.
Restores Fiscal Year 2011 reductions to Garden State Preservation Trust payments in lieu of taxes; appropriates $3,400,000 to DCA.
Designates July 30th of each year as "Corrections Officers Day."
Modifies tax levy apportionment methodology in certain school districts; restricts authority for certain municipalities to enter long-term tax exemption agreements.
Eliminates duplication and redundancy in registration of certain apartments.
Requires school districts to allow home-schooled students to participate in school-sponsored extracurricular activities in the student's resident district.
Revises law concerning certain professional and occupational licenses.

Eliminates payments for unused sick leave earned after effective date; limits carry forward of unused vacation leave; requires suspension and forfeiture of certain payments; limits use of unused sick leave in year before retirement.
Requires State oversight of budgets of joint meetings.
Permits all municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring bond from landlords in certain circumstances and increases penalties for subsequent offenses.
Requires State pay educational costs of students who reside in domestic violence shelter or transitional living facility outside district of residence for more than one year.
The "Green Building and Infrastructure Tax Credit Act"; provides tax credits for certain green buildings.*
Allows corporation business tax or gross income tax credits to developers for certain capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.**
Requires Department of Education to biannually distribute a letter to school districts reminding districts of requirement to enroll resident students regardless of immigration status.
Clarifies local government unit obligations with regard to DEP loan awards for dam repairs.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million to fund mandatory drug court.
Fred Baker's Law; establishes July 30th of each year as "Corrections Officer Day."

Establishes crimes of operating school bus with suspended or revoked driving privileges and being involved in accident causing bodily injury; permanently prohibits passenger and school bus CDL endorsements for persons convicted of those crimes.*
Makes FY 2013 supplemental Grants-in-Aid appropriation of $10 million to Department of Community Affairs for Lead Hazard Control Assistance Fund.
Permits appointment and transfer of certain special law enforcement officers and county park police officers by certain sheriffs and counties.**
Requires installation of safety light on school buses.
Allows corporation business tax credits to developers for specified capital investments for repurposing qualified health care facilities.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Requires the display of county or municipal vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all county and municipal vehicles.
Requires NJHMFA to establish reverse mortgage program for certain retirees living in cooperatives.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act."
Prohibits use of hot tubs in commercial establishments by persons under 17 years of age.
Provides for screening newborn infants for adrenoleukodystrophy.
Permits electronic mail notification, and makes certain other revisions, regarding the "Self-Service Storage Facility Act."
Requires suspension of pay of local elected officials during period between indictment and conviction for certain offenses involving moral turpitude.
Provides that solar and photovoltaic energy facilities and structures on farmland are not an inherently beneficial use, per se, for purposes of zoning approvals.
Requires fee-for-service Medicaid prescription drug benefits for Medicaid recipients not eligible for Medicare.
Requires sex offenders to note criminal status on social network accounts.
Establishes State Transportation Infrastucture Bank and Energy Bank within New Jersey Enviromental Infrastructure Trust.
Repeals and replaces Chapters 1 and 7 of the Uniform Commercial Code and revises various additional provisions of the code.
Modifies certain CATV company filing requirements with BPU and CATV company subsciber notice requirements concerning rates, charges, or services.*
Changes date for election of fire district commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of primary election.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs harbored on insured property.
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.
Concerns cigarette manufacturers and production of certain tobacco products using roll-your-own tobacco machines at retail establishments within this State.

Requires the Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to develop and distribute a document containing student loan repayment information for school districts and nonpublic high schools to disseminate to students.
Strengthens enforceability of premarital and pre-civil union agreements.
Establishes procedure for licensure of timeshare salespersons.
Modifies requirements for local unit to dissolve certain authorities.
Establishes certain traffic privileges for funeral processions.
Authorizes certified celebrants to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Establishes summary action to foreclose mortgages on vacant and abandoned residential property.
Establishes the "New Jersey Residential Foreclosure Transformation Act."
Requires release of bid list prior to bid date under "Local Public Contracts Law."
Updates provisions governing Board of Education Employees' Pension Fund of Essex County to comply with Internal Revenue Code.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue one license plate instead of two.
Revises law concerning the purchase of scrap metal.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.
Regulates sale of olive oil.
Clarifies that first aid, ambulance or rescue squads, as entities, have immunity from civil damages in certain circumstances.
Requires health benefits coverage for refills of prescription eye drops under certain conditions.
Provides for permanent debarment from government contracting of any person who is convicted of certain crimes involving government contracts.
Requires Secretary of State to establish secure Internet website for online voter registration; authorizes use of digitized signatures from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission's database.
Establishes conditional dismissal program in municipal court; alters eligibility requirements and increases fees for existing conditional discharge and supervisory treatment programs.

Permits submission of online voter registration form through secure Department of State Internet site; authorizes use of digitized signature from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission database for online voter registration form approval.
"School Children First Act"; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires principal consent for teacher placement; eliminates certain seniority rights.
Requires Motor Vehicle Commission to issue exempt certificates for motor vehicles not required to be inspected.
Eliminates post-employment restriction for member and employees of New Jersey Racing Commission.
Excludes from gross income tax value of prizes or awards won in athletic competition in Olympic Games.
Authorizes Office of Emergency Management to order lowering of reservoir levels prior to certain severe weather events.
Concerns regulation of grease recycling industry.
Creates the "New Jersey Security and Financial Empowerment Act" to assist victims of domestic violence and sexual assault.
Revises definition of destructive device to include weapons of 50 caliber or greater.
"Healthcare Disclosure and Transparency Act."
Creates New Jersey Business Action Center.
Requires BPU to promulgate regulations requiring electricity providers to provide information so customers can compare prices and services.
Creates "New Jersey Life Sciences Internship Challenge" program.
Requires Division of Fire Safety regulations to establish annual Statewide Type 1 propane tank permit.
Authorizes special Ancient Order of Hibernians license plate.
Reduces number of voters for whom person can serve as messenger; limits to three number of voted mail-in ballots transmittable by bearer; modifies conviction standard under vote by mail law.
Permits the use of electronic communication in child custody arrangements that include parenting time.
Requires institutions of higher education to provide to prospective students certain cost, loan, and debt information in financial aid shopping sheet.
Requires employer notification when relocating call center services outside the United States.
Establishes Response to Intervention initiative in DOE to support and encourage school districts in implementation of Response to Intervention framework.
Allows license suspension or revocation of certain health care professionals and medical waste facilities, generators, and transporters for willful illegal or improper medical waste disposal.
Designates portion of U.S. Route No. 40 in Buena Borough, Atlantic County as "Peter 'Pete' Dandrea Section of the Harding Highway."

Appropriates $250,000 from societal benefits charge revenues for grants to community colleges and vocational schools to create training programs on electric, compressed natural gas, and liquefied petroleum vehicle conversions.*

Provides certain exemptions from sales and use tax for compressed natural gas, liquefied natural gas or propane fueled vehicles and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles, and for equipment used for refueling or recharging certain vehicles.*

Requires New Jersey Turnpike Authority and South Jersey Transportation Authority to provide natural gas refueling, propane refueling and electric vehicle recharging stations at certain rest areas on New Jersey Turnpike, Garden State Parkway and Atlantic City Expressway.**
Provides for $5 million grant program encouraging compressed natural gas fueling stations and electric charging stations.
Requires DCA to adopt compressed natural gas vehicle home-fueling connections code.
Permits compressed natural gas as fuel source to power school buses.
Establishes Clean Car Commission.
Requires BPU, under certain circumstances, to issue a decision within 180 days after receipt of petition by public utilities to sell certain real property.
Authorizes establishment through collective bargaining of alternative workers' compensation program and group self-insurance plans.
Requires HMFA to expand participation in the NJ HomeKeeper Program.
Establishes three-year "Fifth Quarter Pilot Program" in New Brunswick School District to provide summer enrichment programming; appropriates $255,000.

"Drug Dealer Accountability Act;" increases penalties for distribution of phencyclidine; establishes criminal liability for drug dealers under certain circumstances; imposes civil and criminal penalties for combinations of controlled dangerous substances.

Provides municipalities and fire districts with option to hire firefighters up to age 40 with eligibility for PFRS membership; allows firefighters legally hired after age 35 currently in PERS to transfer to PFRS.
"The Reliability, Preparedness, and Storm Response Act of 2012"; requires public utilities to file certain information concerning emergency preparedness with BPU and increases certain penalties.

Authorizes Judiciary to revise or supplement fees, subject to limitations, to fund e-court information system and Legal Services of New Jersey; requires review and reporting on fees and expenditures of such fees.
Amends "Flood Hazard Area Control Act" to require DEP to take certain actions concerning delineations of flood hazard areas and floodways.
Permits certain former mayors to solemnize marriage and civil union ceremonies.**
Requires Department of State to post on its website notice of days, weeks, and months designated by State law as special commemorations.
The "New Jobs for New Jersey Act."
Concerns certain appeals of unemployment benefits determinations.
Concerns withholdings and deductions from employee wages for certain payments.
Prohibits sale of flavored cigars.
Requires certain civil actions against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities when necessary for transportation infrastructure projects at direction of DOT.
Establishes New Jersey Advisory Council on Youth and Collegiate Affairs.

Revises "Overseas Residents Absentee Voting Law" to mirror federal law; permits overseas voters to vote in any election; permits use of federal write-in absentee ballot to vote, register or request ballot for all elections.*
Prohibits animal cruelty violators from owning domestic companion animals and from working at animal-related enterprises; designated as "Moose's Law."*
Removes provision permitting dismissal of de minimis violations for offenses involving corruption of public resources.
Changes pejorative terminology referring to mental capacity of individuals.
Directs Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to forgive certain student loans in the event of the borrower's death.
Gives State Lottery winners option of remaining anonymous for one year.
Requires medical examiner training about sudden unexpected death in epilepsy and requesting decedent's medical information and brain donation for research.
Requires DOT to issue guidance on certain aspects of red light camera pilot program.

Provides for $5 million rebate program for purchase and installation of residential compressed natural gas vehicle fueling stations and electric vehicle charging stations using funds from societal benefits charge.
Prohibits right on red turns at intersections with red light cameras; requires certain additional signage if red light camera is in safe corridor.
"Volunteer Medical Professional Health Care Act."
Requires Superintendent of State Police to include additional questions on loading and passenger capacity in boat safety course examination.
Requires liability insurance for permit to possess certain dangerous animals.
Requires chairperson of each municipal and county political party committee to call annual meeting after Secretary of State certifies results of primary election.
Prohibits the use of county and municipal vehicles by part-time elected local government officers.
Authorizes placement of horse racing wagers using mobile gaming devices at in-State racetracks subject to commission rules and regulations.
Requires certain persons licensed or appointed to inspect homes to pass criminal history background check.
Makes various revisions to laws concerning disabled person identification cards and placards related to parking privileges.
The "Human Trafficking Prevention, Protection, and Treatment Act."
Establishes process for county colleges to offer baccalaureate degree nursing programs.
Prohibits Medicaid managed care organizations from reducing certain provider reimbursement rates without approval from DHS.*
Clarifies that the "Uniform Electronic Transactions Act" applies to real estate transactions.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Tuition Waiver Program."
Requires president of public institution of higher education to regularly report on-campus criminal and fire events to the institution's governing board.
Expands neighborhood revitalization State tax credit to include gross income taxpayers; increases annual total amount of tax credits allowable from $10,000,000 to $15,000,000.

Appropriates $55 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" for local government open space acquisition and park development projects, and approves $2,400,800 from 1995 bond act for coastal blue acres projects.
Appropriates $8,930,975 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.

Appropriates $45 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and $12 million from "2009 Blue Acres Fund" for State acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes, including Blue Acres projects.
Requires public institutions of higher education to waive or reimburse application fees and transcript fees for veterans and members of the military.
Requires constitutionally dedicated moneys be used to provide grants toward the replacement of certain diesel vehicles and diesel equipment with lower emission vehicles and equipment.**
Requires hepatitis B to be considered a priority under "Eliminating Health Disparities Initiative."
Directs CATV companies to provide energy efficient CATV converter boxes to customers.
Appropriates $10 million to the DEP for Black Creek and Wreck Pond dredging.
Creates Veterans Haven North Council; renames current Veterans Haven Council to Veterans Haven South Council.

Permits school districts to provide transportation to nonpublic school pupils and charge parents when the per pupil amount of the route exceeds the maximum nonpublic school transportation costs per pupil.
Exempts certain properties acquired by municipalities from county, school, and fire district taxes immediately upon aquisition.*
Establishes a process for renewal of DOE issued authorization of certified educational facilities manager.
Repeals requirement for general hospitals and State psychiatric hospitals to hold annual public meetings.
"New Jersey Death with Dignity Act"; permits qualified patient to self-administer medication to end life in humane and dignified manner, subject to voter approval.
Limits motor vehicle rental companies vehicle license cost recovery fee to good-faith estimate of actual costs; requires company to annually adjust fee to reflect actual costs.**
Establishes "Naturally Occurring Retirement Community" pilot program in Camden County; appropriates $250,000.
Establishes special license to serve alcoholic beverages in qualifying redevelopment areas.
Establishes civil action for the crime of human trafficking.
Provides for automatic expungement for persons convicted of certain offenses who are also victims of human trafficking.
Concerns criminal sentencing for victims of human trafficking.
Establishes the "Prostitution Offender Internet Registry."
Imposes mandatory education requirements and additional penalties for persons convicted of engaging a prostitute; establishes the "Offender Education Program;" requires HIV testing for offender.
The "Bio-based Heating Oil Act."
Establishes "State Vehicle Reduction Task Force."
Establishes penalty for failure to include bittering agent in antifreeze.
Clarifies that a single State college may enter into a joint purchasing agreement with other contracting units.*
Removes limit on amount or value of bingo prizes.
Requires fire suppression systems in new single and two family homes.
Renames Mountainview Youth Correctional Facility as "William H. Fauver Youth Correctional Facility."
Imposes tax on certain State lottery winnings to finance grant program for not-for-profit entities operating after school programs in certain districts.
Requires correctional facilities to submit voting rights information packets to inmates.

Lengthens amber light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by red light camera; implements half-second delay for red light camera violations.
Protects minors by prohibiting counseling attempts to change sexual orientation.
Requires Division of Addiction Services to grant residential drug treatment program licenses to certain programs operating in State correctional facilities and county jails.
Requires monitoring of prescriptions for human growth hormones.
Extends statute of limitations in certain civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of potentially liable defendants; and revives certain actions. *
Permits automatic expungement for certain persons completing a sentence to drug court under the special probation statute.
Provides that a school district may be placed under full or partial State intervention pursuant to the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) for no longer than five years.
Directs DEP and Monmouth County to form study commission to examine nonpoint source pollution and stormwater management issues in Wreck Pond Watershed.
Establishes permanent task force to review and guide implementation of process improvement programs for Executive Branch based on Lean Six Sigma management approach.
Creates craft distillery license.
Requires workers employed in certain public works to have completed a registered apprenticeship program.
Requires development of a diabetes action plan by DOH.
Provides "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" exemption for artificial turf field construction by local government units.
Permits counties to charge a fee to fund infrastructure through voter approval.
Eliminates requirement that a full-time student at an institution of higher education in New Jersey maintain health insurance coverage.**
Subjects Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to New York's Freedom of Information Law and New Jersey's Open Public Records Act.
Clarifies responsibility of Unsatisfied Claim and Judgment Fund for pedestrian personal injury protection claims.
Permits surety companies to issue blanket bonds for certain local government officers and employees; applies rating criteria and underwriting standards to blanket bond coverage.
Concerns job order contracts for public work.

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
Permits domestic violence victim witness to testify via closed circuit television under certain circumstances.
Requires BPU to issue written decision concerning utility rate increase approvals to public via its website.
Revises requirements related to public hearings on proposed public utility rate increases.
Requires public utilities to provide customers notice of request for increase in rates; revises requirements related to hearings on proposed rate increases.
Requires public utilities to mail customers detailed explanation of rate settlement agreements prior to final BPU vote.

"Save New Jersey Electric and Gas Public Utility Customer Service and Call Center Jobs Act"; requires notification by electric and gas utilities when relocating customer and call centers out of State.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from permitting direct solicitation of students for credit card accounts.
Consumer Electronics Warranty Lemon Law.
Revises calculation of assessments concerning certain casino licensee fees and clarifies certain conditions of employment concerning Atlantic City Tourism District.*
Permits the purchase of small employer health benefits plans by certain self-employed persons.
Eliminates State aid growth limit for school districts in which individuals age 65 and over comprise more than 33.3 percent of the population.*
Prohibits certain energy suppliers from making false and misleading claims to potential customers; prohibits suppliers' calls to customers where no business relationship exists.*
Permits municipal court to order certain offenders to perform community service in lieu of payment of penalty.
Requires DEP to conduct vibration analysis along routes for disposal of dredged material from Delaware River.
Sets forth certain reporting requirements when out-of-State law enforcement entities conduct counter-terrorism investigations within New Jersey.
Makes homeowners' association in which developer's control of executive board has not been surrendered a public body under "Senator Byron M. Baer Open Public Meetings Act."
Allows CRDA to finance certain highway projects outside of Atlantic City Tourism District.
Provides that Good Samaritans are not required to pay for ambulance service if injured while rendering emergency care.
Directs DOE to develop and implement pilot program for compressed natural gas school buses, and authorizes establishment of permanent voluntary program under certain circumstances.
Requires certain contractors to verify work authorization of newly hired employees.
Creates Voluntary Registry for Individuals with a Mental Illness or Developmental Disability.
Requires newborn infant screening for tongue tie.
Allows host municipalities to offer property tax abatements on former Fort Monmouth property under terms and conditions established by those municipalities.
Increases certain time frames governing arbitration in police and fire contract disputes.
Imposes requirements on certain pediatric emergency departments; requires DOH to include information on pediatric emergency departments in its annual hospital performance report.
Prohibits contribution action against local public entity for cleanup and removal costs or any other damages associated with discharge of hazardous substances.*
Requires mandatory imprisonment for child luring and requires certain information about Megan's Law to be provided to sex offenders annually.
Clarifies application of business personal property tax on local exchange telephone companies that were subject to tax as of April 1, 1997.
"Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Cargo Facility Charge Act."
Revises law concerning derivative proceedings and shareholder class actions.
Allows corporate shareholder meeting participation by remote communication and clarifies remedies for dissenting shareholders.
Allows certain business combinations between resident domestic corporations and interested stockholders.
Limits non-debt service portion of sewerage and utilities authority charge or fee increases to no more than 2% over previous year.
Permits inclusion of volunteer firefighters and other emergency responders within municipal eligible employee group for purposes of the small employer health benefits plan statutes.
Requires issuance of construction permits for installation of wheelchair ramps on residential real property within 3 business days of application.

Requires owner or operator of industrial establishment applying for de minimis exemption from "Industrial Site Recovery Act" to certify as to no actual knowledge of contamination exceeding remediation standards.
Requires DOE to train teachers and administrators and monitor districts on bias and discrimination in special education classification.
Directs DOE to make database of special education decisions available on website.
Provides emergency vehicle exemption for vehicle spot lamps. *
Requires health benefits coverage for prescription eye drop refills under certain conditions.
Designates New Jersey Route 47 from Wildwood City to Maurice River Township as "Veterans Memorial Highway at Delsea Drive."
Amends statute of limitations for civil actions for injury based on sexual abuse; increases liability of certain entities and individuals.
Strengthens criminal sanctions for intentionally damaging a rental premises to establish a warranty of habitability violations.
Expands ability of the court to order payment of attorney fees and costs by parties who file frivolous lawsuits.
Requires retirement subdivision and retirement community to install electrical generator to provide electricity to common use area to be used as shelter in case of emergency.
Provides that person convicted of sexual assault that resulted in the birth of a child shall not be awarded custody or visitation under any circumstances.
Requires emergency operations plans in certain senior occupied buildings.
Affords immunity to private colleges and their police officers in certain cases.
Requires DEP to obtain legislative approval and authorization before increasing a fee or imposing a new fee, but retains DEP authority to use ordinary administrative procedure when decreasing a fee.
Upgrades penalties for certain crimes committed during a state of emergency.
Prohibits municipalities from charging interest on unpaid property taxes for 30 days after payment is due following hurricane or other catastrophic weather event.
Provides for establishment of child support lien against life insurance proceeds; requires insurers perform child support judgment search.
Directs BPU to adopt best practices and standards for public utility disaster response.
Authorizes the use of fraud prevention contractors by the Division of Taxation.
Makes looting during a state of emergency an aggravating circumstance in sentencing.

Permits certain businesses to qualify for NJEDA loans for cost of alternative power generation devices; requires toll road authority contracts to provide for alternative power generation devices at service stations.
Adds one member to New Jersey Epilepsy Task Force and extends for one year.
