"Consumer Access to Health Care Act"; eliminates requirement of joint protocol with physician for advanced practice nurses to prescribe medication.
Allows certain undocumented aliens to qualify for in-state tuition rates at public institutions of higher education.
Establishes mandatory penalties for committing burglary and theft during a state of emergency.
Requires newly-constructed grocery stores to have generators.
Requires electric distribution lines be located underground in areas affected by severe weather or natural disasters.
Creates State Beach Task Force.
Establishes cruelly restraining a dog as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Requires gas stations to install generators.
Requires DOLWD to compile consumer report cards for eligible training providers.
Requires home improvement contractors to display State-issued identification badge; requires surrender in certain circumstances; imposes penalty for improper display of badge.*
Requires availability of early voting for certain elections; makes appropriation.
"Compounding Pharmacy Quality Assurance Act"; requires accreditation of compounding pharmacies.
"New Jersey Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program Employment and Training Provider Demonstration Project Act."

"Sudden Cardiac Arrest Prevention Act"; provides student-athletes, parents, and coaches with information on sudden cardiac arrest and establishes protocol concerning removal-from-play for athletes exhibiting symptoms of sudden cardiac arrest.
Requires shore municipalities accepting government funds for storm-damaged beach replenishment to provide free beach access and public toilet facilities.

Requires use of bear-resistant containers, dumpsters, or food boxes in certain areas located in black bear habitat under certain circumstances, including garbage collection, and prohibits certain actions that would result in feeding of black bears.
Permits certain public and private entities to qualify for BPU grants or low interest loans for cost of alternative power generation devices.
Requires electric public utilities to repair or install street lights within certain time periods after municipal notification.

Requires installation of standby emergency power generators in senior and disabled housing; creates BPU assistance program for generator purchase and installation costs in existing senior and disabled housing.
Requires electric public utilities to provide electric circuit maps to municipalities every five years.
Establishes process for recovering cost of caring for animals involved in animal cruelty violations.
Establishes that police cruisers have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Repeals State moratorium prohibiting taking of horseshoe crabs from State waters.
Requires water utilities to cover costs related to flooding damage under certain circumstances.
Authorizes seizure and impoundment of a dog believed to have attacked, severely injured, or killed another domestic animal.
Requires State pay postage for voted ballots returned by mail.
Requires residential community release programs to install cameras in certain facilities and provide telephone access to ombudsperson; requires ombudsperson to investigate reports.
Sets forth procedures for transporting inmates housed in residential community release programs.
Requires DOC oversight of placement of pre-trial county inmates in halfway houses.
Requires residential community release programs to file certain financial disclosure documents with DOC.
Requires DOC to report certain information concerning halfway houses.
Clarifies DOC authority to directly contract with private for-profit entities to provide inmate services in halfway houses.
Permits person with developmental disability and legal guardian to audio record sessions of interdisciplinary team in which person or guardian participates.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for certain purchases made by, or on behalf of, individuals and small businesses affected by natural disasters.
Provides certain small businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain reinvestment in shore municipalities.
Concerns occupational safety and health for public employees of certain interstate authorities.
Prohibits certain contractors from public works projects.
Prohibits retail dealers of motor fuels from requiring identification or proof of residency to purchase motor fuel or from refusing to sell motor fuel based on location of any person's residence.
Temporarily eliminates sales and use tax imposed on sale of certain foods and beverages.
Excludes certain conveyances of graves, crypts and niches from 15% fee charged by cemetery company.
Appropriates $24,290,379 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $4,083,320 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit organizations for farmland preservation purposes.
Appropriates $16,250,000 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" for planning incentive grants to municipalities for farmland preservation purposes.
Appropriates $38.5 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for county planning incentive grants.
Provides for voluntary contributions through gross income tax returns to support victims of Hurricane Sandy.
Provides, under certain circumstances, for immediate issuance of marriage and civil union licenses at the time license application is made.
"Property Tax Lien Pilot Program," establishes pilot program to allow certain municipalities greater control over sale of tax liens.

Lengthens yellow light at traffic signal with red light camera; sets penalty for failing to stop before turning right on red when detected by camera; implements one second delay for red light camera violations.
Requires carbon monoxide detectors in school buildings.
Requires public and independent institutions of higher education to collect and report employment data for certain graduates.
Eliminates 10% surcharge on employer UI taxes during fiscal year 2014.
Allows person with diabetes to voluntarily make notation on driver's license.
"Nikki's Law"; Requires DOT Commissioner to erect signs and use variable message signs to inform motorists of State law prohibiting texting while driving.*
Revises criteria to establish base year for homestead property tax reimbursement after relocation.
"New Jersey Disaster Victims' Bill of Rights"; authorizes $500 million emergency State bonds and appropriates money for municipal property tax relief program.

Directs the executive county superintendent of schools to select a new district of residence for students who reside on certain federal property who are not the dependent children of military personnel.
School bond validating act.
Requires electric and gas public utilities to file maps and information concerning utility infrastructure with municipal emergency management personnel.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from charging a fee to an applicant solely to correct clerical errors on any application form.
Requires Commissioner of Labor and Workforce Development to develop career exploration report for students in grades 7 through 12.**
Directs BPU to study whether State's electric distribution system meets certain standards.
Requires local governing body and DCA to suspend collection of certificate of occupancy and related inspection fees for homes being rented by persons identified by FEMA as displaced individuals.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Upgrades burglary of a residence to a crime of the second degree; requires mandatory period of parole ineligibility if residence was occupied at time of offense.
Requires training program for school bus drivers and aides on interacting with students with special needs.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
"New Jersey Residents' Power Protection Act"; requires use of emergency power generators by various facilities and businesses; provides related tax incentives.
Expands coverage for infertility under certain health insurance plans to women who are not currently covered.
Requires that contract for private operation of State Lottery be subject to approval by Legislature.
Provides for distribution of gross income tax refunds via prepaid debit cards.
Provides for use of prepaid debit cards as standardized form of disbursement for certain State and local government payments to individuals and business entities.
Revises definition of "public works projects" to permit project labor agreements for more projects.
Provides homestead owners gross income tax deduction for certain water supply and sewerage charges.
Revises penalties for certain drunk driving offenses, including mandating installation of ignition interlock device, and creates restricted use driver's license.*
Requires health benefits plans in Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare, SHBP, and SEHBP to offer equal terms for participation of certain health care providers in their provider networks.
"Public Utility Reliability Investment Act"; requires public utilities to file infrastructure improvement plans to increase service reliability with BPU.
Declares violence a public health crisis. and establishes "Study Commission on Violence."*
Establishes certain equal employment opportunity requirements in connection with expenditure of federal funds received for Hurricane Sandy relief and for any future emergencies.
Requires board of education to provide an individual textbook for each student enrolled in a class.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey shall serve as member of Government Records Council.
Provides three years of partial funding to urban enterprise zone assistance fund for Hurricane Sandy relief.

Appropriates $20,000,000 from General Fund to the Department of State for travel and tourism advertising and promotion to communicate that New Jersey's tourism destinations are operational despite damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
Creates Sporting Event Facility License to permit sale of alcoholic beverages in stadiums and arenas on public property.
Provides for certain limits on rates sewerage facilities may charge for processing diverted wastewater from other sewerage facilities when damaged by a natural disaster or other emergent event.
Requires that candidates for certain teaching certificates, in addition to existing requirements, also pass a written test on the foundations of teaching reading and diagnosing reading difficulties.
Directs State Board of Education to incorporate the International Dyslexia Association's definition of dyslexia into special education regulations.

Requires DOE provide professional development opportunities related to reading disabilities; mandates certain school district personnel annually complete two hours of professional development related to reading disabilities.*
Requires 20 hours of professional development requirement for public school teachers to be devoted to reading disabilities.
Requires certain public school students to be screened for dyslexia and other reading disabilities.**
Provides family leave insurance for certain first responders.
Establishes Consumer Finance Advisory Board; abolishes certain advisory boards in DOBI.
Authorizes school district hiring preference for veterans.
Amends Fiscal Year 2013 annual appropriations act to prohibit application of budget adjustment factor when determining Medicaid reimbursement rates for certain nursing facilities.
Codifies protections set forth in certain case law and limits use of eminent domain under the "Local Redevelopment and Housing Law."
"Higher Education Epinephrine Emergency Treatment Act."
Revises definition of volunteer first aid, rescue, and ambulance squad under "New Jersey Highway Traffic Safety Act of 1987."
Clarifies that members of volunteer first aid squads that bill third parties do not lose right to use emergency warning lights.
Provides businesses impacted by Hurricane Sandy a corporation business tax or gross income tax credit for certain replacement and repair of business property.
Provides sales and use tax rebate for certain purchases made by businesses affected by Hurricane Sandy.
Establishes the "Mental Health Court Pilot Program."
Modifies timeframe during which charter school applications are submitted to and approved by DOE.
Concerns payment of homestead property tax reimbursement as credit on property tax bill.
Criminalizes purchase or possession of firearms ammunition by persons convicted of certain crimes.
Makes discretionary driver's license suspension for first offense of driving without motor vehicle liability insurance under certain circumstances.
Requires Commissioner of Education to change deadline for municipal review of defeated school budgets whenever he changes the annual school election date.
Prohibits service and sale in schools of food and beverage items labeled as not intended or recommended for children.
"Consumer Protection Act of 2012."
Requires annual physical examination of child under 19 years of age include certain questions related to cardiac health.
Requires newly-constructed multiple dwellings with six or more residential units to install standby generators to provide electricity in case of emergency.

Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in urban enterprise zone program; allow zone funds to pay for storm related recovery costs for five years.
Regulates sale and transfer of rifle and shotgun ammunition.
Prohibits mail order, Internet, telephone, and any other anonymous method of ammunition sale or transfer in New Jersey.
"Local Hospital Fee Pilot Program Act."*
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.**
Authorizes impoundment of motor vehicles for certain crimes and offenses.
Creates crime of cyber-harassment.
Provides tax credits to certain businesses for certain capital investment in qualified business facilities and qualified residential projects located in vicinity of designated transit villages.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies manufacturing, importing, and selling assault firearms for civilian use.
Establishes compensation limits for licensed public adjusters.*

Establishes small business loan guarantee program in EDA to support capital purchases and operating expenses and permits certain qualified businesses in regional centers to qualify for certain EDA loans.*
Establishes a regulatory system to govern the sale and transfer of ammunition.
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds.
Requires ammunition sales and transfers be conducted as face-to-face transactions.
Establishes offense of unlawfully accessing location information of law enforcement vehicles through certain electronic means.
Requires halfway houses to permit attorneys and certain representatives of attorneys to visit incarcerated clients.
Allows certain students including undocumented immigrants who meet certain criteria to qualify for in-State tuition at public institutions of higher education.***
Requires each school district to annually submit interscholastic athletic opportunity report to the Commissioner of Education.
Creates corporate business tax and gross income tax credits to fund education enrichment demonstration program.
Requires school districts provide pupil directory information to county vocational schools upon request.
Establishes the "New Jersey Workforce Development and Education Commission."
Provides for temporary approval of WIC vendor applications if the applicant currently operates another approved program.
Disqualifies person named on federal Terrorist Watchlist from obtaining firearms identification card or permit to purchase handgun.
Excludes certain increases in school security expenditures from tax levy and appropriation cap, as applicable, for school districts, municipalities, and counties.
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA.
Protects certain politically active employees from retaliatory action by employers.
Requires contracts for professional services be awarded by certain bi-state authorities pursuant to competitive contracting process.
Appropriates up to $1,000,000 to bridge federal funding for Violence Against Women Act grantees.
Requires installation of emergency power supply systems to certain common areas of new planned real estate developments; provides related tax incentives.
Requires submission of certain mental health records to National Instant Criminal Background Check System.
Revises statutes and enhances penalties for offenses involving child pornography; makes crime of causing a child to engage in a prohibited sexual act subject to "No Early Release Act."

Permits municipality to use proceeds of beach access fees for areas near beach facilities that are significantly affected by beach tourism; requires municipality to provide explanation of expenditures on website.
Provides unemployment benefits to certain college and university adjunct faculty members.
Concerns payment of independent contractors.
Reduces lawful maximum capacity of certain ammunition magazines in New Jersey.
Mandates motor fuel dealer maintain and use generator during power outage.
Requires each State agency to review permits issued by the agency and make necessary changes to expedite and facilitate permitting.

"Building Our Future Bond Act"; authorizes the issuance of $750,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance higher educational capital projects for increasing of academic capacity; appropriates $5,000.

Establishes new public-private partnership agreement option for construction of State and county college facilities and changes reference from "Commission on Higher Education" to "Secretary of Higher Education" in higher education construction Educational Facilities Authority bond programs.
Requires homeowners insurance consumer information brochure to contain one page summary of policy.
Creates offense of making false child abuse report; permits assessment of penalty.
Exempts certain veterinary students from compliance with veterinary practice licensure laws.
Clarifies DOBI's regulatory authority over certain flood insurance claims.
Authorizes Parole Board and sheriff's offices to hire alternate route trained police officers; exempts alternate route trainees from certain civil service requirements.
Amends "Administrative Procedure Act" to require State agencies to use various electronic technologies in rule-making procedures.
"New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database Act"; establishes New Jersey All-Payer Claims Database and arbitration process for reimbursing out-of-network health care providers.
Requiring electric public utilities and municipal and county shade tree commissions to meet annually concerning vegetation management; requires commissions to implement vegetation management plans.
Establishes Job Opportunity Benefit Program to provide tax credits to certain businesses having large number of employees in the State.
Makes various changes to law addressing meetings of public bodies to provide public with greater access to meetings and information about meetings.
Makes certain access changes to open public records act; establishes State public finance website and creates program for development of local websites; makes appropriation.
Expands notification when an offender is released from custody or transferred within the criminal justice system.
Establishes highway-related sponsorship programs in DOT, NJTA, and SJTA.*
Provides gross income tax credit for certain expenses paid or incurred for care and support of qualifying senior family member; designated as Caregiver's Assistance Act.
Increases civil and criminal penalties involving unstamped and counterfeit cigarettes and cigarette smuggling and establishes crime involving transfers of counterfeit cigarettes.
Provides that certain funds in Casino Simulcasting Special Fund will be paid to Atlantic City Racetrack and prescribes use thereof with certain amounts remaining paid to other racetracks.
"Let Them Be Little Act"; provides for screening newborn infants for Hunter syndrome.
Requires forms and materials for individuals with developmental disabilities to be available in languages other than English.
Concerns project labor agreements for non-building public works projects.
Clarifies crime of unlawful access concerning certain password protected communications in electronic storage.
Requires notification to crime witnesses of defendant's release from custody under certain circumstances.
Establishes a regulatory program for rifle and shotgun ammunition sales.
Requires dental plans to make out-of-network payments based on assignment of benefits.
Establishes regulatory and reporting program for all ammunition sales.

Requires electric public utilities to provide training, equipment, indemnity, and reimbursement to certain municipal employees for moving and securing detached, above-ground distribution lines impeding vehicular traffic during lengthy power outages.
Permits two or more candidates for school board member to circulate petitions jointly and be bracketed together on ballot for same term.

Provides exemption for commercial and institutional solid waste generators from source separation requirements of municipal recycling ordinances if recyclable materials are otherwise recycled pursuant to certain conditions and requirements.

The "Preserve New Jersey Act of 2013"; implements constitutional dedication of sales tax revenue for preservation of open space, including lands that protect water supplies and flood prone areas, farmland, and historic properties.*
The "Green Acres, Water Supply and Floodplain Protection, and Farmland and Historic Preservation Bond Act of 2013," authorizes bonds for $400 million; appropriates $5,000.
Establishes mileage-based fee on passenger vehicles; exempts passenger vehicles from motor fuels tax.
Clarifies charitable contributions are not a factor in determining where person is domiciled under New Jersey gross income tax.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from imposing surcharges on consumer credit card purchases.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Increases benefit amounts under New Jersey earned income tax credit program to 25 percent of federal earned income tax credit amounts beginning in Tax Year 2013.
Authorizes deployment of integrity monitors in implementation of certain Hurricane Sandy recovery and rebuilding projects.
Prohibits public utility from filing rate increase petition under certain circumstances.
Provides certain immunities from spectator-based lawsuits arising from youth sports events.
Authorizes release or reduction of original performance guarantee after deposit of adequate replacement performance guarantee by successor developer.

Allows monies statutorily dedicated to standardbred or thoroughbred horse racing purses to be used for benefit of horse racing industry, subject to agreement between permitholder and representative horsemen's organization.*
Requires electric public utilities to implement flood mitigation plans for certain electric distribution substations; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of flood mitigation plans.
Requires electric public utilities to file with BPU and implement distribution infrastructure protection plans; prohibits rate increase pending implementation of plans.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice or represent oneself to others concerning certain licensed or certified health care related professions.*
Provides for temporary professional or occupational licensure for qualified nonresident military spouses.
Prohibits notaries public from falsely representing themselves as attorneys in advertisements.
Allows Hurricane Sandy victims to claim gross income tax deduction for certain personal casualty losses.
Creates Task Force on Distracted Driving.

Blocks beach fees in shore municipalities accepting certain government provided beach replenishment funding and dedicates two percent of taxable receipts under the sales and use tax collected in the shore municipalities to the shore municipalities.
Authorizes chiefs of part-time municipal police forces to issue firearms ID cards and handgun purchase permits.
Prohibits retail mercantile establishments from imposing certain surcharges on consumers.
Permits real estate licensees to prepare broker price opinions and comparative market analyses.
Codifies regulation exempting firearms records from State's open public records law. *

Prohibits enforcement, for a period of 12 months, of homeowners' association bylaws prohibiting domesticated animals if owner is FEMA designated displaced individual following emergency declaration by President or Governor.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.

Modifies process for contested case hearings by OAL with regard to telephone and video conferences, delegation of final decision authority, oral decisions, checklist decisions, electronic filings, and settlements.
Modifies rights of judgment creditor of limited liability company member; makes certain technical corrections to the "Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act." *
Codifies the Judiciary's Foreclosure Mediation Program; dedicates monies from foreclosure filing fees and fines.

Increases distribution to municipalities from Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Fund over five years to restore municipal aid reductions; requires additional aid to be subtracted from municipal property tax levy.
Revises definition of "landlord" to include rooming and boarding house owners and operators with regard to ordinances holding landlords to certain standards of responsibility.
Requires certain energy assistance organizations to establish energy assistance grant income verification procedures and to maintain monies received from State in separate account.
Authorizes public schools to serve to students certain produce grown in community garden.
Establishes the four-year "New Jersey Innovation Inspiration School Grant Pilot Program" in DOE to fund non-traditional STEM programs.*
Authorizes installation of residential automatic standby generator without zoning or planning board approval.
Authorizes a school district that moves its annual school election to November to submit separate proposals for additional school spending for the budget year and the subsequent budget year.
Increases the penalty for committing robbery against Turnpike Authority employee; upgrades offense of simple assault to aggravated assault when victim is employee of Turnpike Authority.
Imposes oversight upon Hurricane Sandy recovery funds.
Permits pharmacists to administer influenza vaccines to children seven years of age or older.*
Requires coverage of medication therapy management in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare.
Requires emergency action plans for delivery of oxygen to patient residences during public health emergency.
Supplemental appropriation of $50 million from General Fund to DHS for substance abuse treatment and prevention.
Makes consent to register with Selective Service part of driver's license application process for males under age 26.
Expands definition of "acquisition," for purposes of county and municipal open space trust funds, to include demolition, removal of debris, and restoration of lands being acquired.
Permits county correctional facilities to seek reimbursement from inmate welfare fund for certain medical services provided in county jails.
Directs State agencies to take certain action to expedite permitting through use of general permits.
Requires DEP to update Shore Protection Master Plan.
Exempts certain persons from HVACR licensing requirement; clarifies definition of heating, ventilating, air conditioning, and refrigeration.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.
"Common Interest Community Manager Licensing Act."

Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions by certain taxpayers to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program and provides a State match for contributions to NJBEST accounts for families meeting certain income guidelines.
Designates State Highway Route 53 as "Alex DeCroce Memorial Highway."
Concerns importation and delivery of motor fuel during certain emergencies.
Concerns sale of certain motor fuel during certain emergencies.
"New Jersey Economic Opportunity Act of 2013."**
Revises process for awarding certain public contracts in connection with an emergency.
Establishes "Local Governmental Process Activities Disclosure Act."
"The Opportunity to Compete Act"; establishes certain employment rights for persons with criminal histories.
Requires full-day kindergarten in all school districts and establishes uniform age requirement for enrollment in kindergarten.
Establishes conditional dismissal program in municipal court.
Creates New Jersey Cold War medal.
Amends Offshore Wind Economic Development Act concerning offshore wind energy facilities and wind energy zones.
Requires OLS to provide certain notices and reports to legislators and legislative staff by electronic means only.
Requires labeling of ingredients and restricts phosphorus in household cleansing products.
Directs all fines imposed by municipalities for violations of red light cameras to Highway Safety Fund.
Repeals N.J.S.3B:23-18, concerning intestate property distribution under certain circumstances.
"Corporate Disinvestment Property Tax Relief Act"; appropriates $13.5 million.*
Rescinds recommendation of the Task Force on the Closure of State Developmental Centers and creates new task force.*
Requires that certain HIV testing be performed within 48 hours of request by victim.
Provides limited exemption from development regulations to allow certain structures to be raised as high as the highest applicable flood elevation standard.**
Requires consideration of increased property value due to dune construction or beach replenishment in determining compensation provided for condemned beachfront property.*
Establishes criteria and requirements for shore protection project priority list and funding from Shore Protection Fund.

Permits fifth and sixth class counties to assume control and responsibility for operation and maintenance of beaches bordering Atlantic Ocean unless control and responsibility are reserved by a municipality.*
Repeals law providing CAFRA permit exemption for certain grading or excavation of a dune.
Concerns various authorities, boards, commissions, councils, divisions, and task forces.
Concerns registration of contractors and sets criteria for responsible bidders in public work.
Strengthens State's assault weapons ban.
Establishes pediatric respite care program licensure requirements.
Requires DCA to compile on department's website information about post-disaster reconstruction.
Clarifies authorization for cluster developments under MLUL.
Concerns interest rate chargeable by licensed pawnbrokers on certain transactions.
Permits four-year public institution of higher education to establish academic quality standards for the transfer of college credits earned by a student while the student was enrolled in high school.
Directs BPU to coordinate with PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. concerning development of offshore transmission infrastructure.
Requires information relating to crime of firearms trafficking be included in annual Uniform Crime Report.
Requires BPU to provide grants for cost of purchase and installation of certain electric metering equipment for solar electric power generation systems.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights and Property Tax Reduction Act."
Establishes prescription drug donation repository program.

Requires disclosure of contributions received and expenditures made by committees or organizations not affiliated or coordinated with any candidate, or committee organized to support or oppose public questions.
Concerns closure of Fenimore Landfill in Roxbury Twp., Morris County.
Concerns valuation of property condemned for dune construction or beach replenishment.
Exempts from disclosure as public record personal identifying information provided to government agency for emergency notification purposes.
Revises eligibility criteria for shore protection funding.
Revises laws concerning traffic control signals and traffic control signal monitoring systems.
Requires certain common areas and facilities of assisted living facilities to be generator ready; provides related tax relief.
Reduces amount of fire duty required in order to receive exempt fireman certificate.
"Certificates of Insurance Act."
Establishes "Energy Infrastructure Study Commission."
Requires transfer of certain records to DOLWD and DHS.
Reestablishes historic driving privileges afforded holders of agricultural driver's licenses in operating farm equipment and vehicles.
"New Jersey Rural Electric Cooperative Act."
Concerns employer contribution reports.
Reduces the maximum lawful capacity of ammunition magazines; prohibits possession of certain firearms having a caliber of 50 or greater.
Revises permitted amount of surcharge on admission charges at major places of amusement.
Authorizes municipalities to finance water conservation, storm shelter construction, and flood and hurricane resistance projects.*
The "Emergency Disaster Relief Act of 2013"; appropriates $100 million.
Eliminates ambulatory care facility assessment.

Provides additional State aid to, and increases tax levy growth limitation for, certain school districts experiencing significant increases in tuition costs, appropriates $1,719,000 from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE.
Revises certain provisions of Megan's Law and imposes monthly penalty on sex offenders to fund their monitoring and supervision by the parole board.
Provides conditions for dismissal of certain drug-related charges against defendant who seeks emergency medical assistance for drug overdose.
Requires gasoline stations to be generator ready; provides related tax relief.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for development of Northern New Jersey Veterans Memorial Cemetery.
Requires SHBP to provide certain information to participating public employers.
Provides red light camera fines are shared with county only when violation occurs on county road.
Establishes penalty for failing to report unintentional discharge of firearm in private residence.
Provides that participation by New Jersey residents in contests of skill does not constitute unlawful gambling.
Expands Medicaid eligibility pursuant to federal "Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act."
Establishes Office of the Special Education Ombudsman in DOE.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.
Exempts veterans' organizations from nonprofit corporation annual report filing fee.
Upgrades penalty for unlawful possession of certain firearms on grounds of an educational institution.
Requires reporting of the graduation rates of State tuition aid grant recipients.
Provides exceptions to garnish exemption against benefits from State-administered pension systems for certain financial claims under State law.
Establishes alternative energy portfolio standard and certificate program; provides financial incentives for certain standby generation.
Requires hazard mitigation plan element in municipal master plan; appropriates $95,000.
Modifies interest rates and accrual of interest on certain unpaid water and sewer utility bills and delinquent municipal taxes, assessments, and other municipal liens and charges.
Clarifies law authorizing application of reciprocal limitations against businesses from states that give in-state preference in awarding public contracts.
Requires construction of new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.
Requires certain State departments, divisions, commissions, and authorities to consider use of green or blue roof in construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roofs.
Revises the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Requires county prosecutor to apply for revocation of convicted person's firearms purchaser identification card or handgun permit.

Requires certain information to be contained in application for homestead property tax reimbursement and revises application deadline.
Prohibits bad faith assertion of patent infringement.
Modernizes business filing statutes to include entity conversion and domestication.
Exempts persons practicing certain techniques from the provisions of the "Massage and Bodywork Therapist Licensing Act."
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.
Prohibits improper release of photographs or videos captured by public entities.
Requires school districts to allow nonpublic school students to participate in interscholastic sports programs on resident district's sports teams.
Authorizes municipalities to regulate use of certain explosives.
Prohibits location of off-road vehicle training or recreation facility within five miles of residential zone.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million.
Prohibits workers' compensation reimbursement to certain entities for treatment paid on behalf of injured worker.

Requires school districts to allow charter school students, county vocational school students, and students receiving equivalent instruction elsewhere than at school to participate in interscholastic sports programs on resident district's sports teams.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $2,200,000 to Maritime Industry Fund in Office of Maritime Resources in DOT.
Exempts all transfers made to lineal relatives from the Transfer Inheritance Tax.
Exempts mugshots of arrestees who have not been convicted of the underlying offense from State's open public records law.
Provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities through accountability and transparency; designated as "Stephen Komninos' Law."
Requires public school student to receive instruction in cardiopulmonary resuscitation and use of automated external defibrillator as requirement for high school graduation.
Prohibits sale and possession of shark fins; and allows in NJ the processing or sale of wild striped bass caught outside of NJ.
Prohibits bio-analytical laboratories from charging certain patients more than 115% of the applicable Medicare rate.
Authorizes the establishment of federal impact aid reserve account.
Permits counties and municipalities to use snow removal reserve funds for clearance of debris following declaration of emergency by President or Governor.
Establishes flat digital striped bass motor vehicle license plates.
Requires electric or gas public utilities to apply residential rates and charges to any business heated or cooled by residential heating or cooling system.

Authorizes AOC to assess, collect, and pay service charges and costs for electronic payment of fees and other obligations owed courts; prohibits defendants from using debit cards for bail and penalty payments for certain crimes.
Exempts traffic summons records from public access under State's open public records law.

Requires driver's license examination to include questions on distracted driving; makes it a violation for motorists to talk or text on hand-held wireless devices while vehicle is temporarily stopped.
Permits real estate licensees to prepare broker price opinions and comparative market analyses.
Establishes that payment plan for motor vehicle surcharges is mandatory upon request; extends payment period.

Alters eligibility criteria for special probation for drug or alcohol treatment to permit access by certain persons without previous conviction or delinquency for, or without pending charge of, crime of violence.
Provides for payment to small municipalities, in certain cases, of certain penalty moneys assessed for violations of fish and game laws.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Implements recommendations of the SCI report entitled "Scenes from an Epidemic" concerning prescription drug and heroin abuse.
Provides legal protections and remedies for persons engaged in unpaid internships with employers.
Permits municipality to establish civil penalty for smoking in public places.
Provides that nonpublic school nursing services may include nursing services for a preschool pupil in the event of an emergency.
Expands protections in employment practices to include familial status.
Designates State Route 173 between Clinton and Phillipsburg as "173rd Airborne Brigade Highway."
Concerns low emission and gas emission vehicles; establishes Clean Vehicle Task Force.
Expands role of temporary guardian to include arranging placement of alleged incapacitated person in appropriate, less restrictive environment.
Provides for electronic scanning of certain certificates for initiating court proceedings for involuntary commitment.
Establishes "New Jersey Out-of-School Time Advisory Commission" to review before-school, after-school and summer programs; appropriates $60,000.
Establishes mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for harming or threatening to harm animal owned or used by a law enforcement agency or a search and rescue dog.
Permits boards of education to establish donated leave programs for their employees as an alternative to the sick leave banks which are currently permitted by law.
Authorizes extension of time for completion of investigation of certain contaminated sites prior to DEP undertaking direct oversight.*
Prohibits inclusion of bonus in employment contract of school superintendent for reducing number of out-of-district placements of students with special education needs.
Allows use of master meter system in residential dwellings under certain conditions.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to recruit, select, and train veterans for school security positions in school districts.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
"Angelie's Law"; regulates the operation of certain autobuses.*
Modifies certain fees charged by, and requirements imposed on, check casher licensees.
Authorizes licensing of operators to provide restricted foreign Internet wagering under certain circumstances.
Revises law concerning the rights and responsibilities of motor vehicle franchisees and franchisors.
Concerns disclosure and reimbursement procedures of board of education and municipal employee health care benefit contracts.
Concerns employee leasing companies and unemployment compensation.
Extends time in which DOBI may waive limit of liability exposure for mortgage guaranty insurance companies.
Allows nonpublic schools to participate in joint purchasing agreements entered into by two or more school districts.
Increases State hotel and motel occupancy fee revenues required to be annually appropriated to fund certain arts and cultural, historical, and tourism-related programs and activities.
Establishes Behavioral Health Insurance Claims Advocacy Program.
Directs State Board of Education to develop autism spectrum disorder endorsement and requires all teacher preparation programs to include a special education component.

Establishes loan redemption program for teachers in certain fields to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in certain failing schools.

Permits students made homeless by act of terrorism or natural disaster to attend tuition-free the school district in which they resided prior to being homeless for two school years after the event.

Requires BPU to regulate rates and terms and conditions of service of alternate operator telephone service providers to protect users of those services.
Requires school buildings to be equipped with emergency light and panic alarm linked to local law enforcement.
Revises sales and use tax treatment of garbage removal services.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for pediatric cancer research.
The "Licensed Wildlife Rehabilitator Act;" establishes licensure requirements for wildlife rehabilitators.

Permits certain school districts to be eligible for 2013 State grant funding or for debt service aid for school facilities projects despite having already obtained approval for the local share of the project.

Provides gross income tax credits to support development of New Jersey-based small business start-ups.
Establishes the "Mortgage Assistance Pilot Program."
Prohibits escrow agent evaluation services from charging escrow agents fees.
Provides extended validity to wastewater service area designations and sewer service area designations, and revises certain aspects of wastewater management planning process.

Permits qualifying patients to possess and use medical marijuana legally obtained from another jurisdiction; extends State medical marijuana laws to qualifying out-of-State patients; expands ability of parents to serve as primary caregiver to minor children.
The "Marriage Equality Act"; recognizes same-sex marriage.
Establishes an industrial hemp license.
Prohibits sale and possession of undetectable firearms manufactured using three dimensional printing technology.
Restricts sale and use of remaining State-owned portion of Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital property in Morris County.

"New Jersey Tuition Equality for America's Military (NJTEAM) Act;" provides in-State tuition at New Jersey public institutions of higher education to military veterans.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Reinstates moratorium on imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees until January 2015.
Requires blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death; designated as "Michelle's Law."
Adds to property tax levy cap exclusions increases in flood insurance premiums.
Provides that a teaching staff member dismissed by a district due to a reduction in force who subsequently retires must be removed from preferred eligible lists and has no right of reemployment.
Stipulates that retail motor fuel dealers shall not be responsible for certain fees associated with credit, debit and rewards cards.
Directs NJEDA to establish pilot program to assist with permit and approval process related to redevelopment of certain properties.

Establishes that volunteer firemen appointed to paid positions are not required to be recertified in certain instances.
Requires assessments prior to laboratory and diagnostic testing of persons undergoing mental health screening.

Establishes Task Force on the Illegal Trade and Inhumane Treatment of Endangered and Exotic Animals.*
Proposes constitutional amendment to allow not-for-profit bowling leagues, associations or clubs to conduct raffles.
Proposes constitutional amendment to provide for suspension and temporary replacement of indicted elected official with vacancy in office declared upon conviction.
Proposes constitutional amendment to extend eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction and disabled veterans' property tax exemption to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Memorializes Congress to enact legislation to provide Medicare coverage for incontinence products.
Urges Governor to support expansion of Medicaid program.
Urges federal government to pay 100% of Hurricane Sandy related essential assistance.
Expresses Legislature's objection to certain recommendations included in the Governor's Educational Adequacy Report.
Urges Commissioner of Health to ensure health care providers and expectant and new parents are made aware of impact of Hurricane Sandy on pregnant women.
Urges President and Congress of United States to enact assault weapons ban including prohibition against large capacity ammunition feeding devices.
Urges National Park Service to make restoration and reopening of Sandy Hook Gateway National Recreation Area a national priority.

Amends Constitution to dedicate, for 30 years, 1/5 of a cent for each dollar subject to sales tax for preservation of open space, including flood prone areas and lands that protect water supplies, farmland, and historic properties.*
Provides for special session of Legislature to consider property tax relief and reform.
Opposes entertainment industry profiteering from violent entertainment and media.
Proposes constitutional amendment authorizing Legislature to invalidate certain court decisions.
Urges federal Department of Veterans Affairs to support recommendations of New Jersey Veterans Hospital Task Force.
Concurs in 60-day extension of DEP emergency Flood Hazard Area Control Act Rules.
Establishes the "Joint Legislative Task Force on Health Insurance Exchange Implementation."
Urges Congress and the President of the United States to increase subsidies for federal flood insurance.

Amends Constitution to require States's participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative and dedicates any revenues realized therefrom to certain clean energy and greenhouse gas reduction programs.*
Petitions Congress to allow Hurricane Sandy victims to claim personal casualty losses as arising in a hurricane disaster area for federal income tax purposes.
Urges U.S. Congress and U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to consider and incorporate coastal lake restoration projects as part of Hurricane Sandy recovery.
Urges United States Congress to bestow Congressional Gold Medal upon Puerto Rican 65th Infantry Regiment, also known as "The Borinqueneers."
Proposes constitutional amendment to revise senior citizens' and disabled persons' property tax deduction.
Urges Transportation Safety Administration to permanently prohibit knives in passenger compartment of airplanes.

Memorializes Congress to support efforts to increase allocation of Low Income Housing Tax Credits and New Market Tax Credits in declared Hurricane Sandy disaster areas.
Respectfully urges Russia to rescind the prohibition against adoption of Russian children by United States citizens.
Urges Governor and Lieutenant Governor to establish foreign trade office in Taiwan.
Proposes constitutional amendment to provide that release on bail may be denied under certain conditions to offenders who commit first degree crimes.
Establishes "First District Economic Development Task Force."
Determines that Civil Service Commission's proposed regulations concerning job banding are not consistent with legislative intent.
Urges BPU to coordinate with PJM Interconnection to facilitate development of New Jersey Energy Link in phases; recommends that BPU and EDA conduct economic studies to determine benefits of project.

Amends Constitution to dedicate $200 million annually from FY2015 to FY2044 of sales and use tax revenue for preservation of open space, including flood prone areas and lands that protect water supplies, farmland, and historic properties.

Urges Congress and President to delay individual shared responsibility provision of federal health reform, and reverse decisions to delay out-of-pocket expenses cap and continue federal premium contributions for members of Congress and their staffs.
Amends Constitution to require State's participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.
Urges federal government to regulate electronic smoking devices.
Urges Congress to enact reforms addressing sexual harassment and assault in United States Armed Forces.

Amends Constitution to dedicate $200 million, or 2.4 percent, whichever is less, annually from FY2015 to FY2044 of sales and use tax revenue for preservation of open space, including flood prone areas and lands that protect water supplies, farmland, and historic properties.

Urges Congress to amend the "Communication Decency Act of 1996."
Commends nonprofit organizations and volunteers for providing transportation assistance to mobility-challenged individuals; urges State entities to support volunteer driving.
Urges Congress to reexamine structure and management at PANYNJ and take measures to increase accountability and transparency for safety of region's residents.
